data.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
data.data: I have mastered the basics. Master warned me about forbidden magic, but it sounds so promising. I think a bit of the forbidden can't hurt...
data.title: Adept Thaumaturgy

data.name: Advanced Node Stabilizer
data.data: The advanced node stabilizer acts like a normal node stabilizer but with key differences. It will still stop the node it affects from being drained but the node can still drain from other, lesser nodes. It also has a higher chance to improve fading and unstable nodes. The downside is that any nodes it affects will have their recharge rates effectively reduced to nothing. They will recharge at an extremely reduced rate.
data.title: Advanced Node Stabilizer

data.name: (Almost) Automated Essentia
data.data: By combining the essentia locus, the essentia mirror and an essentia aggregator, you are now able to transmit essentia from almost anywhere. Fancy essentia-storage facility incoming!
data.title: (Almost) Automated Essentia

data.name: A Magical Box
data.data:
This magical box is amazing. No matter how many are created, they all seem to connect to the same dimension. I can store items in one location, and pull them out somewhere else!

I can use dyes on the top of the box to assign its location, and any box with the same colors will share the same space. Using a diamond on the box locks it to me, and me alone.

Shift-right-clicking will remove the diamond and the chest will rejoin the public network.
data.title: A Magical Box
data.tooltip:
A Magical Box
Prequest requests:
More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand

data.name: A Magical Tank
data.data:
This tank always seems to connect to the same dimensional space. I can push fluids into the tank in one dimension, and retrieve them in a totally different dimension!

I have discovered a way to assign a location to each tank using dyes applied to the top. Using a diamond makes the tank private, attuned to the user's mind, and will not share fluids with any other player's tanks.

Shift-right-clicking recovers the diamond and makes the tank part of the public tank network again.

The dial on front controls the input/output of the tank. When blue is up, the tank accepts fluids. When orange is up, the tank will eject fluids.

§3If you get FPS problems from large numbers of them, try the setting in the config to turn off the fancy render at the bottom.
data.title: A Magical Tank
data.tooltip:
A Magical Tank
Prequest requests:
More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand

data.name: An Awesome Magic Conductor
data.data:
More... I want MOOORE! There must be something even stronger than the hydra. Something older, more ancient.

These tears, WOW! I've never felt something so strong. Could it be? Could I make an even more powerful wand with these?
data.title: An Awesome Magic Conductor
data.tooltip:
An Awesome Magic Conductor
Prequest requests:
A Silverwood Wand at Last

data.name: "Armor"
data.data: This new metal, it's so... appealing. You feel comfortable while holding it, so why not get yourself some armor? What could go wrong? It will surely protect you.
data.title: "Armor"

data.name: A Silverwood Wand at Last
data.data: I tried to combine the lich bones I had with a silverwood rod. The result: A pile of ashes. It crumbled to dust within seconds. I need a better conductor. The hydra in the Twilight Forest has the ability to regrow an entire head! Her blood must contain a large amount of magic. I guess I need a bit of that to finally complete my silverwood wand.
data.title: A Silverwood Wand at Last
data.tooltip:
A Silverwood Wand at Last
Prequest requests:
More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand

data.name: A Soul-ution For Warp
data.data:
The Soul Brazier from Thaumic Exploration will store your permanent warp.

As long as it has Ignis centi-vis and Mortuus essentia fed from underneath it will stay active, even while you are in other dimensions. Turning it off or running out of power will dump all that warp back into your body, so watch out.

Containing warp does have a bit of a downside - taint. You'll need to figure out a way to stop that.
data.title: A Soul-ution For Warp
data.tooltip:
A Soul-ution For Warp
Prequest requests:
Temp Warp Remover Soap

data.name: A Travel Companion
data.data:
Lonely? The Traveling Trunk is a simple companion, giving you some extra space. With upgrades (one per trunk) it can offer you some nice advantages. Like other golems, you can pick it up with the Golemancer's Bell. Its brain is pretty small though, so it can easily get stuck. You can order it to stay in one spot via the GUI. It will attempt to teleport to you, as long as the chunk is still loaded. It can also follow you into different dimensions.

They will heal slowly on their own, or faster if you right-click on them with any food, including rotten meat. Keep away from lava.

Golem upgrade effects:
Aer: Moves faster
Earth: 1 more row of item slots
Fire: Attacks hostile mobs, setting them on fire
Water: Nearly invulnerable. In SMP, can only be opened or picked up by player who placed it.
Entropy: Sucks in loose items nearby if it has room
Order: Can be picked up with its contents, and nested in other inventories. Don't be stupid about this.
data.title: A Travel Companion

data.name: Automated Wand Recharging
data.data: So you've found a way to gather nodes now. What about automated wand recharging? Wouldn't that be extremely convenient?
data.title: Automated Wand Recharging

data.name: A Wizard's Staff Has a Knob on the End
data.data: Join the core with two wand caps, a twilight forest mob drop, and screws just as for making a wand. A staff cannot be used for crafting, but holds 2.5x as much vis as a corresponding wand. It can even serve as a backup weapon for melee. While it cannot receive weapon enchantments, its damage is decent, and it does not take damage with use (no durability bar).
data.title: A Wizard's Staff Has a Knob on the End
data.tooltip:
A Wizard's Staff Has a Knob on the End
Prequest requests:
Magic Staff Core

data.name: Bathing in a Spa. Automated Warp Removal
data.data: Bathing in a spa will automate the process of temporarily removing warp effects. Take the bath salt with you into the spa.
data.title: Bathing in a Spa. Automated Warp Removal
data.tooltip:
Bathing in a Spa. Automated Warp Removal
Prequest requests:
Bathing the Warp Effects Away

data.name: Bathing the Warp Effects Away
data.data:
Litmus paper will tell you how high your warp level is, but how can you get rid of the nasty warp effects? Bath salt will help you by prohibiting warp effects for a short period. Just throw the salt into a 1x1 water hole and jump inside. You will feel relieved a bit after bathing.

[note]Note: The more permanent warp you have, the shorter the duration.[/note]
data.title: Bathing the Warp Effects Away
data.tooltip:
Bathing the Warp Effects Away
Prequest requests:
Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?

data.name: Beacon
data.data: With your ascension to adept thaumaturge you are ready to fusion craft beacons. The beacon recipe is found on the GTNH Thaumcraft Page. Activate it in your base to gain various positive effects.
data.title: Beacon

data.name: Best Wand Caps Ever...
data.data: Of course! Thaumium! What could conduct vis better than... a magical metal?
data.title: Best Wand Caps Ever...

data.name: Bring it Home
data.data: You probably have a nice collection of bookmarked nodes. But running around to recharge your wand(s) isn't really the way an adept thaumaturge should get his required vis. Moving nodes is not that hard, but without doubt, you need something to protect them from each other.
data.title: Bring it Home

data.name: Can You Really See Out of Those?
data.data:
If you take a little dip into the dark side, you can make these goggles. They give the best discount until you can make infinity armor. And who even does that?

You'll need infusion and some warping research first.

If you're a §oscaredy-cat§r you can make the Electric goggles on the armor tab instead.
data.title: Can You Really See Out of Those?
data.tooltip:
Can You Really See Out of Those?
Prequest requests:
Adept Thaumaturgy

data.name: Centi-vis
data.data: Many advanced machines require vis in order to do what they're supposed to. But using a wand as some sort of battery to transfer vis from a node to your machine didn't work as expected. What if you could rip open a portal to another dimension and siphon power out of it using a node? Nothing could §opossibly§r go wrong with that, right?
data.title: Centi-vis

data.name: Centi-vis Stuff
data.data: You totally should get yourself some centi-vis things to transport and use the vis from stabilized nodes.
data.title: Centi-vis Stuff

data.name: Charge Buffer
data.data: A Charge Buffer augmentation to your wand allows it to hold 25 percent more vis.
data.title: Charge Buffer

data.name: Check Your Warp For Free!
data.data:
Don't want to spend your Salis Mundus on Litmus Paper anymore? This device can significantly reduce your Litmus Paper usage!

While holding this item, you gain a HUD Icon on the top left of your screen, which tells you how much warp you have. It does not tell you the exact warp values, but it helps you estimate it.

Here's how to read it:
Your §l§5§lPermanent Warp§r is displayed as a dark purple bar
Your §5Normal Warp§r is displayed as a light purple bar
Your §dTemporary Warp§r is displayed as a pink bar

The bar is full at 100 total warp.
data.title: Check Your Warp For Free!
data.tooltip:
Check Your Warp For Free!
Prequest requests:
Magical Item Teleportation

data.name: Cleaning the Goo
data.data:
As you do more and more infusions, you're getting tired of removing all the flux that's generated. The Shovel of the Purifier will help you clean up flux, and is a must-have.

§3Actually this is pretty useless, if you have any concept of what you're doing.
data.title: Cleaning the Goo

data.name: Concentrated Darkness
data.data:
For some reason, you decided to infuse darkness into a seed. It appeared to be promising. For what? You don't know...

§3For the Eldritch research you need to be > 30 for the first, and > 50 for the second. Temporary warp won't work, however.
data.title: Concentrated Darkness

data.name: Creating a Better Wand
data.data: This greatwood wand is nice, but it can only store 50 vis. Not enough to move nodes. My attempts to use silverwood failed, but I've come across other mundane materials that I could use to make a new wand core.
data.title: Creating a Better Wand

data.name: Crying Obsidian...
data.data: ...it mourns the dead. This might come in handy for some cases. By placing 2 on top of each other, you're able to set your respawn point to that location, without the need for a bed. It's up to you to imagine the possibilities...
data.title: Crying Obsidian...

data.name: Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?
data.data:
After a few forbidden researches your warp level has increased a bit. Do you want to know how much warp you have?

Craft some litmus paper to print out the warp level.
data.title: Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?
data.tooltip:
Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?
Prequest requests:
Adept Thaumaturgy

data.name: Disenchanted
data.data: If you found an item or book with a good enchantment - but also a bunch of garbage, you can strip the enchantments into separate books using a Disenchanter. Surround it with bookcases to reduce damage done to the item.
data.title: Disenchanted
data.tooltip:
Disenchanted
Prequest requests:
More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand

data.name: Dynamism Tablets
data.data:
The Dynamism tablet is a block that simulates the functionality of a left and right-click autoclicker. It can be obtained fairly early in the game (early-mid MV), and is a useful tool for simple automation.

Upon placing, the tablet will target the block that it's facing (the direction is indicated by a small dot on the overlay) and will start once you give it an item in its slot. If it holds a block/seed/sapling, it can also place it on the block below it.

It can be configured to either left/right click and also has an option to only be active when it receives a redstone signal. Hoppers or item pipes of any sort also allow the tablet to receive items.

Note that some special mob drops or special interactions (like BM sacrificial knife) are disabled for the Dynamism tablet. However, they do work with Tinkers Tools.

[note]This item has received a rework in 2.8 and has had most of its bugs fixed. If you still encounter any bugs, feel free to report it on our GitHub page or discord server.[/note]
data.title: Dynamism Tablets

data.name: Enchanting Like a Pro
data.data: Finally, a device where you can actually choose which enchantments you want to have. Powered by vis, it can create the most powerful combinations one could imagine.
data.title: Enchanting Like a Pro
data.tooltip:
Enchanting Like a Pro
Prequest requests:
More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand

data.name: Essentia Item Storage
data.data: Sure, you could just go with gazillions of jars, but it's way more convenient to store essentia in a chest or barrel. Isn't it?
data.title: Essentia Item Storage
data.tooltip:
Essentia Item Storage
Prequest requests:
Best Wand Caps Ever...

data.name: Essentia Monitoring
data.data: Manually checking your jars can be tedious, especially if you want to infuse a bunch of stuff at once. Luckily, the essentia locus can help you with that, as it monitors all jars that have been targeted with a crystalline eye.
data.title: Essentia Monitoring

data.name: Essentia Transmission
data.data: What if... you could send essentia from a different location to your infusion matrix? You could finally get rid of all those jars around your altar.
data.title: Essentia Transmission

data.name: Find the Key
data.data: No, nooo! They have hidden it! Must find the keeey. Must find it! We need the tablet to open the door my precious.
data.title: Find the Key

data.name: Fool's Gold
data.data: After holding a Primal Charm for a while, you suddenly understand some of its whispers! It tells of a land filled with untold riches, just waiting for someone to claim them. You scoff at the claim, but apparently if you "Open the Eye" and create a very fancy carved stone, you can create a portal there. But this eye it speaks of...just what is it? Maybe by delving into the darker realm of magic...bah! Only fools would believe such nonsense.
data.title: Fool's Gold

data.name: Gen XXXXXXXXXX...
data.data:
Yes! Yes! The eyes! You understand now, it is all too clear! The land of riches, it is yours! But what is this? It's empty? Why, where have your Riches gone? The sole inhabitant tells you that all such things have faded away long ago, with the End of Time at hand...But that simply means you're in the right PLACE after all! You're simply in the wrong TIME. If you simply adjust the portal a little, you can arrive at the right PLACE and TIME to get your well-deserved Riches. You suspect that such an adjustment would require something strong...INFINITELY strong.

In the meantime you now have a very very big closet to store your things in once the old owner...moves out. Upon leaving, you spot a tiny Ghast, surely just your imagination? Unfortunately the shifting of time causes you to end up in what is likely wilderness when you leave. (Exiting through the portal sends you back to the world spawn)

In order to build a machine to take you to both the right place and time, you're going to have to roll up your sleeves and get to the very limits of technological prowess you can imagine. (see the Endgame Goals tab when you're ready)
data.title: Gen XXXXXXXXXX...
data.tooltip:
Gen XXXXXXXXXX...
Prequest requests:
They See Me, They Watch Me

data.name: Healing Your Nodes
data.data: Many of the nodes of the wild have damage, and unjarring a captured node can also cause damage. The Node Manipulator can help you recover the nodes to full strength, and increase their recharge speed.
data.title: Healing Your Nodes

data.name: Ignore the Glint in Their Eyes
data.data:
Well this is a bad idea, but since when has that stopped you before, golems with brains, what could go wrong?

§2§b§3You only need to complete one task.
data.title: Ignore the Glint in Their Eyes
data.tooltip:
Ignore the Glint in Their Eyes
Prequest requests:
The Best of All?

data.name: Infuse Your Focus
data.data: Try to add Potency to your Shock Focus. At Level 3 you can add Chain Lightning or Shock Wave.
data.title: Infuse Your Focus
data.tooltip:
Infuse Your Focus
Prequest requests:
Pimp Your Wand Focus

data.name: Let's Try This
data.data: Mortals. Pah. What do they know about REAL power? The voices tell me I need to focus on Alienis and Tenebrae if I want to advance. So what about food?
data.title: Let's Try This

data.name: Little Helpers
data.data: A state of the art thaumaturge doesn't do menial work anymore. He has little helpers instead. Golems can and will do all the things for you, just as you command them.
data.title: Little Helpers

data.name: Magical Item Teleportation
data.data: It's annoying to do, but you can teleport items with this. Check the thaumonomicon for details.
data.title: Magical Item Teleportation

data.name: Magic Mirror Glass?
data.data: This glass seems useful for several things, including, perhaps, teleportation of items or essentia?
data.title: Magic Mirror Glass?

data.name: Magic Staff Core
data.data: A staff requires an extra step for crafting: Two (matching) wand cores must be combined with a primal charm, and crystal clusters to produce a staff core. (While the recipes are all similar, each type of staff core requires a separate research topic to be learned.)
data.title: Magic Staff Core
data.tooltip:
Magic Staff Core
Prequest requests:
More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand

data.name: Magic "Staffter"
data.data: It is also possible to create a bizarre hybrid of staff and scepter (sometimes called a "staffter"), by using a staff core instead of a wand core in the scepter recipe. The resulting device can neither hold a focus nor be placed in a crafting table, but it can still be used to activate constructs, or as a "vis battery" for Repair-enchanted equipment or Runic shielding.
data.title: Magic "Staffter"

data.name: More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand
data.data:
Those stainless steel screws don't work on these rods. Due to the huge amounts of vis those wands can carry, the screws somehow "melt" away. I need a material that can handle these energies. I should try energetic alloy next.

§3If you are struggling to make the next wand in this step or one of the next, you should try to get more discount on your gear.

Also look at the various caps, the better ones are more expensive to craft but give discounts or other benefits. In many situations you might need to start with cheap ones and only make the better caps later.

You can also improve your wand with augmentations.
data.title: More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand
data.tooltip:
More Energetic Screws to Finish the New Wand
Prequest requests:
So many options for the core!

data.name: One Does Not Simply...
data.data:
...play with magic. Be warned, these fires are very dangerous! But who doesn't want a patch of snow in the nether?

Fire spread is disabled in the configs of servers to prevent massive lag and world destruction.
data.title: One Does Not Simply...
data.tooltip:
One Does Not Simply...
Prequest requests:
Best Wand Caps Ever...

data.name: ...or are they?
data.data: These caps are even better than thaumium!
data.title: ...or are they?
data.tooltip:
...or are they?
Prequest requests:
Best Wand Caps Ever...
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Oriharukon Screws
data.data: Enderium screws are nice, but they seem to break if too much vis channels through them. Get some Oriharukon screws.
data.title: Oriharukon Screws

data.name: Pimp Your Wand Focus
data.data:
The Focal Manipulator requires both XP levels and centi-vis in order to upgrade foci. Each focus can be upgraded a total of five times, with the level cost increasing by 8 and the vis cost doubling for each upgrade.

Most foci accept Frugal (lowers the vis cost to cast by 10% per level) and Potency (increases damage dealt or improves the focus in another way if it doesn't deal damage) at every level. Foci with an area of effect (like Wand Focus: Equal Trade) accept Enlarge, which usually expands the max area by one block in each direction. Some foci have special upgrades that can only be applied at certain levels (often level 3 or 5), some of which have prerequisite upgrades. See the Focus on Wand Foci & EMT tab for more information about focal upgrades and their effects.

If you regret your past decisions, you can remove upgrades in the Focal Manipulator if you have the Focal Disenchanting research. It will even refund some of the XP!
data.title: Pimp Your Wand Focus

data.name: Purge...Some of Your Warp?
data.data: They're a pain to make, and only work if you have 50+ warp, but if you're wondering if you have dementia from all the chest scrambling, they may be for you. Check the warp theory tab in the thaumonomicon for this and the related items.
data.title: Purge...Some of Your Warp?
data.tooltip:
Purge...Some of Your Warp?
Prequest requests:
Concentrated Darkness
Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?

data.name: Purge Your Warp
data.data:
The warp you have accumulated over time is starting to become a problem. Making bath salts to clean off the warp is only a temporary solution. To truly get rid of it, you need something more powerful, a pure tear. If you collect a few things for me, I will give you one. Think wisely about using it, since it's a very long journey to unlock it through research.

§3PS: You need an LuV-powered EBF for the osmiridium.
data.title: Purge Your Warp
data.tooltip:
Purge Your Warp
Prequest requests:
Concentrated Darkness
Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?

data.name: Pushing the Limits
data.data: Regular enchantments have a limit, like III for Fortune. Utilizing magic, you should be able to bypass that limitation, at least a tiny bit; Eventually creating enchantments like Fortune IV. It comes with limitations, but your book shall tell you more about those.
data.title: Pushing the Limits
data.tooltip:
Pushing the Limits
Prequest requests:
Enchanting Like a Pro

data.name: Reactor Material
data.data: This stuff is interesting... Maybe I can use it as a wand conductor?
data.title: Reactor Material

data.name: Really (Really!) Dark Magic
data.data:
Fools. FOOLS I say! They know nothing! This book will guide me, yes. Yes it will, my precious. It will lead us to even more POWER!

Available in your local bookstore, and also occasionally found on Crimson Knights and Crimson Clerics.
data.title: Really (Really!) Dark Magic

data.name: Research Completer
data.data:
Let's face it... nobody (sane) wants to do all of their research manually!

Now that you've learned how to collect nodes and create a wand recharging pedestal you can make the research completer. This quest shows the minimum required blocks but the structure can be up to 13 in length.

This machine will consume EU and eat nodes placed in the center of it in exchange for completing research notes given to it. If you're using a long machine it's highly recommended you use node stabilizers underneath your nodes to prevent them from destroying each other.

[note]Of course you need to §lresearch§r the Research Completer, you'll find it in the electro-magic tools tab.[/note]
data.title: Research Completer

data.name: Secrets
data.data:
I can feel it. Yess. Yeeeess. We will gain more power nigh. Nigh! Yes. My precious. The voices gave me a hint, there is a dimension filled with unbelievable sources of magic energy. I must go there. I must! The crimson people know the secret. I will rip them aparrrt... They will tell me!

§3NOTE: You might want to set up a spawner because you'll likely need to kill a lot of these guys for the book you need for the next task. Additionally, they're spawned by the Clerics, which DO NOT RESPAWN.
data.title: Secrets

data.name: She Let Go
data.data: This blood seems pretty common, but she had advanced magic abilities. I'm sure I can use this as a medium.
data.title: She Let Go

data.name: Slightly Better
data.data: Wood is somewhat better than straw. They are still to be considered weak, but an ideal little cutie for farms.
data.title: Slightly Better

data.name: Smoke Your Normal Warp Away
data.data:
Having too much normal warp? Sanitizing Soap is too expensive for you?

Well, luckily for you, you can remove your Warp using a Silverwood Smoking Pipe and some Relaxing Tobacco. This is a fairly cheap and sustainable option for removing your Normal warp (assuming you have a good option to get a lot of Vis).

It also has a chance to reduce your temporary warp.

[note]The chance to reduce your normal warp per Relaxing Tobacco is 10%, so you'll be needing a bunch of it.[/note]
data.title: Smoke Your Normal Warp Away
data.tooltip:
Smoke Your Normal Warp Away
Prequest requests:
Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?

data.name: So many options for the core!
data.data:
So many options for my next wand core! The six elemental options are icy, blazing, bone, obsidian, reed, and quartz. They are all pretty similar.

The last two options are more interesting. A transmutative wand has the same capacity while being cheaper to craft! It also has a nice ability that makes it easier to charge.

At last, the thaumium core creates a wand with a slightly higher capacity. But it is also more expensive to craft than the others. Depending on your discounts you might not be able to get it immediately and have to go for one of the other options first.

§3You only need to do one of the tasks.
data.title: So many options for the core!
data.tooltip:
So many options for the core!
Prequest requests:
Creating a Better Wand

data.name: Stable Division Sigil
data.data:
The second ritual will not be as easy as the first one. After this ritual your sigil will be stable enough to make stable unstable ingots which will not explode, and will no longer take durability damage.

This ritual needs to be performed in The End dimension. The ritual is performed by placing a Beacon in the center of a flat area of at least 11x11, not necessarily End Stone. Then place a chest in each of the cardinal directions leaving 4 spaces empty between the chest and the Beacon. In each chest insert these specific contents:

North: iron ingot, gold ingot and the other things listed in the task.
South: The different Ore Blocks and the other things listed in the task.
East: The potions.
West: The Music disks.

A spiral pattern of Redstone and String is then laid out around the beacon. At any time, shift-right-clicking the Beacon with an Activated Division Sigil in hand will show the building progress of the ritual.

Finally, kill an Iron Golem while it stands within the ritual area to activate the process. If it works, there will be an explosion that destroys the beacon and chests, while every Enderman in the End vanishes. During the ritual, throngs of aggressive mobs imbued with Haste will begin spawning and attacking the Player who needs to kill 100 of them to complete the ritual. If the Player dies or leaves the dimension, the ritual will fail and will have to be started over. Once enough mobs have been killed, the first activated Sigil in the inventory will stabilize. The Pseudo-Inversion Sigil can be used an unlimited number of times, and dividing an Iron Ingot by Diamond will produce Mobius "Unstable-Stable" Ingot which does not explode, can be produced in any crafting interface and will stack up to 64.
data.title: Stable Division Sigil
data.tooltip:
Stable Division Sigil
Prequest requests:
Blub Blub Blub.....
Is This the End? No it's the END Dimension
Beacon

data.name: Sticks and Stones...
data.data: ...will break your bones! These guys are hard as rock (Insert audience laugh here) and will protect your claim as good as possible.
data.title: Sticks and Stones...

data.name: Temp Warp Remover Soap
data.data:
This soap is very special. It will remove temporary warp and has a small chance to also remove some normal warp, if you are lucky. Taking a bath first increases your chances.

This can later be upgraded to remove your permanent warp.


[note]Hint: You need to chisel your tallow block for the recipe to work.[/note]
data.title: Temp Warp Remover Soap
data.tooltip:
Temp Warp Remover Soap
Prequest requests:
Did You Want to Know Your Warp Level?

data.name: That Chest is Too Big to Carry Around
data.data: Instead of chest you have to keep placing and breaking, how about a nice convenient pouch you can use? You'll have to synchronize it with the chest you want to link with. To set it to a new chest, sneak-click with the pouch on a new chest.
data.title: That Chest is Too Big to Carry Around
data.tooltip:
That Chest is Too Big to Carry Around
Prequest requests:
A Magical Box

data.name: The Basic Elements
data.data: Of course you know where and how to get the basic essentia types. Right?
data.title: The Basic Elements

data.name: The Best of All?
data.data:
Highly durable, can carry a lot of items and is considered the "top tier" golem. But you are sure there is more...

You'll need to chisel a thaumium block to get the right kind you need for the golem.
data.title: The Best of All?
data.tooltip:
The Best of All?
Prequest requests:
Sticks and Stones...

data.name: The BEST Soap!
data.data:
Finally, you can now reduce your permanent warp.

The chance to reduce your permanent warp is 10%, increased to 25% if you have the Warp Ward effect and further increased to 40% if you're standing in Purifying Liquid.

[warn]This soap has some side effects. Make sure you have a way to remove your normal (and temporary) warp.[/warn]
data.title: The BEST Soap!
data.tooltip:
The BEST Soap!

data.name: The Dark Realm
data.data: We found the way... my precious. We found it! Only need 4 tasty eyes, and some magic to open the door. The secret door, they didn't see it. Hehehe! All the time. It was there... Aaaall the time!
data.title: The Dark Realm
data.tooltip:
The Dark Realm

They See Me, They Watch Me

data.name: The Power of Creation
data.data:
What... What am I doing here? Where am I?! What is this place?! Oh those headaches... (It seems that the pulsating pearl you just found cured your brain from... something. Something old, probably some kind of trap to keep away unworthy ones.)

§3/iskamiunlocked will tell you if you have successfully unlocked Kami. If not, try researching the Thaumium Crowbar and the Cursed Spirits Blade. Or other stuff on the vanilla pages. Or in TT. It's not really reliable anymore with all the mods and such.
data.title: The Power of Creation
data.tooltip:
The Power of Creation

Find the Key

data.name: They See Me, They Watch Me
data.data: Eyes. Yes. Eyes! I need eyes, my precious. Not spidery ones, no. Nasty hairy things. Don't taste good. Eldritch eyes! I will rip those from their bodies.
data.title: They See Me, They Watch Me
data.tooltip:
They See Me, They Watch Me

Really (Really!) Dark Magic

data.name: Useful Trees
data.data: Just like plants, there are trees that will attract various friendly and "not so friendly" creatures. (No warranty when placed in desolated biome!)

data.name: Vis Channels
data.data: This wand augment will lower the vis cost when using your wand by 10 percent. I'm not sure it works, but give it a try and report back, OK?

data.data: Thaumic Machina offers Wand Augmentations. These useful modifications to your wand can boost their capacity, lower their vis usage, or do other interesting effects.

data.data: 256 essentia in one block! Now that is what I call storage. Does make weird sounds, but I guess it's nothing special...

What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

data.data:

This soap has a 50% Chance to reduce your normal warp, increased to 75% if you have the Warp Ward effect (obtained by Purifying Bath Salts) and increased to 100% if you're standing inside of the purifying fluid.
This soap also has a 100% chance to cleanse §lall§r of your temporary warp!

In case you're wondering how to pronounce it: Don't even bother trying.
data.title: Who Came Up With This Name??
data.tooltip:
Who Came Up With This Name??

Temp Warp Remover Soap

data.name: Who Needs Friends?
data.data: Luggage is better than a dumb old traveling trunk. It automatically picks up dropped items, saving you time while mining. It's near-invulnerable, including in lava. It will follow you like an eager puppy, to the ends of the earth - but you probably should pick her up before changing dimensions. A lightning strike can provide more room. Shift-right-clicking will turn it back into an item without losing its contents. Look for her in the GTNH tab of the Thaumonomicon.

data.name: All Alone in the Night
data.data:
Thanks to our amazing devs, you no longer have to use a command block to reload your questbook between updates. This means you'll get all new quests automatically upon updating to a new version of GTNH! Isn't that convenient?

If, for whatever reason, you want to manually reload your questbook, you can do so by typing /bq_admin default load in the chat window. You will need to be an admin for it to work, though.

Here's another questbook in case you already lost the one you spawned with. Don't forget that it can also be viewed at any time by pressing the Tilde (~) key if you have not changed its keybind.

§3Some command blocks are still used for specific tasks, but they do not concern the average player since they are admin-only and thus are not craftable.
data.title: §9§lAll Alone in the Night
data.tooltip:
All Alone in the Night
Prequest requests:
Crafting Time

data.name: Backup Your Stuff...
data.data:
The mod ServerUtilities (SU) is included in the pack to backup your world. You can adjust save path, frequency, and the number of backups to keep in its settings at '.minecraft\serverutilities\serverutilities.cfg'.

If you need to restore from a backup, you can find them in the backups folder in the instance directory.

Remember that the mods JourneyMap and Thaumcraft Node Tracker store information outside of what most solutions backup, so please backup your journeymap and tcnodetracker folders yourself.

The Thaumcraft data is a little buggy, losing scanned aspect data and Thaumonomicon data, so consider backing it up as well. The file is at 'saves\\playerdata\.thaum'.

If you move to another drive or computer, don't forget to migrate all the backed up files, not just the world folder.
data.title: §9§lBackup Your Stuff...

data.name: "Baked" Potatoes
data.data: Eating raw potatoes isn't that healthy, as you might have noticed. Some potatoes are green and poisonous already. After you get a furnace you can make delicious baked potatoes as another food alternative. Put a baked potato on a stick to make it even more delicious.
data.title: §9§l"Baked" Potatoes

data.name: Bamboo Fence
data.data:
Maybe you're lucky and started in a bamboo forest. Bamboo is a very useful tree since it grows really fast and when you break the bottom-most block, the whole thing comes apart.

You can use them as sticks, or you can place the bamboo sticks to grow and make a three-block-tall wall to protect your base. You can also use Berry Bushes for that, assuming you don't want to spend materials on fences.
data.title: §9§lBamboo Fence

data.name: Berry Medley
data.data: Hmmm... what can you do with all those berries? Just eating? You will see that they have a very low saturation level. Let's plant the new berry bushes and mix the berries to make some better food.
data.title: §9§lBerry Medley

data.name: Better Questing?
data.data:
Better Questing has a number of useful commands for the questbook (QB). You need to have cheats enabled to use them.

/bq_admin default load
Use this command to update your QB after you update the modpack. It reloads the quest database from the file. Your save file stores a version of the QB that can be different from the one in the file.

/bq_admin edit
Toggles editing quests. Pressing RMB on the quest will open a context menu to share it or copy its ID.

/bq_admin reset all
Resets all quests. Use this if you want to start over, or are editing the QB. You should specify the player as well if it is a server, otherwise you can skip that part.

/bq_admin reset
Resets a specific quest, defined by the quest ID. Sometimes it may be easier to go into Edit Mode > Designer Tool to specify what to reset.

/bq_admin complete
Completes a specific quest, similarly to the above. You can still claim the rewards. Use this command if a quest is broken, and then report it on GitHub, but please check if it's already reported.

/bq_admin default save
Saves changes to the QB after editing it.

/bq_copyquests
If you want to sync the quests with someone in your party, then use this. They won't get any rewards for that though.

/bq_admin hardcore
Enables BQ3 Hardcore Mode. You only start with 3 lives, so best of luck. Additional life hearts are available in the Kill all the Things tab.

Aside from the consume-type quests, a quest counts for everyone in the party if one person finished it. However, if someone joined your party later, you need to get them up to speed first either through /bq_copyquests above, or manually. Otherwise, your quest completion won't count for them because the requirements for that quest are not fulfilled for them.

If your singleplayer world does not have cheats enabled, go to the ESC screen, open to LAN, then enable cheats. This makes pausing impossible until you reload afterwards. If you host a server, you can run the commands in the command line, without "/". You can also edit the level.dat file, and set 'allowCommands' to 1, but make sure to backup your world before doing that.

[warn]For quests to save properly, you must be online and logged into your Mojang account when starting the game. Sorry, it's a limitation of Better Questing.[/warn]
data.title: §9§lBetter Questing?

data.name: Can You Hear the Carrots Grow?
data.data:
Tired of waiting since your carrots grow sooooo slowly?

Bone meal will help you to grow food in seconds.

Chop down some trees to get a bit of bone meal as a reward.
data.title: §9§lCan You Hear the Carrots Grow?
data.tooltip:
Can You Hear the Carrots Grow?
Prequest requests:
You Reap...

data.name: Caught in the Web
data.data:
Some spider have nasty modifiers:

Witch spiders reflect missile damage back at you. If you see a red X on their back, draw your melee weapon and prepare for close combat...

Mother spiders will spawn a lot of baby spiders on death, some of which may be infernal.

A flying spider can grab the oblivious flier.

Ghost spiders are partially invisible and can pass through thin walls.
data.title: §9§lCaught in the Web

data.name: Collecting Some Berries
data.data:
Are you waiting for the carrots to grow? Go and find some berry bushes and berries.

The berries are a good source of food, and you can put these bushes around your house to make a wall. It should provide a good protection against all those monsters that want to come into your house and kill you.
data.title: §9§lCollecting Some Berries

data.name: Cows Are Supposed to Moo!
data.data:
What the...? You noticed that sometimes when you kill something, even a cow or chicken, it explodes! What madness!

To stop it, use a proper GregTech Knife or Butchery Knife to kill them. Craft a flint GregTech knife with a stick and a piece of flint.

To see its recipe, see how a generic knife is made - NEI should show you many pages. The recipe you need should be on the last page. You can scroll pages with your mouse wheel.

[note]Alternatively you can use the search bar to search for a specific tool material, in this case flint![/note]

As a reward, here's an iron knife to use once the flint one wears out.
data.title: §9§lCows Are Supposed to Moo!
data.tooltip:
Cows Are Supposed to Moo!
Prequest requests:
Rest in Pieces

data.name: Crafting Time
data.data: It's time to get yourself a 3x3 crafting area. Use your flint and some wood to build one!
data.title: §9§lCrafting Time

data.name: Creeping Dread
data.data:
Creepers can make you have a baaaad time.

Drowning Creeper - when it explodes, it surrounds you in a ball of cobble filled with water. Not only do you have to escape, but the cobble is infested with silverfish! And those silverfish are all infernal! The best way to deal with it is to first escape up or down. If you have to clear the cobble ball, first clear the water. Surrounding the cobble with a dirt moat will keep the silverfish inside and unable to hide. Put down punjis, quicksand, or lava, and/or spectral glass. Make a wall with a 1x1 window and use that to break the cobbles - fishing silverfish is especially dangerous.

Ender Creeper - Randomly teleports you a short distance - possibly deep underground.
data.title: §9§lCreeping Dread
data.tooltip:
Creeping Dread
Prequest requests:
Moron's Manual for Massacring Monsters

data.name: E_TOO_MANY_KEYS
data.data:
ERROR: Too many keys to fit a 104 key keyboard.

There are many keybinds in this modpack. To avoid conflicts, most of them are unbound by default. Only the ones available from the start are bound. Note that NEI keybinds are found in the NEI menu and not with the rest of the keybinds.

Here is the list of what some of them do :


BetterQuesting
GRAVE - Open Questbook

Draconic Evolution
V - Place the item you are holding on the block you are looking at

Journeymap
B - Create a Waypoint
Ctrl+B - Open the Waypoint Manager
J - Open Fullscreen Map
= - Zoom In (works on minimap too)
- - Zoom out

Inventory Tweaks
R - Sort Inventory

Share Where I am
INSERT - Places a temporary beam where you are looking at that will be seen by you and other players
SHIFT + INSERT - Places a temporary beam where §oyou§r are that will be seen by you and other players
CTRL + INSERT - Shares the position you are looking at with other players
CTRL + SHIFT + INSERT - Shares your position with other players

Waila - Shows information about what you are looking at
NUMPAD1 - show/hide the Waila HUD
NUMPAD3 - shows how to craft what you are looking at
NUMPAD4 - shows the crafting usages of the thing you are looking at


[note]If you have a non-standard keyboard layout, using the java 17-21 version of GTNH §omight§r help you in being able to use certain keys for keybinds.
[/note]
data.title: §9§lE_TOO_MANY_KEYS

data.name: Even more challenges needed?
data.data:
You have played through most of the pack a few times already? Maybe you even made a Stargate? Or are you just looking for something a bit different? Don't worry, we have a few options for you:

- Play in Hardcore. Either Minecraft Hardcore, or BetterQuesting Hardcore. The latter is a bit more forgiving. Maybe this seems impossible, but people have indeed reached UEV+ in Minecraft Hardcore. Better be prepared to restart a few times. This is obviously not for everybody.

- Never make a rocket. The so called §ono-rocket run§r is somewhat supported by now, you will be able to do almost everything in the pack. Use bees, crops, and blood magic meteors as your main resource production. Be warned though that such a challenge is grindy and slow. For instance, you might need to collect large amounts of andratite ore or via the aluminium bauxite slag route to get your first titanium. Or have to start breeding bees early without much technology to help.

- Skyblock. Yes, really. It is also known as Garden of Grind and it is absolutely brutal. There is no actually supported skyblock version of the pack but some players have figured out the minimal amount of changes needed to make it work. Ask around or search on the official discord channel for all the details. But don't expect any fun down this road.

- Speedrunning. A few players have designed some basic rules and have started to record speedruns to early game goals like the Coke Oven. Ask around or search on the official discord channel for all the details. Maybe you just want to watch how they do it.
data.title: §9§lEven more challenges needed?

data.name: Fire, Fire, Grandpa!
data.data: Time to burn some stuff, isn't it? You can't make charcoal in it, but you sure will find some usage for it soon™.
data.title: §9§lFire, Fire, Grandpa!

data.name: Fluffy and Red
data.data: Epic quest: Kill some sheep! (And try to get some wool, for a bed, obviously...)
data.title: §9§lFluffy and Red

data.name: Food Variants
data.data: Maybe you noticed already that eating the same food too often is very boring and not healthy anymore. Some food like tea leaf can be taken to the furnace and processed further. So take a break and drink a cup of tea. Maybe munch some tasty raisins as they are very nice.
data.title: §9§lFood Variants

data.name: Get That Stone
data.data:
Look at you, with your shiny wooden pickaxe!

Time to mine some cobblestone. Yay! You can even improve your dirt hut!
data.title: §9§lGet That Stone

data.name: Goals
data.data:
GregTech New Horizons is a long and intricate mod pack with massive amounts of custom content and over three thousand quests to guide you through it.

We recommend you set yourself small goals from tier to tier and see how far your journey takes you.

The ultimate late game goal is to craft a Stargate or two, but the recipe is outrageous, and very few players have ever done so.

If you need a big goal for your run, we suggest to aim for something less crazy.
Like going to the moon if it's your first time playing.
Or making and automating an Assembly Line if you have never done so.
Or crafting the Tier 8 Rocket which is the last regular rocket and is reached in UHV.
data.title: §9§lGoals

data.name: Loading the Chunks
data.data:
Minecraft works in chunks - the 16x16 columns of blocks from bedrock to sky. The chunks in a radius around you are simulated or, in other words, chunkloaded. If a chunk is not loaded, nothing happens in it - crops don't grow, machines don't work. Thus, you want to have your base chunkloaded when you're off exploring. Later on, you want your base chunkloaded so things don't spontaneously blow up, especially multi-block machines.

You can chunkload in a few ways:

1) The ServerUtilities mod. With default settings, you will not be able to chunkload. Feel free to change that in the config if you are in singleplayer (SP) or running your own server.

2) Use four types of Anchors from Railcraft, although they are not craftable until the Low Voltage (LV) tier. In SP, or a server you run, cheat in Admin Anchors to chunkload forever, for free. They're limited on servers to prevent TPS dropping from people chunkloading a base forever when they aren't even there. On the officials, you need to use Ender Fragments, Ender Pearls, or Coins to fuel them. Look at the tooltip on each for how long it will work, and in what chunkloader.

3) Use one of the blocks that chunkloads itself. If you do this on a server, expect the admins to possibly get very mad at you if it's not something you're allowed to do. Same for vanilla methods.

Don't use chicken chunks to get anchor-like blocks. It's buggy.
data.title: §9§lLoading the Chunks

data.name: Main Quests and Secondary Quests
data.data:
Now that you've made it this far, you might notice how the two new quests look different.

The quest with the jagged edges is a main quest - it is linked to other main quests by a thick line. You must complete main quests to unlock the next tier and to progress in general. If you can't progress, go back to previous tiers and look for uncompleted main quests.

The other quest is an optional quest, and is not needed to unlock new tiers. However, optional quests often introduce you to useful items or processes.

What are the coins for? You can use them to purchase things in the "Coins, Coins, Coins" questbook tab - you have to scroll to the bottom once it unlocks!

In case you started in a bad biome, here's enough coins to purchase some saplings.
data.title: §9§lMain Quests and Secondary Quests
data.tooltip:
Main Quests and Secondary Quests
Prequest requests:
Crafting Time

data.name: Monster Hunter
data.data:
It's about time to craft something more useful: A sword!

Now that you have a sword, you will get credit for monster kills in the Kill All the Things tab. Watch out, monsters in this world will chew you up and spit you out!

You can find additional weapon quests on the Getting Around tab.
data.title: §9§lMonster Hunter

data.name: Monster Trap
data.data:
If you're lucky enough to spawn near a sand- or rainforest biome, you can find some quicksand.

Collect a stack of it, dig a small ditch, and fill it with the quicksand to protect your "dirt base" home. Just don't fall in!
data.title: §9§lMonster Trap

data.name: Moron's Manual for Massacring Monsters
data.data:
If you haven't noticed, this world is a true hellscape full of Special Mobs and Infernals around every corner. Unlike in vanilla, a player has to actually stay aware and pay attention to what they are fighting. Here are some tips.

If an infernal has Vengeance, don't shoot it with your 56-damage crossbow!

A high health infernal with regeneration is hard to kill. Even worse if it is a witch that can also heal herself. In those cases, run like hell, or bring a soul vial to capture it and throw it into Mount Doom.

Watch out for zombies with fishing poles - they can pull you to them. And zombies with a bow and arrow - they can shoot you back!
data.title: §9§lMoron's Manual for Massacring Monsters
data.tooltip:
Moron's Manual for Massacring Monsters
Prequest requests:
Monster Hunter

data.name: Mushroom Biomes? Why Are There So Many?
data.data:
The GTNH pack is made for the Realistic World Generator (RWG).

If your setup uses the vanilla biomes worldgen, you will get huge Mushroom biomes over the map. If you have this problem, please generate a new world with the RWG.

If you met this problem on a server, put "level-type=rwg" into the server.properties file and generate a new world.
data.title: §9§lMushroom Biomes? Why Are There So Many?
data.tooltip:
Mushroom Biomes? Why Are There So Many?
Prequest requests:
Your First Night

data.name: Numbers in the Corner?
data.data:
What's with the numbers in the corner? That is the In-Game Info (IGI) mod. Some of the info it gives is useful right away, some of it shines later on in progression.

For now, the most important thing it does is showing if you are in an ore chunk. Further quests will explain what it means.

If you want to hide it, type "/igi disable" in the chat. Type "/igi enable" if you want to turn it back on.

The command "/igi config" opens the configuration window to control its position, scale, and size.

The command "/xu_tps" from the mod Extra Utilities toggles numbers to measure ticktime in milliseconds and the TPS (Ticks Per Second). TPS is a measure of how well your server is running. The ideal TPS is 20.00 (meaning a ticktime of at most 50.00). If your TPS is less than 15, things are going to start lagging noticeably. At 10 or less TPS, it is going to be hard to play.
The tooltip shows three types of measurement: instantaneous, average, and worst-case. Each one first shows the ticktime and then the TPS in brackets.

If you need suggestions on solving TPS problems, feel free to ask for help in the GTNH Discord.

While GTNH comes with recommended default settings, in particular when it comes to balance, there are many commands and configurations to customize your experience. They range from accessibility or debug tools to visual customization all the way to various cheats. You can find a small overview on [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Commands_and_Configurations[/url].
data.title: §9§lNumbers in the Corner?
data.tooltip:
Numbers in the Corner?
Prequest requests:
Your First Night

data.name: Oak Trees Are Not Apple Trees
data.data:
Oak trees that give apples? Who the hell added this to minecraft?
You found a way of combining an oak sapling and an apple to get an apple tree sapling. Try to plant one to get a permanent source of food.

Once you complete this quest, check out the rest of the Quest Tabs. A new one, "Coins, Coins, Coins", has unlocked. You'll want to look through all the quest tabs to make sure something new hasn't unlocked somewhere else occasionally. There are lots of tabs, so be sure to scroll down!
data.title: §9§lOak Trees Are Not Apple Trees
data.tooltip:
Oak Trees Are Not Apple Trees
Prequest requests:
Main Quests and Secondary Quests

data.name: Permanent Offhand!
data.data:
With the release of version 2.8 of GTNH, the modern offhand slot has been backported and is available for every player.

With this, we say goodbye to the Battlegear slots of before. The three slots on either side of your hotbar, default key "G", are no longer!

This feature also works with any item that opens a GUI, like a backpack for example. This makes inventory management easier and helps with certain tedious tasks.

Default Keybind to swap between mainhand and offhand: §9F§r

[warn]Any items that were in the Battlegear slots should return to your inventory or dropped on the ground if your inventory is full.[/warn]

[note]You can also toggle various Torch Tweaks in Backhand's mod client configs. They are disabled by default, but you may find them useful if you love holding torches in your offhand.[/note]
data.title: §9§lPermanent Offhand!

data.name: Porkchops With Attitude
data.data: The only zombie pigman to watch out for is the Vampire Pigman. He hardly takes any damage unless you use a wooden sword as a stake, or have a magical sword.
data.title: §9§lPorkchops With Attitude
data.tooltip:
Porkchops With Attitude
Prequest requests:
Caught in the Web

data.name: Rest in Pieces
data.data: It's GLOPPing time! Go kill some pigs to gather meat.
data.title: §9§lRest in Pieces

data.name: Shields UP
data.data: With a sword in one hand, what can you do with the other? Right, you need a shield. Let's make one.
data.title: §9§lShields UP

data.name: Shield Update
data.data: Your wooden shield is very weak. So you should make a better one. Looks like you need some leather, so go and find some cows.
data.title: §9§lShield Update

data.name: Soft Mallet Adventure
data.data:
You now have some melon slices or pumpkins but what can you do with them?

You can just eat them or... use a mallet to get some seeds. OK, let's craft one. Perhaps you can use this mallet for some other things too.
data.title: §9§lSoft Mallet Adventure

data.name: SO...TIRED...MUST...SLEEP...
data.data:
Sleepy time, and the end of the tutorial.

Congratulations! You've built your first hideout, and you should have a steady supply of food by now.

See you again in Tier 0!

[note](Any color bed will complete this quest)[/note]
data.title: §9§lSO...TIRED...MUST...SLEEP...

data.name: Staying Cool in the Heat
data.data: If you happen to be near a snowy biome, you can harvest the snow to make delicious smoothies. They are more satiating than eating the berries by themselves.
data.title: §9§lStaying Cool in the Heat
data.tooltip:
Staying Cool in the Heat
Prequest requests:
Collecting Some Berries
Soft Mallet Adventure

data.name: Sticks 'n Stones
data.data:
This book has a built-in reading light, lucky you! You can read about quests while you're waiting for the night to be over, but for now, you may want to get the basics done. If it isn't dark already, go out and collect some gravel and wood.

Keep in mind that you need food, so look for Pam's Harvestcraft gardens. Save some of the drops from them for seeds. Alternatively, right-click the gardens with an empty hand to get the garden item itself. If you place it somewhere else, it will spread into more of the same garden up to a limit within that area.

Make sure to read the info-quests linked to the first quest, they have important info!
data.title: §9§lSticks 'n Stones

data.name: Storage For Days
data.data:
Now that you've gotten your tools and are about to go collect a bunch of stuff, it's time to make some storage for it.
Take some of your wood, and craft a chest. You will need 4 wood, 4 planks, and 1 flint.
data.title: §9§lStorage For Days

data.name: Tell Me When We Reach 20
data.data:
Jumping all the time is exhausting and makes you really hungry.
To reduce your food depletion, you might want to use stairs instead.
data.title: §9§lTell Me When We Reach 20

data.name: Tools
data.data:
Now that you've got a shelter and a crafting table, you should make some tools, unless you'd like to continue punching trees with your bare hands.

You should probably make the axe first so you can get wood for the rest more easily.
data.title: §9§lTools

data.name: What's That...?
data.data:
You've seen a lot of trees, but there are a few that look really special. You are sure that these trees are much more than just wood to build your home with or used to get charcoal. You're sure that these will be Very Important soon™.

The best place to find them is in a Magical Forest, but if you can't find one, you can try a Garden or Cherry Wood Grove. Or just randomly everywhere.

If you have trouble finding them, you can go to the Coins tab and buy them.
data.title: §9§lWhat's That...?

data.name: ...What You Sow
data.data:
If you, by chance, did read the previous quest and planted the carrots, then you're fine.

Meanwhile, you should turn some more fruits and vegetables into seeds, and increase the size of your farm to get a steady supply of food.
data.title: §9§l...What You Sow

data.name: Where's the Flint?
data.data:
As you might have noticed when collecting gravel, no Flint dropped for you.

Well, there is a... recipe for that. Look up Flint in Not Enough Items (NEI) and craft some!

The search field of NEI is at the bottom of the screen when you open your inventory. The results are on the right side.
data.title: §9§lWhere's the Flint?

data.name: You Reap...
data.data:
You won't always get food rewards from the quests, so it might be a good idea to take care of that problem.

As you've crafted a hoe already, go and find some water nearby to make a field. With this modpack you can only make farmland within range of water. Let's trade some sticks for a carrot, so you can start your own farm.

To get other wheat, use a hoe on grass away from water. You'll get Witchery seeds too - save those for later.

Start planting a Cotton field because it's a key early-game resource.

You can also get seeds from villages, and grow the seeds from the Pam's garden food.
data.title: §9§lYou Reap...

data.name: Your First 'Long Range' Weapon
data.data:
You can't make a vanilla bow or Tinkers weapons yet, but you can make a spear!

Some monsters will become much easier to kill with this long-range weapon.
data.title: §9§lYour First 'Long Range' Weapon

data.name: Your First Night
data.data:
Hello, friend, and welcome to GTNH!

Don't get used to things being nice and comfy, because in about ten minutes the sun will set, and unlike Vanilla Minecraft, there's no light whatsoever at night but plenty of Infernal mobs coming to get you. So your first task is to find food and shelter for the night.

But by the end of this quest tab you will have a bed to make things easier.

You don't need to keep this book. Even if you don't have the item, you can press Tilde (~) to view it at any time...unless you decided to change the keybind.

If you need any extra help or just want to hang out, feel free to visit our Discord server at [url]https://discord.gg/gtnh[/url]. And yes, the links are clickable! On the Discord, select your tech tier in #role-select - it will help people to tailor their advice to your situation.

Many GTNH topics are explained in our Wiki at [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Main_Page[/url]. It does not have the same extent and structure as the Questbook, but some things are much better with pictures and tables! The wiki also has tips on extra topics like what additional mods might work with the pack, how GTNH can be installed for modern Java versions or how to set up a server.

Additionally, there is a spreadsheet at [url]https://www.gtnewhorizons.com/spreadsheet[/url] for the info you would want a spreadsheet for.

If you play through a launcher that relies on [warn]CurseForge[/warn], be aware that it doesn't always work properly. It doesn't play well with all the custom versions of mods that this pack has. So if you have any problems, first switch to another launcher like MultiMC, Prism, or Technic. The wiki has instructions there as well. The latest version of the pack is available on the Discord channel from #announcements or with the !download command.

Hopefully you didn't get munched by a monster while reading this, good luck!
data.title: §9§lYour First Night

data.data:
Middle tier storage cell, which can contain 16,384 bytes of storage. 16,384 bytes of storage can hold 2,032 stacks of a single item, or 1,040 stacks, while holding 63 different items. The 16k storage cell uses 128 bytes of data to store a single type.

When placed inside a drive or chest will consume 1.5 AE/t.

data.name: 1k Component
data.data: Smallest storage component, used to make 1k ME storage cells, or can be upgraded to make 4k ME storage components. Can be recovered from a crafted 1k ME storage cell by fully emptying the storage cell, and shift-clicking it in your hand.
data.title: 1k Component

data.name: 1k Crafting Storage
data.data: Component of the crafting CPU which provides 1024 bytes of storage for crafting. The Crafting Storage blocks are the only necessary part. Each crafting CPU multiblock allows for a separate crafting job (this is different from sub-tasks of the same job). The more items in the recipe and sub-recipes, the more crafting storage you'll need. Having one big and a couple small might be a good idea, but remember it will try to use the best one available first when you order a craft. They are also used when a crafting card requests a craft, so you'll need several separate ones if you intend to use those a lot. A crafting CPU multiblock uses only one channel, regardless of its size. It must be square to form.
data.title: 1k Crafting Storage

data.name: 1k Essentia Component

data.title: 1k Essentia Component

data.name: 1k Essentia Storage Cell
data.data: Unlike the item version, these can only hold 12 types of essentia each. This tier holds 2,048 units if you fill it with a single type of essentia. If you fill it with 12 different types of essentia, you can have about 168 units of each. If you want one for every type of essentia, you'll need 67 of them. You'll want to make the essentia terminal to see what you have. They consume the same amount of AE as the item ones.

data.name: A Digital Singularity
data.data:
What? You filled up the Quantum storage cell? I hope it was with something better than Cobblestone. Anyway, you'd better make something EVEN bigger then.

Hmm, adding even more storage capacity to a single cell would result in something so dense with information that it would just collapse into a singularity. So why not be smart about it? Just use an already existing singularity! Build a sturdy casing around it and add some connecting components, and you should be good. Better use an eternal singularity, though, to make sure things remain stable.

[note]The Digital Singularity can store more than 4 quintillion items. If you manage to fill one up, please contact the dev team so that they can ban you for cheating... eh, I mean, congratulate you on your achievement, of course![/note]
data.title: A Digital Singularity
data.tooltip:
A Digital Singularity

Infinity Infrastructure
Master of Circuits
Well This Looks... Shiny?

data.name: Advanced Neutronium Tech
data.data:
Now that you've unlocked the neutronium energy cell, you can combine it with other objects to make powerful upgrades to your AE capabilities.

Combining with an ME controller gives you a controller with infinite energy.

Combining with a cable anchor & quartz fiber gives you a replacement for the quartz fiber cable that has infinite energy.

Combining with an advanced card will give you an energy card that will allow you to upgrade your wireless terminal to have infinite energy, wherever you go.

[note]It is HIGHLY recommended you use these tools wherever possible on main-nets and sub-nets as they are huge TPS savers[/note]
data.title: Advanced Neutronium Tech
data.tooltip:
Advanced Neutronium Tech
Prequest requests:
I'll Send Wireless Signals Where I Want, Thank You

data.name: Advanced Wireless Setup Kit
data.data:
The Advanced Wireless Setup Kit is a must have for heavy wireless users. Instead of being a 1:1 back and forth it allows you to enter a "queuing mode" and a "binding mode" where you can select multiple targets at one time to bind in a row.

When binding to connectors, the kit will bind connectors in the exact order that they were queued in.

To clear a queue and reset the kit, just shapelessly craft it into itself in your inventory.
data.title: Advanced Wireless Setup Kit
data.tooltip:
Advanced Wireless Setup Kit
Prequest requests:
ME in Your Cleanroom
Tier 7 (ZPM)

data.name: Adv. Stocking Bus
data.data:
Stocking bus but better!

This one can pull first 16 types of items automatically from ME network, which can be useful for some automations. Minimum stack size and refresh time can be configured in the GUI.

[note]Using this on your main network is probably not a very good idea.[/note]
data.title: Adv. Stocking Bus

data.name: AE2 Fluid Crafting
data.data:
Fluid crafting directly integrated in your ME system. NO WAY!

AE2FC is a powerful add-on that was backported for GTNH.

Now, what do you need to get that juicy stuff working?
Every ME System needs a Fluid Discretizer. It allows for on demand crafting. While you can use AE2FC without Fluid Discretizer for moving fluids, you need a Discretizer for autocrafting.

Then you also need a Fluid Terminal or a Fluid Processing Terminal for the Assembly Line.

When creating patterns you will notice your fluids being placed as if they were items.
Your finished patterns will look blue-ish. Placing those in a Dual Interface will allow AE2 to push the fluids and items both. Note. Fluids are being sent first, then items.
You can switch the dual interface on the top right if you want it to keep fluids in stock.

If you use a blue pattern (fluid pattern) in a normal interface, AE2 will send the fluid as a fluid packet. This is just a representation of the fluid as an item. A fluid decoder can turn it back into a fluid and saves it in the fluid grid.

You can use an ingredient buffer (large or normal) so your items and fluids sent by a pattern can get stored internally in one block. The normal buffer can hold 9 items and 4 fluids whereas the large one can hold 27 items and 7 fluids. It is not needed, but you can use it to automate things with item and fluid conduits.

If you want to automate single blocks it's as easy as eating chocolate cake while on a diet:
Make the pattern, make an interface, boom- done! It will automatically insert the fluid in the fluid inventory of a single block machine.

Even automating more difficult things like the Assembly Line becomes much easier with these tools.

If you need more detailed information, visit the wiki:

[url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Applied_Energistics_2#Autocrafting_in_AE2[/url]

[note]The Extra Cells mod has been removed. Any old components and cells were converted to AE2 and AE2FC parts where possible.[/note]
data.title: AE2 Fluid Crafting

AE2 Fluid Crafting

data.name: Alpha and Omega
data.data:
The ME Annihilation Plane destroys blocks as if you had mined them, and places them into the network. The Identity version acts as if silk touch was used.

The ME Formation Plane does the opposite, it places blocks into the world. You'll need to tell it what to place/drop though. This can work in both block and item mode.
data.title: Alpha and Omega
