Your Oil is Too Crude? Refine it!
Wheaty Juice

data.name: Leaves of Steel
data.data: Well, steel leaves anyways. Instead of grinding Twilight Forest for steel leaves, grow a crop in peace.
data.title: Leaves of Steel
data.tooltip:
Leaves of Steel
Prequest requests:
Ironwood is Better Than Normal Wood

data.name: Magic Metal Berry
data.data: ...is obviously the name of my cover band. But also a great crop for Thaumium or Void metals. Requires a block of iron or thaumium to get thaumium, and void metal block to get void metal. Like other ore berries, it only grows in dim light. Any oreberry should have a decent chance of yielding this.
data.title: Magic Metal Berry
data.tooltip:
Magic Metal Berry
Prequest requests:
More Useful IC2 Crops

data.name: Metals From the Earth
data.data:
With higher tier crops you can even increase your ore production. Mixing some of these fibers and leaves with crushed ores can quadruple your output, and some can even be converted directly to dust. Later you can mix these materials to make purified ore with some UU matter.

Show me your ability to get these metal crops and I'll give you some more fertilizer and some decent stat seedbags of rarer crops. Good source crops are essence berries or any of the oreberries.

You will need the proper oreblock beneath the crop to reach 100 percent maturity. For best growing conditions use dirt in between the ore block and the crop.

For Ferru and Aurelia you will have to use a block of metal instead of a GT ore block - a vanilla ore block automined from the Twilight Forest will however work. You can also buy some from the coins tab. WAILA will tell you if the crop will accept the block you are using.
data.title: Metals From the Earth
data.tooltip:
Metals From the Earth
Prequest requests:
Reed and Resin

data.name: Metals From the Sky
data.data:
You can even create metals not found on Earth using crops! You'll need the proper metal block beneath the crop in order for them to fully mature.

BTW, higher tier crops have a lower chance of dropping seeds, so consider breeding a second one before you try breaking them, OK?
data.title: Metals From the Sky
data.tooltip:
Metals From the Sky
Prequest requests:
Metals From the Earth

data.name: Milk of the Earth-Mother
data.data: Milkwart means you can get rid of all your cows. Isn't that nice?
data.title: Milk of the Earth-Mother

data.name: Min-Maxing Crops
data.data:
Breed stickreed until it's around 20/31/10, then create other crops with it, they inherit the stats. Crossbreeding with the ones you got on the way to raise their stats is also good.

Set up camp in a swamp/jungle type biome around Y130, or use the biome changing methods to make one. This is way faster when breeding crops, not just growing them for drops.

Use multifarms, always. You can use them together with the harvesters if you have super fast crops. Or just use more farms. Or add more gearboxes.

Dark glass is nice for oreberry crops.

To avoid weeding, checkerboard up and down on your multifarm. It may look stupid, but no weeds, Gr 23->31, and +2 AQ!

Use fertilia to create more fertilizer.

You can replace mob farms with crops if you don't care about the other drops. Infernals drop special stuff though.

Use WAs in TE mode to accelerate crops if you need it. Mostly useful for breeding, statting up, and for the primordial berry crop.

As you tier up, you can create 31/31/0 crops with the machines and UUM. It's up to you whether it's worth it though.

Go do bees if you want something higher than EV tier materials.
data.title: Min-Maxing Crops

data.name: More Red, Less Wheat
data.data:
When breeding together crops for an output crop, try to get crops that are close in tier to the output crop, and have similar attributes to the output crop.

For example, Redwheat has "Red", "Wheat" and "Redstone" attributes and is tier 6. Nether Wart has "Red" and is tier 5. Use the cropnalyzer crop prediction mode to see how many points Redwheat has using two Nether Wart.

You'll also want to make sure the light level is between 5-10 for this particular cross breeding to occur. Honestly, it's the worst, condition-wise.

Really though, once you get to MV it's better to make a Glowstone crop and centrifuge it for redstone. Or a redstone block crop. Or just mine it, honestly. Red wheat == Dead wheat.
data.title: More Red, Less Wheat
data.tooltip:
More Red, Less Wheat
Prequest requests:
Hops, the Source of Beer

data.name: More Useful IC2 Crops
data.data: Once you get into crops, consider trying other crops that may be of interest. Don't underestimate them, they can be quite strong if used well!
data.title: More Useful IC2 Crops
data.tooltip:
More Useful IC2 Crops
Prequest requests:
Reed and Resin

data.name: Moron's Manual to Fecund Farms
data.data:
If you ever wanted to know how crop breeding works, you are in the right place! Get some Crops - the sticks, that is - and some seeds from farming with a hoe or mattock. You can also place some plants and berries directly on crop sticks. Good plants to start with are flowers, wheat, cactus and sugarcane.

Make a plot of farmland with your tool and place water in the middle. For now, make 3x1 plots, separated by a row of dirt or cobble. You want to be able to see the center of each column of 3x1 plots all at once, like this:
FFFdddFFF
dddFFFddd
FFFdddFFF
dddFFFddd
FFFdWdFFF
dddFFFddd
FFFdddFFF
dddFFFddd
FFFdddFFF
Now place crop sticks in each end of the 3x1 plot. Then place the seeds on the sticks and wait a bit.

When they are almost fully grown you can put double crop sticks in the center spots by using crop sticks once more on already placed crop sticks. This center area can now grow new crops, even new species.

With some luck you might get a new unknown seed which can be scanned later.

Weeds need to be removed with a trowel or spade otherwise your field will become overgrown by them.

Using 3x1 plots is easy and not much work. Check them every 5-10 minutes to remove weeds and gather new seeds. If you forget, you only lose one or two seeds.

If you find a really nice seed, you can do 3x3 or 5x5 plots with the nice seed in the middle and others next to it for crossing. But this requires more babysitting since weeds could destroy the whole field.

Note that the more crops next to the double crop stick the faster new plants will show up, up to 4 obviously. This is also the way to get new versions of the same plant, you can't do it with just one parent like Agricraft.

Don't leave new crops in these intensive fields. Pull them out and hopefully get a seedbag. Put low stat seeds in production fields that don't require babysitting. Keep the high stat seeds for more crossing.

Crossing happens when two or more almost-mature crops are next to a double cropstick. There is a high chance of getting the same species as the parents. The rest of the time will be a mutation. For more details, check out the IC2 cropnalyzer quest.
data.title: Moron's Manual to Fecund Farms
data.tooltip:
Moron's Manual to Fecund Farms
Prequest requests:
Important Tools

data.name: Moss
data.data: Given up on looking for moss in the Twilight Forest? You can easily grow a crop that will give you the various mosses, perfect for your Tinker's tools. Start with a lily pad.
data.title: Moss

data.name: Never Hungry Again
data.data:
Congratulations! You have gracefully served your penance; no longer shall you be bound by the woes of hunger.

With this new trinket (equipable in a baubles slot) you will automatically have your hunger and saturation replenished, so long as the nanobooster stays charged.

Additionally it will do it's best to keep you healed, though it cannot ward off death completely on its own.

[note]P.S. Upgrading your wireless charger might be a good idea![/note]
data.title: Never Hungry Again

data.name: New Threads
data.data:
Tired of killing spiders for string? Grow some flax for an easy non-biting source of string.

You can also directly place Cotton seeds on cropsticks to grow cotton that way. With some Corium in the next quest, you can get easy tanned leather.
data.title: New Threads

data.name: No Chicken Escapes!
data.data: Do you like pies? I sure do! There are many varieties of pies available for you. The chicken pot pie is one of the easiest to make. Just a chicken, potato, carrot, and some dough. The fruit pies are a little simpler, so they don't quite restore as much saturation, but are great for filling tummies while you wait for the best foods to wear off.
data.title: No Chicken Escapes!

data.name: Other Magic Flowers
data.data: Other magical flowers are possible such as shimmerleaf, mandragora, wolf's bane, and more.
data.title: Other Magic Flowers

data.name: Plants That Make Their Own Fertilizer?
data.data:
Sign me up! This plant will create fertilizer ingredients for you.

The best plants to cross to get Fertilia are zomplant, venomilia, trollplant, or spidernip. Watch out for venomilia though, not only is it poisonous, it also acts like a weed at growth 8+!

Use the IC2 fertilizer and apatite this drops to make forestry fertilizer if using the multifarm.

[note]BTW this is the rarest one, with a 0.76% chance even for zomplant, so expect it to take approximately 3 eternities.[/note]
data.title: Plants That Make Their Own Fertilizer?
data.tooltip:
Plants That Make Their Own Fertilizer?
Prequest requests:
Unknown Seeds No More

data.name: Potato Cakes
data.data: Potatoes, onions, butter and a skillet make very tasty potato cakes.
data.title: Potato Cakes

data.name: Potatoes, Carrots, Pumpkins and Melons
data.data:
Your seeds have three different values: Growth, gain, and resistance (GGR).

The only way to change a crop's GGR without 3rd party tools (like NBTedit!) is through cross breeding. When two plants cross-breed, the resulting plant will have a GGR score that is between both "parent" plants' GGR. Sometimes it will also be a little bit higher or lower. Thus, to obtain high GGR scores you must go through numerous generations of crossbreeding.

The highest score for GGR is 31, while the lowest is 0.

[note]BTW, if you want to skip all this BS, the nbtedit command is /nbtedit me, click root in the upper left, then scroll down to inventory, and find the seedbag (empty your inventory first to make it easier) and click on the icons until you find the page with the stats. Once you've found the GGR stats, select one and click edit in the upper left, make sure to save.[/note]

[warn]Remember that you can permanently brick your character! So make a backup first if you don't know what you're doing, or want to edit your actual character.[/warn]

Of course, you can't do any of this on a server.
data.title: Potatoes, Carrots, Pumpkins and Melons
data.tooltip:
Potatoes, Carrots, Pumpkins and Melons
Prequest requests:
Unknown Seeds No More

data.name: Pumpkin Pie
data.data:
Pumpkin Pie is a traditional US dessert that is particularly popular for Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas.

1,5 Food Bars for just two Pumpkins and a three sugar. Bon Appétit.
data.title: Pumpkin Pie

data.name: Put the Petal to the Metal
data.data:
... with the Bio Diesel you produce from Canola!

You can try getting it from dandelions, cocoa, potatoes or lemons.

Put the Petal to the Metal

data.name: Really OP Food
data.data:
You've heard about Dezil's Marshmallow, a really OP food which can be found from time to time in chests. What about I show you a way to cook this stuff yourself?

After you've mastered the flowing spirit in the dream dimension (witchery), put a bit of flour, sugar, salis mundus and draconium dust in your IV Mixer.
The recipe starts when you give flowing spirit to it and gives you malformed slush, a very stinky and disgusting piece of...something.

Be careful, you'll get blindness II when holding it in your hand.
data.title: Really OP Food
data.tooltip:
Really OP Food

Brew of Flowing Spirit
IV Mixer

data.name: Red Touch Yellow
data.data: Garnets are actually more valuable than Sapphires. They're an early source of Chrome and Manganese, which you'll need for HV machines. You can also centrifuge Pyrope, Almandine, and Spessartine Dust with Nitric Acid to obtain a variety of additional passive resources. To reach maturity, you will need a block of Garnet (either type) beneath this crop. You can get Garnets from the HV macerator and Spessartine Ore, or you can use an Implosion Compressor to turn Garnet Sands into crystals to make blocks.
data.title: Red Touch Yellow
data.tooltip:
Red Touch Yellow
Prequest requests:
Deep Blue Sea of Sapphires

data.name: Reed and Resin
data.data:
One of the first useful crops you'll get is Stickreed. It's fast growing, and can produce sticky resin and sugarcane (harvest before it reaches full maturity). It's also great for crossing with other crops to raise their stats. One of the best strategies is to get these to around 20/31/10, then breed out from there. Most people will say 23/31/10, but 24+ act like weeds, so it's better to have some wiggle room.

I'll trade you some fertilizer for 2 stacks of each.

[note]PS, you don't really need rubber trees if you can get these.[/note]

[note]You'll need a Basic Scanner to scan your Stickreed seeds once you get them, though any set of stats will work. See the quest in LV, and note it requires MV circuits.[/note]
data.title: Reed and Resin
data.tooltip:
Reed and Resin
Prequest requests:
Unknown Seeds No More

data.name: Renewable Oil
data.data: Oil from crops? Makes as much sense as oil from bees!
data.title: Renewable Oil

data.name: Rum
data.data: Rum. Yummy!
data.title: Rum

data.name: Son of Odin One-Eye
data.data: The God of Thunder crop lets you increase your Thorium ore from the Nether to 4x. It also will give you Uranium you can use for Reactoria crops.
data.title: Son of Odin One-Eye

data.name: Speed Up Your Plant Growth
data.data: To speed up the growth process a bit you can use a fertilizer. You will note, however, that bone meal no longer works. A bit of ash, apatite or calcite mixed with some water in a chemical reactor will give you the fertilizer you need. Apply by hand.
data.title: Speed Up Your Plant Growth

data.name: Stonelillies
data.data:
Stone lillies allow you to get dusts without having to look for granites, basalt, or marble. A great renewable way to get calcite, fluorine, or bulk aluminium (and a tiny bit of uranium).

These require the original block directly beneath them to grow properly.

There is also a Grey stonelilly for stone dust (who needs more of that??) and a Yellow stonelilly for sand or Endstone dust. Handy for the clever chemist!
data.title: Stonelillies

data.name: Sugarcanes
data.data: Sugarcanes are a source of sugar, and therefore alcohol. If you want some rum or sugar, you'll need these.
data.title: Sugarcanes

data.name: Sweet Tooth
data.data:
Sugarcane or Reed not keeping up with your sugary needs? Sugar beets give 8 sugar per beet. Potatoes or carrots should easily give you sugar beets.

Hmm, now I want some candy. Give me some sugar from your beets. I'll share some with you.

[note]Electrolyze the sugar into O2 for an easy source.[/note]
data.title: Sweet Tooth

data.name: Tasty Toast
data.data: Smelt your bread again and you get some toast! It gives you more nutrition points, and unlocks more culinary potential!
data.title: Tasty Toast
data.tooltip:
Tasty Toast

...What You Sow
First Handmade Bread

data.name: The gathering: Sugar
data.data: Stockpiling sugar might be a good idea if you have a sweet tooth. Or not?
data.title: The gathering: Sugar

data.data:
Need an alternate source of Chlorine? Breed some Tearstalks to get Ghast Tears for making salt water.

;-;

Nether warts should yield tearstalks.

data.tooltip:
The Ground is Crying

More Useful IC2 Crops

data.name: The industrial way
data.data: Making rum can be automated, but you need to follow this industrial way for it.
data.title: The industrial way

data.name: Time for a Spade
data.data:
This item is a combined Weeding Trowel, Hoe and Shovel. If you're the type that accidentally does things, only use this when necessary, as it's easy to mess up and use it to harvest/destroy your crops when you wanted to get rid of a weed.

You can use it to get seeds from crops when they're §9immature§r using §6right-click§r at very low rates. Using [warn]left-click[/warn] when §9immature§r will result in nothing.

If it's §amature§r, use §6left-click§r to have a higher chance of a seed dropping. Using [warn]right-click[/warn] when §amature§r will result in lower seed drops than punching it normally.

Keep in mind that the higher the tier/stats of the crop, the lower the chances. By a lot.

[note]The formula is 1+tanh((-1)(X+5((-Re/2)+Gr+Ga)/21)/12); X=0 to 16, where Re, Gr, Ga are respectively Resistance, Growth and Gain stat of the crop, and X is tier. Don't ask me whether this is for L/R-click, ask bart or look at the code.[/note]
data.title: Time for a Spade

data.name: Turning Dirt into proper Soil
data.data:
With an Assembler and some Seed Oil, you can turn Dirt and Sand into Garden Soil. This optimal Soil does not require nearby water, and Crops won't break when you fall on or run near it.

However, unlike watered Farmland, it doesn't contribute to the humidity stat or speed up IC2 crops, so it's not useful for min-maxing.

The same goes for Enchanted Earth, the Lamp of Growth, Sprinklers, etc.
data.title: Turning Dirt into proper Soil
data.tooltip:
Turning Dirt into proper Soil
Prequest requests:
First Breeding

data.name: Uncooked Slush
data.data:
Next step is to form this slush into the right shape. Use a Marshmallow form and press it with your iv forming press. Remember to sterilize it after using it.

Be careful, you'll get blindness and hunger II holding it.
data.title: Uncooked Slush

data.name: Unknown Seeds No More
data.data:
You have a lot of unknown seeds already. Use your scanner to scan all the seeds.

Seeds can be planted again to breed better and more resilient crops.

Later you can use your portable scanner to see the crop stats while still in the ground.

Growability depends on having dirt beneath your crop (4 max), biome (swamp/jungle types are all pretty much the same), air quality (increases up to Y124 and don't place a lot above/around your plants), hydration, and fertilizer. When the crop tier and plant stats get high enough, they will actually die without enough Growability. This is never a concern if you use a good biome though.

As long as you water and fertilize them, you can pretty much grow crops anywhere.

If the Growth stat gets too high, greater than 24 or so, the plant will spread weeds onto neighbors.

Some crops, such as Redwheat or oreberries, require certain light levels to crossbreed or grow.
data.title: Unknown Seeds No More

data.name: Vegan, But Still Want to Eat Meat?
data.data: Instead of killing animals, just mutate some crazy GMOs into making animal products for you. Science!
data.title: Vegan, But Still Want to Eat Meat?
data.tooltip:
Vegan, But Still Want to Eat Meat?

More Useful IC2 Crops

data.name: Wasps honey
data.data:
Giant wasps can be found in the Nether. Quick! Sneak into their hive and steal some honey!

[note]Just having the fluid in cells or buckets in your inventory lets the quest detect it.[/note]

data.name: Water, Water, Everywhere
data.data:
Even though you have to plant crops near the water, they don't actually get any hydration unless you apply water manually. Make a hydration cell and use it on your crops to increase their growth speed.

You can recycle empty cells in an extractor.
data.title: Water, Water, Everywhere

data.name: Wax On, Wax Off
data.data:
You can take vanilla tree saplings and place them directly on crop sticks. This will give you a "bonsai" tree. Bonsai trees will give you drops just like a tree, but without the wasted CPU of placing all the tree blocks just to chop them down again.

This can be significant overhead on a server, so if you want to be nice, breed some bonsai trees for your pyrolyze ovens. They also drop a ton and are fast, especially statted up, so there's no reason not to if you can automate them.
data.title: Wax On, Wax Off
data.tooltip:
Wax On, Wax Off
Prequest requests:
Moron's Manual to Fecund Farms

data.name: Weed Ex
data.data:
Weed-EX is used to prevent the growth of Weeds on empty Crop blocks at the cost of some weed-EX. Damage to the crop's quality is illusory, and not true. We have people that have looked at the code, we assure you. §oUnless§r it counts as a weed (venomilia Gr 8+, any other crop Gr 24+), then it loses maybe 1 stat. Maybe. And you can just increase it again too. And it might not take effect even then if you don't apply too much, like a crop matron won't.

Usage:
While holding Weed-Ex, right-click on a Crop to apply it. It can also be placed in a Crop Manager to automatically apply it to your crops.
data.title: Weed Ex
data.tooltip:
Weed Ex
Prequest requests:
Crop Automation
Brewing, the Industrial Way

data.name: Weeds
data.data: Weeds will show up from time to time on empty or double crop sticks. They will spread from there and take over all your precious crops, so harvest the weed with your weed trowel before you start desiring to reload the last backup. Later you can make some Weed-EX to prevent them from appearing (until it runs out).
data.title: Weeds

Weeds, weeds, and more weeds. You get so many of them while cross breeding.

Need some biogas cells for your power production in exchange? Or maybe some glowstone to light up your fields?

data.name: Witchery Seeds
data.data:
To get Witchery seeds, use a hoe on grass blocks away from water. To open the rest of the questline, you will need to do Thaumcraft quests and research the Witchery tab in the Thaumonomicon.

According to legend, when the root of the Mandrake plant is dug up it screams and kills all who hear it. This is only partially true. A fully grown Mandrake may scream causing immense discomfort to those around. This is why it is best to harvest the Mandrake root at night when the plant is more likely to be dormant. The fully grown Mandrake can be harvested to obtain more Mandrake seeds and a Mandrake.

Breaking a fully grown Mandrake plant will either yield Mandrake Root or the Mandrake may awaken and cause all sorts of mischief (and pain to the ears!).

Belladonna seeds can be planted and eventually grow into the multistage belladonna plant. The fully grown belladonna plant can be harvested to obtain more Belladonna seeds and a Belladonna flower.

Snowbell seeds can be planted and eventually grow into the multistage snowbell plant. The fully grown snowbell plant can be harvested to obtain more Snowbell seeds, snowballs and occasionally an Icy Needle.

Water Artichoke seeds can be planted and eventually grow into the multistage Water Artichoke plant. The fully grown Water Artichoke plant can be harvested to obtain more Water Artichoke seeds and a Water Artichoke Globe.

Water Artichoke seeds can only be planted on water source blocks.

Garlic is a plantable crop that can be used to make tasty food, and to deal with vampires. It may be planted on tilled farm land, and will grow in five stages. When full grown the plant may be harvested for up to three dropped garlic bulbs. Which may either be replanted, or used in a crafting recipe.

Garlic bulbs can be used to make meaty stew, a particularly nourishing meal. It is also the main ingredient in making a Garlic Garland, a useful tool in warding off vampires. Finally, garlic can be used by witches in a Witches' Cauldron to make a vampire Weakening brew, and by Witch Hunters, to make vampire resistant armor.

Wolfsbane seeds can be planted and eventually grow into the multistage Wolfsbane plant. The fully grown Wolfsbane plant can be harvested to obtain more Wolfsbane seeds and the Wolfsbane flower.
data.title: Witchery Seeds

data.name: You Can't Tell Them Apart Either?
data.data:
Many plants look the same. Someday you'll be able to use a machine to tell them apart+more, but for now you can make a simple Plant Lens to at least identify species.

After using it you can tell the following:
Species
Crop tier
Whether it can grow (some crops have requirements)
Whether you can harvest it
Growth stage, and progress to the next
data.title: You Can't Tell Them Apart Either?
data.tooltip:
You Can't Tell Them Apart Either?
Prequest requests:
Moron's Manual to Fecund Farms

data.name: A Botanist's Best Friend
data.data:
Functional flowers are a large part of Botania. Most of them have nuances to how they operate, and these are generally best explained in the Lexica Botania: a codex of all Botania knowledge. This questline will explain the basics, but be sure to keep a copy of the Lexica Botania on hand so you can easily reference the details.

Besides being a repository of useful information, the Lexica Botania has another function: if, while holding it, you look at any Botania block in the world, you can shift-right-click on that block to open up the relevant page.

Something else you'll want for functional flowers is a handful of redstone roots. Flowers which have a redstone root in their recipe have the ability to toggle whether they are active by applying a redstone signal. Make a few before you move on.
data.title: A Botanist's Best Friend
data.tooltip:
A Botanist's Best Friend
Prequest requests:
The Roots of Magic

data.name: According To All Known Laws Of Mana Generation...
data.data: ...there is no way a bee should be able to produce mana. The beegonia doesn't know this, and will gladly eat up all of your spare drones to help with filling your mana pools.
data.title: According To All Known Laws Of Mana Generation...
data.tooltip:
According To All Known Laws Of Mana Generation...
Prequest requests:
Magic Blue Dust

data.name: A Deal With Alfar Industries
data.data:
So the rumors about the elves are true. Well, §owere§r true. Some are still true. And what isn't true used to be true.

Turns out they have since been talking to a mysterious individual they call the §oDream Master§r. Apparently that sparked an industrial revolution among the Alfar. Sadly, that means that they now insist on receiving the latest fashion in machinery to fuel their ever-expanding factories, in exchange for the elven materials that are now rapidly going out of fashion.

Someone needs to have a word with this guy...
data.title: A Deal With Alfar Industries

data.name: A Glimpse Into A Watery Future
data.data:
The next step is to make some catalysts. The Alchemical catalyst can use mana to change one item or block into a related item or block.

Put it under a filled mana pool, then try it out by making some prismarine.

The recipe will need to be researched in the Thaumonomicon.
data.title: A Glimpse Into A Watery Future
data.tooltip:
A Glimpse Into A Watery Future
Prequest requests:
Upgrading Your Mana Pool

data.name: Alfheim
data.data: Legends speak of a portal to a different realm filled with green energy.
data.title: Alfheim

data.name: Anti-Magnetism
data.data: If you've made a ring of magnetization, you may be getting tired of having to take it off around various Botania systems that require items to be on the ground in order to interact with flowers. The solegnolia is your solution to that. Simply place one down anywhere you don't want items to be automatically put in your inventory, and the ring of magnetization will be disabled while you're in the vicinity of the solegnolia. It doesn't even require mana!
data.title: Anti-Magnetism

data.name: Asgardandelion
data.data: A passive mana generating flower that can produce a never-ending torrent of mana.
data.title: Asgardandelion

data.name: Better Generating Flowers
data.data: If you want anything better than an endoflame, you'll need a runic altar. Fortunately, most runes are easily crafted as soon as you can make the runic altar. Sinful runes, however, require titanium to make. For now, just make one of each of the elemental runes; that'll be enough to get you started.
data.title: Better Generating Flowers
data.tooltip:
Better Generating Flowers
Prequest requests:
Botanic Infusion
Magic Blue Dust

data.name: Botanic Infusion
data.data:
The infusion altar will allow you to make runes, which in turn gives you access to progressively more advanced flowers.

To operate the altar, drop the ingredients on top, whack it with a wand of the forest, and when it's done drop a livingrock block on top to complete the craft. You will additionally need a mana source, such as a mana spreader pointing at it.
data.title: Botanic Infusion
data.tooltip:
Botanic Infusion
Prequest requests:
A Glimpse Into A Watery Future
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Chickenization
data.data: The soarleander generates mana by consuming anything chicken-related, including entire chickens.
data.title: Chickenization

data.name: Creative Mana Tablet
data.data: This tablet holds the power of gaia in your hands, it gives infinite mana to any tool you have...
data.title: Creative Mana Tablet

data.name: Dark Energy
data.data: Perhaps not the kind of "dark energy" you're familiar with, the nightshade produces mana at night. Like other passive generating flowers, it dies after an hour.
data.title: Dark Energy
data.tooltip:
Dark Energy
Prequest requests:
Moron's Manual For Mana Manufacture And Manipulation

data.name: Experienced Botanist
data.data: The rosa arcana transmutes experience into mana. A player standing near it will have their experience drained for this purpose. This process is unfortunately not very practical to automate, as the experience can only be extracted directly from a player, and not from orbs on the ground or any method of storage. It might be wise to place it somewhere you spend a lot of time.
data.title: Experienced Botanist

data.name: Flower Grafting
data.data:
The first item you want to make is the Petal Apothecary. A mushroom is needed to anoint it and give it its restorative properties.

To operate it, fill it with a bucket of water to keep the plants hydrated. After that you can add the ingredients by dropping them on top.

Each craft requires some magical ingredients, but also one or more regular flowers from the world that can function as a stable base. Once you've added all the ingredients, finish the craft by adding a seed. Any vanilla seed will do.
data.title: Flower Grafting

data.name: Flower!!! Unlimited Flower!!!
data.data:
The jaded amaranthus causes mystical flowers to grow all around it. Their vibrant petals can be used for magic, so you no longer have to go foraging for mushrooms.

There §ois§o§o§r another way of getting these, but you'll have to figure that one out for yourself.
data.title: Flower!!! Unlimited Flower!!!
data.tooltip:
Flower!!! Unlimited Flower!!!
Prequest requests:
A Botanist's Best Friend
Botanic Infusion

data.name: Fountain Of Alchemy
data.data:
The Fountain of Alchemy as you may guess, is functionally just like the Mana Fountain, except it can handle the recipes that you would typically need an Alchemy Rune underneath a Mana Pool for.

If you need any further details about it's functionality, check out the Mana Fountain quest or the Lexica Botania.

[warn]This cannot do regular Mana Pool recipes, only Alchemy recipes.[/warn]

[note]If, for whatever reason, you needed an abundance of prismarine in the future... perhaps a quad Fountain of Alchemy would be an excellent aid in obtaining that.[/note]
data.title: Fountain Of Alchemy
data.tooltip:
Fountain Of Alchemy
Prequest requests:
A Glimpse Into A Watery Future
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in EV

data.name: Fountain Of Conjuration
data.data:
The Fountain of Conjuration, as I'm sincerely hoping you can guess at this point, functions exactly like the Mana Fountain and the Fountain of Alchemy, except it handles §nexclusively§r recipes that are typically done with a Conjuration Catalyst underneath a Mana Pool.

If you need any further details about it's functionality, check out the Mana Fountain quest or the Lexica Botania.

[note]Reminder that this can also wall-share with any type of Mana Fountain you may currently have.[/note]
data.title: Fountain Of Conjuration
data.tooltip:
Fountain Of Conjuration
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in IV
Alfheim

data.name: Hydrobotanic Energy
data.data:
Mana is blue. Water is also blue. There's a correlation there, and the hydroangea turns that correlation into causation. Place a water source block nearby, and the hydroangea will consume it to produce mana - until it dies after an hour.

This one can be a bit tricky to automate given the lack of naturally-regenerating source blocks.
data.title: Hydrobotanic Energy

data.name: Is This A Combustion Generator?
data.data: The endoflame burns combustible materials in order to produce mana. It can efficiently consume fuels with a burn time of up to 64000 per item (equivalent to four blocks of coal); any burn time beyond this will be wasted. Endoflames don't die like passive flowers do, and are simple to use, so it's a good idea to make several of them.
data.title: Is This A Combustion Generator?
data.tooltip:
Is This A Combustion Generator?
Prequest requests:
Magic Blue Dust

data.name: Laputa I
data.data: The item when used will raise a sphere of land into the air, centered on the selected block. The radius of the sphere and the height elevated are determined by the Shard Power. The process is not instant, and instead will move each block at a time until every block within a radius is moved. Blocks that rely on walls or floors, such as torches and crops, will drop in the process, as the required support is not moved alongside.
data.title: Laputa I

data.name: LAPUTA XX
data.data: The most powerfull version of the Laputa shard... Maybe instead of using it you should think about meteors.
data.title: LAPUTA XX

data.name: Loonium
data.data:
This flower uses mana to randomly produce dungeon loot that would be found in chests in your world. This loot drops as items. It can be disabled at will by applying a redstone signal.

[note]Here you have a list of all possible drops[/note]

[url]https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EzFQYnL53GdzXxs6H2lVM2QJEgNEAUG1vSS-15DPPSM/edit?gid=0#gid=0[/url]
data.title: Loonium

data.name: Magic Blue Dust
data.data: You'll need mana powder to proceed. Make four to start out with.
data.title: Magic Blue Dust
data.tooltip:
Magic Blue Dust
Prequest requests:
Moron's Manual For Mana Manufacture And Manipulation

data.name: Mana Diamonds
data.data:
Mana diamonds are magically enhanced diamonds, and they require more or less energy depending on the quality of the gem you're trying to enchant.

A completely full diluted pool is barely able to make a mana diamond out of an exquisite diamond. Once you upgrade the pool you can use regular diamonds - be it at a higher mana cost.
data.title: Mana Diamonds

data.name: Mana Fountain
data.data:
The Mana Fountain allows for quick and seamless automation of Mana Pool recipes.

You can assemble the multiblock as specified in the Lexica Botania / NEI. After it's assembled, right clicking it using the Wand of the Forest will show you whether it's complete and the amount of internally stored mana.

You can send the controller mana directly by either using a spreader or a spark much like a Mana Pool. Technically you don't have to use the Mana Pool in the center of the multiblock for it to function, but it is placed conveniently so that you can (plus, it doesn't hurt to have an extra buffer).

Items are allowed to input from any side of the controller, but can only output from the bottom. For early automation, it's recommended to just use hoppers. Once you uinlock AE2 however you can simply place an interface underneath the controller with the appropriate patterns and it should push and pull items automatically.

[warn]You cannot craft Alchemy or Conjuration recipes using this multiblock, those are separate multiblocks that you will unlock with more advanced robot arm technology.[/warn]

[note]This structure can absolutely wall-share. It has the perfect design to be able to share 4 different Mana Fountains between the center pool.[/note]
data.title: Mana Fountain
data.tooltip:
Mana Fountain
Prequest requests:
Upgrading Your Mana Pool
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Mmmmmm, Slimy!
data.data:
Have you ever seen a slime and thought "I'd love to eat that"? The narslimmus has.

It needs to be planted somewhere slimes can naturally appear, but if you can find a good place for a narslimmus it'll consume those slimes and give you a good amount of mana in return.
data.title: Mmmmmm, Slimy!

data.name: Moron's Manual For Mana Manufacture And Manipulation
data.data:
To use the power of magical flowers, you must understand how to generate and manipulate mana. This ethereal blue-ish substance is produced by generating flowers, when their requirements are met. Mana is not easily quantified, so you will have to do a lot of estimating if you want to use it efficiently.

Once you have chosen which flower you want to use to generate mana, you must plant it near a mana spreader. When the flower's conditions are fulfilled, it will begin to produce mana, and store it in the internal buffer of the nearest mana spreader. The mana spreader itself will automatically emit any mana it contains, provided it is aimed at a valid destination (such as a mana pool). You'll need a lot of these devices, so craft a pair for now.

Mana spreaders will aim towards you when you place them down. To change their direction, use a wand of the forest: while holding the wand, shift-right-click on the mana spreader, and then shift-right-click on the block you want it to aim at. This method of binding also works for other things, such as binding a flower to a specific mana spreader.
data.title: Moron's Manual For Mana Manufacture And Manipulation
data.tooltip:
Moron's Manual For Mana Manufacture And Manipulation
Prequest requests:
Pure Daisy

data.name: Obligatory Lava Power
data.data: The thermalily consumes lava, but it's not quite as simple as just constantly replenishing a lava pool. There's a cooldown that you'll have to account for. Even so, it's a fairly easy flower to automate if you have a good lava source.
data.title: Obligatory Lava Power

data.name: Pollination Buddies
data.data:
Some flowers are everywhere, and some are limited to specific biomes. If you don't want to walk long distances from home, you can call in some help.

Bees with the flower trait will slowly generate new flowers in its working area, including plenty that have been brought in from distant pastures.
data.title: Pollination Buddies

data.name: Pure Daisy
data.data:
The first magical flower you are able to make is the Pure Daisy. This flower can slowly enchant nearby stone and logs into basic Botania ingredients.

After placing the flower down, you can use put down stone and wood in the 8 tiles around it, and after a certain time they will be converted.
data.title: Pure Daisy

data.name: Roses Are Blood-Red
data.data: The bellethorne is a delightful little flower with an [warn]insatiable thirst for blood[/warn], though fortunately your blood doesn't count. When provided with a supply of mana, it will inflict damage on any living entities near it, with the exception of players. It's a good extra layer of defense to place at the entrances to your early-game bamboo fortress.
data.title: Roses Are Blood-Red
data.tooltip:
Roses Are Blood-Red
Prequest requests:
A Botanist's Best Friend

data.name: Round One... FIGHT!
data.data: Put the 4 pylons down and shift-right-click the terrasteel ingot on the beacon to summon the Gaia Guardian.
data.title: Round One... FIGHT!

data.name: Round Two... FIGHT!
data.data:
Now craft a Gaia Spirit ingot with your new Gaia Spirit from killing the Gaia guardian.

Put the 4 pylons down and shift-right-click the Gaia Spirit ingot on the beacon to summon a harder version of Gaia Guardian.
data.title: Round Two... FIGHT!

data.name: Runes2
data.data: Craft some runes, because why not?
data.title: Runes

data.name: Shut Down Your Canning Machine
data.data: Some flowers eat bees. Some eat leaves. Some eat slimes. This one eats everything (everything you can eat, anyway). The gourmaryllis is happiest when provided with a good variety of delicious meals, so I hope the HV-tier diet of canned sludge hasn't made you forget how to cook.
data.title: Shut Down Your Canning Machine
data.tooltip:
Shut Down Your Canning Machine
Prequest requests:
Better Generating Flowers

data.name: Solar Power: Floral Edition
data.data:
The daybloom is an extremely simple generating flower. All you have to do is place it down, and it'll produce mana for free during the day. The downside of this arrangement is that dayblooms die after only an hour.

You can find Goldenrod flowers in Prairie biomes.

Make one, and I'll give you another.
data.title: Solar Power: Floral Edition
data.tooltip:
Solar Power: Floral Edition
Prequest requests:
Moron's Manual For Mana Manufacture And Manipulation

data.name: Synthetic Elven Gateway
data.data:
The Synthetic Elven Gateway is an advanced and easily automatable version of the normal Elven Gateway. As a result it is much quicker, less TPS intensive, and AE2 compatible.

Much like the Mana Fountain, the controller can be given mana via a mana spreader or spark & item input can happen from any face, while item output is restricted to the bottom.

[note]While running, this uses more mana passively than a normal Elven Gateway does, so be sure you have adequate mana production![/note]
data.title: Synthetic Elven Gateway
data.tooltip:
Synthetic Elven Gateway
Prequest requests:
Thought Emitters Were Bad Enough?
Alfheim

data.name: Terrasteel
data.data:
To get some advanced tools and equipment you will need some terrasteel. This is done using a dedicated machine.

You'll need to layout the blocks underneath the plate as described in the Lexica Botania. Then place a spark on top of the plate nearby a mana pool with a large stockpile of mana. Lastly you'll place a mana diamond, mana pearl, and mana steel onto the plate to begin the transformation.
data.title: Terrasteel

data.name: The Everlasting Guilty Pool
data.data: Mana for all of your needs, endless amounts of mana.
data.title: The Everlasting Guilty Pool

data.name: The Roots of Magic
data.data:
If you're familiar with Botania, you will notice that the overworld is noticeably void of magical flowers and mushrooms. Such pretty expressions of magic sadly require you to have leveled up on your magical skills. For now you will have to make do with what the world has to offer.

Look in deep caves in the Twilight Forest at low Y-levels for glimmering mushrooms. These are your starting ingredient and can be used instead of flower petals. Beware, unlike flowers you can't grow more just yet, so be careful what you use them for.
data.title: The Roots of Magic
data.tooltip:
The Roots of Magic
Prequest requests:
Searching for Answers

data.name: Upgrading Your Mana Pool
data.data: Now that you have discovered the power of the magically enchanted crucible, you can use that technology to make a better mana pool.
data.title: Upgrading Your Mana Pool
data.tooltip:
Upgrading Your Mana Pool
Prequest requests:
Not For Soup
What Are All These Flowers Even For?

data.name: Violence Is Blue
data.data: The dreadthorne is similar to the bellethorne, but it only kills adult animals. This is helpful for farming livestock, though it's only one aspect of a successful farm.
data.title: Violence Is Blue
data.tooltip:
Violence Is Blue
Prequest requests:
A Botanist's Best Friend

data.name: What Are All These Flowers Even For?
data.data:
If you've never used Botania before, you may be wondering about the purpose of all this effort. This isn't a simple question to answer, but one thing you can do that's quite useful right now is making yourself some manasteel.

Among its many uses, manasteel has one of the best, if not simply §othe§o §rbest, durabilities of materials available at LV, so it's perfect for all of your crafting tools.

If you have a particular dislike of Tinker's Construct, manasteel is a great material to make a Gregtech pickaxe out of too.
data.title: What Are All These Flowers Even For?
data.tooltip:
What Are All These Flowers Even For?
Prequest requests:
Your First Mana Pool

data.name: Your First Mana Pool
data.data:
Now that you have livingrock, create your first mana pool. Chop some pieces into slabs with a saw to make the bottom, then stick them together with plates for the sides.

You lack the knowledge to make it effective, so sadly it won't be able to craft a lot as a result.
data.title: Your First Mana Pool
data.tooltip:
Your First Mana Pool
Prequest requests:
Cutting Things Apart
Pure Daisy

data.name: A Battlemage's Best Friend
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Mage's Mace can be equipped by any wand and will boost its attack damage to 30 hearts. Equipping it to a staff will deal double damage.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Bloodlust§r (level 5): Slain mobs may drop Crystal Blood like when killed with a Crystal Dagger
data.title: A Battlemage's Best Friend

data.name: An Appropriate Weapon
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Nine Hells is truly a weapon worthy of your skills. It can fire creatures of the Nether at your enemies!

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Bat Bombs§r (level 3): Summoned bats always explode on contact
§5Devil Bats§r (level 3): Summoned bats are larger, do more damage, and stay around for longer
§5Vampire Bats§r (level 5): Summoned bats will heal themselves and the caster when they deal damage
data.title: An Appropriate Weapon

data.name: A Taste of Their Own Medicine
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Dark Matter allows its wielder to shoot the same projectiles as Eldritch Guardians. There is a chance for the caster to gain sticky warp for each projectile cast.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Corrosive§r (level 3): The orbs now inflict the Wither effect upon their targets
§5Sanity§r (level 5): The caster will not gain warp from using this focus
data.title: A Taste of Their Own Medicine
data.tooltip:
A Taste of Their Own Medicine
Prequest requests:
Keep it Away from Bags of Holding
The Power of Creation

data.name: But Duct Tape Already is Magical!
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Maintenance will fix all problems of a multiblock machine when used on its Maintenance Hatch. It won't prevent future issues, but it sure beats recharging your Soldering Iron for the 6th time.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: But Duct Tape Already is Magical!
data.tooltip:
But Duct Tape Already is Magical!
Prequest requests:
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Bzzap!
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Shock will shoot a bolt of lightning. It homes in slightly to the nearest mob/player from where it is aimed. It is even fast enough to hit Endermen before they can teleport away!

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Chain Lightning§r (level 3): The lightning bolt now arcs to two nearby creatures. Great for dealing with bats from warp!
§5Earth Shock§r (level 3): The focus now shoots a ball of lightning that leaves the ground electrified
§5Enlarge§r (requires §5Chain Lightning§r): The lightning bolt arcs to two additional targets per level. Show those bats who's boss!
data.title: Bzzap!

data.name: Can You Feel the Sunshine?
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Meteorology can be used to start or stop rain at will. The perfect thing for Water Infused Solar Panels!

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: Can You Feel the Sunshine?
data.tooltip:
Can You Feel the Sunshine?
Prequest requests:
Snowball Fight!
The Power of Creation
Bzzap!
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Diggy Diggy Hole
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Excavation emits a green beam of light that will mine blocks of any hardness (except for unbreakable blocks like Bedrock) from a distance.

This focus is also required to operate the Arcane Bore. Upgrading foci to be used in the Bore with §5Enlarge§r is highly recommended, as it increases the radius by 1 per level.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases block breaking speed every level
§5Treasure§r: Acts like vanilla Fortune, but does not apply to GT ores
§5Enlarge§r (even levels): Breaks an extra adjacent block per level
§5Dowsing§r (level 3): May drop Thaumcraft Native Ores from ores, but does not apply to GT ores
§5Silk Touch§r (level 5): Acts like vanilla Silk Touch
data.title: Diggy Diggy Hole
data.tooltip:
Diggy Diggy Hole
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Dropped in Asgard, Fallen to Earth
data.data: You've heard rumors of a mighty weapon, dropped in Asgard and fallen to earth. Could this be the mystical Item?
data.title: Dropped in Asgard, Fallen to Earth
data.tooltip:
Dropped in Asgard, Fallen to Earth
Prequest requests:
Trigger: Mjolnir

data.name: Electric Hoe-ing
data.data: While the Hoe of Growth breaks easily, we have a fix for you! Get this one and simply recharge it when it's empty.
data.title: Electric Hoe-ing

data.name: Ender Backpack
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Ender Rift opens your vanilla Personal Ender Chest when used. It can also be attuned to an Ender Chest from Ender Storage with shift-right-click. Shift-right-click a block of obsidian to set it back to your Personal Ender Chest.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: Ender Backpack
data.tooltip:
Ender Backpack
Prequest requests:
Keep it Away from Bags of Holding

data.name: EU->VIS
data.data: This device allows you to charge your wands using EU, but it costs 10kEU per Vis restored.
data.title: EU->VIS
data.tooltip:
EU->VIS
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Fly High!
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Uprising propels its caster forward. It works well to gain height to glide for long distances or to scale tall obstacles. Fall damage is only reset when cast, so be careful when using it!

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: Fly High!

data.name: Heat-Seeking Vis-sile
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Vis Shard can be used to cast a homing projectile which deals 35 damage. This projectile can bounce off of solid blocks. If the target is not hit in 10 seconds, the projectile disappears.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Persistent§r (level 5): The shard will seek another target if its current one dies or gets out of range
data.title: Heat-Seeking Vis-sile
data.tooltip:
Heat-Seeking Vis-sile
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: I Don't Want to Set the World on Fire
data.data:
Wand Focus: Fire is a basic wand focus that is able to spew a short-range cone of fire that deals damage and sets mobs ablaze.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Alchemist's Fire§r (even levels): Hit mobs burn for longer and lights blocks on fire
§5Fireball§r (level 3): The focus now shoots a large, explosive ball of fire which sets the ground on fire if paired with §5Alchemist's Fire§r
§5Fire Beam§r (level 3): Concentrates the cone of fire into a beam that does more damage and shoots farther
data.title: I Don't Want to Set the World on Fire
data.tooltip:
I Don't Want to Set the World on Fire
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: It Can't Bend Spoons
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Telekinesis is a wand focus that can move nearby dropped items. It either moves them where you are pointing with the wand or toward you while sneaking.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: It Can't Bend Spoons

data.name: It's Mesmerizing...
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Primal will hurl an orb of primal energy with right-click. The orb explodes on impact, and it has a small chance to cause other effects. It sometimes creates taint when it lands, and it very rarely creates a node if it destroys the block it impacts. Its base vis cost constantly fluctuates. [note]Maybe studying it and its projectiles will give you a better understanding of vis.[/note]

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Seeker§r (level 3): The orb homes in on the closest target, but loses some of its special effects like creating taint or nodes
data.title: It's Mesmerizing...
data.tooltip:
It's Mesmerizing...
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Keep it Away from Bags of Holding
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Portable Hole will create a temporary 3x3x32 hole centered on the targeted block. Some blocks cannot be passed through, such as Bedrock or blocks warded by the Wand Focus: Warding.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Enlarge§r: Extends the hole by 8 blocks per level
§5Extend§r: The hole will stay open 3 seconds longer for every level
data.title: Keep it Away from Bags of Holding
data.tooltip:
Keep it Away from Bags of Holding
Prequest requests:
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Knowledge is Power
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Experience Drain will drain the player's experience at a rate of 15 XP per tick to restore vis at a rather fast rate.

[note]This focus cannot be upgraded in the Focal Manipulator[/note]
data.title: Knowledge is Power

data.name: Magical Base Defense
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Warding can be used to make blocks invincible with right-click. Warding may be removed by right-clicking it again. It is not able to ward transparent blocks like Glass or non-full blocks like slabs, but there is a block known as Warded Glass available with the Warded Arcana research if you want a protected transparent block. It is also unable to ward blocks with Tile Entities like chests. Take note that only the player who warded the block can unward it.

Holding a wand with this focus will show an outline on nearby blocks you have warded. They look normal otherwise. Warded Blocks are [note]completely indestructible[/note] and will produce particle effects similar to runic shielding when a player tries to break them. Blocks will lose any special properties when warded: sand or gravel will not fall, grass will not grow, and packed ice will no longer be slippery. Warded blocks cannot be affected by any outside influence such as redstone or pistons. The only way to break the warded block is via the owner right-clicking with a wand with this focus.

[note]Special Note: Warded blocks emit light. They can also cause quite a bit of lag if used at scale.[/note]

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Architect§r (level 2): Allows the focus's working area to be modified with the Misc Wand Toggle keybind. Sneaking with the keybind changes which axes are modified. This upgrade increases the maximum area to 7x7x7
§5Enlarge§r (Requires §5Architect§r)§r: Expands the maximum range by 1 block in each direction per level
data.title: Magical Base Defense

data.name: Magical Waystones
data.data: This can be used to go back to a Celestial Gateway if you have a bound Celestial Pearl in your hotbar. It will use the leftmost one in your hotbar, so you can carry multiple to travel around with!
data.title: Magical Waystones

data.name: Medic!
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Mending is a wand focus that will slowly mend the caster's wounds by expending Vis. It heals half a heart at a time. It's an invaluable tool in a Blood Mage's arsenal.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases healing by half a heart per level.
data.title: Medic!

data.name: Pimp Your Wand Focus
data.data:
The Focal Manipulator requires both XP levels and centi-vis in order to upgrade foci. Each focus can be upgraded a total of five times, with the level cost increasing by 8 and the vis cost doubling for each upgrade.

Most foci accept Frugal (lowers the vis cost to cast by 10% per level) and Potency (increases damage dealt or improves the focus in another way if it doesn't deal damage) at every level. Foci with an area of effect (like Wand Focus: Equal Trade) accept Enlarge, which usually expands the max area by one block in each direction. Some foci have special upgrades that can only be applied at certain levels (often level 3 or 5), some of which have prerequisite upgrades. See the Focus on Wand Foci & EMT tab for more information about focal upgrades and their effects.

If you regret your past decisions, you can remove upgrades in the Focal Manipulator if you have the Focal Disenchanting research. It will even refund some of the XP!
data.title: Pimp Your Wand Focus

data.name: Plague Inc.
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Pech's Curse is a rare wand focus which cannot be crafted by players. It can only be obtained from a Pech Mage -- either by bartering valuable items or by killing it for its wand to drop. Pech Mages are rare and the drop chance is quite low, so bartering is recommended. [warn]If attacked, the Pech will use this focus against you![/warn]

This focus fires a small ball of energy with a bright bluish-green trail. This missile is affected by gravity, so the shots need to be "arced" to hit distant targets. When the shot hits a mob, it does one heart of damage and randomly inflicts one of several effects on the target: Poison, Weakness, or Slowness.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases potency of the applied effect. Being able to apply Weakness III to mobs might be useful for Blood Magic...
§5Extend§r (even levels): Extends the duration of the applied effect
§5Nightshade§r (level 5): Applies all three effects at once
data.title: Plague Inc.

data.name: Pocket Dolly
data.data:
Wand Focus: Dislocation is a very useful focus that allows its user to take and place nearly any block, even Tile Entities and one that usually can't be moved, like Mob Spawners, planted IC2 Crops, and more.

[warn]Please use responsibly, and don't move things you shouldn't, like door halves, or some multiblock parts, unless you like the idea of world corruption destroying your world. That said, if you're in SP and make a backup, do whatever you want, just know the risks.[/warn]

It uses:
5 Ordo + 5 Perditio + 1 Terra to take any mundane block.
25 Ordo + 25 Perditio + 5 Terra to take any block with a tile entity (such as a Chest).
100 Ordo + 100 Perditio + 20 Terra to take a Mob Spawner.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: Pocket Dolly

data.name: Pocket Furnace
data.data:
Wand Focus: Efreet's Flame shoots a beam similar to the Wand Focus: Excavation that smelts blocks like a Furnace.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: Pocket Furnace
data.tooltip:
Pocket Furnace
Prequest requests:
I Don't Want to Set the World on Fire
Diggy Diggy Hole

data.name: Press and Hold the B Button to Block!
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Shield creates a shield around you which blocks any incoming damage and removes potion effects. Sneak away if you're fighting an enemy too strong for you!

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: Press and Hold the B Button to Block!
data.tooltip:
Press and Hold the B Button to Block!
Prequest requests:
TPV Coil Upgrade
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Projectile Protection V
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Distortion protects the caster from "ordinary" projectiles such as arrows, snowballs, and potions while right-click is held.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Enlarge§r (even levels): Expands the projectile deflection range by 1 block in each direction per level
data.title: Projectile Protection V

data.name: Reactor Shielding 2.0
data.data: Shield Blocks - explosion proof - single use. Get a couple of these to shield your reactor!
data.title: Reactor Shielding 2.0
data.tooltip:
Reactor Shielding 2.0
Prequest requests:
Press and Hold the B Button to Block!

data.name: Rechargeable Scribing Tools
data.data: Are you tired of getting all the Ink for your scribing and you don't want to use your blood either? Get this Hi-Tech Scribing Device which will make your life much easier! Treat it like an HV battery - charge in any HV machine's battery slot, or in an HV battery buffer.
data.title: Rechargeable Scribing Tools

data.name: Repaired it!
data.data: Sadly enough, the hammer was broken. But you have the skills and the knowledge to repair it, don't you?
data.title: Repaired it!
data.tooltip:
Repaired it!
Prequest requests:
What the Heck...?
Dropped in Asgard, Fallen to Earth
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Scrub, Scrub, Scrub...
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Flux Scrubber is an incredibly useful focus for the messy or insane thaumaturge. It creates a beam that sucks up flux goo and gas.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Speeds up flux cleanup
§5Crystallization§r: Drops Crystallized Potentia when cleaning up flux at level 1. Drops Crystallized Essence of a random aspect at level 2. Mutually exclusive with §5Warping§r and §5Calming§r
§5Warping§r: Gives its user temporary warp when used to clean flux. Mutually exclusive with §5Crystallization§r
§5Calming§r (level 5, requires §5Warping§r): Negates the effect of §5Warping§r. Removes some temporary or sticky warp when used to clean flux. Mutually exclusive with §5Crystallization§r
data.title: Scrub, Scrub, Scrub...

data.name: Snowball Fight!
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Frost will launch a ball of ice that can bounce off of blocks and mobs.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Alchemist's Frost§r (odd levels): Applies Slowness to hit mobs. Higher levels increase the potency of the effect
§5Scattershot§r (level 3): The focus now shoots a volley of shards that break on impact. The normal damage immunity timer is ignored, so multiple shards can hit the same mob at once and all will deal damage. §5Potency§r increases the number of shards instead of the damage
§5Ice Boulder§r (level 3): The focus now shoots a larger, bouncier, and deadlier ball of ice
data.title: Snowball Fight!
data.tooltip:
Snowball Fight!
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: So Take Me Back in Time...
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Time can be used to move time forward by 12 hours. Using this focus at noon will set the time to midnight, while using it at dusk will make it dawn. This focus will also make the player unable to use any other foci for 30 seconds.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: So Take Me Back in Time...
data.tooltip:
So Take Me Back in Time...
Prequest requests:
Keep it Away from Bags of Holding
The Power of Creation

data.name: Sparking Nitor...?
data.data: YELLOW! What an ugly color! I want PURPLE Nitor! Get me some and you'll receive something nice in exchange.
data.title: Sparking Nitor...?

data.name: Super-Mjolnir
data.data: Additional tweaks to your Mjolnir have changed it. Now you can summon some Guardian Snowmen to help you out!
data.title: Super-Mjolnir

data.name: Tainted Nuclear Detonation
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Tainted Shockwave will release a powerful shockwave around the caster which travels 10 blocks away, damaging all mobs in the radius and launching them into the air. After using this focus, the caster will be unable to use any other foci for 6 seconds.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
§5Enlarge§r: Increases the radius by 2 blocks per level. This also adds 2.5 Perditio, Terra, and Aqua to the casting cost per level
data.title: Tainted Nuclear Detonation

data.name: The One Ring
data.data:
So you found it. The One Ring, forged by a mighty Dark Wizard. A strange feeling tells you to put it on. The Ring seems to whisper to you as well...

[warn]Yeah, maybe don't do that. Unless you like tons of warp and withers spawning on your ass, blowing up your base.[/warn]

The ring may make you §1invisible§r and §1invincible§r, but not only does it collect §5warp§r itself, it piles it on you as well. After an hour the amount SIGNIFICANTLY increases so try not to wear it that long unless you have a pure tear handy. You can also expect other effects, and the ring to not want to come off either.
data.title: The One Ring

data.name: Trade Offer
data.data:
Wand Focus: Equal Trade is able to switch out blocks in the world with blocks in the player's inventory. Shift-right-click on a block to attune the focus to the block. Once attuned to a block, left-click on a single block to replace it with the substitute block. Right-click will transform a contiguous 5x5x5 area of the same block that has air on at least one side. This can go through thin walls or into caves, so be careful. Very useful for upgrading EBF coils or for swapping other blocks that are slow to break like Obsidian! It cannot be used to break or place blocks with Tile Entities like chests.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Enlarge§r: Expands the maximum range by 1 block in each direction per level
§5Treasure§r (level 3): Works like vanilla Fortune
§5Architect§r (level 3): Allows the focus's working area to be modified with the Misc Wand Toggle keybind. Sneaking with the keybind changes which axes are modified. This upgrade also changes the working area to a plane, so be sure to test this upgrade out before committing to it and applying further upgrades
§5Silk Touch§r (level 5): Works like vanilla Silk Touch
data.title: Trade Offer
data.tooltip:
Trade Offer
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Walking is Too Hard...
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Blink is a very powerful focus that allows its user to teleport anywhere in sight, as long as the destination is less than 50 blocks away. There is no teleport cooldown, so it can be used to travel very quickly in the right conditions.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrade in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
data.title: Walking is Too Hard...
data.tooltip:
Walking is Too Hard...
Prequest requests:
Keep it Away from Bags of Holding

data.name: Wand Focus Shadow Beam
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Shadowbeam shoots a beam of dark energy that is reflected by any block and damages everything it passes through. The beam travels about 40 blocks and does about 100 damage.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt every level
data.title: Wand Focus Shadow Beam
data.tooltip:
Wand Focus Shadow Beam
Prequest requests:
Projectile Protection V
Diggy Diggy Hole
Bzzap!

data.name: Weaponized Blight
data.data:
The Wand Focus: Tainted Storm will emit a stream of tainted bubbles which damage anything in a short distance and inflict Poison for 5 seconds. The focus may also debuff the caster with Flux Flu III for 50 seconds.

[note]This focus accepts the following upgrades in the Focal Manipulator:[/note]
§5Frugal§r: Lowers vis cost to cast by 10% per level
§5Potency§r: Increases damage dealt and increases the number of bubbles every level
§5Tainturgy§r (level 3): The caster will no longer get Flux Flu. This adds 0.6 Ordo to the casting cost
§5Enlarge§r (level 4): The tainted bubbles fan out across a wider area. This adds 0.6 Aer and Aqua to the casting cost
§5Corrosive§r (level 5): The tainted bubbles inflict the Wither effect instead of Poison. This adds 0.6 Perditio and Ignis to the casting cost
data.title: Weaponized Blight

data.name: What the Heck...?
data.data: You found a yellow-ish glowing ball. It might be useful later on.
data.title: What the Heck...?

data.name: Another Path to Ethanol
data.data: Using a fermenter with excess saplings or other garbage will give you Forestry biomass. Higher Sappiness trait on your trees will get you better results.
data.title: Another Path to Ethanol
data.tooltip:
Another Path to Ethanol
Prequest requests:
Forestry Core Block

data.name: A Series of Tubes
data.data:
Before you can craft your first farm block you need apatite tubes. Make some apatite rods first with a lathe, then use a forge hammer to join them into long apatite rods. You need golden bolts and a red alloy plate.

Put some glass or sand into your thermionic fabricator and make your first tubes.

[note]You can also use the circuit assembler for a better output. Why did we have you make the TF again?[/note]
data.title: A Series of Tubes

data.name: Aspen
data.data: You can breed an Aspen by combining Common Alder and Common Beech.
data.title: Aspen

data.name: Balsa
data.data:
Balsa has some pretty wood. Breed it by mating Teak and Acacia.

§eHigh Fertility Get!
data.title: Balsa

data.name: BEGONE, LAG! Also, Bats
data.data:
Lag = Butterflies in this case, since they like to pile up just outside of chunk loading range. Also, they're annoying since they convert regular trees into more forestry ones, one leaf block at a time. Which causes more of the buggers to spawn. Fortunately, the settings we use prevent too many from being present at once, but still, they're annoying.

The solution to this is to kill them. Also, the bats. Stupid Thaumcraft warp. Use the (potentially unfinished) Pest Killer to do so.

Notes: Hydrogen Cyanide has a recipe now. Both it and Formaldehyde require a Chemical Plant. It doesn't appear to use any of the Formaldehyde up though. The range is apparently 5x5 chunks, not blocks. It also only runs once every 30s or so?

[note]PS: If you experience problems using it (more than already mentioned), raise a ticket on GitHub.[/note]
data.title: BEGONE, LAG! Also, Bats
data.tooltip:
BEGONE, LAG! Also, Bats
Prequest requests:
Speak For the Trees
Playing With the Big Boys, Chemically

data.name: Better Fermenter Outputs
data.data: With a Squeezer you can boost the output from your fermenter, saving on Fertilizer or Mulch and getting more per sapling. There's a variety of crops you can use to make fruit juice, so have fun breeding.
data.title: Better Fermenter Outputs
data.tooltip:
Better Fermenter Outputs
Prequest requests:
Another Path to Ethanol

data.name: Better Grafter Through Technology
data.data: The GT Branch Cutter is much better than the forestry grafters. It can have much higher durability based upon which material you use to create it.
data.title: Better Grafter Through Technology
data.tooltip:
Better Grafter Through Technology
Prequest requests:
Collecting the Hybrids

data.name: Bio Gas Engine
data.data:
Producing RF power with lava is possible with the help of the biogas engine. You need water, fruit juice, liquid honey, milk, seed oil, or forestry biomass in the other slot. After a brief warmup time, the engine outputs up to 50 RF/t depending on the fluid used.

The possible fluids give the following power:

Water: 10 RF/t for 1k ticks
Fruit juice: 10 RF/t for 2.5k ticks
Liquid honey: 20 RF/t for 2.5k ticks
Milk: 10 RF/t for 10k ticks
Seed oil: 30 RF/t for 2.5k ticks
Biomass: 50 RF/t for 2.5k ticks
data.title: Bio Gas Engine

data.name: Blazing, Ender, Emerald Tubes
data.data:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.
data.title: Blazing, Ender, Emerald Tubes
data.tooltip:
Blazing, Ender, Emerald Tubes
Prequest requests:
A Series of Tubes

data.name: Blue Mahoe
data.data:
The Blue Mahoe has the most sappiness of any tree. It will vastly increase the efficiency of your biomass production with Fermenters. Breed it by mating Balsa with Desert Acacia.

§6High Sappiness Get!
data.title: Blue Mahoe

data.name: Brazil Nut
data.data: Brazil Nuts don't give you much in the way of important attributes. Breed them from Common Beech and Jungle.
data.title: Brazil Nut

data.name: Bull Pine
data.data: You can breed a Bull Pine by combining Red Spruce and Mundane Larch.
data.title: Bull Pine

data.name: Changing Your Foresty Circuit Configuration
data.data:
The (forestry) soldering iron is a tool used for attaching electron tubes to circuit boards in order to manipulate how an electrical engine works or to program multifarms, as well as upgrading the squeezer or centrifuge. Honestly, you'll probably only use it for the multifarm though.

Once electron tubes have been attached to a circuit board they cannot be removed, only replaced. The circuit board is automatically crafted as soon as the basic recipe requirements are met, so it's best practice to first place your electron tubes and then add the circuit board.

The soldering iron can also be used to remove the circuit board from electrical engines, multifarms, squeezers and centrifuges by opening the machine's GUI and left-clicking with the soldering iron on the circuit board slot.
data.title: Changing Your Foresty Circuit Configuration
data.tooltip:
Changing Your Foresty Circuit Configuration
Prequest requests:
The Multifarm

data.name: Clockwork Engine
data.data: Producing RF Power by hand is a good idea for making one or two recipes in the Forestry machines. The turrets can be charged with it too.
data.title: Clockwork Engine

data.name: Coast Sequoia
data.data:
You can breed a Coast Sequoia by combining Mundane Larch and Bull Pine.

[warn]Fireproof Wood Get! If you care.[/warn]
data.title: Coast Sequoia

data.name: Cocobolo
data.data: The Cocobolo is a nice tall tree, perfect for mating into your other trees to maximize their yield. Breed it by mating Desert Acacia with Dark Oak.
data.title: Cocobolo

data.name: Coconut
data.data:
Coconut is King for seed oil production - 300L per nut. Breed them from Brazil Nut and Balsa.

§eCoconut and Seed Oil Get!
data.title: Coconut

data.name: Collecting the Hybrids
data.data:
If you got lucky and found some bees in a village, put them in their houses next to some trees. Over time the bees will slowly pollinate the leaves of the trees. Using a grafter you can break the leaf blocks to retrieve a sapling 100%, useful for getting the forestry saplings. This doesn't seem to work with magical trees though. You can trade with villagers to get proven grafters that have a longer lifetime. Also investigate magic, you have heard rumors of long lasting grafters available to magicians.

GregTech also offers a really nice tool, the Branch Cutter.
data.title: Collecting the Hybrids

data.name: Combustion Engine
data.data:
The combustion engine combusts things for power like a car engine does. You need water in it if it's over 100 degrees, or it will explode. Don't run out of water! You turn it on with a redstone signal.

Your options for fuel are:
Oil @30RF/t for a total of 150K
Ethanol @40RF/t for a total of 360K
Diesel @60RF/t for a total of 1,500K

[note]Make sure to use Oil, not raw, light, medium, or heavy oil.[/note]
data.title: Combustion Engine

data.name: Common Alder
data.data: You can breed a Common Alder by combining Silver Birch and Common Beech.
data.title: Common Alder

data.name: Common Beech
data.data:
Common Beech gives you access to the Faster maturity attribute. Breed them from Silver Birch and Apple Oak.

Note: For all tree breeding quests, the required tree must be a pure species, not a hybrid, and must be scanned.
data.title: Common Beech

data.name: Copper, Tin, Bronze Tubes
data.data:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.
data.title: Copper, Tin, Bronze Tubes
data.tooltip:
Copper, Tin, Bronze Tubes
Prequest requests:
A Series of Tubes

data.name: Desert Acacia
data.data: Desert Acacia. Another step on the road. Breed it by mating Teak with Balsa.
data.title: Desert Acacia

data.name: Elderberry

data.name: Farm Logic
data.data:
This chip allows you to select the farm type (when combined with the right electron tubes), and not use the default of growing trees. Unless that's what you want, in which case you don't need it.

For each circuit tier, you can configure 1/4 more of your farm.

Changing Your Foresty Circuit Configuration

data.name: Finding Apatite
data.data: It's now time to search for some ores. Apatite is the most important material in Forestry. You can make fertilizer, farm blocks and other things with it. The vein is found between Y 40-60.
data.title: Finding Apatite

data.name: Forestry Core Block
data.data: This sturdy casing is the basis for almost all machines in Forestry, essentially being the Forestry equivalent of a machine casing.
data.title: Forestry Core Block
data.tooltip:
Forestry Core Block
