data.name: Grinding With Wind
data.data:
The Windmill is a grinder that uses the force of wind to macerate Items and Blocks. You will only get one crushed Ore from it sometimes. However it does give a bonus when you try to macerate other things. That bonus depends on the item inserted, for example Netherrack has a chance to give two instead of one dust and Wheat will always give one and a quarter flour.

The dispensers replace a clay block in the walls. Put anything you like in the interior - a bed, stairs, torches, etc.

Normal multiblock rules apply - do not cross chunk boundaries with this multiblock.

If this is your first GregTech multiblock, as with all the rest you will need to whack the controller with a soft mallet to activate it.

If you have troubles forming the multiblock, try breaking and replacing the controller block.

The controller can be fed items via hoppers etc. to allow for larger batches. Just don't allow the dispenser to fill up or it will void outputs.

The rotor blades will run if the controller is disabled or has no recipe. Remove the blades when not in use or else they'll be used up.

Speed and output will be affected by wind speed, recipe, and rotor.

Macerates 16 items at a time.

High wind speeds will decrease output.

The durability will decrease according to the wind speed.
data.title: §6§lGrinding With Wind
data.tooltip:
Grinding With Wind
Prequest requests:
A Very Important Alloy
Circle Shapes Give Me Comfort

data.name: Helium is Not Just for Balloons
data.data:
Higher tier superconducting wires and energy hatches will require helium. Compressing air and liquefying it requires 1802 compressed air cells to get 1 He cell. It's probably better to get it from end stone dust or monazite from the Moon. Another option is to have a look at your oil processing and see how you can get Helium from there.

[note]PS: If you've progressed far enough in the TF, you can also chip off parts of the snow queen's lair. She won't mind, right?[/note]
data.title: §6§lHelium is Not Just for Balloons
data.tooltip:
Helium is Not Just for Balloons
Prequest requests:
At the End of...

data.name: High Energy Laser Purification
data.data: For even more pure water, you will need to use strong lasers to precisely bombard the water and remove impurities. As usual with the waterline, this multiblock presents you with a complex automation puzzle to solve.
data.title: High Energy Laser Purification
data.tooltip:
High Energy Laser Purification
Prequest requests:
Purifying Water With Plasma

data.name: Higher Precision
data.data:
You can upgrade the precise casings to unlock more recipes in precise mode and gain more parallels in normal mode.

[note]To make orundum check out the recipe for the orundum plate.[/note]
data.title: §6§lHigher Precision

data.name: High-Pressure Boiler Tank
data.data:
After you make steel you are able to craft a high pressure boiler tank. The upgraded version increases the temperature and produces more steam than the low pressure version. It will take longer to warm up, so make sure to keep it well fed!

Extract steam by attaching a pipe to the boiler tank.

[note]This is better than the low pressure variant only if you keep it working for very long time, if you intend to turn it on and off all the time this will waste a lot of resources! If you keep it at top temperature it will use ~2x more fuel than low pressure and will give ~4x more steam per sec making it 100% more efficient! If you can't sustain the fuel drain or want a more flexible power source instead use the low pressure variant.[/note]

[warn]Actual fuel usage depends on the machine size and other factors such as machine temperature, if you want to know the actual number you will need to test it on your own setup.[/warn]
data.title: §6§lHigh-Pressure Boiler Tank
data.tooltip:
High-Pressure Boiler Tank
Prequest requests:
Railcraft Steam Power
Liquid-Fuelled Firebox

data.name: High-Speed Charcoal
data.data: Sure, those coke ovens are nice, but they aren't even remotely fast enough to keep up with a large steam boiler. Luckily, there is an upgrade available! The creosote oil will not be produced, but the process will speed up dramatically. Who needs that nasty yellowish flammable stuff anyway...
data.title: §6§lHigh-Speed Charcoal

data.name: High Temperature Super Breeder
data.data:
Have you heard of pebble reactors?

It's called the High Temperature Gas-cooled Reactor (HTGR), and it uses fuel pebbles and consumes power. However, it doesn't really make a lot of power, and doesn't even match the EU/t of THTR, despite being much more expensive. The multiblock structure is basically the same, a huge reactor around 12x12x12 blocks in size, with 500+ casings made with Europium. What it doesn't make in power, it compensates in breeding, however.

For the unaware, this is expensive. Pebble reactors work by stuffing the reactor absolutely full of pebbles, and then the reaction will keep going for, essentially, forever. In this case, you will have a fully automated source of almost endless Lutetium, Plutonium and other things that will be explained in the following quests, alongside the production of fuel and the processing of outputs. What this means is that this is an expensive multiblock, but it's placed at a tier in which this expense is actually reasonable, if there is a need for immense, endless breeding of many outputs.

If you're on the fence about building this, check the next quests to learn more about the fuel and outputs.

Notes:

HTGR has an internal buffer for fuel and only one input bus is required (any will do), as well as only one output bus (reactor automatically compresses every 64 burned pellets into one ball, so you need 6 slots or more to avoid problems with voiding at full capacity).

Reactor requires only 72k out of 720k pebbles to operate, but running at minimum capacity means that you will not get any bonuses, such as lower recipe time and higher amount of pebbles processed per cycle.

This multi consumes 1A LuV when operating, no matter how many pebbles are inside, but it also generates Hot Coolant as it runs. If you use it to generate power, you will gain more EU than is consumed by the reactor.

In this reactor, the throughput increases with the amount of pebbles put into it.

By typing HTGR in NEI, you can see all the items that are related to this multiblock.
data.title: §6§6§6§lHigh Temperature Super Breeder
data.tooltip:
High Temperature Super Breeder
Prequest requests:
Faster Lutetium Excitement

data.name: Hot Hot Hot!
data.data: Once you build your vacuum freezer, you're going to have to carry around hot ingots all the time (assuming you don't automate it). Your old gloves are falling apart, and take up both hands. I think there's a way to glue them together so you can carry hot items with just one hand. Give me some parts and I'll do it for you.
data.title: §6§lHot Hot Hot!
data.tooltip:
Hot Hot Hot!

At the End of...

data.name: HSS-G Coil Upgrade
data.data: To process more advanced materials like HSS-E, HSS-S and naquadah you need more than 4500K. Time to upgrade your EBF to 5400K.
data.title: §6§lHSS-G Coil Upgrade

data.name: HSS-S Coil Upgrade
data.data:
Technically this coil tier can be skipped. But you need LuV to get the next one, so you should really get these coils for now.


To process more advanced materials like LuV Superconductor Base you need more than 5400K. Time to upgrade your EBF to 6300K.
data.title: §6§lHSS-S Coil Upgrade

data.name: Hundreds of Thousands of eV
data.data:
A Linear Accelerator (LINAC) can be used to boost the energy of your beam, provided the beam's particles are charged. You'll need to constantly provide it with coolant for it to run, otherwise you'll have maintenance issues every time it runs dry.

Output energy can be increased by increasing EU/t (scales with the cbrt) or increasing length (scales linearly). The latter also decreases focus, however.

Focus in turn can be improved by using a better/lower temperature coolant (options listed on tooltip).

Note that Amount remains unchanged.
data.title: Hundreds of Thousands of eV
data.tooltip:
Hundreds of Thousands of eV
Prequest requests:
No More (IC) Engraving

data.name: Hypogen Coil Upgrade
data.data:
Forged from the blood of an ageless dragon, and melded together by the power of fusion beyond what you thought was the reality. No natural element, or combination of elements, could match up to this glowing orange material, not even the Awakened Draconium you got your hands on before.

What truly happened inside that Mk4 Fusion Reactor? What §ois§o§r this material? Its dust pulsates visibly, at different rates depending on the size of the dust itself. Hypogen approaches a state of complete balance as it approaches the block size, and it is obvious to you what needs to be done with it.

It absorbs and radiates energy without any effort, but it would be stupid to attempt making coils out of this without assistance. Wetware wasn't good enough anymore, and only the most advanced living circuit could withstand the erratic behavior Hypogen demonstrates.

Provides 12601K heat. Almost certainly, this will end up on your DTPF.
data.title: §6§lHypogen Coil Upgrade
data.tooltip:
Hypogen Coil Upgrade
Prequest requests:
Infinity Coil Upgrade
Getting More Out of Your Hypogen

data.name: Industrial Water Purification
data.data:
For a while now, you have been able to get away with cutting and engraving your silicon circuit wafers with nothing but the bare metal of your machines. However, this can cause significant imperfections in the final wafer, so now that you are producing even more advanced circuitry such imperfections are no longer tolerable.

With the ability to make LuV components, you can now make the Water Purification Plant. This multiblock allows you to make purified water, which will be helpful in making wafers of increasing purity and perfection. For your current Naquadah-Doped Wafers, this is not yet necessary, but using purified water may significantly speed up the process, so it's definitely worth checking out.

The Water Purification Plant does not run recipes itself. Instead, it provides the core logistics for your water purification line to work. Around it you can build water purification units that link to the Water Purification Plant. The plant then provides power and maintenance to the different units, and synchronizes their recipe cycles.
data.title: §c§lIndustrial Water Purification

data.name: Infinity Coil Upgrade
data.data:
Smelting with the ferocity of the universe itself.

This unbelievable material seemed impossible to manipulate into a coil block form, even though its properties made this desirable. It is incredibly stable even at extreme temperatures, but this also made it unable to pack together for coils.

However, the situation changed when you thought about using something more intelligent. By integrating a Wetware or better UHV circuit, the Infinity Coil became a reality, controlled by the ever-watching eyes of the circuitry you've spent months to create. From now on, these eyes will watch over your multiblocks.

Provides 11701K heat. You could upgrade your EBF, though at this point it's more likely to be for your MBFs or your DTPF.
data.title: §6§lInfinity Coil Upgrade
data.tooltip:
Infinity Coil Upgrade
Prequest requests:
Infinity Infrastructure
Awakened Draconium Coil Upgrade

data.name: Integrated Ore Factory - All in One!
data.data: The Integrated Ore Factory allows you to process ores through multiple processes at once.
data.title: §6§6§6§lIntegrated Ore Factory - All in One!
data.tooltip:
Integrated Ore Factory - All in One!
Prequest requests:
Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger... Pt 1 in UHV
Master of Circuits

data.name: iTNT
data.data: Industrial TNT is the HV variant of TNT. It explodes with more power, and you can't pick it up. Not by hand anyway
data.title: §6§liTNT

data.name: It's Time to Get More Steam
data.data:
As soon as you have the ability to store energy in large quantities, it would be necessary to have a way to generate energy in large quantities. You need a large bronze boiler. But in order to make this boiler, you will need a mountain of bronze. This boiler produces 800L of steam per tick. This is enough to run 10 basic steam turbines.

The large boiler can use either water or distilled water. Water is consumed at a rate of 1L of water per 150L of steam.

To make a large boiler you must make a 3x3x5 structure with Bronze Pipe Casings in the center of the middle 3 levels. The lowest level must contain at least 1 or 2 input hatches, 1 or 2 input buses, 3 or 4 fireboxes, 1 muffler, and one maintenance hatch. The lowest level can not contain any plated bricks. All hatches, buses, and mufflers must have their back side touching a firebox. The output hatch can be placed on any of the upper 4 levels.

§c§cWarning: Different from other boilers, Large Boilers must contain water at all times while active. If at any point the Boiler runs out of water while it is active, it will explode.
data.title: §6§lIt's Time to Get More Steam
data.tooltip:
It's Time to Get More Steam
Prequest requests:
Good Circuits

data.name: IV Glass
data.data:
The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Tungstensteel (5). Make it to allow higher tier recipes in the Bacterial Vat, higher tier Energy Hatches in the MBF, or better Capacitors in your LSC. Or just use it for machine recipes, whatever.

[note]PS: If you just want to use it to make machines, check out the Thorium Yttrium glass blocks.[/note]
data.title: §6§lIV Glass
data.tooltip:
IV Glass
Prequest requests:
Better Glass Upgrade, EV Glass

data.name: Less Power Loss
data.data: When you reach MV tier you can make your own duct tape in case you have to move your multiblock machines around. Duct tape will fix all maintenance problems in any multiblock machine.
data.title: §6§lLess Power Loss

data.name: Let's Get Crackin!
data.data:
Cracking oil products like light and heavy fuel with the oil cracker is faster and more efficient than using a chemical reactor, producing 25 to 50 percent more output, depending on which cracking method it's doing (steam does 50%, hydro does 25% but consumes 20% less hydrogen). Cracked products will result in additional by-products in the distillation tower. It is a smart idea to get this multiblock since you are going to need TONS of industrial TNT from Toluene for advanced tier rockets.

The 16 coils form 2 vertical rings of 8 on either side of the controller. The casings between the rings can be replaced with a hatch for steam/hydrogen input. Energy hatch and maintenance hatch can replace any of the casings. The input product hatch and output product hatch must replace one of the casings outside of the coils.

Hint: Only GT/Railcraft steam can be used, not ic2 steam. You can use a fluid heater to make it instead of a boiler.

[note]The circuit goes in the controller.[/note]

[note]PS: I listed all the cracker recipes on the spreadsheet for you to look at in a convenient format. Now you can easily compare which oil path to take![/note]
data.title: §6§lLet's Get Crackin!

data.name: Liquid Cooling Tower
data.data:
I have started to hit the limit of the multiblock without overclocking it, so I decided to give it a liquid cooling tower. This will allow it to overclock like every other multi with 2x Speed and 4x EU/t.

I will need to provide some distilled water to its hatch to absorb any excess heat.

[note]The Liquid Cooling Tower allows the Multiblock to have 2/4 OC at the cost of 10L/s of distilled water when running. The input hatch is placed in the bottom center of the Liquid Cooling Tower.[/note]
data.title: Liquid Cooling Tower
data.tooltip:
Liquid Cooling Tower
Prequest requests:
One Ingot, Infinite Power
PCB Factory

data.name: Liquid-Fuelled Firebox
data.data:
Creosote oil into steam! After you make your first steel you are able to craft a liquid fueled firebox.

Diesel, ethanol, creosote and Biodiesel all work well here. This will also require a boiler tank - see the quests linked below.
data.title: §6§lLiquid-Fuelled Firebox

data.name: Low-Pressure Boiler Tank
data.data:
The low pressure boiler tank is the easiest way to make steam with an RC boiler. The firebox needs this tank on top to produce steam. The bigger the boiler the slower it heats up, but it will produce more steam when heated up.

Extract steam by attaching a pipe to the boiler tank.

[note]This variant is very useful for inconsistent operation. It has lower efficiency but heats up significantly faster than the high pressure variant meaning the fuel will be used more efficiently at the beginning of the operation, the drawback is that this variant is 50% as efficient as the high pressure one is at max temperature. If instead you want to have a constant high-throughput steam generation use high pressure variant instead.[/note]

[warn]Actual fuel usage depends on the machine size and other factors such as machine temperature, if you want to know the actual number you will need to test it on your own setup.[/warn]
data.title: §6§lLow-Pressure Boiler Tank
data.tooltip:
Low-Pressure Boiler Tank
Prequest requests:
Railcraft Steam Power
Liquid-Fuelled Firebox

data.name: LuV Glass
data.data: The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Rhodium-Plated Palladium (6). Make it to allow higher tier recipes in the Bacterial Vat, higher tier Energy Hatches in the MBF, or better Capacitors in your LSC. Or just use it for machine recipes, whatever.
data.title: §6§lLuV Glass

data.name: Making the Vat More Efficient!
data.data:
Looking at the Vat's recipes you are likely discouraged by the small amount of fluid being produced per recipe. Don't worry! Fluid consumption and production shown in NEI are just the baseline for the lowest efficiency. The efficiency of Vat depends on the amount of fluid in the Output Hatch.

The efficiency gradually increases as the output hatch fills up and reaches maximum efficiency when it is §cexactly half-filled§r. If the hatch fills even more, the efficiency goes down again, so try to keep it close to half! At maximum efficiency the amount of fluid consumed and produced per recipe is multiplied by 1001. The items and culture are not affected.

There are different means to keep it at half, including OC (not SFM, it doesn't like BW fluids), fluid detector+machine controller, or a fluid regulator, as well as more off the wall ones such as frames or block-sharing. If you choose the fluid detector route, remember that using a larger output hatch will make it easier to keep it close to half-filled.
data.title: §6§lMaking the Vat More Efficient!
data.tooltip:
Making the Vat More Efficient!
Prequest requests:
Bacterial Vat

data.name: Moooooore Steam
data.data:
The Titanium Large Boiler is a distant cousin to the Bronze and Steel Boilers, and it has a significant difference. Instead of accepting just about any burnable fuel, it will only accept specific ones and reject all others. You can see which ones are accepted by looking at the appropriate NEI tab, but the Solid Super Fuels are guaranteed to work.

This is a big downside, but the upside is that these boilers output respectable power even in these tiers. Without any other inputs, this boiler produces Superheated Steam at a flow rate matching 4000 EU/t, on turbines running at 100% fuel efficiency. If this becomes 150%, then the steam output will produce 6000 EU/t, almost the same as a boosted Large Combustion Engine!

To get all the power from this, though, you will need an HP Steam Turbine, followed by a regular Steam Turbine, or more than one of each if the flow rate is too big for the turbine material you've chosen. Make sure to send the Distilled Water back to the boilers!
data.title: §6§lMoooooore Steam

data.name: More Algae Uses
data.data: Now that you have Titanium, why not make about 79 EV machine casings for some cheap Ammonia? The ratio is about 50mb to one Golden-Brown Algae. At EV you have a 10% chance to get 8 about every 30 seconds. It also does not require a Chemical Plant, but it will require an MV Assembler and an MV Fluid Extractor at minimum.
data.title: More Algae Uses

data.name: More Heat - Kanthal Coil Upgrade
data.data:
Better materials need higher temperatures. You can just exchange the old coils with the new ones. Kanthal coils let you reach 2700K. You can even reuse the old coils in your Pyro or to make other machines, how fancy is that! If you don't have any other place to use them, you can macerate or arc furnace them too.

If you don't have a Vacuum Freezer yet, then cool the hot ingots in an MV Chemical Bath with Coolant.

Remember that you can get an upgraded OC (4/4) instead of a regular one (4/2) if your coils are 1800K above the recipe temperature, as well as an EU discount. This applies to every 900K or 1800K above, so you should try to upgrade your coils as soon as you can.
data.title: §6§lMore Heat - Kanthal Coil Upgrade

data.name: Moron's Manual for Effective EBFing
data.data:
Welcome to the latest Moron's Manual, Effective EBFing! This manual covers common problems encountered when using the GregTech 1000 Electric Blast Furnace.

Setup
When setting up your EBF, make sure to place it a few chunks away from things pollution affects, like farmland. Pollution is nobody's friend!

During setup, make sure the center of the EBF is hollow. Sometimes things can sneak in there without you noticing, like a Thaumcraft light orb!

Make sure your muffler hatch is placed on the top middle block. The EBF can't work if it is not spreading those delightful odors!

When placing your power hatches, make sure to minimize the distance between any generators and the EBF. Especially at LV, those few blocks make a big difference! Every amp of energy traveling over a cable loses a little bit - and you'll need as much as you can get! Your best setup is to put two generators right next to each hatch, with a 2A cable. If you're poor, you could use 2 battery buffers with 2 batteries each directly attached to each hatch. Make sure to top off the buffers' generators. If you make 9 slot battery buffers, you can fill them up over time to get longer running time until you get stable power.

Output hatches and buses will automatically push into tanks and inventories placed next to them such as chests or BC tanks. They will also void if they're full, so keep an eye on them!

When building multiple EBFs, the GregTech 1000 Electric Blast Furnace can share walls. This can save you on input and output hatches too. Not recommended for energy and maintenance hatches!
data.title: §6§lMoron's Manual for Effective EBFing

data.name: Multiblock Tanks... Railcraft Tanks
data.data:
576 buckets of fluid, that should be enough to store all the creosote you have accumulated thus far. If that isn't enough you can make this tank bigger. The smallest tanks are 3x4x3 while the biggest are 9x8x9.

Fluid will auto-output without any pumps if you place a valve on its bottom side at the center. The output rate is 1000 L/t so twice as fast as a GT HV Pump Cover. You can color the tank with Buildcraft paintbrushes and the GT spray can.

If you still use Railcraft tanks in later tiers, you boost the output rate by using pumps.
data.title: §6§lMultiblock Tanks... Railcraft Tanks

data.name: Nano Forge Tier 1
data.data:
There must be a way to make a nano scale robots to work in a machine. Carbon ones can be made in an assembly line, but very inefficiently. There must be a better way.

What about a Nano Forge, able to cut up blocks into nano-thin sheets and then creating the first nanite, which helps create thousands of them in mere seconds.

[note]The Nano Forge is a big multiblock requiring lots of power over the course of a couple minutes. It is able to use TT energy hatches (including lasers). The controller must have a carbon nanite inside to make tier 1 recipes.[/note]

[note]Despite what NEI might claim there are no minimum voltages for the Nano Forge recipes. If you want to do a recipe you just have to achieve the minimum EU/t required, no matter the voltage[/note].
data.title: Nano Forge Tier 1

data.name: Nano Forge Tier 2
data.data:
Carbon Nanites are good first workers, but they don't have much in the way of working with more complex systems as they have a very basic nanite network. So a new more advanced nanite will be needed to produce complex nanites.

The neutronium nanite is an in-between of the two tiers able to produce tier 2 nanites, which have other uses.

[note]When putting the neutronium nanite in the controller, you will need to wait for the structure check to happen again or break and replace the controller with a neutronium nanite inside. Allows the Nano Forge to make tier 2 nanites.[/note]
data.title: Nano Forge Tier 2
data.tooltip:
Nano Forge Tier 2
Prequest requests:
Quantum Anomaly
Nano Forge Tier 1

data.name: Nano Forge Tier 3
data.data:
Neutronium nanites are slow moving, but that allowed them to have a complex nanite network. If there was a material that could move itself it could allow for an even more complex nanite with great speeds... Thankfully with the DTPF fully functional we can make it, transcendent metal.

[note]Same thing as the neutronium nanite, but this nanite allows for tier 3 nanites to be made in the nano forge.[/note]
data.title: Nano Forge Tier 3
data.tooltip:
Nano Forge Tier 3
Prequest requests:
Nano Forge Tier 2
Haha, Spinny Ingot

data.name: Nano Forge Tier 4
data.data:
The Transcendent nanite has the required complexity and speed to create most nanites, but lacks the strength required to handle the exotic, hyper-dense, magnetic forms of matter you need to manipulate in order to advance. Fortunately with Eternity, you have found an ample replacement that should be up to the task... But you suspect that you'll need a far more complicated structure to be able to contain such a process.

[note]Grants the ability to create §lMagmatter Nanites§r in addition to a greater speed at the cost of assembling a more expensive structure.[/note]
data.title: Nano Forge Tier 4

data.name: Naquadah Alloy Coil Upgrade
data.data: This one is optional now. But still very useful and recommended.
data.title: §6§lNaquadah Alloy Coil Upgrade
data.tooltip:
Naquadah Alloy Coil Upgrade
Prequest requests:
Naquadah Coil Upgrade

data.name: Naquadah Coil Upgrade
data.data: To process more advanced materials like naquadah alloy you need more than 6300K. Upgrade your EBF to 7200K to increase the heat.
data.title: §6§lNaquadah Coil Upgrade

data.name: Neutron Accelerator
data.data:
It is used to accelerate the NKE. You just need to connect a cable to it and it will keep consuming the energy.

[note]PS: You can use a controller cover to stop it.[/note]
data.title: §6§lNeutron Accelerator

data.name: Neutron Activator
data.data:
You will need machine to process the naquadah in the future.

This machine is different from most multis. It needs to use [warn]Neutron Accelerator[/warn] this special hatch instead of energy hatch to keep it running.

The accelerator will increase its Neutron Kinetic Energy (NKE) and when the NKE is between the requested number which you can see in NEI, the machine will work and output the right products. However, if you turn on the Neutron Activator when NKE doesn't meet the requirement, it will still consume your input material but output trash. So be careful with the NKE when you run this machine.

When all Neutron Accelerators aren't running, NKE will decrease 72keV/s.

Neutron Activator will explode when NKE is over 1200MeV.

§dYou can enable batch mode with wire cutters.§r

[note]The more height/speed casings you have, the more inefficient the EU->eV conversion becomes, so you then need more power. The math is as follows: Multiply recipe time by 0.9 for each height above 4 and multiply eV you get from your input power by 0.95 for each height above 4.[/note]
data.title: §6§lNeutron Activator

data.name: Neutronium Compressor
data.data:
In order to compress infinity catalysts and singularities, you'll need the strongest compressor yet: the Neutronium Compressor. This multiblock channels and controls extreme amounts of pressure through carefully calibrated Active Neutronium Casings, but the sheer magnitude of pressure is too much to produce blocks or superdense plates, as any regular material inserted into the device will be compressed down to a singularity. More advanced singularities should be possible in theory, but you'll need something even stronger...

[note]Note that singularity recipes require extreme amounts of items! Consider using Super Buses or ME Stocking Input Buses to fit everything in there.[/note]
data.title: Neutronium Compressor
data.tooltip:
Neutronium Compressor
Prequest requests:
Neutrons From Space
Admit it, You Love This Pt 1 in UV

data.name: Neutron Sensor
data.data:
The sensor will send redstone signals according to the NKE of the Neutron Activator.

It works like a cover: enter the threshold value in eV, and it will emit a redstone signal when the NKE is at least as high as the threshold.
data.title: §6§lNeutron Sensor

data.name: Nichrome Coil Upgrade
data.data: To reach 3600K so you can process higher tier materials like tungsten, you need nichrome heating coils.
data.title: §6§lNichrome Coil Upgrade
data.tooltip:
Nichrome Coil Upgrade
Prequest requests:
At the End of...
More Heat - Kanthal Coil Upgrade

data.name: Nobody Wants an Explosion...
data.data:
...right? So when building multiblocks, make sure you:

1. Don't cross chunk boundaries with the multiblock.

2. If possible, don't rely on resources coming from outside the chunk. Make sure you source your water locally.

Keep in mind that electric machines don't like getting rain or snow on them. They'll start fires, and those fires have a chance of causing an explosion. This explosion will explode other machines, cascading until your whole base is a hole in the ground. This is one of the reason backups are a thing. Stay safe out there!

If worse comes to worst, there is logs/Explosion.log that tracks what caused an explosion. However, this file appears to reset on world load.
data.title: §6§lNobody Wants an Explosion...

data.name: No More (IC) Engraving
data.data:
Now that you've reached ZPM, you're going to have to resort to means other than mere laser engraving for your photolithography needs.

Of course, we're going overkill right away, requiring a full-on particle accelerator setup to produce the ultra-coherent ultra-high-energy light used to etch more advanced ICs.

To begin with, you'll need a Source Chamber to produce electrons (at pitifully low energies, of course). Check out NEI for the available recipes, you'll want the one with the hand-drawn icon.
data.title: No More (IC) Engraving

data.name: Obtaining Ender Pearls
data.data:
You can hunt endermen the Vanilla way to get a chance at Ender Pearls, you can purchase Endermen spawn eggs, or try your luck in the End.

Or you can get cruel, and stuff one into a smeltery to melt it down into delicious Liquid Ender and cast pearls from it.

You monster.

Some of the dungeons have Spawner of Enderman, so you can do whatever you want with it.

To prevent endermen from teleporting, make sure to cover the smeltery so they don't see the sky.

If you manage to put a regenerating endermen in there, tag it so it doesn't despawn, and make sure your smeltery is not in a claimed chunk on a server.
data.title: §e§d§c§6§lObtaining Ender Pearls
data.tooltip:
Obtaining Ender Pearls
Prequest requests:
You Are Now Prepared, Hopefully!

data.name: One Fluid Tank to Store it All!!
data.data:
If you ever thought that the standard super tanks or quantum tanks were still too small then the YOTTank is the next option.

The YOTTank compared to the TFFT might only be able to store one fluid instead of 25 fluids. However it makes up for this downside by not having to share any of the fluid storage space with any other fluids. It also does not require any energy input or maintenance requirements.

If all you want to do is store a large amount of one fluid type then look no further then the YOTTank. It has a special ME input hatch for ae2 connections while having expandable storage blocks. The tank can be both upgraded with the fluid storage blocks and can be increased in height to hold any more fluid.

So if you want to store your fluid in style then look no further then the YOTTank.

[note]If you're having issues searching for the fluid storage blocks for the YOTTank in NEI then search for: fluid cell block[/note]
data.title: §6§lOne Fluid Tank to Store it All!!
data.tooltip:
One Fluid Tank to Store it All!!
Prequest requests:
Tier 5 (IV)

data.name: Oops
data.data: If you failed to meet the NKE as NEI requested, you can recycle something useful in this place.
data.title: §6§lOops

data.name: Ozonation
data.data:
Want even more speed on your wafer processing? Using Grade 2 Purified Water, made by ozonation, you can now reduce processing time by 50%. To run this machine, you will need to make large amounts of Ozone Gas by bombarding air with a strong laser. If you haven't already, you should definitely make the Hyper-Intensity Laser Engraver multiblock to speed up this process.

[note]This multiblock is very picky about where the ozone input hatch goes. If you can't figure out why it's not forming, chances are you forgot to place this hatch in the correct location. Use the hologram projector to see where it goes.[/note]
data.title: §c§lOzonation

data.name: PCB Factory
data.data:
All those boards made in a chemical reactor. It's time to stop that, there must be a more efficient way to make them. After a couple days of research I have found one, a factory designed to print out circuit boards.

The PCB Factory is able to use a wide range of plastics to create circuit boards ready to be used. The printing mechanism overheats when it tries to overclock currently, so I will have to find a way to make that work later. Boards with neurons on them will also take a bit before they can be made, but it won't be hard to achieve.

§2Trace size: the trace size represents the lines between components, which are needed to transmit the electrical signals on the circuit. One can make it smaller to slow down the machine, but use less resources, or make it bigger to make it faster, but use more resources.

§1Formulas:
- 10000/(TraceSize/100) Production
- RecipeDuration/TraceSize^2 Time

§2Using the GUI, the player can go to the configuration menu. There they can change the trace size or add new parts to the multiblock. One can also change where they are placed around the multiblock.§r

[note]Make sure to set the configuration you want before using the structure lib blueprint for autobuild.[/note]
data.title: PCB Factory
data.tooltip:
PCB Factory
Prequest requests:
The Board that Keeps Life

data.name: PCB Factory Tier 2
data.data:
With the Nano Forge built, we can upgrade our production of circuit boards for free, but the nanites need a container to hold them. The current casings aren't enough, we need to find an alternative casing.

After some research, infinity as a frame and enriched holmium as the protection layer seems to work well. It can be allowed to let through nanites to go into the printer base so that extra material can be directly removed instead of trying to go slower.

[note]Allows the player to use the tier 2 recipes with the use of a silver nanite in the input bus. This also unlocks parallels of the PCB Factory with said formula: Log2(x) parallels, where x is the amount of nanites in the input bus.[/note]
data.title: PCB Factory Tier 2
data.tooltip:
PCB Factory Tier 2
Prequest requests:
Wait, PBI wasn't the last plastic?
PCB Factory

data.name: PCB Factory Tier 3
data.data:
Why use a small nozzle to print out the conductor on the board when one can just build it using nanites? Well the silver nanite isn't rigid enough for that so a new nanite will be needed... and so will new casings. Heard that celestial tungsten is a good candidate for a frame. Quantum can be used for the protection as these nanites will be forever flying around inside.

The structure will need to change as it needs to be a bit bigger and taller.

[note]Works the same as the Tier 2 in most cases, but allows the player to use even less resources by using a gold nanite.[/note]
data.title: PCB Factory Tier 3
data.tooltip:
PCB Factory Tier 3
Prequest requests:
Nano Forge Tier 3
PCB Factory Tier 2

data.name: pH Neutralization
data.data:
If you want to process your Europium-Doped Wafers with a significant speed boost, this machine is for you. Using the pH neutral water you get from this machine, you can process wafers twice as fast.

This is the first real complex automation challenge in the waterline, it's up to you to figure out how you want to deal with the pH neutralization process. Have fun!

[note]This multiblock is very picky about where its hatches for acids and bases go. If you can't figure out why it's not forming, chances are you forgot to place these hatches in the correct location. Use the hologram projector to see where they go.[/note]
data.title: pH Neutralization

data.name: Playing with Colors!
data.data:
Multiblock machines enforce input separation based on hatch color. Inputs from Input Buses and Input Hatches will only interact if they share the same color. Un-dyed inputs act as wildcards compatible with any color.

Color can be applied using a Spray Can and removed with a Spray Can Solvent. An Infinite Spray Can becomes available later in progression.

§6Now §2go §3have §4fun§5!!!
data.title: §6§lPlaying with Colors!

data.name: Playing With the Big Boys, Chemically
data.data:
This facility will process certain chemical recipes you'll need later on, like Rocket Fuels. Keep in mind that recipes can only be made after meeting the required Chemical Plant tier.

It will need a minecart load of resources, so start mining!

Catalysts are needed in some recipes, place them in the Catalyst Housing. They use durability, this includes ones that don't look like it.

[note]You can make Silicon Carbide in the mixer, you don't need the ABS.[/note]

Valid solid casings: (Determines CP Tier for recipes)
1 Strong Bronze Machine Casing
2 Solid Steel Machine Casing
3 Sturdy Aluminium Machine Casing
4 Clean Stainless Steel Machine Casing
5 Stable Titanium Machine Casing
6 Robust Tungstensteel Casing
7 Vigorous Laurenium Machine Casing
8 Rugged Botmium Machine Casing

Valid machine casings: (Determines maximum hatch/bus tier)
LV-UHV Machine Casing, UHV unlocks any hatch/bus.

Valid pipe casings: (+2 Parallels, -20% chance to consume catalyst durability per pipe casing starting with 2 parallels and 100% chance for the first one.)
Bronze
Steel
Titanium
Tungstensteel

All coils from Cupronickel to Eternal are valid. Each one increases speed by +50%, starting at 50% speed for Cupronickel.

[note]Additionally: If you have at least Awakened Draconium Coils and Tungstensteel pipe casings, then no catalyst is consumed at all![/note]
data.title: Playing With the Big Boys, Chemically
data.tooltip:
Playing With the Big Boys, Chemically
Prequest requests:
Algae Pond
Performing Chemical Experiments at HV Level

data.name: Powderbarrels
data.data: Powderbarrels are pretty bad in the implosion compressor. They are good for prospecting though. Craft one stack.
data.title: §6§lPowderbarrels

data.name: Precise Assembler
data.data:
Precise Assembler has two modes: Precise mode and Normal mode.

Precise mode is used to make some of the advanced components from Good Generator mod.

[note]As name suggests your current casings lack precision to produce these advanced components.
You will need at least MK-1 casings for this mode to work.[/note]

Normal mode works as multiblock version of Assembler.

[note]You can't skip tiers with this. You need singleblock Assembler or GT++ multi to make your first Energy Hatch, then you can use it for Precise Assembler.[/note]
data.title: Precise Assembler
data.tooltip:
Precise Assembler
Prequest requests:
ASoC - Advanced System on a Chip
Rhodium-Plated Palladium
Osmiridium
Insane Voltage Multiblocks
IV Energy Hatch

data.name: Producing Solar Panels in BULK!!
data.data:
[quest]The Solar Factory![/quest]

The structure has §c3§r tiers, each of which allow greater production than the previous tier.

Recipes in NEI display the minimum wafer tier required.
Wafer Tiers:

§6Monocrystalline
Phosphorous
Naquadah
Europium
Americium
Photonically Prepared
Photonically Enhanced§r

Machine parallels are based on Precise Casing Tier:

§6MK-I: §f§c8x§r
§6MK-II: §f§c16x§r
§6MK-III: §f§c32x§r
§6MK-IV: §f§c64x§r

§lTier §b2:§r

§aSupports Multi-Amp energy hatches§r
§c25%§f§r more outputs for every Wafer tier §oabove§r the minimum required.
§r§r§rThe bonus to outputs occurs after parallels, but §9cannot be greater§f§r than §c100%§r
LV-LuV Solar Panels can be made without the previous panel, but at a higher cost.

§lTier §b3:§r

§aSupports Laser Energy hatches§r
Bonus per increased wafer tier is increased to §c50%§f
§rZPM-UV Solar Panels can be made without the previous panel, but at a higher cost.
data.title: Producing Solar Panels in BULK!!
data.tooltip:
Producing Solar Panels in BULK!!
Prequest requests:
Avengers, Assemble! 3

data.name: Purifying Water With Plasma
data.data:
As usual, before you can make use of your Americium to make better wafers, you will need better water. This time, we're going to use plasma to rapidly heat up the water and then cool it back down.

Some of the mechanics may seem similar to how you set up the pH neutralization process, maybe you can expand on what you learned there?

[note]This multiblock is very picky about where its plasma and coolant input hatches go. If you can't figure out why it's not forming, chances are you forgot to place these hatches in the correct location. Use the hologram projector to see where they go.[/note]
data.title: Purifying Water With Plasma
data.tooltip:
Purifying Water With Plasma
Prequest requests:
UV Energy Hatch
Netherite Materials
pH Neutralization

data.name: Railcraft Steam Power
data.data:
As an alternative way to make steam you can use the railcraft boilers. They require at least one firebox.

More than one size is possible: (1x1 which the quest gets you to make) 2x2 and 3x3.

Provide water and coal to the firebox. Make sure you don't run out of water or...BOOM.

Each boiler needs 1, 2 or 3 layers of tanks on top, equal to the size (1x1x1, 2x2x2, or 3x3x3) - see the quests linked below.
data.title: §6§lRailcraft Steam Power

data.name: Sievert for the Vat
data.data:
Some Vat recipes require a certain Sievert (radioactivity) value. So attach this Radio Hatch to your Vat to input radioactive material!

The Radio Hatch holds rods/long rods of radioactive material and uses them to produce Sievert. The input item determines the Sievert value and how long it lasts. Items stored in the hatch will be used continuously even if machine not active, so make sure you want to craft something before putting items in.

You can check the stats of an inputted item with a portable scanner. Higher tiers of hatch hold more, from 1kg (HV) to 6kg (UV). Rods are worth 1kg, while long rods are 2kg.

Some recipes require [warn]exact[/warn] sievert, you can use the screwdriver to access the radiation shutter control to adjust how much sv is blocked from being sent to the vat. For example, you need 100sv to make Seaweed Broth, so you'd use Naquadah rods, and block off 30sv.

Rod Stats:
Material-Sievert-Apprx. time until used up
Bismuth 83sv 198s
Uranium 235 92sv 80s
Uranium 238 92sv 80s
Plutonium 239 94sv 66s
Plutonium 241 94sv 66s
Naquadah 130sv 14.5s
Enriched Naquadah 140sv 10.5s
Naquadria 150sv 8s

There are more radioactive materials than these, but these are the main ones.
data.title: §6§lSievert for the Vat
data.tooltip:
Sievert for the Vat
Prequest requests:
Bacterial Vat
Reactor Fuels

data.name: Smelt All the Things...
data.data:
Smelting up to nine items at once sound nice? With a bit of steel you can make a railcraft Steam Oven. 2x2x2

Hint: All furnace recipes work just fine, but you cannot use it to make charcoal from wood.
data.title: §6§lSmelt All the Things...

data.name: Something From Nothing pt 2
data.data: This multiblock works just as a normal drilling rig, but with the power of §5§l§oTechnology §rit won't reduce the underground field size so the output will always be the same.
data.title: §6§lSomething From Nothing pt 2
data.tooltip:
Something From Nothing pt 2
Prequest requests:
Master of Circuits
Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger... Pt 1 in UHV

data.name: Something From Nothing
data.data:
Void Miners are basically the same thing as regular ones, except that they draw from the whole pool of ores for the dimension without there having to be any nearby. In addition, you can speed them up by supplying Neon, Krypton, Xenon, or Oganesson.

You can get Neon reasonably easily from Bartimaeusnek Ore from Ross 128ba. Krypton and Xenon can be produced from centrifuging fuel rods. All three can be produced from the EV liquid air distillation method. Remember you need the Liquid Air Fluid Hatch to actually put in enough liquid air. If you want all the produced gasses from the first 4 slots, you'll need to use the Giant Output Hatch.

To get Oganesson, you'll need mk3 fusion.

All four fluids can be replicated, so you'll probably end up doing that.

[note]If you want the Deep Dark's ores, you HAVE to use a Void Miner.[/note]
data.title: §6§lSomething From Nothing

data.name: Steam is Never Enough
data.data: Now you can make Advanced Circuits, which means it's time to build a Large Steel Boiler. Each one of these produces 1000 EU/t in Steam, which means you will need several Steam Turbines to convert it all to power! Keep in mind that the MV ones are less efficient, so calculate your losses when building your setup.
data.title: §6§lSteam is Never Enough

data.name: Steel Multiblock Tanks
data.data: Do you want to have tanks that can hold double the amount of the iron ones? Go ahead and make a steel tank. Everything else is the same.
data.title: §6§lSteel Multiblock Tanks
data.tooltip:
Steel Multiblock Tanks
Prequest requests:
Blastoff!
Multiblock Tanks... Railcraft Tanks

data.name: Still Not Enough Charcoal?
data.data:
This oven is the best way to get charcoal and creosote (x50 faster than Railcraft's coke oven) and other byproducts. You will need tons of bronze, iron and steel to build it, but it's worth it. Finally, it will be possible to dismantle the charcoal pit.

With Cupronickel coils the oven is a bit slower. Each coil tier speeds up the charcoal production.
data.title: §6§lStill Not Enough Charcoal?

data.name: Synchrotron (No Relation to the Catalyst)
data.data:
To actually produce some light for photolithography, you'll need to accelerate your electrons in a Synchrotron. Like with the LINAC, providing it with coolant is necessary to keep it running.

You can increase the energy of the produced photons by increasing EU/t, or increasing the tier of all four Antenna Casings inside.

To improve focus, you can use a better coolant, and the output amount increases with both EU/t and antennae tier.

Yes, you need all four energy hatches.
data.title: Synchrotron (No Relation to the Catalyst)
data.tooltip:
Synchrotron (No Relation to the Catalyst)
Prequest requests:
Hundreds of Thousands of eV

data.name: TFFT
data.data:
The TFFT is very useful if you don't want to have a bunch of Super Tanks, it also has a modular structure so it can be up to x4.33 times bigger than numbers in this quest.

With the tier I storage field block, it consumes 27 EU/t but only has about 0.27x the storage capacity of a Super Tank I per fluid.

With the tier V storage field block it consumes 1134 EU/t and has about 0.54x the storage capacity of a QT III per fluid.

With the tier X storage field block it consumes 0EU/t (only tier X uses 0) and has about x3.3 capacity of T7 YOTTank (divide by 25 to get per 1 fluid)

You can use the multi hatch to access all the fluids at once with an ME Fluid Storage Bus or Fluid Ender Conduit.

[note]Remember to turn auto-voiding on if you need it.[/note]
data.title: §6§lTFFT

data.name: The Quest for Holy Water
data.data:
You got to take a well deserved break from the waterline in UHV, but now that you are going to be making optical circuits, your Grade 6 Purified Water will no longer be enough. Using the Degasser, you can remove all the leftover decontaminants from previous processes and make even more pure water, pure enough for Optical Circuits.

The tooltip and list of requirements looks intimidating. Try breaking it down into small, digestible units of logic and you will quickly arrive at a solution.
data.title: The Quest for Holy Water
data.tooltip:
The Quest for Holy Water
Prequest requests:
One Last Time
High Energy Laser Purification
UEV Energy Hatch

data.name: Thermal Boiler - Lava you long time
data.data:
If you want energy from Lava and the byproducts, the Thermal Boiler is the perfect solution. It processes Lava super fast for Steam, and with a Lava Filter will provide some centrifuged lava byproducts as well. A great source of Copper, Silver, Gold, Tin, Tantalum, and Tungstate, better outputs than regular lava processing in a Centrifuge.

You can get even better efficiency pairing it with a Large Heat Exchanger. The LHE will turn normal vanilla Lava into Pahoehoe Lava, which will provide Steam and byproducts in the Thermal Boiler. Win/Win/Win!
data.title: Thermal Boiler - Lava you long time
data.tooltip:
Thermal Boiler - Lava you long time
Prequest requests:
Extreme Voltage Multiblocks

data.name: Thermosink Radiator
data.data:
With the control of spacetime you have achieved and its 0K temperature it would be possible to make an even better cooling unit. A casing able to keep its room temperature very low and nanites which can transfer heat effectively because of their small bodies. This doesn't quite work and some coolant is still needed, but water freezes at those temperatures so super coolant will be our choice.

[note]The Thermosink Radiator allows for 4/4 OC making it possible to speed through recipes. It requires 10/s of super coolant in its hatch, it's in the same place as the Liquid Cooling Tower.[/note]

[warn]This upgrade is incompatible with its lower tier predecessor.[/warn]
data.title: Thermosink Radiator

data.name: The Water Dilemma
data.data:
Finite water is a problem. But fear not, there are solutions! I shall guide you to a steady supply of water. The Railcraft water siding tanks provides enough water to last the early game.

The humidity of a biome is very important and will increase the base fill rate. If it is raining, the tank will fill much quicker. One block of the water siding tank must see sky for the maximum output. The best part is that you don't need a pump to extract water. Tanks and pipes placed next to it will be autofilled by the water siding tank.
data.title: §6§lThe Water Dilemma

data.name: The 'Water Problems' Are Solved
data.data: After entering the HV age you've found a way of making a water reservoir which solves the finite water problem. Craft it with some fused quartz glass, HV pumps, and cauldrons.
data.title: §6§lThe 'Water Problems' Are Solved
data.tooltip:
The 'Water Problems' Are Solved
Prequest requests:
The Water Dilemma
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Tier 2 Manipulating
data.data:
After significant progression, you'll be able to upgrade the QFT to tier 2 by replacing the §b§3Neutron Pulse Manipulator§f §rcasings § with §b§3Cosmic Fabric Manipulator§f §rcasings. Once installed, the QFT can perform the §6§6monaline skip§f,§r § the §6§6first two naqline skips§f§r, and the §6netherite line skip§r.

§rThese casings require more advanced materials, including §b§3Hyper-Stable Self-Healing Adhesive§f§r, which can only be crafted in a tier 1 QFT. This adhesive isn’t just excellent at sticking things together - it’s also built to withstand the intense energy flow of a tier 2, 3, or even tier 4 QFT! §o

Who knows what kinds of materials you’ll need after this?!
data.title: Tier 2 Manipulating

data.name: Tier 2 Shielding
data.data: Consider improving your QFT's focusing capabilities by replacing your §b§3Neutron Shielding Core§f §r§rcasings with §b§3Cosmic Fabric Shielding Core§f §rcasings. Like the tier 2 manipulators, these also require §b§3Hyper-Stable Self-Healing Adhesive§§§r.
data.title: Tier 2 Shielding

data.name: Tier 3 Manipulating
data.data:
With access to even more advanced materials, you can upgrade your QFT to tier 3 by replacing the §b§3Cosmic Fabric Manipulator§f §rcasings with §b§3§b§3Infinity Infused Manipulator§§§f §rcasings. This tier unlocks two powerful new skips: the §6§6final naqline skip§f §rand the §6§6stem cell skip§f§r.

This new casing requires even more advanced materials still, including the §b§3Superconductor Rare-Earth Composite§f§r, which can only be crafted in a tier 2 QFT. Unlike §b§3Hyper-Stable Self-Healing Adhesive§f§r, which focused on structural integrity, this composite is designed purely for energy transmission. With automatic self-repair now fully handled, we can shift our focus to increasing the energy flow between components and into the multi itself.

Standard superconductors break down under quantum stress - but this composite eliminates all resistance across the outer shell. Its precisely layered rare-earth elements create such gradual transitions that quantum flow moves effortlessly, with no losses or destabilizing effects.

§oWhat will you discover next?!
data.title: Tier 3 Manipulating

data.name: Tier 3 Shielding
data.data: Consider improving your QFT's focusing capabilities even further by replacing your §§§3Cosmic Fabric Shielding Core§f §rcasings with §b§3Infinity Infused Shielding Core§f §rcasings. Like the tier 3 manipulators, these also require §b§3Superconductor Rare-Earth Composite§f§r.
data.title: Tier 3 Shielding

data.name: Tier 4 Manipulating
data.data:
§lFinally, you have done it§r! You can now upgrade your QFT to the ultimate tier by replacing your §b§3Infinity Infused Manipulator§f §rcasings with §b§3SpaceTime Continuum Ripper§f §rcasings. This final upgrade unlocks all skips, including the §6§6bio cell§f §rskip, the §6§6kevlar skip§f §rand the §6§6radox + xenoxene skip§f§r.

Even with all previous upgrades, the final leap remained out of reach. Chemical skips for foundational components used in the earlier stages of the QFT, such as bioware circuits, were still impossible - §ountil now§r. Reaching the theoretical limit of the QFT demands a material far beyond anything seen before, hidden deep within the second half of the Naquadah line.

The material you require will be your magnum opus - the §b§3Black Body Naquadria Supersolid§f§r. This extraordinary substance acts as a perfect black body - absorbing all radiation without reflection - and behaves as a supersolid, flowing like a fluid with zero viscosity. Combining these properties in a single material ensures stable, effortless quantum energy flow at any voltage level, even at the MAX tier!

With this breakthrough, your QFT is fully unlocked, capable of creating components up to the UHV tier.
data.title: Tier 4 Manipulating

data.name: Tier 4 Shielding
data.data: Consider pushing your QFT's focusing capability to its final form by replacing your §b§3Infinity Infused Shielding Core§f §rcasings with §b§3SpaceTime Bending Core§f §rcasings. Like the tier 4 manipulators, these also require §b§3Black Body Naquadria Supersolid§f§r.
data.title: Tier 4 Shielding

data.name: Time to Drill for Oil!
data.data:
Pumps are nice but you're going to reach a point where you'll want MOOOOOOOOOOOOORE oil. This multiblock will help with that but you'll need to search for oil using a seismic prospector. You can find raw, light, medium, and heavy oil. There's also a chance to find natural gas.

Higher tiers of power will drill faster. You need to upgrade the energy hatch corresponding to the power tier.

Later you can upgrade the oil drilling rig so it extracts from more than one chunk at a time.

You need mining pipes in the controller. If you need more than 64, you can use an input bus.

These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on any side. And set a waypoint with JourneyMaps so you don't forget where you placed it!

Space dims can also have fluids beneath bedrock. For info, check the Tips and Tricks tab.
data.title: §6§lTime to Drill for Oil!

data.name: Time to Drill For Ore!
data.data:
Auto Miners are nice but you're going to reach a point where you will want MOOOOOOOOOOOOORE ores. This multiblock will help with that. It will also pre-macerate your ores and give you a little bonus crushed ores as well.

Higher tiers of power will drill faster. You need to upgrade the energy hatch corresponding to the power tier. You will also need an energy hatch, an input hatch, and an output bus - at least MV but you can choose.

Later you can upgrade the ore drilling plant so it extracts from more than a 48 block radius. If you don't want to mine that far away, adjust the range with a screwdriver. Each tier of the controller also gives 1 bonus fortune for small ores starting at 4. At tier 3 you'll want to spread the wealth to multiple compressed chests!

The multiblock miners have been upgraded so that they will chunkload the area they dig in. They will NOT chunkload themselves however. They will dig §odown§r in the chunk they're in like normal, and then dig §oup§r one chunk at a time in other chunks within its range.

You need mining pipes in the controller and drilling fluid in the fluid hatch. You can also feed mining pipes into an input bus.

You'll need to make lots of Drilling Fluid. 64 is a tiny amount to get started with! Plan to make thousands of buckets - perhaps onsite, or pumped in via Long Distance Fluid Pipes.

These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain (and meteors!) on any side. And set a waypoint with JourneyMap so you don't forget where you placed it!
data.title: §6§lTime to Drill For Ore!

data.name: Time to Get Some Steel
data.data:
You need steel? Uhh... fine. Let's get busy...

The Bricked Blast Furnace (BBF) can share walls with other ones, just like most GT multiblocks. How will this affect the air quality though...

If you are short on Stone Dust, you can get more by macerating cobblestone.

If you spawn near a biome with Hardened Clay you can macerate it to get the clay dust you need. You can also use brick blocks from Villages to get brick dust in the macerator.

Crafting the Worktable from Forestry can make it easier as you can use all the buckets for crafting in one click.
data.title: §6§lTime to Get Some Steel
data.tooltip:
Time to Get Some Steel
Prequest requests:
Compressing Stuff

data.name: TNT
data.data:
TNT is much more powerful than the powderbarrel but much harder to craft. There are LV and HV ways to craft. At LV you need heavy or light fuel to make some toluene which can be solidified to gelled toluene. Alternatively you can use sugar and plastic dust in a chemical reactor to make toluene more efficiently. Mix it with sulfuric acid to make TNT.

The HV petrol way requires an oil cracking unit to make all kinds of cracked fuel or cracked naphtha and a distillation tower to extract toluene from that.
Though you can also go the wood tar route in mid-MV.
data.title: §6§lTNT

data.name: Too much Indium?
data.data: Milling process is an alternative way to produce Indium, designed for LuV and above. It does not void Aluminium and Galena for no reason, and you can extract Indium from Sphalerite efficiently. In exchange for machine cost and infrastructure needed to process.
data.title: Too much Indium?
data.tooltip:
Too much Indium?
Prequest requests:
What Even is This?

data.name: TPV Coil Upgrade
data.data: To process more advanced materials like Tungstensteel, Enderium and Niobium-Titanium, you will need more than 3600K. Time to upgrade your EBF... again.
data.title: §6§lTPV Coil Upgrade
data.tooltip:
TPV Coil Upgrade
Prequest requests:
EXTREME MIXING
Nichrome Coil Upgrade

data.name: Trinium Coil Upgrade
data.data: To process more advanced materials like neutronium or fluxed electrum you need more than 8100K. Upgrade your EBF to 9001K. (OVER 9000!!!)
data.title: §6§lTrinium Coil Upgrade
data.tooltip:
Trinium Coil Upgrade
Prequest requests:
Naquarite Universal Insulator Foil
Naquadah Coil Upgrade

data.name: UEV Glass
data.data: The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Cosmic Neutronium (10).
data.title: §6§lUEV Glass

data.name: UHV Glass
data.data: The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Neutronium (9).
data.title: §6§lUHV Glass

data.name: UIV Glass
data.data: The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Infinity (11).
data.title: §6§lUIV Glass

data.name: UMV Glass
data.data: The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Transcendent (12).
data.title: §6§lUMV Glass

data.name: Using that Algae
data.data:
So you've created the Chemical Plant, and an Algae Farm, excellent! Time to make some use of it instead of letting it sit there collecting. There's quite a few recipes you can make with Algae, but we'll start with a more simple one.

For this you'll need some Brown Algae and some Green Algae. This means you need at minimum HV machine casings for the bottom of the Algae Farm. HV will produce up to 8 brown algae every 35 seconds, but can at worst case produce 2 in 105 seconds, while EV will produce at best 20 every 30 seconds, and at worst 12 in 90 seconds.

Once you have some Green and Brown Algae, you'll have to put them in a tier 2 Chemical Plant (steel based) with some distilled water, and you'll get back Sulfuric Acid. Cheap to produce once you have it all set up, a bit expensive to get there though! There's another Sulfuric acid recipe you can use as well later on, but it'll cost higher tier Algae and a higher tier Chemical Plant.
data.title: Using that Algae
data.tooltip:
Using that Algae
Prequest requests:
Playing With the Big Boys, Chemically
Algae Pond

data.name: UV Glass
data.data: The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Osmium (8). Make it to allow higher tier recipes in the Bacterial Vat, higher tier Energy Hatches in the MBF, or better Capacitors in your LSC. Or just use it for machine recipes, whatever.
data.title: §6§lUV Glass

data.name: What Even is This?
data.data:
In addition to being a dehydrator multi, it's also a Vacuum Furnace, for which no singleblock exists. It's supposed to be used with the IsaMill Grinding Machine multi and the Flotation Cell Regulator multi for the purposes of ore milling, an advanced method of ore processing that needs a lot of infrastructure, but which gives many new outputs for each ore it supports.

[note]This multi is LuV now![/note]
data.title: What Even is This?

data.name: Why One Coke Oven When You Can Have Ten?
data.data:
Your bricked blast furnace uses coal like hell and your steam boilers do too? Well it's time to make more coke ovens and automate them a bit. Wooden fluid pipes and tin item pipes will help you reach your goal. You can use either faucets with redstone clocks or LV pumps to empty the creosote. For the charcoal, hoppers are easy to get once you have an assembler.

Unlike GregTech multiblocks, coke ovens must have 1 space separating each oven.

Search NEI for a more efficient way to make coke oven bricks.

Remember that tin item pipes require a steel wrench to dismantle them.

The whole coke-oven process generates a lot of pollution, so consider putting it further away.
data.title: §6§lWhy One Coke Oven When You Can Have Ten?
data.tooltip:
Why One Coke Oven When You Can Have Ten?
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #1
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: You Are Not Prepared!!!
data.data:
It's time for something really big: A smeltery! There's a lot to craft, so better gather some resources... or you could go try complete this with the help of some unhappy NPC friends, but that would void your quest rewards.

[note]Note: This quest is mutually exclusive with the other smeltery quest.[/note]
data.title: §f§k§f§l§6§lYou Are Not Prepared!!!
data.tooltip:
You Are Not Prepared!!!
Prequest requests:
Basic Processing
You Are Not Prepared... But They Are

data.name: You Are Not Prepared... But They Are
data.data:
Building a smeltery from the ground up can be really tedious and time consuming. How about borrowing one from the locals? They will surely be happy to share it with an unfriendly adventurer that just dismantled their bricked railway station.

The villagers are so dumb that they spent all their seared bricks without adding a few key components like faucets or drains. You still need to craft some smeltery bricks yourselves...

Totally not useful tip: if you hold off building this long enough, you will be able to break down seared brick blocks into seared brick items with a forge hammer or extractor.

[note]Unfortunately, going down this path means we will not give you quest rewards, since you are already getting this important multiblock for free. Check the checkbox to signify your consent.[/note]
data.title: §f§k§f§l§6§lYou Are Not Prepared... But They Are
data.tooltip:
You Are Not Prepared... But They Are
Prequest requests:
Basic Processing
You Are Not Prepared!!!

data.name: You Are Now Prepared, Hopefully!
data.data:
No matter where you got this smeltery from, you have one now. Time for some casting!

Buy the zinc gravel in the Coins Coins coins tab if you can't find it.

Note: The book says a 3x3 base, but you can make a smeltery with a smaller base. Taller/wider smelteries can do more items at one time, conserving fuel.

[note]The smeltery does not double ores in GTNH. Later machines will help you there.[/note]
data.title: §f§k§f§l§6§lYou Are Now Prepared, Hopefully!
data.tooltip:
You Are Now Prepared, Hopefully!
Prequest requests:
You Are Not Prepared!!!
You Are Not Prepared... But They Are

data.name: Your New Friend
data.data:
It's painful to carry all the tools in your inventory. You can put GT tools and soldering into IC2 Toolbox to save space for inventory.

You can also use it to do maintenance, without taking out tools. Just hold toolbox and right-click the Maintenance Hatch. Now who needs duct tape? You. It is needed to automate maintenance later.
data.title: §6§lYour New Friend

data.name: ZPM Glass
data.data: The next tier of Borosilicate glass is Iridium (7). Make it to allow higher tier recipes in the Bacterial Vat, higher tier Energy Hatches in the MBF, or better Capacitors in your LSC. Or just use it for machine recipes, whatever.
data.title: §6§lZPM Glass
