data.name: 3 Plus 4, Carry the 2...
data.data:
When doing infusions, it's always good to know how close you are in stability. The Arcane Abacus will tell you at a quick glance how stable your infusion altar is, and any asymmetries present.

For now, you can have one in exchange for a few types of common infusion stabilization blocks- but if you need to replace it, it will cost you some circuits!
data.title: 3 Plus 4, Carry the 2...

data.name: A Better Fluid Pipe
data.data: Now that you have lead you can convert your bronze pipes to potin pipes with higher capacities.
data.title: A Better Fluid Pipe
data.tooltip:
A Better Fluid Pipe
Prequest requests:
Lead, Galena, Silver and Cryolite

data.name: Adding More Functions
data.data:
One such improvement is the Advanced Redcrystal.

It allows you to set a threshold with your wand to define how strong a signal needs to be in order to pass through. This can come in handy when checking fill level of tanks or power storage.

[note]One caveat for redstone experts: The Advanced Redcrystal checks the signal strength in the block it is in, not in the previous block like a comparator would.[/note]
data.title: Adding More Functions

data.name: A "Greater" Wand
data.data: While doing all your research and mining of these infused stones, you had an idea how to use the wood of a Greatwood tree to make a new wand. Actually, it turned out to be pretty simple, but you lacked one important thing back then: vis! The vis makes sure the wood doesn't lose its magical conductivity while forming the rod.
data.title: A "Greater" Wand

data.name: Alleviating Warp
data.data:
When you get poisoned or withered a bit of milk solves the problem. Why not create something akin to milk, but for Warp effects?

Briar gives a bit of an answer to that. These two block tall plants, which require good light to grow, will produce Briar Seed Bags when harvested. Those can be combined with sugar and a suitable container in an Arcane Workbench to create Rosehip Syrup.

Rosehip Syrup stacks up to 16 and can be used the same as milk, also removing some (though not all) Warp effects as well as Flux Flue and Flux Phage.

The plant has a strange life cycle where the seed pods will first appear as yellow dots, turn pink as they start to mature, then §odisappear§r, only to return fully matured. Still, if it works, it works.
data.title: Alleviating Warp

data.name: A More Powerful "Scale"
data.data: The naga scales are weak, they can only hold a very limited amount of vis. You need a better, more powerful component to store vis in your wand. You've heard rumors about an evil wizard in the Twilight Forest. Maybe he has... something... that can be used?
data.title: A More Powerful "Scale"

data.name: An Alternative to Torches
data.data: And lava! It's an excellent magical light source. You can use it under your crucible, too! But not your witchery stuff. :(
data.title: An Alternative to Torches
data.tooltip:
An Alternative to Torches
Prequest requests:
Not For Soup

data.name: A New Way to "Farm" Resources
data.data:
While regular plants are mostly used to make food, these magical plants (courtesy of Thaumic Bases) will grow you some good ol' resources!

Specifically, you have the ability to create Redlon (for Redstone), Metalleat (for Iron). Lucrite (for Gold), and Lazullia (for Lapis Lazuli).

There's also the fabled "Rainbow Cacti", which should help those who like to build with various colors...
data.title: A New Way to "Farm" Resources
data.tooltip:
A New Way to "Farm" Resources
Prequest requests:
Enchanted Earth

data.name: A Pechuliar Merchant
data.data:
During your travels, you've heard about a forest filled to the brim with magic. In that forest, there is a rumor about an interesting little fellow who can trade magical artifacts, including infused shards! Supposedly, they scour the world for gems and gold, but are cold to wanderers who have no valuables to their name.

You wonder if you can find this merchant and obtain their wares. If only there was a tool that could help find this... §5§o"Magical Forest"§f§r.

[note]Note: This quest accepts meeting any type of Pech, not just Pech Foragers.[/note]
data.title: A Pechuliar Merchant

data.name: A Portable Barrel?
data.data:
As an upgrade to the barrels, EFR also adds the ever-familiar shulker box! The shulker box allows you to portably tote it's contents. You can find the research for them in the New Horizons tab of the Thaumonomicon.

These have seven additional tiers much like the barrels and chests that give you additional storage space.

You can dye any tier by shapelessly crafting them with a dye, and undye them by shapelessly crafting them alone. They §nwill§r retain their inventory.

[note]There are many ways to obtain shulker shells:
1. Fighting Shulkers in the Twilight Forest Lich & Ghast Queen Towers.
2. Fighting Shulkers from the eggs in the Coins tab
3. Manually crafting the shells[/note]
data.title: §2§lA Portable Barrel?
data.tooltip:
A Portable Barrel?
Prequest requests:
Not For Soup
Welcome to Tier 1, LV
The future is here!

data.name: Ardite and Cobalt Mining
data.data: Ironwood is a much harder and durable material than you imagined at first. Making Tools and Armor gives them unique features. With a pickaxe, you can mine ores up to Cobalt level, meaning you can harvest Ardite and Cobalt without an EBF.
data.title: Ardite and Cobalt Mining

data.name: A Table to Work On
data.data:
Now you need something on which to craft magical items. It probably needs to be a little magical itself. Let's see what the book says.

§3I should probably take this time to read all the stuff in the Thaumonomicon I don't know about while I'm at it, instead of posting on Discord and looking stupid.
data.title: A Table to Work On
data.tooltip:
A Table to Work On
Prequest requests:
Scribing Tool

data.name: Balanced Shards sdrahS decnalaB
data.data: By combining all six primal aspects in a crucible, you are able to make balanced shards. They can be ground up into "Salis Mundus", an absolutely crucial thing to have, trust me!
data.title: Balanced Shards sdrahS decnalaB
data.tooltip:
Balanced Shards sdrahS decnalaB
Prequest requests:
Not For Soup

data.name: Better Screws
data.data: Unfortunately, your aluminium screws don't work with the greatwood rod. Somehow, the wood seems to repel the material. Luckily, you already have a blast furnace, so you can get a better material than aluminium.
data.title: Better Screws

data.name: Blub Blub Blub.....
data.data:
The brewing stand is really important for brewing the various potions like night vision, healing, haste and jump. Toxic potions or splash potions can be created too. You'll also need it to make a brewery.

With your basic wand you can finally create one. The recipes can be found on the GTNH page in the Thaumonomicon.
data.title: Blub Blub Blub.....
data.tooltip:
Blub Blub Blub.....
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Boots Are Made For Walking
data.data:
And swimming. These boots of the traveller will make you a blur as you go around the world. You'll need to research infusion before you can make these.

§3There's also Electric versions with greater discounts on the GAWD tab. ...I swear I didn't put any thought into the acronym of the tab.
data.title: Boots Are Made For Walking
data.tooltip:
Boots Are Made For Walking
Prequest requests:
What Are You, a Seamstress?
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: BRRRRAAAAAAAIIIIIIINNNNNNNSSSSS
data.data: Automagy is a little subtle about what the "smort" mage needs to do next. Make some crystalline brains and scan them to unlock the next stage. You'll want to use the zombie brains you've been collecting from dangerous Furious zombies spawned by Eerie nodes.
data.title: BRRRRAAAAAAAIIIIIIINNNNNNNSSSSS

data.name: Clothes Make the Magical Man or Woman
data.data: The Witching Gadgets Spinning Wheel will unlock a few materials and items. Hopefully without that creep Rumpelstiltskin! Make sure you get the WG Spinning Wheel and not the Witchery version.
data.title: Clothes Make the Magical Man or Woman
data.tooltip:
Clothes Make the Magical Man or Woman
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On
Thaumium Cooking

data.name: Comparing at a Distance
data.data:
Comparators are wonderfully useful devices, but their need to be directly next to whatever they are comparing is quite limiting. If you could do so remotely that would free you from one major constraint.

Remote Comparators allow you to do just that. Sneak-right-click with a crystalline eye to bind the block you want to watch, and place the eye in a remote comparator to start monitoring the block remotely.

Given the extra distance, though the range of the remote comparator is quite limited, you should expect the §otiniest§r amount of signal lag compared to a direct comparator. You're doubtful that is ever going to be a limiting factor, though.
data.title: Comparing at a Distance
data.tooltip:
Comparing at a Distance
Prequest requests:
Not Just For Decoration
Solid, Directional Redstone

data.name: Counting Items
data.data:
The Remote Comparator makes it significantly easier to get comparator signals out of whatever block you want, but looking at your storage chests you can't help but see no reason to bother. So what if they're nearly full? You want to know what they're nearly full §oof§r.

Tally Boxes can be pointed at a container - either directly or, using a Remote Comparator, remotely - and given a Runic Whitelist that specifies conditions where you want a Tally Box to send a redstone signal. Quantity, metadata and NBT matching are options, as is using a basic name filter.

Note that the redstone side is always opposite the reading side, and Remote Comparators must be placed on top of Tally Boxes to work together, meaning redstone is always output on the down face in that case.

[note]Runic Whitelists don't let you use NEI ghost items to set their filters, unfortunately.[/note]
data.title: Counting Items

data.name: Crystal Clusters
data.data: You, as a Thaumaturge, like shiny things. And what could be more shiny than a cluster made of those shards? You totally should get one of each.
data.title: Crystal Clusters
data.tooltip:
Crystal Clusters
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Cursed Earth
data.data:
You can kill the powered-up monsters that spawn on the cursed earth, or just sleep and despawn them. Use a shovel with the silk touch enchantment to dig up the cursed earth blocks. You can use these blocks to make a mob spawner, or place one under a vanilla spawner to let it run even when you're not around.

When setting up a mob spawner in the Nether using Cursed Earth, poor design can cause huge TPS issues.

Make sure the Cursed Earth is not attached to anything from the Nether. For example, you can place it on top of marble, but the marble cannot touch anything in the nether (netherrack, brick, etc.), and must be floating in the air. Also, limit the Cursed Earth to 1 chunk max, with 2 block buffer to the chunk edge, including a wall.
data.title: Cursed Earth

data.name: Division Sigil
data.data:
Find a sigil in a chest? Get one from the Wither? You've heard about a ritual to activate it.

You need an enchantment table, 8 redstone dust, a weapon, and an animal you want to sacrifice. Catching and holding it with a Golden Lasso would be the easiest way. Check in LV for the Golden Lasso quest if you haven't completed it yet.

Place your enchantment table on a grass field and surround it with redstone dust. At midnight, place the animal on or near the table and kill it. You can check with the sigil if it's time yet by right-clicking it on the enchantment table. Of course you also need to have your sigil on you.

Beware! Your actions will have consequences.
data.title: Division Sigil

data.name: Enchanted Earth
data.data: Enchanted Earth makes saplings and seeds planted on it grow faster. When stacked on top of each other it has a chance to add ticks to the block above accumulating all the way to the top. This will randomly speed up growth a bit.
data.title: Enchanted Earth

data.name: Enchanting Table 1.0
data.data: Finally, with your new wand with 50 stored vis you're able to build your own enchantment table. The recipe can be found on the GTNH Tab in the Thaumonomicon.
data.title: Enchanting Table 1.0
data.tooltip:
Enchanting Table 1.0
Prequest requests:
Not Coal
"Stores 50 Vis" Wand
An Alternative to Torches

data.name: Essentia Cooking
data.data:
In order to get essentia, you need to dissolve items. Obviously, you only want to dissolve those items you don't really need, and only those with essentia you need to craft things.

Make sure you keep your furnace as empty as possible. If it fills up with essentia, it can cause a large TPS drop.
data.title: Essentia Cooking
data.tooltip:
Essentia Cooking
Prequest requests:
Not Coal
Thaumium Cooking
Yet Another Brick in the Wall...

data.name: Essentia Filtering
data.data:
This nifty little device will filter essentia out of an Alchemical Crucible or Alchemical Boiler. Once it has received a single unit of any type, it will only accept this type until it is completely empty. You can place more than one on top of an alchemical furnace, and you should. Try to have one per essentia type in the item you're melting on a furnace.

You should lock the type with a Label, or every time it fills again, it's likely to be a different type, and gum up your pipes.
data.title: Essentia Filtering

data.name: Essentia Storage
data.data:
At long last, you have all the tools to smelt items into Essentia, keep it stable, and store it for later use.

The last step was creating Warded Jars, relatively simple creations that keep Essentia in a quasi-liquid state, which makes it easier to keep Essentia from turning into Flux. Unlike phials, which must hold 8 Essentia exactly to keep it stable, Warded Jars can store anywhere from 1 to 64 Essentia.

These Warded Jars are safe to pick up and carry around, which you suspect will not be the case for most objects storing much more Essentia than these jars do. Right-click them with a label to filter that jar to a specific type of Essentia. Use a preset label if the jar is still empty.

Sneak-right-click with an empty hand to remove a label from a jar, or void the Essentia it contains if it doesn't have a label. Voiding Essentia from jars will not generate Flux, because... magic, I guess. It's very convenient, so just politely don't question it too much.
data.title: Essentia Storage

data.name: Everything Fuzzy? Try Some Lenses
data.data: Now that you have Goggles of Revealing, Thaumic Horizons offers various lenses with handy uses. This one will grant night vision. Try out some of the others.
data.title: Everything Fuzzy? Try Some Lenses
data.tooltip:
Everything Fuzzy? Try Some Lenses
Prequest requests:
I Can See Everything
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Fuuuuuu...(sion)!
data.data: Your arcane table does a great job with infusing primal vis into items while crafting. However, you feel that there must be more. What if you could infuse items with all kinds of magic aspects? The possibilities are endless...
data.title: Fuuuuuu...(sion)!
data.tooltip:
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!
Prequest requests:
Essentia Cooking
"Stores 50 Vis" Wand
Yet Another Brick in the Wall...

data.name: Getting Shards
data.data: However you obtained them, you've collected a variety of Infused Shards. Now on how to use them...
data.title: Getting Shards

data.name: Gimme gimme gimme
data.data: The Avarice Pearl is the next object Automagy requires you to interact with in order to unlock the next section. Make an Avarice Pearl, throw some stuff on the ground, and throw Avarice Pearls at them by right-clicking quickly over and over to get a Shattered (ha ha) Pearl to unlock a few more research items.
data.title: Gimme gimme gimme

data.name: Gold-Banded Greatwood Scepter
data.data:
A scepter is crafted from a wand core, a primal charm, three wand caps, a twilight forest monster mob drop, and some screws. Any sort of core or cap may be used, but the caps must match each other. A scepter cannot hold a focus, but holds 150 percent as much vis as a wand with the same core, and gives an additional 10 percent discount for costs, beyond any discounts from its caps or the user's worn equipment.

This is ideal for all your crafting needs and to progress further!

[note]There are multiple ways to get enough vis capacity to craft the scepter. If you are not yet able to make it, maybe first work on Fusion and make yourself some boots with better discounts.[/note]
data.title: Gold-Banded Greatwood Scepter

data.name: Greedy Chest
data.data: The Greedy Chest from Automagy looks to have some interesting uses. It also gates a pretty important device for a magician...
data.title: Greedy Chest
data.tooltip:
Greedy Chest
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Growing Auram
data.data:
One Essentia you might have a hard time gathering is Auram. Maybe you've gotten some from Ethereal Essence, which is dropped by the flying balls of light that rarely show up in the Nether, or some from Nodes. But that is hardly a good supply. The Aurelia plant can resolve this.

When a full moon is visible overhead, Aurelia flowers will open up their petals presumably to feed off of the light. Significant for you is that they will occasionally shed these petals, which can be collected off the ground as a dense source of Auram Essentia.

You should make sure the ground near the flower is level and clear, so you'll be able to collect the petals later. The flower itself is simply planted on grass, not farmland, so no need to have a water source nearby either.

[note]Terra Wart is also a growable source of Auram Essentia. It has a quest in the Fishing, Farming, Cooking quest tab.[/note]
data.title: Growing Auram

data.name: Growing Glowstone the Magical Way
data.data: There are many plants that can provide you with Glowstone Dust. But the best one might just be Glieonia. This magical plant, once matured, can be harvested for two Glowstone Dust directly.
data.title: Growing Glowstone the Magical Way
data.tooltip:
Growing Glowstone the Magical Way
Prequest requests:
Enchanted Earth

data.name: Growing your own Knowledge!
data.data:
Ever thought to yourself "man, why does everything have to use primal aspects so much?" Well now you won't have to worry about that anymore!

Meet the Rosa Mysteria. When the sprout planted on a Crystal Block, it will use that block's essence to grow into an Aspect Shard of the same type! These shards can then be thrown into your Cauldron or Alchemical Furnace, or used as Knowledge Fragments to gain Research Points. Even Mixed Crystals can be used as a catalyst!

[warn]Warning: Planting Rosa Mysteria on Tainted Crystal Blocks will lead to unf§ko§rrs§ke§re§kn §rco§kn§rs§ke§rq§kue§rnc§ke§r§ks.§r[/warn]
data.title: Growing your own Knowledge!

data.name: I Can See Everything
data.data:
With your new wand, you can make Goggles of Revealing. You can now see nodes clearly, more so than with the thaumometer, but all the time! Additionally, the goggles give you a 5 percent vis discount.

Simple lens upgrades will grant you various seeing abilities as well.

Later you can make more advanced goggles and even integrate the goggles into advanced armors.

With TC Node Tracker, it makes remembering nodes trivial. The default key is I. You can select from the list of nodes you have scanned, and an in-world arrow will show you the way. You can also sort the list.
data.title: I Can See Everything
data.tooltip:
I Can See Everything
Prequest requests:
"Stores 50 Vis" Wand

data.name: Improved Armor: Samurai Style
data.data: Time to get some decent armor. With this, those infernal monsters won't be as much of a pain as they are now.
data.title: Improved Armor: Samurai Style

data.name: Improving Your Wand
data.data: Your wand does a great job in storing and releasing vis as you please. However, those iron caps are... §oweak§r. If you don't pay enough attention to it, it might hurt the node. They also make crafting harder. Maybe you should try to improve it with caps made out of a more valuable material. Like... gold, perhaps?
data.title: Improving Your Wand
data.tooltip:
Improving Your Wand
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Infinite Bats! Wait, What??
data.data:
Tired of the constant chirping from the thousands of bats drawn to your world-bending activities? Use this handy device to attract them to a central location where they can be...disposed. The Corporeal Attractor can be configured to attract or repel mobs, and the redstone strength applied divided by two determines the range.

You can use Soul Molds to filter the mobs the Attractor draws in or pushes away. This gives you some idea for automating...
data.title: Infinite Bats! Wait, What??

data.name: Infinite Durability
data.data:
Pipe some liquid Instrumentum into this bad boy and you can repair anything with Vanilla durability!

§b§3[note]Doesn't work on Blood Magic potions, TiC tools, GT tools and tools with charge. Every point of Instrumentum equals eight points of durability.[/note]
data.title: Infinite Durability
data.tooltip:
Infinite Durability
Prequest requests:
What Are You, a Seamstress?
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Infinite... Lava?
data.data: Well, it does need some ignis centi-vis, but hey, it's free. Also, expensive.
data.title: Infinite... Lava?

data.name: Infinite Water!
data.data: The struggle is over. You've finally discovered a way to get infinite amounts of water.
data.title: Infinite Water!

data.name: Infused Stones
data.data:
This whole place here is filled with magic. No matter where you look at, it's just everywhere. You wonder what happens to regular stone if it's exposed to large amounts of magic for such a long time. Maybe it's time to go mining?

There are 3 veins. There's amber and cinnabar in each. They aren't super useful, but make sure to keep hold of some at least.

Even when you find these infused stones, they won't drop the infused shards you desperately need. Rather, you have to process the raw ores themselves. The easiest way to do that is to throw these raw ores in your Forge Hammer.

Later when you have a Sifter, you can sift purified ores for more shards. An autoclave can also turn shard dust into a shard. Maybe there's a magical way to do the same thing?
data.title: Infused Stones

data.name: Iron Capped Greatwood Wand
data.data:
Making a gold capped greatwood wand requires 30 vis, but your old wand's limit is 25. So first create an iron or copper capped greatwood wand reload it with 50 vis and then later on in the next quest create a gold capped greatwood wand.

§3You can always press the NEI 'U' command on the caps, the core, or the boss ingredient to find the correct GT:NH recipe for the wands.
data.title: Iron Capped Greatwood Wand
data.tooltip:
Iron Capped Greatwood Wand
Prequest requests:
A "Greater" Wand
Better Screws
A More Powerful "Scale"

data.name: Ironwood
data.data:
Ironwood is much harder and durable than rubber. Ideal for a soft mallet. Collect some liveroot underground from some roots, macerate it and mix the powder with iron and gold to create a new magical material.

You can make some unique armor with this material.
data.title: Ironwood

data.name: It's Called the Thaumatorium, OK?
data.data: This device will allow automating the crucible. Check the research to the far right of the crucible for details.
data.title: It's Called the Thaumatorium, OK?
data.tooltip:
It's Called the Thaumatorium, OK?
Prequest requests:
Essentia Storage

data.name: Just Tell Me What to Scan Already!
data.data:
Don't want to guess at what has what aspect? Just want to get to work? Then scan this stuff. The first set should be scanned in order. If any of them don't work, try scanning something else first (especially the third set).

Watering Can
Torch
Coal
Grass Block
Trapdoor
Chest
Glass Block
Bleached Bone Block

Soul Sand

Ash Cloud
Any Dye
Wool

Gold

Ender Pearl
Slimeball
Tainted Anything. Try overfilling your cauldron to create flux goo to make the slimes (not in your base)

Obzinite Ingot

Fine Copper Wire

The last 5 aspects might only be obtainable by combining aspects or by creating a node that has them. You can combine:

Cognito + Ordo
Cognito + Vitium
Vacuos + Motus
Lux + Primordium
Humanus + Iter



Note that the above list is for aspects, you may need to scan things like the Nether Portal to unlock certain researches.
data.title: Just Tell Me What to Scan Already!
data.tooltip:
Just Tell Me What to Scan Already!
Prequest requests:
See the Unseen

data.name: Keeping Out the Riff-Raff
data.data:
You're starting to get tired of having to build everything like some kind of fortress just to make sure no unwanted guests come in. Sure, that's just the nature of living in a world where infinite hoards of restless undead haunt every other dark corner, but is having a secure entryway that isn't conveniently door-shaped too much to ask?

Not anymore. Paving Stone of Warding, assuming nothing sits on top of it, will project a two block tall invisible force-field above itself that block non-player mobs from passing through, at least the common riff-raff. As a bonus spiders cannot climb the force-field, so no need for overhangs to keep them out too.

That said, since the force-field cannot tell an arrow fired by you from one fired §oat you§r, mundane objects will still pass through regardless. And the force-field does as much to block line of sight as the term §oinvisible§r would suggest.

Of course, you're not concerned about that part. Being able to shoot things with your crossbow while they can't reach you is very much in §oyour§r favor, all told.
data.title: Keeping Out the Riff-Raff
data.tooltip:
Keeping Out the Riff-Raff
Prequest requests:
Yet Another Brick in the Wall...

data.name: K-Mart Special
data.data: Every point of vis is critical, so make yourself some magical robes to help conserve how much you use. Later you can make even better robes. They don't offer much in protection, so remember to change before going to hunt!
data.title: K-Mart Special
data.tooltip:
K-Mart Special
Prequest requests:
What Are You, a Seamstress?

data.name: Knightmetal
data.data: Knightmetal ingots are loot taken from Goblin Knight Strongholds. They can be made into Diamond-tier armor. You can take Armor Shards dropped by helmet crabs and turn them into Knightmetal ingots.
data.title: Knightmetal

data.name: Lead, Galena, Silver and Cryolite
data.data:
You can't find Lead in the Overworld or the Nether. So it's time to explore the mysterious Twilight Forest a bit and find a Cryolite vein at Y 5-40.

You can get Lead, Silver, Cryolite for Aluminium production and Galena, which is more lead, in the vein.

There is some Silver in small ores in the OW and Nether, but this is a better source.
data.title: Lead, Galena, Silver and Cryolite
data.tooltip:
Lead, Galena, Silver and Cryolite
Prequest requests:
Searching for Answers

data.name: Light It Up!
data.data:
The arcane lamp creates additional light sources which acts like a Torch in a sphere with a radius of 16 blocks centered on it. This will include caves or other areas behind walls. That might be useful...

When attached to the base of an arcane bore, the arcane lamp gains an additional ability: It will light up the tunnel that the bore digs.
data.title: Light It Up!
data.tooltip:
Light It Up!
Prequest requests:
Where'd I Put That Amber?

data.name: Low on Sticks?
data.data: If you stay in the Twilight Forest for more than a few minutes you'll find Canopy Trees. This big tree generates a lot of logs for your Coke ovens and some roots when planted which give sticks. Be careful that no building or chest right beside or above the tree otherwise the tree replaces it. You might find a use for this, to sinfully get above a ceiling you really shouldn't.
data.title: Low on Sticks?

data.name: Magic Feather
data.data:
In order to understand where you are, and where you §owant§r to be, you'll need a map. This is a magical place, so why not a magical map? The main part is a Magic Map Focus.

First, go find some Raven feathers. You can get them by killing Ravens. They like to hang out near the obsidian pillars.

Then you need some Torchberries (found underground) and some Glowstone dust.
data.title: Magic Feather

data.name: Magic Map
data.data:
For the magic map you need the magic map focus and a paper stack, made from a stack of paper.

It will fill in the area near you, and reveal boss locations. You need to kill these to get access to the rest of the Twilight Forest. Start with the Naga.

You can see what to do next in the TF achievement tab. There's also quests for the boss kills on the kill all the things tab. You can only get one map every 24 hours, so be careful with it.

§4Only use the map in the Twilight Forest, using the map in any other dimension will lag the server!
data.title: Magic Map

data.name: More Health
data.data:
No matter how much of a crack shot you become it doesn't help when your twitchy fingers shoot your crossbow before your eyes can notice the tell-tale red lines on one particular type of spider's body. Usually incredible amounts of pain follow...

With your new wand you are able to craft Red Heart Canisters. A total of ten of them can be put in their own dedicated inventory slot, increasing your maximum health by one heart per.

It might not be enough, but if it ends up making the difference between standing upright and standing horizontally in a box, you'll be thankful you made these things.
data.title: More Health

data.name: Need More Sugar?
data.data:
With Briar starting to consume you might also want to increase your sugar production.

Sweeds are planted on grass, not farmland, and will spread to propagate themselves. Once fully matured they can be harvested for sugar as well as sugar cane.
data.title: Need More Sugar?

data.name: Not Coal
data.data: Way better. More than Lignite even. It even speeds up the dissolving of items in an alchemical furnace.
data.title: Not Coal

data.name: Not For Soup
data.data:
At least not for edible soup, but for essentia slurry. Get yourself a cauldron and give it a solid whack with your wand. Place some netherrack 2 blocks under the crucible and set it on fire with some flint and steel. Lastly you need to fill it with water. This one works with pipes, so you can automate that.

Now you can do crucible recipes!

Just don't put in too much or, well, Bad Things will happen.
data.title: Not For Soup

data.name: Not Just For Decoration
data.data: Sure, they look pretty, but they serve a much more important purpose: Channeling vast amounts of vis and essentia. Your first uses will be an infusion setup and an alchemical furnace.
data.title: Not Just For Decoration

data.name: Primal Charm
data.data:
With your new 50 vis wand you are able to make a Scepter which holds up to 75 vis.
First you need some primal charms which cost 50 vis to craft.
data.title: Primal Charm
data.tooltip:
Primal Charm
Prequest requests:
Balanced Shards sdrahS decnalaB
"Stores 50 Vis" Wand

data.name: Primal Shrooms
data.data:
Primal shrooms allow you to refill wands easier before you can move nodes to your base.

Go and find some Vishrooms in a magical forest biome. Try using a Nature's Compass. Or buy some using coins if no biome is close to your location.

1 pumpkin and 4 tiny piles of stone dust are the perfect combo to make these.

Whenever they're fully grown, you can break them to get some vis orbs to drop, just like enemies do. You do need to be holding the wand to collect it though. For these to grow, they will need a certain light level.
data.title: Primal Shrooms

data.name: Pushing Back the Taint
data.data:
So how do you actually destroy tainted land?

These Ethereal Blooms will remove Tainted Lands within a small area around themselves, which in turn kills off any Fibrous Tendrils. They cannot cleanse Tainted Nodes, nor will they necessarily return tainted biomes back to what they were before, but they will provide a barrier.

The Shimmerleaf they are made from have a recipe in an LV Assembling Machine if you're having a hard time finding them around Silverwood trees. There is also an IC2 crop version of them.
data.title: Pushing Back the Taint

data.name: Save the Squids, We Must
data.data:
A very convenient way to make PETA activists happy and get ink at the same time.

Hint: The essentia in those roses might be useful...
data.title: Save the Squids, We Must
data.tooltip:
Save the Squids, We Must
Prequest requests:
Not For Soup

data.name: Scanning Made Easy
data.data:
We get it; The early-game of thaumcraft sucks and you don't want to throw every one of your 1000 items on the ground and scan them. That's why we added 2 cool QoL features which makes this tedious task very quick and easy.

1. You don't actually have to throw the item on the ground. You can scan it directly from your inventory! Simply hover it over the item you want to scan, and after a short duration it will be scanned.

2. You've probably accumulated dozens of double chests full of junk that you don't want to sift through and scan, so there's a second feature now: Scanning entire chests! Simply shift right-click while hovering over a chest with your thaumometer and it'll scan EVERY item inside of the chest. Though be beware, this strong feature requires a bit of research.
[note]To unlock the research, go to your Thaumonomicon, open "Basic Information" (the first tab), and complete this research path: Research -> Research Expertise -> Deconstruction Table -> Container Scanning[/note]
data.title: Scanning Made Easy

data.name: Scribing Tool
data.data:
To unlock research you need a scribing tool and paper. To do the research, you need a scribing tool and the research note you made in the research table, so you should probably make two tools.

Note: Thaumcraft Research Tweaks has reworked the research table GUI. Aspects are now combined with drag & drop between aspects in the GUI. You can also right-click while dragging the aspect instead of dropping; the same works with the hexes. All the new features are described in your Thaumonomicon, make sure to check out the 'Research', 'Research Expertise', 'Research Mastery' and 'Research Duplication' pages.
data.title: Scribing Tool

data.name: Searching for Answers
data.data:
Last night you had a dream. A dimension, so strange and different, almost... magical? Like the saplings you found. You decided to go there and look for answers.

First, place water in a 2x2 grid, with 12 flowers surrounding it. Then toss in a portal crystal to open it up. And no, a diamond is not enough.

§3You should be able to use any vanilla flower.
data.title: Searching for Answers
data.tooltip:
Searching for Answers
Prequest requests:
Welcome to Tier 1, LV
What's That...?

data.name: See the Unseen
data.data: Everything is made of 6 primal aspects. Those aspects can be combined to form compound aspects, but in the end, there are only 6, kinda like the infused shards you found. You noticed that those shards start to vibrate when you bring them next to something that is made of the respective aspect. Maybe you can create a device to actually "scan" items, and reveal their compounds? This could be very useful later on.
data.title: See the Unseen

data.name: Shadow Metal
data.data:
Shadow Metal is an extremely useful metal in the early game. It can be easily made via the crucible and refined once you unlock the vacuum freezer.

It's high durability makes it a fantastic candidate for handheld tools, prospector scanners, turbines, and even wand caps later down the line.

Start off by making 5 ores, and doubling that using a macerator.

[note]Hint: You can find the research early on in the Maleficia section of the Thaumonomicon[/note]
data.title: Shadow Metal
data.tooltip:
Shadow Metal
Prequest requests:
Not For Soup
At the End of...

data.name: Silky Jewel
data.data:
Silky jewels add silk touch to your tinkers tool, making them useful for collecting GT ores intact. You can also use them for other purposes, like obtaining cursed earth or grass blocks if needed.

The recipe can be found on the GTNH page after researching the enchantment table.
data.title: Silky Jewel

data.name: Solid, Directional Redstone
data.data:
Redstone Dust is a wonderful substance, but it has several limitations that only true Minecrafters can handle.

Luckily, with a bit of magic the dust crystallizes and becomes much easier to handle.

Redcrystal can be placed directly against a wall or ceiling, and also allows you to use a wand to toggle whether a given side sends/receives any redstone signals. This allows for nice and compact builds in places regular redstone couldn't even exist in the first place.

Maybe it is possible to improve these redcrystals further to allow them to manipulate or process the signal they're receiving in some way...
data.title: Solid, Directional Redstone

data.name: So Thirsty
data.data: Just listening to this tank gulp water makes me thirsty. If placed next to a water source block, it is a decent water source. It also supports several upgrades to speed and capacity. Try out this glyph near your cows, and get a tank full of milk for all your cheese and butter needs.
data.title: So Thirsty
data.tooltip:
So Thirsty
Prequest requests:
A Table to Work On

data.name: Source of Nickel
data.data:
Your Electric Blast Furnace needs Nickel. Now that you've reached the Twilight Forest, it's time to get some. The Nickel Vein that contains it is located at Y 10-40. In MV, you'll need tons of Nickel for Cupronickel, so stock up.

You can get some Cobalt out of Cobaltite through the side processes such as washing or thermal centrifuging. To electrolyze it, you'll need an MV electrolyzer though. Or you can EBF it after your EBF is done. Remember that the Sulfur Dioxide you get is based on your muffler tier. This is probably easier than searching in the Nether for Cobalt.

§3You can also find small quantities of Pentlandite ore in the Overworld if you care.
data.title: §5§lSource of Nickel

data.name: Steeleaf
data.data: If you locate a labyrinth you may find steeleaf in chests inside. This is the best material for a soft mallet for now, however a unique armor out of steeleaf can be made too.
data.title: Steeleaf

data.name: "Stores 50 Vis" Wand
data.data:
With gold caps you avoid the downsides of iron. So best to upgrade to a Gold Banded Greatwood Wand!

You could also consider making your Greatwood Wand with enchanted cloth caps instead. That gives you an extra 5% discount!

With this Greatwood Wand you are more powerful than ever!

[note]You only need one of the tasks to complete the quest.[/note]
data.title: "Stores 50 Vis" Wand
data.tooltip:
"Stores 50 Vis" Wand
Prequest requests:
Iron Capped Greatwood Wand

data.name: Stuck in the Twilight Forest?
data.data:
If you're in the Twilight Forest and your portal gets broken, you're kinda stuck. Every 24h you're able to exchange some materials to get a new portal crystal to escape.

§3Also consider making an extra yourself and sticking it in a chest on the TF side, just in case.
data.title: Stuck in the Twilight Forest?
data.tooltip:
Stuck in the Twilight Forest?
Prequest requests:
Searching for Answers

data.name: Taint Warnings
data.data:
Now that you have started using Vis in the form of Essentia, a warning about Taint.

Vis in the state of Essentia is unstable if not stored properly. Left alone too long, or emptied out of the Crucible, Essentia will break down. But not into Vis. Rather, it will turn into Flux.

Flux manifests as a liquid or a gas, but is, itself, only a nuisance. Thaumaturges exposed to the stuff can end up getting Flux Flue, a condition which makes it harder to channel Vis, but it is only temporary.

Larger concentrations of Flux will solidify into Thaumic Slimes, bizarre creatures that try to merge with each other to grow larger. They can be dangerous, but are no less susceptible to crossbow bolts than most things.

However, if too much flux is allowed to linger for too long, it will corrupt the land and solidify into tendrils. This is a manifestation of the blight called Taint. Fibrous Tendrils (as well as condensed blocks thereof) spread the Tainted Lands, feeding on the magic it twists. Nodes are especially vulnerable, becoming Tainted themselves if exposed to this twisted magic.

Destroying the tendrils stops the spread, but unless §oall§r are destroyed this is only temporary. A more effective solution is to destroy the Tainted Land itself, as outside this specific biome tendrils quickly starve and die off.

If you are §oexceedingly§r careless with your Crucible you can, in fact, create Tainted Lands. So you would be wise to try wasting as little Essentia as possible, and clean up any you do waste.
data.title: Taint Warnings

data.name: Thauminite Helmet
data.data:
If you improve your Thaumium to Thauminite, you can make this very stylish helmet! Also comes with a very useful 5% vis discount while equipped.

Maybe this new material is useful for wands too?
data.title: Thauminite Helmet

data.name: Thaumium Cooking
data.data: Now it's time to 'cook' your first thaumium ingots. After first researching it, you need iron ingots and praecantatio essentia to make it.

Well, good news. In exchange for some crystal clusters, I will give you one of my old nodes. They're all pale, but they'll still help you out. You may only choose one, so think twice before you make your decision.
data.title: The Choice...

data.name: The Choice: Aer
data.data: In exchange for 6 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain vis...

data.name: The Night's Not Dark Anymore
data.data:
Hardcore darkness is a pain, but now the night will be bright. Or at least, your perception will be that it is, mobs can still spawn! Be careful, the mobs aren't any weaker.

If you want, you can make a longer-lasting potion out of the Potion of Night Vision. Also, you should probably make them in batches of 3 so you don't waste materials.
data.title: The Night's Not Dark Anymore
data.tooltip:
The Night's Not Dark Anymore
Prequest requests:
Blub Blub Blub.....

data.name: This is the End...
data.data: ...of your apprenticeship. You have mastered all 6 primal aspects, you mastered the weak and strong infusion of essentia and vis, and you've already made your adept wand. But be warned, young one. The further you progress, the more darkness, and evil will tempt you to follow the forbidden ways of magic. I have seen things... weather changing, random teleportation, or even a Wither tearing its way into our universe right next to someone. Be careful, my friend...
data.title: This is the End...
data.tooltip:
This is the End...
Prequest requests:
Gold-Banded Greatwood Scepter
Fuuuuuu...(sion)!

data.name: Tome of Knowledge
data.data: All the things you've discovered so far, you need to write them down. But you're lazy, and you have a wand, so why not try a magical way to "write down" your research? You wonder if you could enchant a book with your wand, so that it will keep track of your progress... You should try that on a bookshelf!
data.title: Tome of Knowledge

data.name: Tube Madness
data.data:
So you want to move essentia from your Alchemical furnace to your warded Jars without getting it all gunked up with different essentia types?

Well you came to the right place, with the use of buffered tubes and your handy wand you can move your essentia in tubes to fill all your jars without having to manually break and replace one jar at a time.

To create a simple setup place the buffered tubes in a main line from your Arcane Alembic with tubes coming out of the main buffered tube line. These standard tubes will then go directly into a warded jar. To get the essentia to flow correctly into the buffered tubes, shift-right-click the output side of the buffered tube with your wand until it is red. This will change the band to a red band which will limit the suction of the Essentia.

The Essentia will be forced from the buffered tube to a normal tube then into your Warded jars. Chain your buffered tubes as needed until all your Warded Jars will fit.
§4
Note: This system will get gunked up with essentia if any of your Warded Jars are full!

§rIf you would like more information please check out the guide 'A Thaumaturge Guide to Laying Pipe' by xlstadal for more in-depth Thaumcraft 4 Tube knowledge.

§9§n[url]https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fMvJ5HbeOdy4UgBMe47cggis02idxWoMDgK81SgowEo[/url]§r
data.title: Tube Madness

data.name: Turning Liquids Into Essentia
data.data: What a simple idea. So many people waste tons of buckets just to get aqua from water, or sano from milk. Why didn't they just dissolve the liquid itself? Idiots...
data.title: Turning Liquids Into Essentia

data.name: Understanding Wand Progression
data.data:
More advanced Thaumcraft recipes require larger and larger amounts of vis that your initial wands can't handle. You need to progress bit by bit to increase your capabilities. The progression is two-fold:

First, you need to craft more advanced wands, the Greatwood Wand is next. And secondly, you need to improve your crafting discounts. They reduce the vis cost of crafts and thus also let you craft higher vis recipes.

In your progression you will need to rely on both aspects. Better wands and higher discounts. However, as you progress, there are many different ways on how to proceed. Some ways focus more on discounts, others more on wands. Therefore, the questbook can only give you some general advice.

For example, when making a new wand type, it is always cheapest to first make it with iron caps and then try to improve it afterwards. However, if you are able to obtain enough discounts you can directly make the wand with gold caps or better, skipping the iron capped wand.

But before all these options really open up, let us work on that Greatwood Wand!
data.title: Understanding Wand Progression

data.name: Warp Warnings
data.data:
Thaumcraft offers considerable power from its devices and tools. But power comes with a price.... That price is represented by Warp: A corruption of the character's mind and soul, inflicting progressively more dire effects upon them.

While the effects of warp can range from annoying to deadly, accumulating enough of it can also grant you access to greater power... at the cost of increasing madness, and attention from dark powers. At least, others may call it madness... but is it truly insanity, when the voices in your head grant useful knowledge?

Warp Theory adds a bunch of new Warp Effects to the Player. Be very careful because you don't want to spawn a Wither in your base.

[note]If you're still early on in your thaumcraft journey, Warp shouldn't be something that scares you away from progressing further. You'll only stumble upon dangerous warp effects once you've done a lot of research. If you still wanna play it safe, make sure to avoid research that's labeled with "§d§5Forbidden Knowledge§r" [/note]

5 warp: Message
10 warp: Fake Explosion
15 warp: Coin, Pumpkin
20 warp: Lay Eggs, Spawn Phantoms
25 warp: Fake Creeper, Fake Rain
30 warp: GregTech Fake Sounds, Spawn Bats
35 warp: Blood, Fake Enderman
40 warp: Spawn Friendly Creeper
45 warp: Jump Boost, Nausea
50 warp: Insomnia, Vis Drain, Strange Noise
55 warp: Thunderstorm
60 warp: Spawn Fire Bats
65 warp: Blindness, Poison
70 warp: Livestock Rain
75 warp: Spawn Doppelganger
80 warp: Spawn Endermen, Wither Potion
85 warp: Wind
90 warp: Ender Pearl
95 warp: Blaze Fireball
100 warp: Litmus Paper, Junk, Call from the Deep
110 warp: Obsidian
120 warp: Lightning
125 warp: Inventory Swap
130 warp: Random Teleport
140 warp: Acceleration
150 warp: Fake Wither, Inventory Scramble
160 warp: Countdown Bomb
170 warp: Mushrooms
175 warp: Snow
180 warp: Decay
190 warp: Swamp
200 warp: Spawn Wither
data.title: Warp Warnings

data.name: What Are You, a Seamstress?
data.data: Enchanted Fabric is the key material to fancy robes and wizard's clothing.
data.title: What Are You, a Seamstress?

What Are You, a Seamstress?

data.name: What's That...?
data.data:
You've seen a lot of trees, but there are a few that look really special. You are sure that these trees are much more than just wood to build your home with or used to get charcoal. You're sure that these will be Very Important soon™.

The best place to find them is in a Magical Forest, but if you can't find one, you can try a Garden or Cherry Wood Grove. Or just randomly everywhere.

If you have trouble finding them, you can go to the Coins tab and buy them.
data.title: §9§lWhat's That...?

data.name: Where'd I Put That Amber?
data.data: Every Thaumcraft Infused Stone vein has a bit of amber ore in it. I'm sure you have a bunch by now.
data.title: Where'd I Put That Amber?
data.tooltip:
Where'd I Put That Amber?
Prequest requests:
An Alternative to Torches

data.name: Witchy (Wo)man
data.data:
If you've made the spinning wheel and done the research, you can make these.

The vis discount is very useful both to craft more efficiently and to ease your wand progression. Maybe you should look around for more discounts?
data.title: Witchy (Wo)man
data.tooltip:
Witchy (Wo)man

Clothes Make the Magical Man or Woman
K-Mart Special

data.name: Yet Another Brick in the Wall...
data.data:
A magical one this time. You're on your way to infusion which needs 8 of these. Another 4 will be needed for the alchemical furnace.

§3Yes, you need an MV PLE, deal with it.
data.title: Yet Another Brick in the Wall...
data.tooltip:
Yet Another Brick in the Wall...
Prequest requests:
Not Just For Decoration

data.name: Your First Wand
data.data:
You're sure that this place will give you all the answers you're looking for! To continue, you need something to handle the magic energy called "vis". Guess it's time to craft your first wand.

If you haven't started on defeating the TF bosses yet, you'll need to do so to proceed. All wands require some kind of TF boss drop, with better wands needing later boss's drops. Once you've defeated them once, you can buy a spawn egg (only usable in the TF) or use the trophy+salis mundus to make more of the drop.

§3You should look for wand recipes in NEI. Not all of them are correct in the Thaumonomicon.
data.title: Your First Wand

data.name: A Bloodmage's Sword
data.data: Diamonds and emeralds are limited in their ability to store LP. With this sword, you are able to get the crystallized souls from your enemies. Time to go hunting.
data.title: A Bloodmage's Sword

data.name: Advanced Rituals
data.data: More powerful rituals require dusk runes. With your new dusk chalk, you can enhance your ritual diviner to place those. Allowing you to perform a lot more rituals.
data.title: Advanced Rituals

data.name: Alchemy With Blood
data.data:
Not like "blood alchemy". You probably will need more than one later, but for now one is sufficient.

Place an orb in the slot to start crafting, using LP from your network. You'll need higher tier orbs to craft more complicated items.

If the LP in your network falls to 0 while you're working with this alchemy, you will get a permanent Nausea debuff until it is increased again.
data.title: Alchemy With Blood

Apprentice Orb

Tier 2 slates

data.name: Ascended
data.data: You feel empowered, light, almost like a ghost.
data.title: Ascended

data.name: A true blood-mage
data.data: Bloodmagic is fine, so is Thaumcraft. Why not combine both worlds?
data.title: A true blood-mage

data.name: Basic Rune
data.data:
The Blood Rune is the basic rune that makes up blood altars, expect to make a lot of them.

You need 8 runes for your tier 2 altar. You can make new stuff with your upgraded altar.
data.title: Basic Rune

data.name: Blood Altar Tier 3
data.data:
To make your altar more powerful you need to upgrade it. Add another ring of Blood Runes with a two-high pillar of blood-soaked thaumium blocks at each corner. Top each of the pillars with a block of glowstone.

View the structure preview in NEI or visit [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Blood_Altar[/url] for images on how it should look.
data.title: Blood Altar Tier 3

data.name: Blood Altar Tier 4
data.data: If you want to make tier 4 slates you need a Tier 4 altar. This can be made like the tier 3 altar with pillars out of void-blood-soaked stones four blocks high and a blood brick on top of the pillars.
data.title: Blood Altar Tier 4
data.tooltip:
Blood Altar Tier 4
Prequest requests:
Magican's Orb
Concentrated Darkness
Getting Soul Shards

data.name: Blood Altar Tier 5
data.data: If you want to make tier 5 slates you need a Tier 5 altar. This can be made with 4 beacons. Beacons have thaumcraft recipes and can be found in the thaumcraft book on the GTNH page. The quest is most of the way through adept thaumaturgy.
data.title: Blood Altar Tier 5

data.name: Blood Altar Tier 6
data.data: The highest tier of the blood altar is tier 6. You need pillars of blood-soaked ichorium 7 blocks high and on top the crystal cluster blocks made out of demon soul shards.
data.title: Blood Altar Tier 6

data.name: Blood Letters Pack
data.data: The Blood Letters Pack will damage you by half a heart until you're at half health (accounts for extra health!), and stores 100 LP each time up to 10,000. You can then use it on an altar to deposit the contents so long as it's not currently crafting something.
data.title: Blood Letters Pack

data.name: Bound Armor
data.data: Time to assemble your armor. You need to build the pattern with blocks as you would craft the armor in a crafting table. The soul forge must connect to the structure on at least 2 sides. Then, right-click the forge block with an empty hand to craft the armor piece.
data.title: Bound Armor

data.name: Bound Tools: Axe
data.data: Upon right-clicking while activated, this axe will clear out any wood within a large area. Be warned: This uses a huge amount of LP. You might suffer from sudden death...
data.title: Bound Tools: Axe

data.name: Bound Tools: Pickaxe
data.data:
Mining never was easier. Just right-click with this tool and all the stone is gone! Like all bound tools, this uses a massive amount of LP.

[note]Watch out for falling into lava![/note]
data.title: Bound Tools: Pickaxe

data.name: Bound Tools: Shovel
data.data:
Ever wanted to clear out a large piece of terrain with dirt, gravel and sand? Why not let demons do it? This shovel, imbued with the soul of a demon will unleash the power by your will. But be warned: The demon you're about to summon with this is thirsty, and it costs a lot of LP to make use of it, so make sure your LP pool is full!

[note]Will not dig beneath you.[/note]
data.title: Bound Tools: Shovel

data.name: Complex Spell System
data.data: Unlike the simple spells with foci and paradigm, the complex spell system is incredibly...complex. There are way too many combinations to cover them here, so it's advised to look for the knowledge in other places. However, with the items from this quest, you are able to craft a simple mining spell.
data.title: Complex Spell System

data.name: Convocation of the Damned
data.data:
Time to open a portal to the Demonic Realm. What could possibly go wrong? (It's recommended to do this ritual in a space dimension, as the demon city spreads up to 1000x1000 blocks)

[note]You should also be starting the ritual from the ground rather than in the air for the best results![/note]

Requirements:
- 15M LP (Archmage Blood Orb and >= 13 Runes of the Orb)
- 8 Crystal Belljars (one filled with each of: magicales, potentia, incendium, terrae, tenebrae, sanctus, aether, and aquasalus)
- 1 Sacrifice (Bottle a lesser demon/elemental in a soul vial)
- 1 Master Ritual Stone, 128 Ritual Stones, and 1 Blood Altar
- 1 Awakened Activation Crystal

Steps to the Ritual:
1. Use a Ritual Diviner to place all the Ritual Stones.
2. Place the Belljars atop the 8 pillars surrounding the center.
3. Link the Belljars to the Master Ritual Stone.
4. Place the Blood Altar on top of the Master Ritual Stone.
5. Start the ritual with the Awakened Activation Crystal.
6. The Belljars are drained of their reagents.
7. Kill the lesser demon/elemental with a Dagger of Sacrifice.
8. The Demon Portal is opened.

For more details and images, visit [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Convocation_of_the_Damned[/url]

[warn]The OW is now blacklisted for the portal. Too many people did not follow the recommendation and servers suffered for it. It also does not work well in the Personal Dimension.[/warn]
data.title: Convocation of the Damned
data.tooltip:
Convocation of the Damned
Prequest requests:
Archmage Orb. Let Them Come!
Tier 4 Runes

data.name: Dagger of Sacrifice
data.data: Time to get more blood. Mobs are a good source for more blood. Transform your knife of sacrifice in your tier 2 altar into a dagger of sacrifice.
data.title: Dagger of Sacrifice

data.name: Demon Blood Shards
data.data:
To get Demon Blood Shards, you'll need to summon and kill a demon. To summon one you'll need to arrange the pedestals around the plinth as such:

xpxpx
xxxxx
pxPxp
xxxxx
xpxpx

x=space, p=pedestal, P=plinth

Place a bound master orb on the plinth and the appropriate sacrifices on the pedestals. They must all be the same element. Specifically, Aether, Incendium, Aquasalus, Terrae, Tenebrae, or Sanctus.

After the lightning, the demon will appear. It won't always drop the shard, so prepare multiple sets.
data.title: Demon Blood Shards
data.tooltip:
Demon Blood Shards
Prequest requests:
Master Orb: Getting Close
Blood Altar Tier 4

data.name: Elemental Chalk
data.data: Necessary for rituals. You can technically use these to make the rituals, but just make the diviner.
data.title: Elemental Chalk

data.name: Elemental Chalk II
data.data: Enhanced elemental chalk, to write "darker" runes than you're used to...
data.title: Elemental Chalk II

data.name: Ethereal Chalk
data.data: Top tier chalk, for fancy wall paintings?
data.title: Ethereal Chalk

data.name: Getting Soul Shards
data.data: Enable your sword by shift-right-clicking and slay some enemies! Collect as many shards as possible. You will need a ton of them...
data.title: Getting Soul Shards

data.name: Glass Sacrificial Dagger
data.data:
The Glass Sacrificial Dagger works the same as the normal one, but gives you more LP and can cause you to bleed. The amount you get is randomized.

To get the Glass Shards, break normal Glass while holding Flint.

Unfortunately the glass version of the Dagger of Sacrifice might have some bugs, but other players are saying it works fine. Maybe try it yourself and report any issues.
data.title: Glass Sacrificial Dagger

data.name: High-end Rituals
data.data: The last diviner so far, used for the most powerful rituals.
data.title: High-end Rituals

data.name: How Dark Can You Go?
data.data: Seriously, how dark can one be? You're sure the face in that crystal was nothing but imagination...
data.title: How Dark Can You Go?
data.tooltip:
How Dark Can You Go?
Prequest requests:
It Holds More, Ok?

data.name: Imbued Spell Upgrades
data.data: With these new shards you're able to craft the most powerful spell components. Maybe it's time to upgrade your mining spell?
data.title: Imbued Spell Upgrades

data.name: Imperfect Ritual Stone
data.data: This stone allows you to create simple rituals, such as changing the time to night, or summoning a thunderstorm.
data.title: Imperfect Ritual Stone

data.name: Incense Crucible
data.data:
The forefather of the 1.12.2 Incense Altar.

The bonuses it gives are mostly similar, but the way it works is completely different.
Each incense is meant to be tiered one after another. Currently you can only use §eWood Ash§r and §4Byrrus (Red)§r.

White smoke will come out when there is an incense in the crucible, and the crucible will light up when it finds a player to increase the incense value of.
Once the player has an incense value greater than 0, their sacrificial knife will get super-charged, allowing the player to completely sacrifice all of their hearts but one.

Putting §eWood Ash§r in the crucible will increase the incense value from §90§r to §9400§r.
§4Byrrus§r increases it from §9400§r to §9800§r. It cannot get you from §90§r to §a§9800§r alone.

The LP you get from self-sacrifice will get a boost depending on your §9Incense Value§r.

§dLP§r = §d200LP§r * §cHeartSacrificed§r * §bIncenseModifier§r

§bIncenseModifier§r = §9IncenseValue§r * 0.001
data.title: Incense Crucible

data.name: It Holds More, Ok?
data.data:
But why is it transparent?

[note]Does not actually hold more, doesn't render the blood in it properly, and can't be used in the altar. It does list the amount of blood you have in realtime though, and is used to make the next one.[/note]
data.title: It Holds More, Ok?

data.name: Jeremy Fragrance
data.data:
The peak of all Incenses.

§dPurpura§r will increase your Incense from §92400§r to §93500§r.
data.title: Jeremy Fragrance

data.name: Magican's Orb
data.data: Your tier 3 orb.
data.title: Magican's Orb

data.name: Master Orb: Getting Close
data.data: Your tier 4 orb.
data.title: Master Orb: Getting Close
data.tooltip:
Master Orb: Getting Close

Tier 4 Slates
Just Enough Tungstensteel For Your Rocket

data.name: Micro-Rituals
data.data: Don't want to use all that space for rituals? Use the Soul Compactor to reduce them to a single block!
data.title: Micro-Rituals

data.name: Paradigm
data.data: Paradigms shape your spell.
data.title: Paradigm

data.name: Paying the Highest Price
data.data:
When regular magic just isn't enough, you need something... stronger. Which is paid with blood. Your blood, and maybe others'.

In tier 1 you only need to place the blood altar. Plan for the configuration to grow in size up to 23x23 for a single altar.

Keep in mind that you get less blood, and use more when crafting in GTNH. Plan for pain and frustration too.

The altar has a 10,000L blood tank, plus a 1,000L I/O buffer (you can pump in and out, but the rate is pitifully low at the start). Blood will flow to the I/O buffer until it's full, so be aware of that before your first craft.
data.title: Paying the Highest Price
data.tooltip:
Paying the Highest Price
Prequest requests:
Essentia Cooking
Attuned Stone
Not For Soup
Yet Another Brick in the Wall...

data.name: Poke
data.data:
Time to get some blood. You will have to start with your own...

You get 100LP in the altar for each use.
data.title: §oPoke§r

data.name: Portable Battery...
data.data:
Using this binds it to you (expect to do that a lot), and consumes one heart while depositing 200LP in your 'soul network'. You can draw upon the soul network for anything that needs LP such as Alchemy or Rituals. If you want to automate it, you can put it into your altar for a 1:1 conversion of blood.

The highest tier orb you have bound will be considered the maximum limit to LP in your network, but you'll need to put it into the appropriately tiered altar to keep absorbing blood.
data.title: Portable Battery...
data.tooltip:
Portable Battery...
Prequest requests:
Poke
Getting Ready for Tier 2, MV

data.name: Potion Catalysts
data.data: In order to manipulate potions you need catalysts. You then combine the ingredient you used to get the potion effect in with either a lengthening or power catalyst to increase the duration or the strength of the potion effect.
data.title: Potion Catalysts

data.name: Potion: Flight Mode
data.data: Just to give you an idea what is possible. Let's do a sample potion. Shall we? Get yourself a potion flask, a feather and one of your weak binding agents you made. Combine those in the chemistry set, and you'll get something that you'll probably want to keep for a while.
data.title: Potion: Flight Mode
data.tooltip:
Potion: Flight Mode
Prequest requests:
Potion Catalysts
Special Potion Flasks

data.name: Powerful Armor
data.data: A long way to go, and rather expensive, but a really powerful armor and well worth the effort.
data.title: Powerful Armor

data.name: Powerful Shards
data.data: The demons summoned are rather strong, but their souls contain immense power!
data.title: Powerful Shards

data.name: Refilling Your Potions
data.data: If empty, you don't have to throw the potion away. Just refill it.
data.title: Refilling Your Potions

data.name: Ritual Dismantler
data.data: Use this to quickly dismantle a ritual.
data.title: Ritual Dismantler

data.name: Rituals
data.data:
Time for some rituals. The most basic one you'll probably get first is the ritual of binding.

There are various rituals, some useful, some not. The other ones you're likely to care about are: Serenade of the Nether (if you don't like everburn urns), Ballad of Alchemy (for automating alchemy), Well of Suffering (for automating blood collection), Mark of the Falling Tower (summon a meteor filled with ore), and the endgame Convocation of the Damned.
data.title: Rituals

data.name: Rituals Made Easy
data.data: Now that you have access to elemental chalk, you can get yourself the basic ritual diviner. A convenient way to place simple but yet complex magical rituals. Shift-right-click to cycle between rituals.
data.title: Rituals Made Easy

data.name: Runes Tier 2
data.data:
The speed rune is the only tier 2 rune. The speed rune does what its name implies, provides an additive 25% increase to the processing speed of the blood altar.

HOWEVER, this makes it much more difficult to actually craft anything, so don't use them unless you're sure you can craft the item.
data.title: Runes Tier 2

data.name: Sacrificial Runes
data.data:
Poking your finger might work for simple slates and runes, but getting enough blood for advanced stuff is tedious. With sacrificial runes you are able to increase the blood gain from mobs or yourself.

These increase the blood gain by 12% additively for each rune.
data.title: Sacrificial Runes

data.name: See All the Things
data.data:
It's quite difficult to see how much blood there is in your altar, or your personal blood network. This little device will solve that problem for you. Just a little prick in the finger, and everything will be revealed.

You can also make the sigil of sight when you have the alchemy set too.
data.title: See All the Things

data.name: Simple Alchemical Things
data.data: Alchemy can be weird, and tedious. There are a lot of reagents and even more possible combinations. For now, and in order to get started, you need a couple of basic things.
data.title: Simple Alchemical Things

data.name: Simple, But Powerful Spells
data.data: The simple spell system is rather easy to set up, and can be done early on in your blood magic career.
data.title: Simple, But Powerful Spells
data.tooltip:
Simple, But Powerful Spells
Prequest requests:
Getting Soul Shards

data.name: Smelling Even Better
data.data:
§3Livens§r will increase your Incense from §9800§r to §91500§r.
§aViridis§r will increase it even further from §91500§r to §92400§r.
data.title: Smelling Even Better

data.name: Some Examples
data.data:
There are a LOT of spell combinations to discover, so just use trial and error!

[note]Or the internet.[/note]
data.title: Some Examples

data.name: Special Potion Flasks
data.data: Regular glass phials are unable to hold these special potions you want. You need to imbue them with some blood from your altar.
data.title: Special Potion Flasks
data.tooltip:
Special Potion Flasks
Prequest requests:
Basic Rune
Alchemy With Blood

data.name: Spell Foci
data.data: There are nine basic elements and each has a focus, an item that represents them. You place this focus in your altar next to the spell table in order for your magic to flow through it and the paradigm.
data.title: Spell Foci

data.name: Starter Key
data.data:
You need this to start Rituals. More complex rituals need the Activated version. To use it, bind it to yourself and right-click on the center of the ritual.

[note]The Energy Crystal needs to be fully charged.[/note]
data.title: Starter Key

data.name: Summon the Meteor!
data.data:
The Mark of the Falling Tower is among the most powerful magic you can achieve in GTNH. It allows you to summon a huge meteor full of various GT ores right were you want it. All you need is a particular catalyst item and a good amount of LP. Even better, you sometimes get access to ores before you could get them normally! Check out NEI for all the possible meteors. For example you can start by looking at the uses of a Pufferfish.

The meteor requires at least a singular block to see the sky above the master ritual stone. You can use the alchemical component Terrae to increase the radius of the meteor by 1. Using Orbis Terrae increases the radius by 2.

The meteor deals some damage but it does not deal environmental/block damage. Just be weary if you have villagers or important mobs nearby. The size of the meteor also increases the damage & radius by an enormous amount.

A multiblock miners can mine out the various ores spawned from the meteor, but there are other options too!
data.title: Summon the Meteor!

data.name: Tier 1 Slates
data.data:
The basic slates. Basically just stone with blood infused in it.

You can either pump the blood out, use buckets, or fill cells to get the blood for the cutting machine.
data.title: Tier 1 Slates

data.name: Tier 2 Sigils
data.data: With Reinforced Slates, you can make new sigils.
data.title: Tier 2 Sigils

data.name: Tier 2 slates
data.data: You need MOOORE. Imbue some slates with even more blood.
data.title: Tier 2 slates

data.name: Tier 3 Runes
data.data: The first rune increases the I/O from the altar's buffer by a multiplicative 50% rate, and the second increases your altar's capacity by 3500L. This also increases the size of the I/O buffer, which is always 10% of the altar.
data.title: Tier 3 Runes

data.name: Tier 3 Sigils
data.data: They're actually useful this time.
data.title: Tier 3 Sigils

data.name: Tier 3 Slates
data.data: ...and even more blood.
data.title: Tier 3 Slates

data.name: Tier 4 Runes
data.data:
Runes of Superior Capacity increase the Altar's size by 14% multiplicatively.

Runes of the Orb increase the soul network size by 4% each. You'll need them later on.
data.title: Tier 4 Runes

data.name: Tier 4 Sigils
data.data: Are they useful? Maybe.
data.title: Tier 4 Sigils

data.name: Tier 4 Slates
data.data: Tier 4 slates: Getting close.
data.title: Tier 4 Slates

data.name: Tier 5 Runes
data.data: The final frontier: There are not many runes available. The acceleration rune reduces the tick time until the next buffer I/O interaction. It starts at 20, and is reduced by 1 for each rune, with the minimum being 1.
data.title: Tier 5 Runes
data.tooltip:
Tier 5 Runes
Prequest requests:
Archmage Orb. Let Them Come!

data.name: Tier 5 Sigils
data.data:
They're of seriously questionable utility this time, so why not try to get the blood arsenal ones as well? Collect them all!

PS: You need Lightning Sigils for the Transcendent Orb
data.title: Tier 5 Sigils

data.name: Tier 5 slates
data.data: 1023 Buckets of blood in one slate! How much more I can store, oh I wish I would know. Then I add one and check if it works. 1024 buckets of blood in one slate! ... ...
data.title: Tier 5 slates

data.name: Unlimited LP
data.data:
This orb can hold (almost) unlimited LP. It also constantly refills itself §ofor free§r while it is in your inventory, or in an altar which has some blood in it.

But you still need blood for crafting, OK? (Look into the ritual §oCry of the Eternal Soul§r for a way around this.)
data.title: Unlimited LP
data.tooltip:
Unlimited LP
Prequest requests:
Misc Endgame Goals
How Dark Can You Go?

data.name: Well of Suffering
data.data:
The Well of Suffering damages mobs in a 6 block radius and feeds blood gained from them into an altar that is also within 6 blocks. Each mob costs 2 LP to damage, but give 10LP back. You can use Runes of Sacrifice to increase this. Very useful for automation!

[note]Instead of feeding it live mobs, you can also use the Extreme Entity Crusher (EEC) set to ritual mode for the same effect![/note]
data.title: Well of Suffering

links.source: Just Enough Tungstensteel For Your Rocket
Yet Another Brick in the Wall...

data.name: A Second Reactor?
data.data:
At this point, why not? You should be in a better position to afford it, but there is the issue that t3 fusion unlocks an easier Americium recipe, which lets you craft a second t3 more easily. You might not want to wait that long, maybe you've been smelting a lot of ingots, or using World Accelerators?

Regardless, two Helium Plasma reactors will surely suffice for whatever it is you're doing. Tin Plasma is worth using, of course, but the Molecular Transformer recipe to convert Silver to Tin isn't available in the singleblock anymore, so you might want the easier option, since you're rocking two reactors and all. With the 2x overclock they're still produce millions of EU/t with the right Plasma Turbines, assuming you have them ready.

If you want to continue expanding, you can look at the Mk2 fusion chain that ends at Runite Plasma. This process uses Force Plasma from the Mk1 fusion chain, so it needs those 5 fusion recipes, plus another 5. Despite being an extremely powerful powergen option, it's unlikely you need something in this scale right now. Keep in mind, however, that you might need it in UHV or UEV.
data.title: A Second Reactor?
data.tooltip:
A Second Reactor?
Prequest requests:
Two Million Turbines
Optional Tier 2 Fusion

data.name: Automation for Fluid Nukes
data.data:
If you've looked at the wiki setups, you might have seen some that seem harder to automate than others. Particularly, that one with two kinds of Uranium Rods. More than filling empty slots with Reactor Platings to force all the inputs to move to the specific slots where the rods must go, this one needs each rod to go in a specific slot!

The solution for this is a GT cover. The Robot Arm does the same action of moving items around as the Conveyor, but it moves to specific slots. With this, you can move the Dual Rod to where it needs to be, and the Quad Rods can fill the remaining slots as intended. If you're using other setups, you can use a similar logic to do your automation.
data.title: Automation for Fluid Nukes
data.tooltip:
Automation for Fluid Nukes
Prequest requests:
Fluid Nukes
Fuel Input Automation

data.name: Basis for All Reactors
data.data:
Nuclear energy is first available in EV. However, it comes in all shapes and forms, and it can be hard to choose one kind of setup to use amongst all of those that are available. To start this questbook page, this first quest will be a summary of how nuclear power can be produced, and when it is available. Other quests down the line will have more details about each specific setup, but this is an overview of all of them.

TL;DR: Nuke < Fluid Nuke < Vacuum Nuke < LFTR = THTR = Naq Reactor < Fusion < Compact Fusion for power, per reactor. For breeding, Nuke < LFTR = Naq Reactor < HTGR in terms of breeding speed and outputs, with fusion being required to make some materials.

The first nuclear source you have access to is the Industrialcraft 2 Nuclear Reactor, usually called a nuke. It's a small singleblock that can have additional chambers attached to it to make a multiblock structure, and the amount of chambers decides the amount of space available for the nuke's components. Inside it, fuel rods with radioactive materials generate power, and every other item serves to control the temperature of the reactor and keep it from exploding. It generates EU directly, but it can be upgraded to a fluid nuke, which outputs hot coolant instead, for the Large Heat Exchanger, but with more efficiency. Lastly, there's also the vacuum nuke, which is very similar to regular nukes but it cools down by using Coolant Cells, which wear out and are only reusable by using Vacuum Freezers. Usual fuels for all of these are Thorium, in EV, and Uranium, in IV.

Between IV and LuV, there's another kind of reactor, the Liquid Fluoride Thorium Reactor (LFTR). In this large multi, the Thorium and Uranium are mixed with very hot, molten salts (which need to be prepared in another multi), improving the power generation at the cost of additional processing. It's an expensive setup, but the depleted fuel can be recycled into many more byproducts than usual, especially at LuV, where you can get almost all the noble gases amongst other things, alongside huge amounts of power.

At those same tiers (albeit mostly for LuV and above), there are also two larger multis, the Thorium High Temperature Reactor (THTR) and the High Temperature Gas-cooled Reactor (HTGR). The THTR is mostly for power, needing an input of about 0.5 IV amps and outputting LuV power at a varied amount of amps, whereas the HTGR is a breeder reactor, outputting 1/20 the amount of hot coolant, which is where the power generation comes from, but with much better ratios for breeding into Lutetium and other elements.

Another kind of nuclear reactor is the Good Generators Naquadah Reactor, which coincidentally has recipes to consume Thorium Liquid Fuel and Uranium Liquid Fuel, alongside the several types of Naquadah fuel that exist. With these two, this reactor can process those elements much faster than regular nukes, which is helpful for power and for breeding, but it requires more processing until those fuels are ready to be consumed. Additionally, there are fuel rods for the IC2 nukes that use different Thorium and Uranium fuels, more or less related to these.

From then on, it's fusion power. The infamous GregTech Fusion Reactors work by fusing two elements into a new one, which is often a required step for progression, but they also turn the power they require into exponentially more in the way of plasma. Helium and Tin Plasma are some of the most used for power, and putting them into Plasma Turbines is an excellent source of power for lategame, in ZPM to UEV and so on. There are 4 tiers to the regular Fusion Reactors, but there is also compact fusion and some other kinks to fusion that you might explore later on.

This page will mostly serve to guide you into making a choice between all of these possibilities. It's pretty much guaranteed that you'll use at least 2-3 of these setups, so try to get comfortable with these quest descriptions.
data.title: Basis for All Reactors

data.name: Bismuth Plasma For Soldering
data.data:
Who in their right mind would use a plasma to solder things together? That's mental. Well, all the progression at this point is mental, that's all there is to it.

It's not directly with the plasma, though. It is once again about the Mutated Living Solder, and now its fluid inputs: Tin Plasma and Bismuth Plasma. These are the two main components of the previous solders, and that's the reason they're needed now. Tin Plasma is t2 fusion, and you might have already made a lot of it to generate power, but Bismuth Plasma is t3, with the inputs being Zinc Plasma and Molten Tantalum, which is actually Tritium, Copper and Tantalum in the end.

The recipes are cheap in power, you just have to make sure the inputs are there. Tritium can be centrifuged from Deuterium, which itself can be centrifuged from Hydrogen Gas, and the other two inputs are easy. You will need 18000L of each plasma for 40000L of the solder, or almost half the amount for each.
data.title: Bismuth Plasma For Soldering
data.tooltip:
Bismuth Plasma For Soldering
Prequest requests:
Optional Tier 2 Fusion

data.name: Building the Reactor
data.data:
All the regular Fusion Reactors share the same structure. The tier they belong to is determined by the materials used, which become more expensive for each tier. Tier 1 is LuV, tier 2 is ZPM, tier 3 is UV and there's also a tier 4.
