...and the Lithium one.

[note]Lithium is the one that stores the most EU of the 3 rechargeable batteries.[/note]
data.title: Reusable Battery: Lithium

data.name: Reusable Battery: Sodium
data.data:
Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They're crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

If placed in a machine, it will fill up if there's excess power, and drain if the machine can't get enough. Handy for high-EU machines you don't want to choke.

[note]Sodium is the one that stores the least EU of the 3 rechargeable batteries, but is definitely the easiest to get.[/note]
data.title: Reusable Battery: Sodium

data.name: Safety First
data.data:
For those new to GregTech, here are some tips and warnings about electricity.

Machines don't like being out in the rain, and will start fires nearby. Fires next to a machine have a random chance of an explosion. Also, sending a higher voltage than a machine's tier causes an explosion. Or several, if you pack things together, like many people. Sending more amps than a machine can use doesn't harm anything though.

Sending too high a voltage or too many amps down a cable will cause the cable to burn up and start fires, which may then cause machine explosions. Make sure the number of amps provided by generators and buffers to a cable does not exceed the amps it is capable of carrying.

A generator that supplies 1A can possibly feed multiple machines, if their recipes require less than the full voltage. For example, macerators processing ore only need 2 EU/t, so you could run several from a single 1A generator, as long as the wires aren't too long. Why does that matter? Because there's loss for every amp for every block, listed on the wire/cable. Note that cables are better than wires. But be careful! Sometimes a recipe needs a lot more EU than you expect, like a macerator sand -> quartz dust recipe.

Most machines only use 1A, however there are exceptions, such as the arc furnace, thermal centrifuge, world accelerators, and the UUM machines. Note that machines can accept more amps than they use (usually 2) in order to top up their energy supply, especially if they didn't receive most of the amp because of loss (mostly a problem in LV). The formula is (EU/t of Recipe * 2) / Voltage Tier + 1. Keep this in mind when deciding on cables.

Some machines are specifically there to help you deal with multiple amps, such as battery buffers, transformers, and diodes. Check out the quest tab Storing and Transforming EU for more on those.

If you want to send more amps, use a larger cable or a superconductor (MV+, but ULV and LV have their own lossless cables). You can use laser hatches much later to send even more. There even are wireless options, but not right now.

A single block machine starved of EU will restart progress but not lose the recipe items. A multiblock machine will lose the items.

Note that any block that emits EU has loss when doing so: 2 ^ (tier-1) per amp. So 1 EU at LV, 2 EU at MV, and so on. Using large numbers of battery buffers in a row is thus very wasteful of your power. You have to be careful with losses when making your first EBF later in LV, maybe rather power them directly? Of course, if you want to keep your amps topped up over longer distances, you'll need to place BBs occasionally to 'top up' the amps, though this is less the case the further ingame you get, as the loss becomes less of something to worry about.

If this info isn't enough for you, head on over to [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Electricity[/url] to read more.

If you prefer to learn via video there are also great YouTube resources such as HamCorp's Electricity Guide: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lpDPY8J-4QY[/url]
data.title: §3§lSafety First

data.name: Single Use Battery: Mercury
data.data: Mercury and acid batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.
data.title: Single Use Battery: Mercury

data.name: Single Use Battery: Acid
data.data: Mercury and acid Batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.
data.title: Single Use Battery: Acid
data.tooltip:
Single Use Battery: Acid
Prequest requests:
Battery Alloy
Sulfuric Acid1

data.name: Storage of the Gods
data.data: Who needs a PSS when this bad boy holds over 600,000x as much.
data.title: Storage of the Gods
data.tooltip:
Storage of the Gods
Prequest requests:
UHV Superconductors (2,097,152 EU/t)
UV Field Generator

data.name: Take charge!
data.data:
The Lapotronic Supercapacitor is your best option for massive power storage.

It can have maintenance issues which increase its power loss by 20% more each, so try not to let that slide. Though at most it's still only 2.2%

For the first, smallest one, you'll need the following, plus an Energy Hatch and a Dynamo. Remember that you can get your Lapos back if you run the capacitor through an unpackager. Finally a reason to make one!

You can use Laser Hatches, that can output very high amperage. You need at least UV Glass to use them.

Your LSC can hold between 300 MEU and 25.38 GEU using only the EV capacitors. Remember that you need more than half the blocks to be non-empty capacitors for it to be valid.
data.title: Take charge!

data.name: Transform and...Stay Put Actually
data.data:
Active Transformers will transform power up or down at only a 0.004% power loss, making using several in a row obsolete, if you can afford it. Unfortunately, it's kinda expensive. On the other hand, you can use it to turn your lasers from your laser hatches, which is probably a better use.

It doesn't need a Maintenance Hatch, just the I/O Hatches.
data.title: Transform and...Stay Put Actually
data.tooltip:
Transform and...Stay Put Actually
Prequest requests:
The Beginning of the End Game

data.name: Transformers, Roll Out!
data.data: When you get to HV you'll want to start thinking about centralizing power generation and delivering power over longer distances. An HV to EV transformer will let you send power across your base without too much penalty.
data.title: Transformers, Roll Out!

data.name: Who Cares About a Little Cancer...
data.data:
...when it means you don't have to strip naked to recharge your nanosuit?
The Wireless Charger will keep your armor and tools charged up without having to put them into a battery buffer.

It will charge armor and tools at the tier and below.

You didn't want kids anyways...
data.title: Who Cares About a Little Cancer...
data.tooltip:
Who Cares About a Little Cancer...
Prequest requests:
Carbon Skin
Quantum Eye

data.name: Wireless Power!?
data.data:
Are you sick and tired of having cables all around your base? Are you tired of having to upgrade your cables constantly to handle different amperage amounts? Are you a fan of lightning bolts zapping around your base?

Then this multiblock is for you, the Tesla Tower comes with high amperage output and full TecTech energy hatch support with this powerful multiblock.

To get started you will need to fill the tower with capacitors matching the tier of the Primary Tesla Windings within the capacitor bank. The Tesla Winding determines the tier of power that the tower transfers power at and the amount of capacitors determines the maximum amperage that can be output.

A total of 16 capacitors can be placed into one capacitor bank so you might need many banks depending on your power needs.

Once the tower is constructed click open the controller to configure the maximum transfer distance of the tower to fit the needs of your base. The range setting is currently buggy which means that at least for now you can do so without needing any plasmas. This option is called “Tesla Towers Transfer Radius Setting”.

Now that your tower is all configured how do you get power out of it to your machines? Well I am glad you asked. To get power to the machines of the base you will need to use the Tesla Coil Covers. Place them on the tops of your machines, energy hatches and even transformers to get power flowing from the tower. Energy hatches are a bit picky however and the hatch likes to be facing upwards to receive power.

[warn]Warning! The Tesla Tower will output only one tier of amp such as EV, IV etc. When upgrading the Primary Tesla Windings, please make sure to check that all of your coil covers and transceivers in the base can handle the upgraded power. Failure to do so will result in a machine explosion.[/warn]

[warn]Failure to turn off the controller before adjustment can also cause an explosion.[/warn]
data.title: Wireless Power!?

links.source: A Lead About Lead That Leads to Lead

links.target: Don't Put a Finger in That Socket
Let it flow, let it floww ...

links.source: The Beginning of the End Game

links.target: Who Cares About a Little Cancer...
Who Cares About a Little Cancer...

data.name: A Better Way to Find Items
data.data:
NEI has a built in search feature for finding an item stored in an inventory nearby. A Stockroom Catalog can give you a list of everything stored in your inventories.

Sneak-right-click a block with an inventory (a chest, bookcase, barrel, anything with an inventory) to add that inventory to the list of inventories for the catalog to keep track of.

Sneak-right-click the same block again to remove that block from the list.

A small particle effect will render on any block that has been selected with the catalog when holding the Stockroom Catalog to let you know that block is being tracked.

Right-click to open the GUI and see the list. You can sort the list in ascending or descending order by quantity (Count) or alphabetical order.

You can also see a list of all the inventories that have a particular item and easily add the location of one of those inventories to a stockroom catalog so you can easily find your stuff.

The Stockroom Catalog can also be copied with the typesetting table and printing press.

Click on the title to change it to anything so you can custom label your stockroom catalog.

Click on the small chest icons on the right hand side of each listing to open the inventory list view.

If you want, you can craft a waypoint compass and use that to point you towards the chest. Since we have JourneyMaps and NEI, it's not really necessary.

[warn]The Catalog seems to be a bit broken though and doesn't work well with GT items.[/warn]
data.title: §3§lA Better Way to Find Items
data.tooltip:
A Better Way to Find Items
Prequest requests:
Books

data.name: Accelerated Plant Growth
data.data: As you might've discovered by now, plants grow very slowly. So why don't you try to speed that up a little? A watering can will come in handy.
data.title: §3§lAccelerated Plant Growth

data.name: A Clear View
data.data:
Are you still living in your dirt/cobble hut? How about letting in some sunlight? Grind up some sand and flint and craft some glass dust. Put it in your smeltery and pour it into a casting basin to make clear glass.

[note]Hint: In order to use it for recipes, you have to chisel it.[/note]

[note]PS: The macerator no longer gives tiny piles, just uncraft a normal pile to get tiny ones. You'll appreciate this once you have a mixer in LV.[/note]
data.title: §3§lA Clear View
data.tooltip:
A Clear View
Prequest requests:
The Hell is That?

data.name: Advanced Solar Boilers
data.data:
Once you have some Steam machines, you can make Advanced Solar Boilers. They have more Steam output per second. Otherwise they are the same as Simple Solar Boilers.

Fill it with Water on the bottom side to produce Steam. Unlike the other Boilers, this only outputs Steam on the output port side.

Hint: The Advanced Solar Boiler calcifies and becomes less efficient over time - but it will only drop to 120L/s, not 40L/s, like the Simple Solar Boiler. Later on you can consider using Distilled Water to avoid calcification.

[note]You'll need Silver from the Twilight Forest (LV+) or from small ores for this.[/note]
data.title: §3§lAdvanced Solar Boilers
data.tooltip:
Advanced Solar Boilers
Prequest requests:
Better Than Iron
Time to Get Some Steel
The Power of the Sun

data.name: A Fool Fit for a King
data.data:
Only the craziest fool would use diamonds to make a tool! Or is it crazy like a fox?

§3PS: You can also §oburn them for fuel§r§3 for that extra bit of craziness.
data.title: §3§lA Fool Fit for a King
data.tooltip:
A Fool Fit for a King
Prequest requests:
Ooo, Shiny! (Not Platinum!)

data.name: Another Use for Java, I Mean Lava
data.data:
Now that you have Steel, you can craft a sturdy enough Boiler to handle Lava. Steam is only outputted in the back, and you require Water input on the side and Lava input on the top. But as an added benefit, this Boiler will reward you with Obsidian!

§3Did you know? Over 3 billion machines run on Lava!
data.title: §3§lAnother Use for Java, I Mean Lava
data.tooltip:
Another Use for Java, I Mean Lava
Prequest requests:
Where Can I Put All the Liquids?
Steam Alternatives
Time to Get Some Steel

data.name: A Quite Different Storage
data.data:
Regular chests can fill up rather quickly if you happen to collect mob drops like swords and/or armor. By using a cabinet, you can store up to 270 items of the same type. Also, it doesn't need a dolly - you can break it normally and it will retain contents.

Perfect for storing IC2 crop seeds, Forestry saplings, or bees!
data.title: §3§lA Quite Different Storage

data.name: A Very Important Alloy
data.data:
The most important alloy (until you reach a higher tier) is undoubtedly red alloy. Fortunately, you have an alloy smelter, so grab some redstone and combine it with copper to get yourself a handful of that.

Don't confuse your bronze with your copper or else you'll be scratching your head.
data.title: §3§lA Very Important Alloy
data.tooltip:
A Very Important Alloy
Prequest requests:
More Advanced Alloys

data.name: Barrel Upgrades
data.data: Are your cobblestone or dirt barrels filled to the brim? No problem, upgrade them!
data.title: §3§lBarrel Upgrades
data.tooltip:
Barrel Upgrades
Prequest requests:
Compressing Stuff
Time to Get Some Steel

data.name: Barrel Upgrades Tier 2
data.data: Are your upgraded cobblestone or dirt barrels full again? No problem, upgrade them some more!
data.title: §3§lBarrel Upgrades Tier 2

data.name: Barrel Upgrades Tier 3
data.data: Are your upgraded cobblestone or dirt barrels full again? No problem, upgrade them some more!
data.title: §3§lBarrel Upgrades Tier 3

data.name: Barrel Upgrades Tier 4
data.data: Are your upgraded cobblestone or dirt barrels full again? No problem, upgrade them some more!
data.title: §3§lBarrel Upgrades Tier 4

data.name: Barrel Upgrades Tier 5
data.data: Are your upgraded cobblestone or dirt barrels full again? No problem, upgrade them some more!
data.title: §3§lBarrel Upgrades Tier 5

data.name: Basic Crafting: Machine Hulls
data.data:
All machines need a hull to keep their private parts together. Good news is: They are crafted in the same way for every tier, only the materials change.

§3As noted on the tooltip, you can also use a machine hull to pass EU through, at 1A. This can be useful for a 1A diode on Thermos servers, splitting cables from 4A->1A or in a cleanroom later. You can also pass items or fluids through it.
data.title: §3§lBasic Crafting: Machine Hulls
data.tooltip:
Basic Crafting: Machine Hulls
Prequest requests:
Wired, Weird?!
Better Than Iron

data.name: Basic Crafting: Motors
data.data: Motors are little devices that can turn electrical power into rotational energy. Very useful for all kind of machines, and not that difficult to craft. The pattern is always the same, only the materials change with tiers. For now you can use redstone to magnetize your iron rod. Later on you will build an Electromagnetic Polarizer.
data.title: §3§lBasic Crafting: Motors

data.name: Basic Crafting: Rotors
data.data: Rotors are also crafted using an identical pattern with different materials. A bit annoying to craft at the moment, but you don't need a lot of them anyway.
data.title: §3§lBasic Crafting: Rotors
data.tooltip:
Basic Crafting: Rotors
Prequest requests:
Basic Crafting: Machine Hulls

data.name: Basic > Steam Lootbag Trade
data.data:
Trade three Basic lootbags to get a better one: Steam.

After you've completed the Steam tab and head into LV you will unlock recipes to uptier your lootbags in the assembler, but for now here is a quest to do so! (Repeatable)
data.title: Basic > Steam Lootbag Trade
data.tooltip:
Basic > Steam Lootbag Trade
Prequest requests:
Welcome to Tier 0.5, Steam!

data.name: Better Make that Two!
data.data:
You may need a second anvil!

One would have been for the Forge Hammer and another for general repairing or renaming!
data.title: §3§lBetter Make that Two!

data.name: Better Tank... Iron Tank
data.data:
Storing more than 16 buckets of fluid in one tank? Sure! Just make an iron tank or upgrade the Buildcraft tank.

Diamond tanks carry up to 64 buckets and obsidian ones are blast proof. There's even more past that, but you should probably use GT tanks or large cells instead.
data.title: §3§lBetter Tank... Iron Tank
data.tooltip:
Better Tank... Iron Tank
Prequest requests:
Where Can I Put All the Liquids?

data.name: Better Than Iron
data.data:
But not as good as steel. Mostly, this is used in machine hulls, or in tools if you don't want to use steel up for that.

To make wrought iron, you need a tinkers smelter to melt some iron ingots down and cast nuggets; or use an ingot and a saw to get your nuggets. Now put these in a furnace to get wrought iron nuggets. With the compressor, you can compress the nuggets into ingots.

§3Hint: Crushed or purified iron ore (not a mixed version like pyrite, look for Iron Ore in Chalcopyrite veins) can be smelted to iron nuggets directly. Or you can use an alloy smelter to turn iron ingots into nuggets faster than a smeltery. You can also use a saw to cut up iron ingots into nuggets.

Later on, you can use an arc furnace to make wrought iron ingots directly.
data.title: §3§lBetter Than Iron

data.name: Blastoff!
data.data: It's about time to make some steel. Look in the Multiblock Goals quest tab and build a Bricked Blast Furnace. Return here once you've made at least 8 steel ingots.
data.title: §3§lBlastoff!

data.name: Books
data.data:
Books can be found easily enough in villages or in the roguelike dungeons surface brick house. I'm sure they have a recipe too.

Now glue on the other hand...or should I say horse? Try and get a horse inside a smeltery and feed it hay to keep it alive.

Or you can wait until after you go to the Nether and get some sulfur. Either way.
data.title: §3§lBooks

data.name: Bowl Full of Spaghetti
data.data:
Or at least factories full of item pipes. With these simple item pipes and conveyors you can take items out of one machine and feed them immediately into a second machine.

Later on you can make better item pipes. Search for "item pipe" in NEI for options.

[warn]You'll need a Steel Wrench to remove them. Don't place them down unless you're sure of the location until you have one.[/warn]
data.title: §3§lBowl Full of Spaghetti

data.name: Circuit Boards
data.data: For every circuit you need a circuit board. Craft a coated circuit board and use copper wire to finish it.
data.title: §3§lCircuit Boards

data.name: Compressing Stuff
data.data: This rather simple device does a very important job: compression. Its main function is to press 9 ingots into a block, but it's also useful for a variety of recipes, for example making firm tofu.
data.title: §3§lCompressing Stuff

data.name: Copper Barrel
data.data: The Copper barrel has 45 slots.
data.title: §2§lCopper Barrel

data.name: Cutting a Tree log by log is so Old School
data.data:
By making a lumber axe, you are now able to cut down an entire tree in one hit. Don't forget your backpack when you're cutting a sacred oak down.

Protip: With wooden equivalents of casts, make a lumber axe completely out of netherrack - lower mining speed means less XP needed to level it up. Use the modifier slots to add Reinforced. Once you've leveled it up enough, upgrade the parts for better ones, such as steel, obzinite, or others. The higher-level metals will require an MV Extruder. Keep in mind that the auto-smelt modifier doesn't work, so don't bother with it.

The quest will accept a lumber axe from any material.
data.title: §3§lCutting a Tree log by log is so Old School
data.tooltip:
Cutting a Tree log by log is so Old School
Prequest requests:
Tool Forge

data.name: Extracting Stuff
data.data: As you'll need rubber later to make cables from wires, you should get yourself a steam extractor. You can also use this machine to get more dyes from flowers, or process different fruits into juice.
data.title: §3§lExtracting Stuff

data.name: Extra Modifier
data.data:
If you don't have an extra modifier on your tool you can easily add one. A gold block and a diamond are all you need.

You can add two more modifiers, but you'll need to read the tinkers book yourself to know what to use.
data.title: §3§lExtra Modifier

data.name: Factory Iron Door
data.data:
For your new Factory you need iron doors. Unfortunately, the recipe is really hard, needing steel.

You can choose two more iron doors as reward if you like.
data.title: §3§lFactory Iron Door

data.name: Flaming idiots
data.data:
Blazes are all infernals, and all nasty. Avoid like a plague. Get awesome weapons, awesome armor, and prepare for a fight.

The alternative is to figure out a way to destroy them with technology.

The alternative to the alternative is to figure out a different way to get blaze powder and blaze rods.
data.title: §3§lFlaming idiots

data.name: Flint and Steel
data.data:
After you make steel you are able to craft flint and steel. I guess you'll want to travel to the Nether as soon as possible but be aware; the Nether is a very dangerous place.

Note: The ball of moss gives a tinker's tool self-repair. But if the tool is completely broken, it won't repair it.

Note that the flint and steel can take a few times to work.
data.title: §3§lFlint and Steel

data.name: Gold Barrel
data.data: The Gold barrel has 81 slots.
data.title: §3§lGold Barrel

data.name: GT6-Styled Wires and Cables
data.data:
They work basically the same as pipes, but you need wire cutters (or a soldering iron) instead of a wrench. Additionally, you take damage if they're not insulated (wire) but not if they are (cable).

Hint: If you click one wire or cable on the other it will auto-connect. Cables and pipes can be painted to make sure you do not cross your MV line with your EV line, or dump hot lava into your plastic water pipes. No boom today.

Ha ha just kidding there is always a boom today!
data.title: §3§lGT6-Styled Wires and Cables

data.name: Gypsum
data.data: To make bricks for the blast furnace you need concrete and gypsum. Gypsum can be found in a vein together with basaltic and granitic mineral sand, and fullers earth. Y 50-60 and only in the overworld.
data.title: §3§lGypsum

data.name: Hammer time v2
data.data: Using 6 ingots to craft a hammer seems pretty wasteful, as this tool has durability. How nice would it be to have a machine that does the same but without having durability and using three ingots to make two plates? Guess what, there is one! And you should totally get one.
data.title: §3§lHammer time v2

data.name: Handpicking Crops is So Old School
data.data:
By making a scythe you are now able to clear 3x3 blocks of vegetation, and to harvest 5x5 tiles of crops! The harvesting ability works on most non-magical crops, including IC2 crops! Keep in mind this scythe will harvest IC2 crops even if they are not fully mature.

§6The quest should accept the tool whatever materials you used.
data.title: Handpicking Crops is So Old School
data.tooltip:
Handpicking Crops is So Old School
Prequest requests:
Tool Forge

data.name: Hoppers
data.data: Hoppers come in handy when you want to automate your machines. You can input items via hoppers directly into GT pipes and you don't have to use a conveyor module. However, the input rate is much slower, and the hopper must be beneath its source inventory.
data.title: §3§lHoppers

data.name: How Can I Carry All These Items?
data.data:
After you made your first steel, you are able to craft a small backpack. It has 36 slots, which is a bit more than a small chest. Later you can make it even larger.

You can have at most four of these backpacks in your inventory.

You can put one on your back and set it to automatically pick up stuff. In your controls, check that the command "Open Backpacks" has a key and doesn't have conflicts. The key only works after the backpack is added to the back slot, which can be done by using Shift+.
§r
You can rename your backpack by pressing Shift+RMB when holding it in your hand.
data.title: §3§lHow Can I Carry All These Items?
data.tooltip:
How Can I Carry All These Items?
Prequest requests:
Blastoff!

data.name: How to Make Rubber
data.data:
Making rubber is now more complicated - you need raw rubber and sulfur. Finding a sulfur vein in the Nether seems like a good idea, doesn't it? Found on Y 5-20. Later on you can get sulfur from chemicals like hydrogen sulfide or pyrite.

[warn]Sphalerite will be important later for gallium and zinc. Save it until you can fully process it in LV.[/warn]
data.title: §3§lHow to Make Rubber
data.tooltip:
How to Make Rubber
Prequest requests:
Extracting Stuff
THE NETHER

data.name: How to open your Iron Doors?
data.data:
Your iron doors make your Machine Hall or House more safe. They cannot be opened by hand.

Now let's craft some Pressure Plates and Buttons to open these heavy iron doors.
data.title: §3§lHow to open your Iron Doors?
data.tooltip:
How to open your Iron Doors?
Prequest requests:
Factory Iron Door

data.name: I Ain't Afraid of no Ghost!
data.data:
I've found a use for the Ectoplasm you can collect from spirits of the dead. It makes a very useful glass that you can walk on, but mobs cannot. However, they think they can!

So you can use this to create a moat around your base that drops mobs to the death in various ways, or just to shuttle them off somewhere else. Separate babies from mothers? Use it in a mob farm? Capture pigmen walking into the Overworld from your Nether portal? So many possibilities!
data.title: §3§lI Ain't Afraid of no Ghost!
data.tooltip:
I Ain't Afraid of no Ghost!
Prequest requests:
A Clear View

data.name: I Know His Name!
data.data:
The Name Remover is a simple utility machine that can strip off incorrect or useless NBT data. Only works on GT items?

§3Was more useful before NBT disassembly data was removed, but good riddance I (and basically everyone) say.

Lead is plentiful in the Twilight Forest. Or if you are desperate, small ores can be found in the Nether.
data.title: §3§lI Know His Name!
data.tooltip:
I Know His Name!
Prequest requests:
Better Than Iron
Rubber Sheets1

data.name: Iron Barrel
data.data: The Iron barrel has 54 slots.
data.title: §2§lIron Barrel

data.name: It's a Dirty Job, and You're Going to Do It
data.data: The Plunger is used to clear liquids from pipes. It can also be used on a machine to remove up to 1000mb of fluid from its internal buffer. So you don't have to wrench your machine and re-place it. It can be crafted from a rod of the desired material and rubber sheets.
data.title: §3§lIt's a Dirty Job, and You're Going to Do It
data.tooltip:
It's a Dirty Job, and You're Going to Do It
Prequest requests:
Rubber Sheets1

data.name: Jacques Cousteau
data.data:
Now that you have a Scuba Helmet you can safely explore underwater for long periods of time. You just need some compressed air cells. I'll trade you some Tin ingots for a few compressed air cells.

As your air drops, the helmet will take a compressed air cell and give back an empty cell. Throw these cells into your compressor and you can easily gather clay from beneath rivers. You'll be able to make more cells later once you get an extruder or a plate bender.
data.title: §3§lJacques Cousteau

data.name: Key to Your Heart
data.data: Barrels by default allow locking the barrel to a specific item, even when empty. For drawers however you will need to make the Drawer Key to lock its content types.
data.title: §3§lKey to Your Heart

data.name: Lapis, Lazurite, Sodalite, Calcite
data.data:
In order to make your bricked blast furnace you need to find a lapis vein containing calcite.

You can find the vein in the overworld at Y 20-50.
data.title: §3§lLapis, Lazurite, Sodalite, Calcite

data.name: Lapis? Lucky!
data.data:
Maybe you were lucky and received the luck modifier on your pickaxe. If not, you may still have an unused modifier on your pick so you can add some lapis lazuli. Or you can perhaps add another modifier by adding a diamond and a gold block to your pick and then add some lapis.

You can put the lapis lazuli in more than one slot in the tool station, use blocks to raise the luck level faster, and even use lapis blocks in the crafting station with your tool for maximum luck gain.
data.title: §3§lLapis? Lucky!

data.name: Lit Way to Get Charred
data.data:
The "Charcoal Pile Igniter" is an alternative option for mass-producing charcoal. It does not consume any power or steam, but generates a lot of pollution. Follow the steps below to get it working.

1. Build a brick floor no bigger than 11x11 in size.
2. Place 1-5 layers of logs atop the brick floor. No air gaps allowed.
3. Place the Charcoal Pile Igniter above the top-center log.
4. Surround the remaining logs in dirt or grass.
5. The Charcoal Pile Igniter immediately starts processing
6. After some time, the logs are converted to brittle charcoal blocks.
7. Break the blocks with an axe for the charcoal (Luck/Fortune has NO effect on the drop rates).

If this is your first multiblock, read the extended tooltip (hold shift) for construction requirements, or visit [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Charcoal_Pile_Igniter[/url] for more information and step-by-step images.
data.title: §3§lLit Way to Get Charred
data.tooltip:
Lit Way to Get Charred
Prequest requests:
Better Than Iron
Flint and Steel

data.name: Lucifer's Little Helper
data.data:
With an alloy smelter and some netherrack dust you can make Nether furnaces, which are extremely efficient cooking machines. Very handy for someone needing a lot of stuff furnaced in a jiffy.

In comparison to the Blast Furnace, the only downside to crafting Nether Furnaces is that they cannot be used as a component for the Electric Blast Furnace (EBF) craft later on. Blast Furnaces can. Then again, Nether dust is practically free, so what's the loss? You can always use them to bake stacks of bread!
data.title: §3§lLucifer's Little Helper

data.name: Macerator v1.0!
data.data:
Finally you are able to make a device that will replace your mortar. However, the "no-durability" feature of this device comes with a cost: You need 2 diamonds for the grinding heads.

The macerator will double your ore output. Put ores through it instead of smelting directly.

§3NOTE: Remember, don't block the output port and don't stand behind it.§r
data.title: §3§lMacerator v1.0!
data.tooltip:
Macerator v1.0!

The Hell is That?
Making Better Tools

data.name: Making a List, Checking it Twice
data.data:
As your base grows, you're going to have a dozen different long term goals each with many steps. Build a clipboard to keep track of what you need to do.

[note]Hint: You can put the clipboard on a wall using shift-right-click.[/note]
data.title: §3§lMaking a List, Checking it Twice
data.tooltip:
Making a List, Checking it Twice
Prequest requests:
Compressing Stuff

data.name: Mining Dirt Block by Block is so Old School
data.data:
By making an excavator you are now able to mine dirt in a 3x3 area. You can use iron, steel, or obzinite poured from the Smeltery, it doesn't need to be steel.

Higher tier metals require the MV extruder. Don't destroy your whole garden.

§6The quest should accept the tool whatever materials you used.
data.title: §3§lMining Dirt Block by Block is so Old School
data.tooltip:
Mining Dirt Block by Block is so Old School
Prequest requests:
Tool Forge

data.name: Molds, Molds, Molds
data.data:
After you can make steel and have a tinkers smelter you can make molds. Molds can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes, ingots, gears and more.

[note]PS: The 'shapes' are for the Extruder.[/note]
data.title: §3§lMolds, Molds, Molds

data.name: More Advanced Alloys
data.data:
Your smeltery does a great job mixing metals into alloys, but it's not very efficient, and limited in its complexity. You need something new, so why not put your steam to some use? The Alloy Smelter can make bronze for you directly, using ingots, dusts, or even nuggets. You can make a nugget mold as well to turn ingots into nuggets if you have steel.

It might also come in handy when processing raw rubber. You should keep an eye on recipes to see when machines offer better options to make items...

[note]NOTE: Like all steam machines, the output port is a steam outlet when recipes complete. It must not be blocked. Also, steam is hot, remember? Change the output side by whacking the machine with a wrench. The 3x3 grid will show you which side the output will move to when you whack it.[/note]

You can empty the machine by putting a hopper beneath it.

[warn]WARNING: The Alloy Smelter recipes take a lot of steam.[/warn] Do them one by one until you understand how fast you use steam, and how much you will need buffered. Large pipes are a decent "poor man's" buffer, and the boiler can hold quite a bit of steam, as well as the machine itself. Once you get a little further along, make a larger steam buffer with an iron or steel railcraft tank.
data.title: §3§lMore Advanced Alloys
data.tooltip:
More Advanced Alloys
Prequest requests:
Welcome to Tier 0.5, Steam!

data.name: Moving Your Tanks, Chests, and Barrels
data.data:
Want to move your chests and barrels without spilling all the things (buildcraft™)? No problem! Make a dolly and you can carry your full chests, barrels or storage drawers anywhere you want. But be warned, you will get a slowness debuff so hopefully you don't have to travel very far. You can also move non-portable buildcraft and iron tanks without losing fluids, and worktables without losing stored recipes.

Shift-right-click an empty dolly to collapse it. It won't carry anything until you unfold it, but it will stack and can go in your backpack.

§3PS: Later on you can fly or make a traveller's belt to get around the debuff.§r
data.title: §3§lMoving Your Tanks, Chests, and Barrels
data.tooltip:
Moving Your Tanks, Chests, and Barrels
Prequest requests:
Blastoff!
Wire-Wrap

data.name: Mud, Can Also be Used For Facials
data.data: You may have found plenty of mud piles around the wetlands and thought of them as mere annoyances when jumping in the water or for that armor. Waste not! With your new extractor, you can pull out the clay hidden in the mud!
data.title: §3§lMud, Can Also be Used For Facials
data.tooltip:
Mud, Can Also be Used For Facials
Prequest requests:
Extracting Stuff

data.name: Multiblock Revolution
data.data:
The steam machines you have been using until now have served you well, but there will be a time when you need to process even more items. That's where the so-called multiblocks come in. There's a variety of steam multiblocks available to you - go have a look at the Mass Processing quest tab!

This tab introduces you to a wide range of extremely powerful multiblock machines that can replace your old, worn-out singleblocks (and some that can replace your old multiblocks!). Many of these new machines will require you to handle additional mechanics and requirements, but it will be worth it!

Here are some terms you should be familiar with as you enter the world of multiblocks:

Overclock (OC):
If a machine can handle at least 4 times the voltage that is required for a recipe, it will overclock - causing it to require 4x the EU/t but also run 2x as fast. This can happen multiple times!

Perfect Overclock (Often phrased as "Does not lose efficiency when overclocked):
Some machines conditionally (or unconditionally) perform perfect overclocks: in this case, the machine will require 4x the EU/t, but it will run 4x as fast instead, leading to both increased speed and no net increase in the total EU usage!

Parallel (Often phrased as "Processes x items"):
Machines which parallel act as if they are running multiple of themselves - that is to say, they are able to perform multiple of the same recipe at the same time, using the recipe's EU/t multiplied by the number of parallels. Machines which parallel will [warn]PRIORITIZE[/warn] this behavior over overclocking, which is good for you! Parallels are more efficient.

[note]When working with multiblocks, if power is interrupted during operation, your inputs will be lost forever... careful![/note]
data.title: §3§lMultiblock Revolution

data.name: Nether Quartz? Sharpness!
data.data:
Your sword is too dull? Get some nether quartz to sharpen it.

If you have lots of Certus quartz, 1 piece of Certus is equal to 24 Nether quartz.
data.title: §3§lNether Quartz? Sharpness!

data.name: New Source of Glowstone
data.data: Find some glowflowers in the Nether and plant them in the Overworld. You will never need to go to the Nether and harvest glowstone again.
data.title: §3§lNew Source of Glowstone

data.name: Nice Nether Trees
data.data:
There are a few very useful Nether trees out there which give resources like Redstone, Gunpowder, Bone meal or Fertilizer.

Go and get a few trees like Bloodwood, Fusewood, Darkwood or Ghostwood out of the Nether.

These trees can be planted like normal trees, except for Bloodwood. That has to be planted on a ceiling and will grow down instead of up.
data.title: §3§lNice Nether Trees
data.tooltip:
Nice Nether Trees
Prequest requests:
How to Make Rubber

data.name: Obzinite
data.data:
It's upgrade time again. You could in principle make obzinite by mixing obsidian, steel and zinc in the smeltery. But to get a much better yield, you can show you are a GregTech hero and search NEI for an alternate recipe using dusts. Obzinite pickaxes are able to mine ardite in the Nether.

Leave the rest of your Obzinite as liquid in your smeltery, you'll want it to make the Tool Forge. You need 16 ingots in the smeltery to make 2 Large Plates.
data.title: §3§lObzinite

data.name: One Anvil...
data.data:
With your brand-new Compressor you are able to make some metal blocks for your new anvil. You're required to craft at least one for the Forge Hammer.

§3With the anvil you can repair, rename and enchant armor and tools.§r
data.title: §3§lOne Anvil...

data.name: One Block Mining is so Old School
data.data:
By making a hammer you are now able to mine a shaft of 3x3 blocks. You can use iron, steel, or obzinite poured from the Smeltery, it doesn't need to be steel. Higher tier metals require the MV extruder. You'll need a hammer head, two large plates and a large rod for your hammer. Be careful in the Nether or you could be boiled in lava very quickly.

§6The quest should accept the tool whatever materials you used.
data.title: §3§lOne Block Mining is so Old School
data.tooltip:
One Block Mining is so Old School
Prequest requests:
Tool Forge

data.name: Ooo, Shiny! (Not Platinum!)
data.data: To make your first macerator you need two diamonds, and to enter the Twilight Forest you need one. Finding a diamond vein would help you a lot. Go and look for one at Y 5-20.
data.title: §3§lOoo, Shiny! (Not Platinum!)
data.tooltip:
Ooo, Shiny! (Not Platinum!)
Prequest requests:
The Hell is That?

data.name: Pollution What....?
data.data: If you are running your bricked blast furnace for a long time you will sometimes get headaches, nausea and other weird effects. Yes this is pollution... from making so much steel. If you can collect some rubber sheets, I will trade you a complete hazmat suit.
data.title: §3§lPollution What....?

data.name: Pumping Water
data.data: RC Water Tanks not cutting it through those dry spells? Or maybe you chose a dry biome to set up in? This pump will produce more water for the low cost of something burnable (like all that lignite).
data.title: §3§lPumping Water

data.name: Reinforced X? Unbreakable
data.data:
With your steel tool you are able to mine obsidian. You can make the Reinforcement which gives a reinforced modifier which increases the durability of your tool. Reinforced level X makes a tool unbreakable.

§3PS: In many cases this is not worth it, since the tools don't degrade that fast, it doesn't cost much to repair, and you get better materials (with higher durability) to make them out of reasonably fast. Plus, by the time you got it to unbreakable, you'd be auto-mining everything with a miner anyway. Just use redstone, or maybe luck/silky. However, there are a few very nice use cases like lumber axes and tools for automation setups.
data.title: §3§lReinforced X? Unbreakable
data.tooltip:
Reinforced X? Unbreakable
Prequest requests:
Upgrade of the Upgrade of the...

data.name: Repairing Your Hazmat Suit
data.data:
Be careful when wearing your hazmat suit all the time. The durability is not very high. Even just falling a few blocks will damage the boots quickly.

You can repair your suit long before you can craft a new one in late LV Age, using some rubber sheets and a glue bucket.
data.title: §3§lRepairing Your Hazmat Suit

data.name: Resistor
data.data:
Every basic circuit needs two resistors to work.

There are better versions you can make later.
data.title: §3§lResistor

data.name: Rubber Sheets1
data.data:
Let's make a mold for the rubber sheets. They are mainly used for conveyors and cables.

At this stage, making cables by hand with rubber sheets is faster and cheaper in power than the Alloy Smelter recipe for the cables.

With the sheets, you should be able to craft Piston Boots - a massive upgrade to your mobility. Check out the questline Getting Around to find them.
data.title: §3§lRubber Sheets

data.name: Rubber Soft Mallet
data.data:
Your wooden soft mallet breaks after a few uses. Now you can make a rubber mallet which is much more durable.

§3The best one is made of Steeleaf, followed by Ironwood, both easily attainable once you get access to the Twilight Forest.
data.title: §3§lRubber Soft Mallet

data.name: Safety First
data.data:
For those new to GregTech, here are some tips and warnings about electricity.

Machines don't like being out in the rain, and will start fires nearby. Fires next to a machine have a random chance of an explosion. Also, sending a higher voltage than a machine's tier causes an explosion. Or several, if you pack things together, like many people. Sending more amps than a machine can use doesn't harm anything though.

Sending too high a voltage or too many amps down a cable will cause the cable to burn up and start fires, which may then cause machine explosions. Make sure the number of amps provided by generators and buffers to a cable does not exceed the amps it is capable of carrying.

A generator that supplies 1A can possibly feed multiple machines, if their recipes require less than the full voltage. For example, macerators processing ore only need 2 EU/t, so you could run several from a single 1A generator, as long as the wires aren't too long. Why does that matter? Because there's loss for every amp for every block, listed on the wire/cable. Note that cables are better than wires. But be careful! Sometimes a recipe needs a lot more EU than you expect, like a macerator sand -> quartz dust recipe.

Most machines only use 1A, however there are exceptions, such as the arc furnace, thermal centrifuge, world accelerators, and the UUM machines. Note that machines can accept more amps than they use (usually 2) in order to top up their energy supply, especially if they didn't receive most of the amp because of loss (mostly a problem in LV). The formula is (EU/t of Recipe * 2) / Voltage Tier + 1. Keep this in mind when deciding on cables.

Some machines are specifically there to help you deal with multiple amps, such as battery buffers, transformers, and diodes. Check out the quest tab Storing and Transforming EU for more on those.

If you want to send more amps, use a larger cable or a superconductor (MV+, but ULV and LV have their own lossless cables). You can use laser hatches much later to send even more. There even are wireless options, but not right now.

A single block machine starved of EU will restart progress but not lose the recipe items. A multiblock machine will lose the items.

Note that any block that emits EU has loss when doing so: 2 ^ (tier-1) per amp. So 1 EU at LV, 2 EU at MV, and so on. Using large numbers of battery buffers in a row is thus very wasteful of your power. You have to be careful with losses when making your first EBF later in LV, maybe rather power them directly? Of course, if you want to keep your amps topped up over longer distances, you'll need to place BBs occasionally to 'top up' the amps, though this is less the case the further ingame you get, as the loss becomes less of something to worry about.

If this info isn't enough for you, head on over to [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Electricity[/url] to read more.

If you prefer to learn via video there are also great YouTube resources such as HamCorp's Electricity Guide: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lpDPY8J-4QY[/url]
data.title: §3§lSafety First

data.name: Silver Barrel
data.data: The Silver barrel has 72 slots.
data.title: §3§lSilver Barrel

data.name: Slime Island Journey
data.data:
Rubber trees are not the only source for raw rubber. Go and find a slime island high in the sky. Slime balls and slime leaves give raw rubber too.
Make some slime tree farms beside your rubber farm.

§3Liquid slime is not allowed to be placed down, as it acts as a spawner, and can cause lag.
data.title: §3§lSlime Island Journey

data.name: Steam-a-licious!
data.data:
You've almost made it. One last crafting step is required in order to advance to Tier 1. Keep going!

This Steam Turbine generates electricity from Steam. The power source you've been using is the same, but from this point on you will generate EU, and bring it to your machines via cables, instead of bringing the Steam directly to them. Luckily, electric machines don't need an exhaust port, and they are considerably more efficient than Bronze machines.

At a later point, you will most likely switch from Steam to another fuel, though.
data.title: §3§lSteam-a-licious!
data.tooltip:
Steam-a-licious!
Prequest requests:
Your First Electronic Circuit
Basic Crafting: Motors
Basic Crafting: Rotors

data.name: Steam Alternatives
data.data:
There is more than one way to get steam for your machines. This completely optional questline shows you some alternative methods for producing steam.

§3For the ones that need glass, you'll need to progress a few more quests to see how to do so, though you can also make it now if you know how to use NEI to find the recipe.
data.title: §3§lSteam Alternatives

data.name: Steel Barrel
data.data: The Steel barrel also has 72 slots.
data.title: §3§lSteel Barrel

data.name: Steel Chest?
data.data: While being significantly more expensive than a gold chest, the steel chest has less capacity but it can be used in some specialized crafting recipes.
data.title: §3§lSteel Chest?

data.name: Tame an Ocelot to Get a Friend
data.data:
Once you have the required materials, you will need to find an ocelot to tame.

Ocelots can be found in Jungle Biomes.

If you are having trouble finding an ocelot, you can always summon an ocelot using a spawn egg.

You can tame an ocelot by giving it a raw fish. So add the raw fish to your inventory and select the raw fish in your hotbar.

Just like vanilla Minecraft, a tamed ocelot turns into a cat. The cat will repel creepers.

§3TIP: Make sure you are in a large space when trying to tame the ocelot so that the ocelot has lots of room to move. If you are in a space that is too small, you will not be able to tame the ocelot.

Next, while holding the raw fish, do not move. If you move, you will scare away the ocelot. If you are very still, the ocelot will eventually notice the fish in your hand and begin to walk over to you.
data.title: §3§lTame an Ocelot to Get a Friend
data.tooltip:
Tame an Ocelot to Get a Friend
Prequest requests:
Wiremill v0.2 Alpha

data.name: The Cool Guy
data.data: Feeling lonely? Located far away from a snow biome? Craft a Snow Golem, and perhaps challenge him to a snow ball fight.
data.title: §3§lThe Cool Guy

data.name: The future is here!
data.data: EFR adds with it vanilla Barrels (not to be confused with JABBA barrels). These are essentially like chests, but they can be placed next to each other and opened with a block above them. And you can upgrade them! Great for those compact machine setups.
data.title: §2§lThe future is here!

data.name: The GT Tank, ULV Version
data.data:
This is the first GT-type tank. It stores 32 buckets or 32,000L, and can be used to I/O cells. The ULV Tank from GT++ needs steel plates, iron plates, tin plates, a clay pipe, and a water bucket.

GT tanks do not auto-output. If you want to move fluids out of the tank, use a GT pump, conduit, or something similar.
data.title: §3§lThe GT Tank, ULV Version

data.name: The Hell is That?
data.data:
In order to get more machines, you'll need pistons. But not those amateurish ones, you need special ones, and I shall guide you in the making of them.

§3PS: Infernals can drop them, though you won't get credit for the quest that way.
data.title: §3§lThe Hell is That?
data.tooltip:
The Hell is That?
Prequest requests:
Wiremill v0.2 Alpha

data.name: The Iron Guy
data.data:
Do you feel lonely? Need some extra protection in your base? Want to keep the pigmen off your back in the Nether? Craft some Iron Golems and the monster problem inside your base will be gone.

They can do good amounts of damage and aggro enemies like the pigmen away from you. They can even take care of that pesky Vampire Pigman.
data.title: §3§lThe Iron Guy

data.name: THE NETHER
data.data:
Now more dangerous with extra hardcore infernal mobs. Have fun and take care. Remember that the flint and steel can take a few times to work, but there are other ways to make fire ...

Be sure to bring a tough companion along to keep you alive. If you have no friends, why not make an Iron Golem and push it through first, or bring the materials for more along with you?

Also, §lwhen§r you die here, not if, your graves will spawn skeletons because of the darkness. Make sure you light up areas where you might die, and when recovering graves light up the area §lfirst§r so that you don't end up dying over and over and making a mess.

Watch out for some mobs! They'll take minimal damage from any weapon that is not their weakness. So if you seem to not be doing much damage, you probably aren't! Think about other options to hurt/kill the monster.
data.title: §3§lTHE NETHER

data.name: The one book to rule them all
data.data:
This Tome can store multiple documentation books from other mods. It will be empty when crafted, but you can add books by combining it with the desired book in a crafting grid.

Right-clicking with the Tome in hand will open an interface showing all the added books; clicking on a book will transform the tome into the selected book. To revert it back to the Tome, left-click while sneaking.

To retrieve a stored book, transform the Tome into the desired book and throw it away while sneaking - this will drop the selected book and leave the tome in your inventory.

[warn]Some warnings:

The extended version of the Book of Biomes from Witchery is not compatible with this tome.

You should not throw it through the Botania portal. The elves might steal your Tome and return only their own copy of the Lexica Botania.[/warn]
data.title: §3§lThe one book to rule them all
data.tooltip:
The one book to rule them all
Prequest requests:
Books
Tanned Leather

data.name: The Power of the Sun
data.data:
The sun has quite a bit of power, so why not use it to produce Steam?

Fill it with Water on the bottom side to produce Steam. Unlike the other Boilers, this only outputs Steam on the output port side.

You need Silver from small ores to craft Solar Boilers. Later in LV you can get much more in the Twilight Forest.

§3Hint: The Simple Solar Boiler calcifies and becomes less efficient over time, dropping down to a minimum of 40L/s. Later on you can consider using Distilled Water to avoid calcification.
data.title: §3§lThe Power of the Sun
data.tooltip:
The Power of the Sun

A Clear View

data.data: Good news! You are now able to advance to the next tier! Bad news: You still have to craft a lot of things before you can begin. Fear not mortal, I shall guide you!

Time For Some Logic

data.name: Tool Forge
data.data:
After getting obzinite, it's time to craft a tool forge for making bigger (and better) Tinkers tools.

§Y§3You do not have to use iron to create the forge; you can also use other materials like tin or copper, among others.
data.title: §3§lTool Forge

data.name: Too Much Junk??
data.data: Impossible! But if you really want to get rid of excess items, make yourself a trashcan. If you want to be really fancy, you can use a hopper with a lever next to it to make sure you only throw away items you really want. I mean, §lI've§r never thrown away a tool accidentally, nope, never me.
data.title: §3§lToo Much Junk??

data.data: An updated version of the steam compressor. Uses the same total amount of steam as its predecessor but does the job twice as fast.

data.name: Upgrade: High Speed Alloys
data.data:
Like most machines, there is a more advanced version of the alloy smelter. It uses the same total amount of steam as its predecessor but does the job twice as fast.

Keep in mind that it uses quite a lot of steam, so you better have enough of it in boilers, pipes, or tanks.

Upgrade: High Speed Alloys

data.name: Upgrade of the Upgrade of the...
data.data:
It's upgrade time. Unlock redstone and obsidian level for your different tools.

Remember, a fresh tool head starts at one level below. So you'll need to use it enough to level it up before you can mine at the proper level. Go strip-mine a mountain or something.
data.title: §3§lUpgrade of the Upgrade of the...

Upgrade of the Upgrade of the...

data.data: Drawer upgrades are different from barrel upgrades. First you need to make the upgrade template.
data.title: §3§lUpgrading Drawers

data.name: Using Steam to Cook Things
data.data: A rather slow process, but it's more efficient than using a regular furnace.
data.title: §3§lUsing Steam to Cook Things
data.tooltip:
Using Steam to Cook Things

Welcome to Tier 0.5, Steam!

data.name: Welcome to Forestry
data.data: Want to make some automated farms or work with tree or bee breeding? Want the Forestry Worktable for easier recipe access? Then this is the right chapter for you. You'll need a bookshelf to unlock it, better rev up that compressor.
data.title: §3§lWelcome to Forestry

data.name: Welcome to Tier 0.5, Steam!
data.data:
Welcome, and well done so far! This tier is all about your first machines, getting more stuff from your ores and making bronze ingots in a more efficient manner.

For water, check out the Water Siding Tank multiblock in the Multiblock goals tab.

To connect up your boilers, be sure to provide water from the bottom, they'll accept only water from this side, so no risk of melting your pipe. Wooden pipes are fine for this. Make sure you never run out of water - [warn]adding water to a dry hot boiler will cause it to explode![/warn]

Steam will come out from the sides. Remember, steam is hot! It will destroy wooden pipes. And it can burn you if you walk on bronze pipes full of steam. Cover them with wooden planks or paper. Or just don't walk on/next to them.

And no, you can't automate it. Make an electric one if you want to do that.
data.title: §3§lWelcome to Tier 0.5, Steam!
data.tooltip:
Welcome to Tier 0.5, Steam!
Prequest requests:
You Shall Proceed

data.name: What Engineer Doesn't Want a Portable Workbench?
data.data:
This backpack sacrifices some space to give you a portable crafting table. You have to put the items you want to craft inside the backpack. Because of this, you can use it to quickly craft large amounts of items at once.

You can also use the Forestry Worktable with its larger inventory to do the same. Once you reach MV, you can switch to an Adventure Backpack that includes a pair of tanks for storing fluids if you want.
data.title: §3§lWhat Engineer Doesn't Want a Portable Workbench?
data.tooltip:
What Engineer Doesn't Want a Portable Workbench?
Prequest requests:
How Can I Carry All These Items?

data.name: Where Can I Put All the Liquids?
data.data:
With your brand new alloy smelter you are able to combine two materials. What happens if you mix some obsidian dust and thickened glass? Obsidian glass, great. Your first tank that you can make would be a Buildcraft tank. This tank can carry up 16 buckets of a single fluid. It's possible to upgrade those tanks so they can hold up to 64 buckets.
You can also stack the tanks to increase capacity.
data.title: §3§lWhere Can I Put All the Liquids?
data.tooltip:
Where Can I Put All the Liquids?
Prequest requests:
A Clear View

data.name: Wired, Weird?!
data.data: Two of the very basic materials for machines are wires and cables. For cables you can either use a rubber sheet in the crafting table or use rubber bars in the alloy smelter. Not very efficient, but there will be a better way later.
data.title: §3§lWired, Weird?!

data.name: Wiremill v0.2 Alpha
data.data: Small gears require a wire cutter to be made, so let's craft one.
data.title: §3§lWiremill v0.2 Alpha
data.tooltip:
Wiremill v0.2 Alpha
Prequest requests:
A Very Important Alloy

data.name: Wire-Wrap
data.data: Placing wires without insulation seems to be a bad idea. Now that you have an extractor to extract raw rubber out of sticky resin and an alloy smelter to further process it using sulfur, you should work on getting some insulating rubber bars.
data.title: §3§lWire-Wrap

data.name: Wooden Bolts
data.data:
Your crossbow need some ammo to shoot with. Let's craft some wooden bolts. For now, you can put either iron, obzinite, or steel on the tip of your bolts using the Smeltery. For higher tier bolts and tips you will need to pump metals into a Fluid Solidifier with the correct tool rod inserted.

[warn]For upgrades:[/warn]
[note]Nether Quartz - More damage
Moss - Self-Repair (unlock in GTNH Thaumcraft tab)[/note]
data.title: §3§lWooden Bolts

data.name: Wooden Crossbow
data.data:
Now you are able to make a better long range weapon - a crossbow. Use wood for the crossbow limb and the body and use obsidian (Reinforced III) for the tough binding. Normal strings for the bowstrings would be enough for now.

Assemble the bow yourself on your tool forge.

[warn]For upgrades:[/warn]
[note]Redstone - Speed on the draw
Lapis - Fortune on kills
Moss - Self-repair[/note]

§6NOTE: Some mobs require damage from specific tools. IF YOU ARE SHOOTING AT SOMETHING AND IT IS NOT GETTING HURT, *RUN*. And then figure out what weapon might be best to kill it.
data.title: §3§lWooden Crossbow

data.name: Working Table 2.0
data.data:
A manual crafting table which remembers the last nine used recipes. Left-click one of the recipes shown in the right-hand side to automatically fill in the crafting grid. Right-click to lock a memorized recipe and prevent a newer recipe from bumping it off.

Resources need to go into the internal inventory. The crafting matrix is only a visual representation.

The Forestry worktable is super-useful, and can reduce the tedium of many common jobs because you can click-drag across a row of items, and it will use tools in its own inventory to continue crafting.

Specifically:
Making with - Put all the ingredients into the table, and if the recipe is selected, shift-click the result to craft them all at once (until you run out)
Making fresh water for Pam's - Same as above, but no second item
Making clay bricks - The wooden form is automatically reused
Making anything that uses a tool - Also automatically reused, while consuming durability

[warn]Warning: Stored recipes will be lost if the worktable is broken! To avoid this, move it using a dolly.[/warn]

[note]For more forestry quests you need to go to the dedicated tab.[/note]
data.title: Working Table 2.0

data.name: Your First Electronic Circuit
data.data: Steam machines are quite stupid, they just do one thing over and over again. As you advance into the electrical age, you've decided that you want the machines to have more features, like automatic output in order to create some automation. For that, you need electronic circuits.
data.title: §3§lYour First Electronic Circuit
data.tooltip:
Your First Electronic Circuit
Prequest requests:
Time For Some Logic
Circuit Boards
Resistor

data.name: Your Mom Says to Upgrade Your Drawers
data.data:
There are many tiers of upgrades for storage drawers. Make some iron and gold tier upgrades and I'll give you some of the special purpose upgrades to experiment with in your base. Check NEI for more options such as Obsidian, Emerald, and Diamond upgrades.

[warn]To remove upgrades, shift-right-click with an empty hand to access the drawer interface.[/warn]
data.title: §3§lYour Mom Says to Upgrade Your Drawers
data.tooltip:
Your Mom Says to Upgrade Your Drawers
Prequest requests:
Upgrading Drawers

A Fool Fit for a King

links.source: Where Can I Put All the Liquids?
links.target: Another Use for Java, I Mean Lava
Another Use for Java, I Mean Lava
Another Use for Java, I Mean Lava

Making a List, Checking it Twice

Moving Your Tanks, Chests, and Barrels
Mud, Can Also be Used For Facials
One Block Mining is so Old School
