Tier 11 (UIV)

data.name: Haha, Spinny Ingot
data.data:
Transcendent Metal is the primary metal used in UIV components.

This metal is a bit different from the ones you have been processing so far. You need to macerate your tesseracts to get the dust and then blast it at such high temperatures that you'll need a coolant to help manage the heat.

Due to the impossible nature of the tesseract particles, you'll need a medium to enable them to form 3D shapes. Tungsten, for some reason, works very well for this purpose.

The ingot itself is also not very stable; therefore, a coating of titansteel must be applied during the cooling process.

[note]Consider passively generating it. This process is slow.[/note]
data.title: Haha, Spinny Ingot

data.name: Helioflux Melting Core my Beloved
data.data:
As usage of the Forge continues, more data on graviton shards is gathered. It has been found that they can stabilize the outputs of the Forge, allowing for the direct extraction of molten material while it is still close to the heart of the star.

[note]The second module of the Godforge, Helioflux Melting Core allows processing EBF recipes by directly outputting molten metal when possible. This may not always be as efficient as other methods, but the time and scaling saved from Vacuum Freezer steps often more than makes up for this.[/note]

[note]Usage of this module requires the FDIM upgrade.[/note]

[warn]Helioflux Melting Core <3[/warn]
data.title: §b§lHelioflux Melting Core my Beloved
data.tooltip:
Helioflux Melting Core my Beloved
Prequest requests:
An Even More Mega EBF
Project Godforge
No, it's not a Typo

data.name: Heliofusion Exoticizer
data.data:
Using large quantities of graviton shards creates regions of space so extreme that exotic forms of matter can exist with far greater stability than usual. Unfortunately, this region is so extreme that it is essentially spatially disconnected from the rest of the Forge, unable to utilize existing upgrades to the structure and its other modules.

[note]The fourth and final module of the Godforge, Heliofusion Exoticizer allows for the production of Quark Gluon Plasma and Magmatter. Initially only Quark Gluon Plasma is possible, with Magmatter requiring a much later upgrade. Consult the Godforge Information section of the UI to read how to produce these materials.[/note]

[note]Usage of this module requires the QGPIU upgrade.[/note]
data.title: §b§lHeliofusion Exoticizer

data.name: Heliothermal Plasma Fabricator
data.data:
As understanding of graviton shards continues to improve, better control over the materials they manipulate can be achieved. Graviton shards provide an alternative to electromagnetic containment of plasma using spacetime manipulation instead, allowing the Forge to directly output processed materials as plasma.

[note]The third module of the Godforge, Heliothermal Plasma Fabricator can directly convert materials into their plasma form, at the cost of an immense amount of power. This may not be ideal for every plasma, but can save a lot of time on particularly slow ones. Additionally, later upgrades allow the creation of exotic plasmas which cannot be created through other means.[/note]

[note]Usage of this module requires the GPCI upgrade.[/note]
data.title: §b§lHeliothermal Plasma Fabricator
data.tooltip:
Heliothermal Plasma Fabricator
Prequest requests:
Project Godforge
Helioflux Melting Core my Beloved

data.name: Hypogen Coil Upgrade
data.data:
Forged from the blood of an ageless dragon, and melded together by the power of fusion beyond what you thought was the reality. No natural element, or combination of elements, could match up to this glowing orange material, not even the Awakened Draconium you got your hands on before.

What truly happened inside that Mk4 Fusion Reactor? What §ois§o§r this material? Its dust pulsates visibly, at different rates depending on the size of the dust itself. Hypogen approaches a state of complete balance as it approaches the block size, and it is obvious to you what needs to be done with it.

It absorbs and radiates energy without any effort, but it would be stupid to attempt making coils out of this without assistance. Wetware wasn't good enough anymore, and only the most advanced living circuit could withstand the erratic behavior Hypogen demonstrates.

Provides 12601K heat. Almost certainly, this will end up on your DTPF.

data.tooltip:

data.name: Nano Forge Tier 3
data.data:
Neutronium nanites are slow moving, but that allowed them to have a complex nanite network. If there was a material that could move itself it could allow for an even more complex nanite with great speeds... Thankfully with the DTPF fully functional we can make it, transcendent metal.

[note]Same thing as the neutronium nanite, but this nanite allows for tier 3 nanites to be made in the nano forge.[/note]

data.name: No, it's not a Typo
data.data:
Stabilizing the neutron star of the Godforge was successful, but now you need something new to extract the power out of it into something usable. Your experiments lead you to using the newly discovered Mellion with a Transcendent Metal Nanite to create what seems like a crystal seed of some type, which exhibits perfect thermal conductance.

Processing this seed further into a solution, you realize you can grow this crystal into a slurry-like solution, which you decide to name [note]Phonon Transfer Medium[/note]. This incredible material displays exactly the properties you were looking for, and decide that now you can move forward with the second module of the Godforge.

data.name: PCB Factory Tier 3
data.data:
Why use a small nozzle to print out the conductor on the board when one can just build it using nanites? Well the silver nanite isn't rigid enough for that so a new nanite will be needed... and so will new casings. Heard that celestial tungsten is a good candidate for a frame. Quantum can be used for the protection as these nanites will be forever flying around inside.

The structure will need to change as it needs to be a bit bigger and taller.

[note]Works the same as the Tier 2 in most cases, but allows the player to use even less resources by using a gold nanite.[/note]

data.name: Power in the Ether
data.data:
These new hatches allow you to wirelessly send, store and receive energy from any location in any dimension. They can be placed in any existing multi block structure and will function as normal energy/dynamo hatches. A dynamo hatch will consume EU and store it in a global network linked to your user. The wireless network can store a total of 2^(2^31) EU, far exceeding even a max tier LSC.

You can share a wireless network with others by adding them to your network with /gt global_energy_join user1 user2. This will make user1 use user2's energy when interacting with the global network. You can leave a network at any time by doing /gt global_energy_join your_name your_name.

You cannot connect wires to these blocks. These are also designed to be highly lag efficient, meaning EU is added at large intervals to prevent needless calculations from occurring. This will also save you some TPS lag from vast wire networks.

[note]If your calculator is giving up, 2^(2^31) is a number with 646,456,994 digits.[/note]
data.title: Power in the Ether
data.tooltip:
Power in the Ether
Prequest requests:
Your First SpaceTime

data.name: Project Godforge
data.data:
With your research now complete, you have finally constructed it - the Forge of the Gods.

The Forge of the Gods is an immensely powerful structure constructed around a stabilized neutron star - it is so advanced that its full capabilities are not yet understood. However, through continued use, one can slowly upgrade and expand the range of abilities of the Forge, and learn the power hidden in the most extreme parts of the universe: [note]Graviton Shards[/note].

This esoteric material can only be found where conventional matter and degenerate neutronium crust matter on the surface of a neutron star meet. At this point in space, gravitons are far more common and irradiate this material mixture to create highly unstable graviton shards, which can be used to internally upgrade the Forge. While these shards cannot yet exist outside the extreme conditions of the Forge, with continued research and utilization it may be possible to eventually isolate and extract them outside the Forge - but for what purpose?

[note]Click on the logo in the UI to read more on how to operate the Godforge.[/note]
data.title: §b§lProject Godforge
data.tooltip:
Project Godforge
Prequest requests:

Star Fuel and Dark Matter
Crayon and Melon

data.name: Pseudostable Black Hole Containment Field
data.data:
As the materials around you achieve transcendental properties, you have found that traditional modes of compression like pistons or gases will not be enough to compact them as densely as you require.

The solution? Using the sheer force of gravity. By using extreme amounts of explosive force on your fourth-dimensionally engineered tesseracts, you can tear tiny rifts in the fabric of space, enough to create a seed which can birth a black hole. If you can build a machine which can harness it, it will be able to compress even the strongest materials to the most dense states possible.

Taming a black hole is no easy task - even with all of your precautions, it defies your efforts to stabilize it and attempts to collapse itself constantly. Meaningfully extending the lifespan of the black hole will be extremely difficult. By bending spacetime through carefully aligned glass, you can reverse the flow of hawking radiation back into the black hole and keep it completely stable - problematically, however, the amount of spacetime required to maintain this process increases at an exponential rate.

As the black hole decays, it becomes even more powerful - but be wary, as it will eventually become unstable and you will no longer be able to recover your items from the edge of the event horizon. To safely close the black hole and restart this process, you have engineered a collapser out of the same fourth-dimensional materials.

[note]The Pseudostable Black Hole Containment Field is the most powerful compressor in the game, capable of creating superdense plates out of any material, as well as being able to perform more advanced neutronium compressor recipes that will save incredible amounts of resources.[/note]

[note]You must use programmed circuits in the input buses to determine if the machine will act as a Compressor or Neutronium Compressor![/note]

data.name: Star Fuel and Dark Matter
data.data:
In your research on §b§lProject Godforge§r, you determine that you need a new type of fuel to create a neutron star. Naquadah Fuel possesses some of the properties needed, but isn't enough. Stabilizing this fuel with Exotic Catalyst, and drastically increasing the density of the fuel with other things leads you to something that may just work.

During this synthesis, you realize that this fuel could be used to make [note]Dark Matter[/note], something you previously had only seen on the Mehen Belt in the Amun-Ra System.

[note]Dark Matter Shards can be found in the Mehen Belt and mined manually, if you don't want to synthesize it.[/note]

data.name: Tier 11 (UIV)
data.data:
Now that you've enjoyed your exotic cookies, let's keep going, shall we?

Welcome to UIV! One of the shortest tiers in NH for now. This tier is mainly about solving your DTPF catalyst problems and getting to Eternal Coils.

There are a few QoL additions introduced, like the Uncertainty Resolver and the Thaumometric Essentia Cell.

You also gain access to the Dyson Swarm, an incredibly powerful power generation option.

[warn]This tier is not fully complete. Expect changes.[/warn]

data.name: Transcendent Plasma Mixer
data.data:
Definitely consider making one.

The Transcendent Plasma Mixer is a powerful asset for all your DTPF catalyst needs.

The base processing time is always 5 seconds. You can specify the number of parallels the machine can run in the GUI.

Each parallel additively increases the power requirement, so you don't lose any efficiency while increasing production!

[note]Most of your power will go here. Consider upgrading your naquadah fuel or creating the Dyson Swarm.[/note]

data.data:
[note]Hurrah, you can finally move on to the UMV tier![/note]

The residue produced from the DTPFs seems to have an interesting interaction with reality, as if it bends the universe to its will.

What if you combined it with some infinity and hypogen to excite it, and an energized tesseract as a way to fling it back and forth to the 4th Dimension?

Maybe then you could achieve the unachievable, a building block of the entire universe.

data.name: An Eye at the End of Time
data.data:
So you have made yourself an Eternal DTPF or hopefully a few, and now it is time for the push to the next tier, UXV.

Introducing the final multiblock in the game, and by far the most expensive.
It introduces 4 new materials: Raw Stellar Plasma, White and Black Dwarf Matter and finally Universium.

It has 3 different tiered casings with 9 tiers each:

Spacetime Compression Field Generator:
- Determines the tier of the planet block that can be run and decreases the processing time by 3% per tier.

Time Dilation Field Generator:
- Decreases recipe time by 50% per tier, while decreasing the chance of a recipe succeeding by 9.25% per tier.

Stabilisation Field Generator:
- Increases the chance of a recipe succeeding by 5% per tier, while decreasing the output of a recipe by 5% per tier.

Lower tier Stabilization Field Generators have a power output penalty.

Finding the best setup of different casing tiers might be a hard task, so a calculator visualizing all the drops and setups has been created: [url]https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15j30mNnFIWBhwpJGuDrKTfiHBXNEEqyvB_r7ztFWlyQ[/url]

[note]Be sure to read the tooltip of the Eye of Harmony controller, it explains everything in detail! Depending on your GUI scale it might have multiple pages.[/note]

[note]Well... it explains mostly everything. The Eye of Harmony has an inbuilt pity system to make sure you don't lose your mind. Here's a quick rundown on how it operates:

(All chances are decimals here)
There is a counter C that starts at the current recipe success chance P. If a recipe fails, (1-P)*P is added to C. If C reaches >= 1, the next roll is guaranteed to succeed and C resets to P.
If a recipe succeeds before C reaches >= 1, it resets in a similar manner.
If you switch recipes, C will be reset to P of the new recipe, even if the next roll would be a guarantee.
The guarantee can be canceled out by overflow penalties as they apply after the pity does. However, they do not reset C, so the guarantee is shifted to the next recipe cycle.
If parallels are > 1, pity doesn't apply.[/note]
data.title: An Eye at the End of Time
data.tooltip:
An Eye at the End of Time

data.data:
From now on, you'll be dealing with extremely slow recipes.

You should definitely upgrade your power generation and infrastructure to handle millions of recipes.

The Eye of Harmony will be consuming most of your power before it starts generating more than it uses.

May Colen have mercy on your soul.

[note]Welcome to the waiting lounge.[/note]

As additional rings are placed closer to the star at the center of the Forge, the gravitational stress drastically increases on the structure. Graviton shards alleviate these stresses while also creating localized spacetime bridges to link the two rings and their modules' respective upgrades.

[note]Adding a second ring to your Godforge allows for 4 additional modules, as well as allowing you to pick a second path in the split paths part of the upgrade tree.[/note]

[note]Usage of a second ring requires the CD upgrade.[/note]

Reinforcing your casings with matter from white dwarfs was a good idea.

You can now accelerate a solar system until a black dwarf forms. This material will likely be key to observing and understanding what happens next.

This is the second of your three EOH materials. Use it to upgrade your casings to T7.

[note]The EOH becomes power positive once all the casings are Tier 7.[/note]

data.name: Convergence
data.data:
Running your Dimensionally Transcendent Plasma Forge for an extended period [note](8 hours)[/note] allows the Multidimensional Spaces to align perfectly.

With your newly acquired technology, you can now tap into these spaces in perfect sync, enabling your plasma forges to operate at incredible speeds.

The Transdimensional Alignment Matrix allows the DTPF to run with Perfect Overclocks. To achieve this, you need a full discount, and the extra power cost is offset by using more of the same catalyst.

Overall, it is more efficient and totally worth it.

This process is extremely catalyst-hungry. Ensure you're producing enough to sustain it.

For recipes without a catalyst, you must specify the catalyst in the GUI by right-clicking the Convergence button, otherwise it will default to Crude.[/note]

[note]Math for the curious:

To clear up what exactly happens in the background, here's an explanation on how the extra catalyst values are calculated using an example:

The example recipe of choice is the molten neutronium recipe using prosaic catalyst, running at 64A UMV (8,589,934,592 EU/t).
The recipe uses 14,753L of Prosaic catalyst and 36,484,545,600 EU per recipe without OCs or the catalyst discount. With the discount, the catalyst amount gets cut in half, meaning 7,376.5§ L of catalyst, which are rounded to 7,376L, and due to the 64A UMV the machine is supplied with the recipe overclocks 3 times, meaning each recipe actually uses 36,484,545,600 * 2^3 = 291,876,364,800 EU.

Knowing the amount of OCs and the base voltage of the recipe, the difference of the needed EU per recipe with and without perfect OC can be calculated, that being 291,876,364,800 - 36,484,545,600 = 255,391,819,200 extra EU due to imperfect OCs.
To get the value of needed extra catalyst, this extra EU value has to be divided by the energy density of the relevant catalyst, prosaic in this case.

The division equates to 255,391,819,200 EU / 66,768,460 EU/L = 3,825.037 L, rounded to 3,825L extra prosaic catalyst per recipe. For the final step, this value has to be multiplied by 0.5 as it's affected by the discount, meaning the total extra catalyst that gets added to the recipe is 3,825L * 0.5 = 1,912.5 L, rounded to 1,912L.

To summarize it all in a formula:
Amount extra catalyst per recipe = (B * ((2^x) - 1))/2L
where:
B is base total EU of the recipe
x is the number of overclocks
L is the EU/L of the relevant catalyst [/note]
data.title: Convergence

data.name: Finally, Universium!
data.data:
You've finally solved it. Who knew that leaving dead stars long enough would cause your artificial solar system to implode and lead to a Big Bang?

If only you could tap into that much mass right before it started expanding again, you could literally hold the entire universe in the palm of your hand.

This is your third and final material from the EOH.

[note]It's mainly used for UXV crafts, but your first few should go in the Eternity loop. The quest for it is located in the Endgame Goals tab.

Congrats! You can now craft Magnetohydrodynamically Constrained Star Matter (MHDCSM).[/note]
data.title: Finally, Universium!
data.tooltip:
Finally, Universium!
Prequest requests:
An Eye at the End of Time
Black Dwarf Matter

data.name: Guzzling Massive Amounts of Gas
data.data:
It can run 4 different recipes simultaneously, with 4 parallels for each recipe.

A worthy upgrade for some SpaceTime.
data.title: Guzzling Massive Amounts of Gas

data.name: Magnetic Monopole Matter
data.data:
With total mastery of the Forge of the Gods achieved, it is possible to begin a new universe-spanning initiative. It is now possible to quantize and extract graviton shards for use outside the Forge in powerful new technological endeavors; produce the most exotic plasmas beyond merely periodic elements; and most importantly, begin to understand the immense power of magmatter, a form of matter made entirely of magnetic monopoles with density and stability billions of times that of conventional bosonic matter. It is with this development you realize that the completion of the Forge was not the end goal, but merely a stepping stone to universal transcendence.

[note]Required for UXV components, Magmatter is the second material the Heliofusion Exoticizer can create, and will require a second module. Read the Godforge Information in the UI for more information on how to automate this.[/note]

[note]The creation of Magmatter requires the END upgrade.[/note]

[note]Congrats! You can now move on to the UXV tier![/note]
data.title: §b§lMagnetic Monopole Matter

data.name: Not Quite There Yet
data.data: Just a bit more.
data.title: Not Quite There Yet

data.name: Raw Stellar Plasma
data.data:
Created by all tiers of the Eye of Harmony, Raw Stellar Plasma can be used for several things including Stellar Catalyst.

[note]You may want to be careful with this material, as later running EOHs with Astral Arrays requires this instead of Hydrogen and Helium, so make sure to never fully run out![/note]
data.title: Raw Stellar Plasma
data.tooltip:
Raw Stellar Plasma
Prequest requests:
An Eye at the End of Time

data.name: Saving on SpaceTime
data.data:
SpaceTime is quite a challenge, isn't it? You should definitely consider upgrading your Component Assembly Lines to save on some of it.

[note]Did you know you can wall-share the component casings? Just turn one CoAL upside down.[/note]
data.title: Saving on SpaceTime
data.tooltip:
Saving on SpaceTime
Prequest requests:
Not Quite There Yet

data.name: Shirabon
data.data:
A helper material needed in some UMV and UXV components. Have fun making millions.

[note]This is extremely slow to make and to process.[/note]
data.title: Shirabon

data.name: Stars, So Many Stars
data.data:
Eternal coils? Perfect time for stargate trophy number three.
You know the drill, you give 2 stargates' worth of stuff, you get your trophy. Simple as that.

[note]Our journey through time continues onwards, entering the UMV, aka DTPF era.

Surprisingly, it still is the year 2022, but there have been a huge amount of changes since our last stop in the UEV era. The DTPF exists now, hypogen & eternal coils included, and machine parts up to UMV thus are craftable. Wireless energy is a thing now too, both the LSC and the regular hatch kind, and AE2FC is in the pack, allowing direct fluid crafting (meaning no more volumetric flask shuffling).
The power situation hasn't changed much since the UEV era, except for dyson being even more bugged and giving free uncapped infinite power (abusing this was obviously labeled as bugabuse).
Some other new useful things are the MABS, Integrated Ore Factory, Space Elevator, UIV and UMV singleblocks, EIG, EEC, industrial & mega apiary, yottanks, stocking buses, data bank chaining and the Draconic Fusion Crafter.
The stargate's cost has now skyrocketed far more than ever before, marking the beginning of this new era of GT:NH endgame, the era of expansion.

This time around the leading §aGDCloud§r was challenged by the team §aNeo Caelestia§r, who were progressing at a staggering speed, inching ever closer to being first to gate, but ultimately weren't able to fully catch up and thus §aGDCloud§r once again was first to conquer the challenge on the §a19th of November, 2022§r.

P.S.: You know how this works, right? Here's the list:
-PCB Factory, Component Assemblyline, AAL, Transcendent Plasma Mixer, EOH, QFT
-Multi-Amp wireless hatches
-Sub 1-tick OC, Batch Mode, inbuilt Void Protection on multis
-Level Maintainer, Stocking Hatches, Crafting Input Buses

P.P.S.: Chaotic capacitor bank? What's that?[/note]
data.title: Stars, So Many Stars
data.tooltip:
Stars, So Many Stars
Prequest requests:
Eternal Coil Upgrade
Are you Ready?

data.name: Stellar Catalyst
data.data:
Your attempts to improve your dimensional catalyst have been futile so far, but with the Raw Stellar Plasma from your Eye of Harmony, you can finally create a stable and more powerful catalyst.

You will need some higher-tier plasmas to help maintain its stability as well.

[warn]Handle with care. We are not responsible for your base turning into supermassive black holes. /s[/warn]
data.title: Stellar Catalyst
data.tooltip:
Stellar Catalyst
Prequest requests:
Fuwusion MK5
Heliothermal Plasma Fabricator
Raw Stellar Plasma

data.name: Storing Computation in the Cloud
data.data:
Wireless Computation is similar to Wireless Data, Cloud Computation Server Hatches send computation to Cloud Computation Client Hatches, which other multiblocks can use.

Place down a Server Hatch on a Quantum Computer, screwdriver the controller to enable Wireless Mode, then after placing down a Client Hatch, you have to set how much computation it should request from the Server Hatch.

[note]Wireless Data Hatches are N:M instead of 1:1[/note]
data.title: Storing Computation in the Cloud
data.tooltip:
Storing Computation in the Cloud
Prequest requests:
UXV Circuits

data.name: Subspace Cooling
data.data:
Cooling exotic ingots proves to be a much bigger challenge than smelting them.

Fortunately, reinforcing some of the casings with your new materials allows you to inject exotic coolants that capture extreme heat in miniature tears of spacetime, helping to cool your ingots a bit faster.

With Subspace Cooling, you can enable the Vacuum Freezer to achieve Perfect Overclocks… at a cost.

Tier 1 will consume SpaceTime in liquid form at [warn]7500 L/s[/warn] and allow for 1 Perfect Overclock.

[note]This cost is very high but static, remaining the same for each recipe being run. So, be selective about cooling your ingots.

The faster the recipes, the more efficient the cost, so find your optimal balance.[/note]

The Infinity Cooled Casings replace the frost proof casings, so you don't need to worry about damaging your setups.
data.title: Subspace Cooling

data.name: Thermosink Radiator
data.data:
With the control of spacetime you have achieved and its 0K temperature it would be possible to make an even better cooling unit. A casing able to keep its room temperature very low and nanites which can transfer heat effectively because of their small bodies. This doesn't quite work and some coolant is still needed, but water freezes at those temperatures so super coolant will be our choice.

[note]The Thermosink Radiator allows for 4/4 OC making it possible to speed through recipes. It requires 10/s of super coolant in its hatch, it's in the same place as the Liquid Cooling Tower.[/note]

[warn]This upgrade is incompatible with its lower tier predecessor.[/warn]
data.title: Thermosink Radiator

data.name: The SUCC
data.data:
Like its predecessor it can run 4 different recipes at once, but this time each recipe has 16 parallels.

A good solution for your Hydrogen and Helium problems.

[note]This also requires Eternity to craft.[/note]
data.title: The SUCC

data.name: Tier 12 (UMV)
data.data:
Welcome to the current penultimate tier of New Horizons.

This tier is the tier for upgrading everything and provides access to better parts to help you scale up.

Good Luck.

[warn]This tier is not fully complete. Expect stuff to change.[/warn]
data.title: Tier 12 (UMV)

data.name: Tier 4 QFT Catalysts
data.data:
With Shirabon now acquired, you can finally create catalysts to use in your Tier 4 QFT.

[note]These are extremely expensive, you may want to look into DTPF convergence, and faster means of creating Metastable Oganesson before you can make many of these.[/note]
data.title: Tier 4 QFT Catalysts

data.name: UMV Energy Hatch
data.data:
The penultimate energy hatch.

Hopefully you know what to upgrade first.

[note]Have you checked out wireless energy hatches yet?[/note]
data.title: UMV Energy Hatch

data.name: UMV Field Generator
data.data: Another Field Generator... you are almost done.
data.title: UMV Field Generator
data.tooltip:
UMV Field Generator
Prequest requests:
Not Quite There Yet
UXV Circuits

data.name: UMV Superconductors
data.data:
One of the last wires you have to make for now.

[note]Hope you're not using these for hooking up power to your pre-existing machines. Consider the Infinity Wire.[/note]
data.title: UMV Superconductors

data.name: UXV Circuits
data.data: The final circuit in the game: Quantum Circuit, these will be required for lots of UMV/UXV crafts.
data.title: UXV Circuits

data.name: What Do I Use This Stuff On?
data.data:
White Dwarf Matter, your first main EOH material! I must be able to craft all sorts of cool endgame things with this... right?

[note]Currently, besides EOH casing upgrades, White Dwarf Matter is not used anywhere on its own, often paired with Black Dwarf Matter or other later materials. Save it up for now and keep upgrading that EOH![/note]
data.title: What Do I Use This Stuff On?
data.tooltip:
What Do I Use This Stuff On?
Prequest requests:
White Dwarf Matter

data.name: White Dwarf Matter
data.data:
Who knew that creating artificial solar systems would finally allow you to extract the core of a freshly dead star?

With your current crude casings, you can only accelerate the life of an artificial solar system to observe white dwarfs.

Perhaps this matter will help you push the process even further.

[note]This is one of the three EOH materials. Use it to upgrade your casings up to T4.[/note]
data.title: White Dwarf Matter
data.tooltip:
White Dwarf Matter
Prequest requests:
An Eye at the End of Time

data.name: Wireless Multi-Amp Hatches
data.data:
With Shirabon now acquired, you can create 4A, 16A and 64A wireless energy hatches. These are particularly useful for machines which can use multi-amp, but do not need extreme amounts of power warranting a laser hatch.

[note]These used to be needed in large quantities, being the best energy hatch to use on a Processing Array. May they rest in peace.[/note]
data.title: Wireless Multi-Amp Hatches

data.name: Yet Another Space Elevator Upgrade
data.data: This bad boi can handle 18 modules at once.
data.title: Yet Another Space Elevator Upgrade

data.name: You Are Worthy
data.data: Go no further if you value your sanity.
data.title: You Are Worthy

An Eye at the End of Time

A Second Ring has Hit the Godforge

data.name: Akihabara
data.data:
Tired of talking one by one with every villager to determine their trades? A trading post will show you all available trades from villagers in the area.

You'll need an Assembler to finish it up.
data.title: §5§lAkihabara

data.name: A Lead About Lead That Leads to Lead
data.data: The next step of making batteries is to collect some lead. Look at the lead quest in the novice thaumaturgy tab for more info.
data.title: §2§3§5§lA Lead About Lead That Leads to Lead
data.tooltip:
A Lead About Lead That Leads to Lead
Prequest requests:
Tetrahedrite, Stibnite and Copper

data.name: Alloy Smelter
data.data: Upgrade your steam alloy smelter to an LV one.
data.title: §5§lAlloy Smelter

data.name: Aluminium Tank
data.data: If you make some Double Aluminium Plates, you can make a new 96,000L single block tank.
data.title: §5§6§l§5§lAluminium Tank
data.tooltip:
Aluminium Tank
Prequest requests:
Getting Ready for Tier 2, MV

data.name: Analyzing the Soil
data.data:
Tired of looking for ores by hand? Want to find underground oil that will last a long time? A seismic prospector will tell you the ores in the surrounding chunks in a (sorta) handy book you can read, and also the underground fluids beneath you. It doesn't need to be powered.

To determine which kind of fluid there is in the chunk you need to scan the soil by right-clicking an Advanced Seismic Prospector with 2 Powderbarrels, 4 Glyceryl Trinitate cells, 8 iTNT or 16 TNT. This one doesn't explode the user too on use. Features! There are four types of oil or natural gas for the overworld. See the quest in Tips and Tricks once you've made an oil drill.

1) Right-click explosives.
2) Use a single Data Stick to extract the data by right-clicking on it after the animation has finished. Each will hold ONE result.
3) Next you need to put the data stick in a GT scanner to have it analyzed.
4) Place the analyzed data stick in the bottom right slot of a printer and add 3 paper in the top left slot and make sure you have at least 144L squid ink in it.
5) Take the printed pages and combine it with a piece of leather in an assembling machine filled with at least 20 mb of refined glue.

[note]TADA![/note] Now you have a book with detailed info about the chunks you scanned. Visual Prospecting adds the information to your map the moment you make the book.

§2Data Sticks are not easy (or possible) to make right now, so do not lose them.§r You can put it in a crafting table to erase it when done.

Ore locations are given as the center of the chunk. Ores that are marginal in that chunk may not be found in the center but on an edge. Look at where ores are located and determine the center of the vein. At higher tiers, it scans more chunks for ores. If you just want to know about fluids, use the lower tier version so the book isn't as long.

Each underground fluid field is 8x8 chunks. This starts at 0,0 and continues for 8 chunks east and south, containing 64 chunks. Not all fields have anything in them though. Within the field the amount can vary +/- 25 percent. The amount reported in the book is the minimum and maximum per field across all chunks in the field. The prospector reports on 3x3 fields (as in, 9 fields of 8x8 chunks) at all tiers with the center field where the seismic prospector is located. Fluid extraction rate depends on many factors, check the wiki for details. In general, anything above 300 is really good. The total amount in the chunk is complicated.
data.title: §5§lAnalyzing the Soil
data.tooltip:
Analyzing the Soil
Prequest requests:
Scanning Bees, Crops and Moooooore!

data.name: A New Alloy - Cobalt Brass
data.data:
If you want to cut diamond blocks into plates, it's time to get a new alloy, Cobalt Brass.

First you need to make brass out of zinc (only found in small ores or TiCo Zinc Gavel Ore in the Overworld, in Nether Sphalerite, or as a centrifuge byproduct from tin or tetrahedrite) and copper. Mix it with tin and cobalt dust (you can get it as a byproduct of a couple ores, go searching in the nether, or go to the Twilight Forest for Cobaltite) to get the cobalt brass dust.

Now that you've come this far, we think that you're able to look up the ores that you need by yourself with the help of NEI.
data.title: §5§lA New Alloy - Cobalt Brass
data.tooltip:
A New Alloy - Cobalt Brass
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #1

data.name: A New Alloy - Magnalium
data.data:
Wondering why you need magnalium now? It's not for GT machines but for a material update for your crossbow.

You already made some Aluminium dust before. Getting Aluminium will become easier once you get an EBF or MV electrolyzer.
If you can't find any aluminium, search for chests in the Twilight Forest or kill a few monsters.

Combine Aluminium and Magnesium in your alloy smelter to get Magnalium.
data.title: §5§lA New Alloy - Magnalium
data.tooltip:
A New Alloy - Magnalium
Prequest requests:
LV Extruder
Magnesium Source
Getting Ready for Tier 2, MV

data.name: Antimony
data.data: The most efficient way to get antimony for batteries is to run stibnite through a BBF or EBF, burning off the impurities (sulfur), and giving you more antimony. You can also centrifuge it if you want to keep the sulfur. You can also centrifuge tetrahedrite dust if you're desperate.
data.title: §5§lAntimony

data.name: Ardite and Cobalt
data.data:
If you have some time you can look for cobalt and ardite in the Nether.

You've heard rumors of a special wood only found in another land, a forest of Twilight, that can make tools strong enough to mine them.

Remember, you need an electric blast furnace to process these materials before you can make tools with them.
data.title: §5§lArdite and Cobalt

data.name: Ardite Crossbow Body
data.data:
To make your crossbow even better, craft an ardite crossbow body. You received a few ardite ingots as reward before but will need to find ore in the Nether and process it in an Electric Blast Furnace.

With redstone you can make your bow faster. This requires a free modifier slot on your crossbow.

Don't bother putting Nether Quartz on the crossbow, it only improves damage from whacking mobs over the head with it. Put the Nether Quartz on your bolts instead.
data.title: §5§lArdite Crossbow Body

data.name: A Truly Sharp Saw Blade
data.data: Combining cobalt brass and diamond dust makes a really sharp saw blade for your cutting machine.
data.title: §5§lA Truly Sharp Saw Blade
data.tooltip:
A Truly Sharp Saw Blade
Prequest requests:
A New Alloy - Cobalt Brass

data.name: Automated Crafting2
data.data: The Auto Workbench is a simple automated crafting system. You place ghost items in the grid to create the recipe, and place components in the inventory. They will slowly be converted into the crafted item. While not fast and can only do 1 recipe each, it does support automation - only items acceptable to the recipe are allowed in the inventory. It does not use power.
data.title: §5§lAutomated Crafting
data.tooltip:
Automated Crafting2
Prequest requests:
Working Table 2.0
You're Gonna Hate This #1

data.name: Automated Farmer
data.data: Your hoe must be getting worn out by now. Why not craft an electric one which never breaks?
data.title: §6§l§d§5§lAutomated Farmer

data.name: Automated Sticky Resin Farmer
data.data:
If you're tired of crafting tons of tree taps, how about a machine that uses power but never breaks? Let's craft an electric tree tap!

(If you're looking for better ways to get Sticky Resin, you might want to consider the Stickreed crop from IC2 crops. To get it, plant Sugarcanes on Crops on an X formation, with spaces between them, and then put 2 Crops on each empty slot. For more information, check the crop quests.
data.title: §5§6§l§5§lAutomated Sticky Resin Farmer

data.name: Auto Mining
data.data:
Automatic mining in LV tier? Wow! This nifty machine will collect ores for you, which can be helpful especially in the Nether, as it won't anger pigmen.

Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. Each pipe can go 1 block, and allow the miner to dig 1 block further. If you're above Y64, you may need to pipe more in.

This machine only needs 8 EU/t to work, so LV batteries in a batbuff work OK if you don't want to make another generator.

The miner searches for ores in a 17x17 block work area (adjustable with a screwdriver), and comes with a level 1 fortune bonus! Great for gathering additional small ores!

Don't forget to cover it up! These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on all sides. And set a waypoint with JourneyMap so you don't forget where you placed it if you place it far away! You'll need to chunkload the miner if you want it to keep working when you're not there.
data.title: §5§lAuto Mining

data.name: Avengers, Assemble!
data.data:
An absolute must have for fans of the movie. Oh, and to make all the things, of course. There are a number of recipes that take fewer materials to make in the assembler, or can only be made with it, so make it ASAP!

You can use the battery slot and the other extra slot in the GUI to store unused configuration circuits.

If you've completed the Silverwood quest on the first tab, you can go to the Twilight Forest after making your Assembler. See the Novice Thaumaturgy tab for details.
data.title: §5§lAvengers, Assemble!

data.name: Basic Arc Furnace
data.data:
The arc furnace is an alternative to macerating stuff back into dusts and for making wrought iron, annealed copper, and glass (in MV). You get ingots, and sometimes different materials back from recycling than with a macerator. You also have all 4 slots at LV. The recipes use oxygen and 3A of power.

Just ignore the plasma one.

And no, you can't just send 1A of MV. That will blow it up.
data.title: §5§lBasic Arc Furnace

data.name: Basic Canner
data.data:
The canning machine is used to fill batteries, fill cells with stuff (usually dust, not used that often), or to fill tin cans with any kind of food (HV+).

At LV-HV tier you can make batteries with sodium, cadmium, or lithium.
data.title: §5§lBasic Canner

data.name: Basic Circuit Assembler
data.data:
Advanced (HV) circuits require an LV circuit assembling machine. Basic (LV) and Good (MV) ones can also be made much more efficiently with this machine.

However, all circuit assemblers need higher tier circuits than the other machines of their tier. This means you have to use MV circuits instead of the LV ones you've been using until now. I know you want it, so make it already!
data.title: §5§lBasic Circuit Assembler
data.tooltip:
Basic Circuit Assembler
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #5
You're Gonna Hate This #4
Good Circuits

data.name: Basic Fluid Solidifier
data.data:
To get your molten fluids back to a solid state you need a fluid solidifier. This is handy for processing molten rubber directly from the chemical reactor. It's used for crossbow bolts as well.

Keep in mind that GT fluids are different from Tinker's Construct. You will mainly work with GT fluids going forward.
data.title: §5§lBasic Fluid Solidifier

data.name: Basic Monster Prevention
data.data: Monsters spawning in or near your base can be annoying. Especially if you happen to get infernal creepers. Luckily, there's a good way to prevent them from spawning at all.
data.title: §5§lBasic Monster Prevention

data.name: Basic Ore Washer
data.data:
Macerating ores usually doubles the output. If you want MOOOOOOORE, craft an ore washer and wash out some rare materials.

Note that these both use water, and are painfully slow.

Put crushed ore in them.

[note]You can also consider using the steam multiblock instead if you want.[/note]
data.title: §5§lBasic Ore Washer
data.tooltip:
Basic Ore Washer
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Basic Transport: Fluids
data.data: Just like item nodes, liquid nodes transfer... liquids. But probably the best thing: They can all utilize the same transfer pipe!
data.title: §5§lBasic Transport: Fluids

data.name: Basic Transport: Items
data.data: In order to transfer items, you need so called "nodes". There are some for pushing items into a pipe system, and later you'll have access to nodes that are able to pull items from attached inventories.
data.title: §5§lBasic Transport: Items

data.name: Basic Transport Pipe
data.data: These pipes are rather simple and won't do anything on their own. But in combination with transfer nodes, you'll soon find out how great they are.
data.title: §5§lBasic Transport Pipe
data.tooltip:
Basic Transport Pipe
Prequest requests:
Welcome to Tier 1, LV

data.name: Battery Alloy
data.data:
Mixing antimony and lead in the alloy smelter will give you battery alloy. Combine it with tin cable and voila, there's your small battery hull.

Small = LV, Medium = MV, Large = HV. It gets weirder after that.

Note that if you make the battery alloy in the mixer you need to use dusts, but if you use the alloy smelter you can use either.

Check out the quest tab Storing and Transforming EU for all details about EU power storage.
data.title: §5§lBattery Alloy
data.tooltip:
Battery Alloy
Prequest requests:
A Lead About Lead That Leads to Lead
Antimony

data.name: Be Sure to Get Your Armpits
data.data:
Want to use all that delicious XP to raise your levels? Move the tank with XP above you and attach this convenient shower head to take the XP from the tank.

This thing can be laggy, so be careful about letting too many XP orbs out of the tank. Apply a redstone signal to turn it off.
data.title: §5§lBe Sure to Get Your Armpits
data.tooltip:
Be Sure to Get Your Armpits
Prequest requests:
No More Filing

data.name: Better Gallium and Arsenic Sources
data.data:
There are a couple of ways to increase your Gallium.

1. Find TiCo zinc gravel ore and process it to get gallium.

2. Breed Zinc Bees and react the Gallium Combs with Hydrochloric Acid. The bee is not too deep in the breeding progression and the processing only requires LV.

3. Use IC2 crops under the Farming tab to get Galvania leaves, to 4x your zinc and sphalerite crushed ores to purified ores.

4. Use the HV macerator on the centrifuged ores to get a 10 percent chance of a whole Gallium dust.

5. Use plentiful Bauxite ores from the Moon.

6. Kill Redcaps/Redcap Sappers in Twilight Forest. Also Kobolds drop Arsenic.

7. Duplicate nugget with Thaumcraft. This requires §lTaboo§r researches, so you might not want to do this.

For Arsenic, Cobaltite ore in the Twilight Forest is a great source for more information go to the quest "Cobalt and Arsenic from Cobaltite".

Cobaltite can also be multiplied 4x by the IC2 crop Nickelback.
data.title: §5§lBetter Gallium and Arsenic Sources
data.tooltip:
Better Gallium and Arsenic Sources
Prequest requests:
Gallium Arsenide Crystal

data.name: Biomes Everywhere, But Not the One You Want?
data.data:
Tired of searching all over the map for that Bamboo Forest or Tropical Rainforest? Desperate for clay dust and need to find a Canyon or Mesa biome? Nature's compass will lead you to the biome you're looking for, if it's within its range.

The compass menu has the following functionality:
* When Sorted By: Name, you can filter the list by name or its parts. The search is case-insensitive.
* You can search by keys and their combinations. For instance, name: bamboo, climate: warm, bh: -1.8, tag: forest.
All available keys are:
name,
climate [hellish, hot, warm, normal, cold, icy],
baseheight | bh (float, can be negative),
heightvariation | hv (float),
rainfall | rain (float),
temperature | temp (float),
humidity [damp, normal, arid],
tags.

Some things to keep in mind:
* Biomes from other dimensions show up on the list, don't bother searching for those unless you're in that dimension.
* In general, the full list has biomes that are not generated by Realistic World Generator, like Sunflower Plains.
* Radius 10000 means it couldn't find the biome. In this case after the initial search, its menu will show only the biomes in the 10k radius. Use Shift+RMB to see the whole list again.
* You can try again at a different location - the range is 10k from your current position.
* Artificially created biomes count, so remove them if you want to find a natural one.
* There's lots of different 'versions' of biomes under the same category, so if you want a tropical one for tropical bees, there are actually a bunch of places you can get it.
* For those who don't mind the freeze when searching, the radius can be changed in a config. The HUD position can also be changed in the config.
data.title: §5§lBiomes Everywhere, But Not the One You Want?
data.tooltip:
Biomes Everywhere, But Not the One You Want?
Prequest requests:
Avengers, Assemble!

data.name: Black and Decker
data.data:
Tired of having to replace tools all the time because they constantly break? Now that Steel is available, it's time to make some electric versions of the Screwdriver and Wrench! Charge them up like Batteries, and they'll last much longer than the non-electric versions of these tools.

You can use Lithium Batteries, or if you're on a budget, Cadmium or Sodium Batteries instead. This does reduce their energy capacity though. Later on, Vibrant Alloy will make excellent tools with great durability. There are, however, a multitude of other great materials that you may have access to, so take a look around in NEI and decide for yourself.

There are also MV and HV versions, though they require that you can process Aluminium or Stainless Steel, respectively.
data.title: §§§5§lBlack and Decker
data.tooltip:
Black and Decker
Prequest requests:
Battery Alloy
Time to Get Some Steel

data.name: Brewing, the Industrial Way
data.data: If you want brews or alcohol, I recommend you to build one of these. You might have noticed that you cannot build a brewing stand without Thaumcraft. But fear not, you can still find them in secret rooms on the first floor of some roguelike dungeons or ur-ghast towers. Better get searching...
data.title: §5§lBrewing, the Industrial Way
data.tooltip:
Brewing, the Industrial Way
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Brittle But Hits Like a Sledgehammer...
data.data: A Carbon crossbow limb is 1/3 the durability of the magnalium limb, but hits a lot harder and shoots a little faster. But you'll want to carry around a tinker table and extra ingots to repair it constantly, and watch that you don't break it in the middle of combat!
data.title: §5§lBrittle But Hits Like a Sledgehammer...
data.tooltip:
Brittle But Hits Like a Sledgehammer...
Prequest requests:
Round and Round and Round...
Magnalium Crossbow

data.name: Butane and Propane
data.data:
You can crack and distill a lot of different fluids out of your already distilled products, such as Butane, Butene, Butadiene, Benzene, Ethane, Ethylene, Helium, Hydrogen, Methane, Octane, Propane, Propene, Toluene, and even more Light Fuel, Heavy Fuel, or Naphtha. You can then crack them down even further too sometimes. Many of these are only used for power. Go check out the spreadsheet for more details than this quest can encompass.

For now, get some Butane and Propane.
data.title: §5§lButane and Propane
data.tooltip:
Butane and Propane
Prequest requests:
Naphtha1
Refinery Gas
Light Fuel1
Heavy Fuel1

data.name: C9H8O4...NaCl...H2O...
data.data:
Want to make some cetane-boosted diesel, plastic or some chemical dyes? Then it's time to craft a chemical reactor.

You can use the battery slot and the other extra slot in the GUI to store items.
data.title: §5§lC9H8O4...NaCl...H2O...

data.name: Cable Diodes
data.data: Sometimes you just need a Diode, either to prevent burning up cables when splitting off a main line, or on a Thermos Server's chunk borders. Make one 4A Diode and get a 2A one for free!
data.title: §5§lCable Diodes

data.name: Cadmium
data.data: You can get Cadmium from Sphalerite (centrifuge or thermal centrifuge). Later on you can use GT++ Ore processing chains to get Cadmium from Rare Earths. I don't care how you get it, just get some Cadmium.
data.title: §5§lCadmium

data.name: Cheaper Annealed Production
data.data: It's even faster and cheaper to make annealed copper in the arc furnace than in the electric blast furnace. Annealed copper is a very good material for cables in MV. It only loses 1 EU per block.
data.title: §5§lCheaper Annealed Production

data.name: Chemical Bath
data.data:
Wait, what? You want more byproducts from your ores? A cheaper way to make paper? Well, the chemical bath is perfect for you!

You'll have to provide liquids like mercury to extract different products like nickel, silver, copper, and platinum (only as PMP) from ores.

For paper you'll only need some water and wood pulp. Maybe you'll find more uses for it!
data.title: §5§lChemical Bath
data.tooltip:
Chemical Bath
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #1
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Chemical Rubber Production
data.data: A much more efficient way to make insulated cables is by making molten rubber in a chemical reactor, which can be applied to a cable in the assembling machine. When you put both machines next to each other you can output the molten rubber directly to the assembling machine by clicking the fluid auto-output button on the chemical reactor. Make sure to set the correct side of the reactor as output side by wrenching it. Also remember to use the right circuit in the assembling machine.
data.title: §5§lChemical Rubber Production

data.name: Chlorine, Your New Best Friend
data.data:
Chlorine is a fluid that is used in significant quantities throughout the game, so you might as well get used to collecting it now.

You can electrolyze Salt, Rock Salt, Sodalite (finally a use!), or Salt Water for it. Since you'll need so much, you may wish to consider using your first Super Tank to hold it all.
data.title: §5§lChlorine, Your New Best Friend
data.tooltip:
Chlorine, Your New Best Friend
Prequest requests:
How to Get Sodium and Lithium

data.name: Choices, Choices
data.data:
Need a map on fuel choices? Well, we don't have that, but we have suggestions. You can use Steam up to IV, but beyond MV it gets pretty painful.

In LV you can start refining oil for either Light Fuel for a Combustion Generator or Refinery Gas for a Gas Turbine. Or you can use Creosote in a Semi-Fluid Generator.

Once you hit MV, you can switch from Steam to renewable Benzene (Gas) from your logs. Other renewable alternatives are Fish Oil or Seed Oil based bio diesel (combustion). Seed Oil can be sourced from Pam's peanuts, IC2 Rape crop or Forestry tree nuts.

At MV you can also upgrade your Light Fuel with Heavy Fuel to get Diesel. When you reach HV turn diesel or bio diesel into Cetane Boosted Diesel. In EV, you can make High Octane Gasoline (HOG), but it's complex, and you'll need to rejigger your whole oil distillation setup, since it uses different fluids than Cetane does.

EV introduces the Large Gas Turbine, Large Steam Turbine, Large HP Steam Turbine, and Large Combustion Engine, which are more efficient versions of the earlier ones. The first 3 require turbines.

You can also make Nukes, or Wind and Water Kinetics.

For low-power operations, or dedicated players willing to set up autocrafting, you can begin using Solar Panels at MV.
data.title: §5§lChoices, Choices

data.name: Circuit Programming
data.data:
Some machines have a very, very large number of recipes. To avoid conflicts, many recipes have programmed circuits to ensure that the correct recipe is used. These programmed circuits are not consumed.

In this modpack, all singleblock GT machines now come with an icon in the GUI on the bottom-right that represents a ghost circuit. Click it or scroll to choose the number you need. If you do that, you don't have to insert a physical circuit. This is going to be your main option for all single block machines. This option is now also available for input buses of multiblocks, which you will use much later.

There are a few places throughout the modpack where you still need the physical circuits. You can turn an LV circuit into a programmed circuit in the crafting grid and then program it in various ways:

1) Find a correct crafting recipe with a screwdriver in NEI and use that.

2) Right-click while holding the programmed circuit to open an easy menu. You still need to at least have the screwdriver in your inventory though or it won't work. Eventually you can also make an electric screwdriver.

3) Use the BartWorks Circuit Programmer. It's only available in MV, but it does not use any durability and runs on EU.

4) Use the GT++ Circuit Programmer block. It isn't portable and only available in MV, but it allows for automation.


The tasks in this quest are just the showcase of what programming circuits there are. You can just click the checkmark once you understand how the programmed circuits work.
data.title: §5§lCircuit Programming

data.name: Cobalt and Arsenic from Cobaltite
data.data:
Can't find any Cobalt in the Nether? Too lazy to bother finding some Ironwood in the Twilight Forest, even though it's super duper easy?

You can make it with your EBF now using Cobaltite Ore from the Twilight Forest and Oxygen to get Cobalt. It's a little complicated, but you also get arsenic out of it.

You can also just electrolyze it out in MV, which is what you §oshould§r be doing instead of this, but assuming you actually need it this method has higher yields (at the cost of carbon of course).
data.title: §d§0§5§lCobalt and Arsenic from Cobaltite

data.name: Compact? Or is it?
data.data:
It's a compressor but that doesn't mean it's compact...

It is highly recommended to get one of these electric compressors, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to compress something is a lot better when using EU.

[note]You can also consider using the steam multiblock instead if you want.[/note]
data.title: §5§lCompact? Or is it?
data.tooltip:
Compact? Or is it?
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #3

data.name: Craftsman Used to Mean Quality
data.data: Now that you have an EBF you can make vanadiumsteel GT tools. With 192k durability they'll last you a long time.
data.title: §5§lCraftsman Used to Mean Quality
data.tooltip:
Craftsman Used to Mean Quality
Prequest requests:
Round and Round and Round...
EBF-Time

data.name: Cutting Things Apart
data.data:
An absolutely mandatory machine to have. It will cut rods into bolts, plates into casings, logs into planks, and all of that will be done with the highest possible efficiency. Totally worth it!

You can use water, distilled water, or lubricant to run it. Use lubricant if possible, as it's the best.
data.title: §5§lCutting Things Apart
data.tooltip:
Cutting Things Apart
Prequest requests:
A Truly Sharp Saw Blade

data.name: Damascus Steel
data.data:
Damascus Steel is one of the hardest materials you can get, at your current tier. It's time to craft a stack of Damascus Steel.

You can't get it through the Mixer yet, but there is a crafting recipe.
data.title: §5§lDamascus Steel
data.tooltip:
Damascus Steel
Prequest requests:
Round and Round and Round...
EBF-Time

data.name: Damn You, Wire Cutter!
data.data: This should be one of your first machines. You get 2 wires for every ingot. You can run them back through to get 4 fine wires each or get them from ingots by changing the circuit.
data.title: §5§lDamn You, Wire Cutter!
data.tooltip:
Damn You, Wire Cutter!
Prequest requests:
Welcome to Tier 1, LV

data.name: Diamond Barrel
data.data: The Diamond barrel has 108 slots.
data.title: §5§lDiamond Barrel
data.tooltip:
Diamond Barrel
Prequest requests:
Cutting Things Apart
The future is here!

data.name: Diamond Chests... Ooo, Shiny
data.data:
After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new, even bigger diamond chests.

[note]Just as with the previous chests you can also upgrade with a fitting upgrade item.[/note]
data.title: §5§lDiamond Chests... Ooo, Shiny
data.tooltip:
Diamond Chests... Ooo, Shiny
Prequest requests:
Cutting Things Apart

data.name: Diamond Spikes
data.data:
Diamond Spikes damages mobs (or you!) that touch any side of it other than the bottom. With 7 attack damage, the Spike does as much damage as a Diamond Sword. Mobs will not walk around the block, but will try to walk over it as if it were a regular solid block. Most explosions won't destroy the Spike because it has a very high blast resistance.

These can also be enchanted with all the enchantments a regular diamond sword would receive. This includes Looting and Sharpness, which function exactly as it does on a sword. Interestingly, mobs killed by the Diamond Spike will return experience as if killed by the player.

There are weaker versions, but who wants that? If you happen to want the last hit, you might want the wooden ones though.
data.title: §5§lDiamond Spikes
data.tooltip:
Diamond Spikes
Prequest requests:
No More Filing
Ooo, Shiny! (Not Platinum!)

data.name: Diamond Tanks... Ooo, Shiny
data.data: After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new 64,000L single block tank.
data.title: §5§lDiamond Tanks... Ooo, Shiny
data.tooltip:
Diamond Tanks... Ooo, Shiny
Prequest requests:
Cutting Things Apart

data.name: Diodes1
data.data:
Good circuits need diodes. There are two main ways to craft them. You can crush the Gallium Arsenide crystals to dust and combine that with fine copper wires and molten glass. Once you have solar grade silicon you can use it to make silicon wafers in your EBF to make even more. Note that the wafers are much more efficient on gallium and arsenic, so even a reduced amount is still worth it.

Make sure you check all the NEI recipes for advanced items instead of just using the first one you find. You can use annealed copper wires and polyethylene to increase your output even more.
data.title: §5§lDiodes

data.name: Dust to Crystals
data.data: Use the autoclave to crystallize your dust. You can also make Raw Carbon Fiber out of Carbon Dust, and do other things.
data.title: §5§lDust to Crystals
data.tooltip:
Dust to Crystals
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Electrically Separating Dusts
data.data:
Using the power of electricity you can get even more out of your dusts. Somehow. With no catalysts, electrolytes, or anything. Look, don't ask me how it works. §oIt just works§r.

Aside from that, this is a very important machine to process some items and fluids into other, more useful items and fluids. A basic example of this is electrolyzing Water, which should be completely free to you, to get both Hydrogen and Oxygen, two very important fluids for your progression.
data.title: §5§lElectrically Separating Dusts
data.tooltip:
Electrically Separating Dusts
Prequest requests:
Welcome to Tier 1, LV

data.name: Electric Furnace
data.data: It's, like, faster than a normal one I guess? But uses power.
data.title: §5§lElectric Furnace

data.name: Electric Macerator
data.data:
It is highly recommended to get one of these, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to macerate something is a lot better when using EU.

You get the first extra slot at HV, then +1 for EV and IV. The 2nd slot is for more byproducts, and is super §osuper§r useful. The 3rd slot is for ore block dusts. The 4th slot is basically only used for recycling stuff.

[note]You can also consider using the steam multiblock instead if you want.[/note]
data.title: §5§lElectric Macerator

data.name: Electrotine Battery
data.data: The electrotine battery is exclusively used in project red machines and the jetpack. Electrotine is made by mixing redstone and electrum dust in a mixer, or mined from the Nether.
data.title: §5§lElectrotine Battery

data.name: Empty Cells
data.data: With your plate bender you're able to make empty cells. The circuit needs to be configured to 12 otherwise you will make foils. Once you have an LV Extruder, you can make cells directly from ingots.
data.title: §5§lEmpty Cells

data.name: Empty Circuit Board
data.data:
Good circuit boards require wooden pulp and refined glue to make phenolic circuit boards. By adding gold wire you can craft a good circuit board.

There are more efficient ways to make it if you look in NEI.
data.title: §5§lEmpty Circuit Board

data.name: Enderman Smelterman
data.data:
Need enderpearls? Getting them by killing endermen can be dangerous. Instead of doing that, put an enderman into a smeltery with hot fluids and use a gem cast to get guaranteed pearls.

The higher the hit points, the longer they'll last, so the more pearls you get. If you can find a regenerating enderman, or an enderman spawner, you'll have all the pearls you would ever want. Later on with EnderIO you can even create your own powered spawner to make endermen on-demand. Or just place it in the End and move the mobs inside.

Use a nametag on a regenerating enderman to make sure he doesn't despawn. You'll want to keep him from seeing the sky or else he'll teleport away.

If you haven't found a regen enderman yet, you can buy enderman spawn eggs to put into your smeltery with coins. Maybe you'll get lucky and get a regenerating one.
data.title: §5§lEnderman Smelterman

data.name: Exploding Fluids For Power
data.data:
The Combustion Generator produces EU from several fluids and spends fuel only when necessary. Some fluids are more popular than others, but the Oil processing line has a different combustion fluid in every tier from LV to EV, and all of them are burned in these generators.

To start, LV is the tier of Light Fuel. It is worth much more than the Oil itself for generating power, so you should distill and desulfurize the Oil to get clean Light Fuel and use it for power. It's a great way to run your base, and can be upgraded further in the next tiers. Check the "Working with Oil" tab for more information, once you've made a Pump and found some Oil.

If you're dealing with Oil processing, this is the type of generator you'll use the most.§r
data.title: §5§lExploding Fluids For Power
data.tooltip:
Exploding Fluids For Power
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #3

data.name: Faster Steam Transportation
data.data:
Do you think that steam fluid transport is far too slow? Your LV pumps got you down, doing only 640L/s? Then it's time to make the 32 times faster LV steam valves!

They only work with steam and are just as fast as the valve on a Railcraft tank (if you put it on the bottom side).

There are also MV, HV, EV, and IV versions.
data.title: §5§lFaster Steam Transportation
data.tooltip:
Faster Steam Transportation
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Faster Steel Production
data.data:
A faster alternative to steel production is to use the arc furnace and smelt iron ingots (or dust) into wrought iron ingots. Then macerate them to dust and smelt them very fast in the EBF to steel.

Of course, you'll need enough oxygen to do so.
data.title: §5§lFaster Steel Production

data.name: Ferment Your Brew!
data.data: What's better than lame brews? Alcoholic brews! Get one of these to make beer, rum or even vodka.
data.title: §5§lFerment Your Brew!
data.tooltip:
Ferment Your Brew!
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Fertilized Earth
data.data:
With a Chemical Reactor, you can make Fertilized Earth. It ticks faster than normal farmland, so crops will mature much faster. As a bonus, it can be tilled away from water and doesn't get damaged when you fall on it.

It does allow IC2 crops to be placed on them, but will not accelerate the crops.
data.title: §5§lFertilized Earth

data.name: Fiery Bowstring
data.data: Why not upgrade your bowstring too? You got some from the last quest, but will need to find some more in the Nether by killing spiders. Craft some fiery bowstring with it.
data.title: §5§lFiery Bowstring

data.name: Filling the World With Fluids...
data.data: Need to make a lake? Look no further than the Flood Gate. It will fill the world with any fluid you provide it, up to the level below the gate. This can get kinda laggy in a large area, so keep that in mind.
data.title: §5§lFilling the World With Fluids...
data.tooltip:
Filling the World With Fluids...
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Firestone Ore/Dust
data.data:
Firestone ore is used to make some BC machines like the filler, and some other stuff. Unfortunately, it's in the nether...at the bottom of the lava ocean!

Here are some tips for finding it:

-Firestone only spawns in deep lava, at least 6 deep. It will only replace netherrack, so a fjord filled with soulsand won't have any. Can you think of ways to check the lava depth, and what's down there?
-Alternatively, if you keep your head at just the correct height above the lava and at the correct angle, you'll be able to see underneath it - surely there must be a hovering jetpack?
-...or just look for the biome when your cursor is over the JM map. Hell is the default one that has netherrack.

Firestone can be mined with the GT miners, if you place it within horizontal range. Firestone ore and products will cause random fires to start nearby, so get it into a backpack quickly!
data.title: §6§lFirestone Ore/Dust

data.name: Fluid Canner
data.data:
The fluid canner used to be the main way to fill cells, single-use batteries, and coolant cells. It was needed because direct interaction with cells was limited.

Now everything is much easier and cells almost always work as expected, so you likely won't need this, even for molten redstone.

However, if you want an electric hoe or treetap, you'll need to make IC2 batteries in a fluid canner.

Another interesting thing about this is it also works as a fluid uncanner. And maybe later you could fill a Lighter with it.
data.title: §5§lFluid Canner

data.name: Gallium Arsenide Crystal
data.data:
The diode requires gallium arsenide, and you may be wondering how to get gallium or arsenic this early in the game.

Sphalerite and zinc are the primary sources of gallium at this tier.

You can find sphalerite in sulfur veins at Y 5-20, and the small zinc ores in the Overworld or the Nether at Y 80-210. You won't find much on the Overworld because of obvious reasons. To get additional zinc crushed ore drops, use a Tinker's Construct tool with the Luck (Fortune) enchant on it, probably the best use for all that lapis you got while looking for calcite. Or use a miner, if you don't mind how slow it is.

- Sphalerite can be electrolyzed for a small chance of a gallium dust. Better put in a lot or you might get unlucky.
- Zinc crushed ore can be washed and then thermal centrifuged or forge hammered and then centrifuged. But you don't always get the crushed ore as a drop, the impure dust doesn't give gallium.

You can get arsenic from realgar small ores in the Nether at Y 15-85. Centrifuge the dusts in a centrifuge.

Other sources are Tinker's Construct cobalt ore in the nether and cobaltite ore in the Twilight Forest. You can use your EBF for that. You also need to level up your pickaxe to ardite or make an Ironwood Pickaxe or LV Miner to harvest cobalt ore.

Another way to get gallium and arsenic is with XP buckets in a crafting grid if you're really desperate.

With your EBF you can combine these two dusts to make a Gallium Arsenide Crystal.
data.title: §5§lGallium Arsenide Crystal

data.name: Getting Ready for Tier 2, MV
data.data:
In order to proceed forward, you need to get aluminium. A lot of it. But for now, 8 is enough to complete this quest.

Your first option is alumina dust. Probably the best source for alumina is clay or hardened clay from canyons, however you need an MV machine for that, so you need to find an alternative until you have enough dust for your initial setup. For now, you can get it by centrifuging various impure piles from your ores or by smelting ruby, sapphire, or green sapphire in an EBF with carbon. Check the EBF quest in the Multiblock Goals.

You will also need an EBF to turn the alumina into aluminium ingots. For that you need cryolite. Go visit the Twilight Forest for that and find a Cryolite vein. The related quest is "Lead, Galena, Silver and Cryolite" is the Novice Thaumaturgy tab.

Your second option is to use aluminium dust. However, you can not smelt that directly yet, even if you have an EBF. That will require higher heat levels. For now, you will have to either use a Tinker's Smeltery or a GT Compressor to turn the dust into raw aluminium which you can then smelt into ingots in the EBF.

By the time you've completed this, you'll probably be done with most of the tab, but you'll still need Good Circuits (MV) to actually open up the next tier if you haven't done that yet.

You might also want to check the Getting Around and Without Dying tabs for new unlocks.

[note]If you were exploring Twilight Forest before 2.1.1.4 you won't find any cryolite in existing veins. You'll need to explore new chunks.[/note]
data.title: §5§lGetting Ready for Tier 2, MV
data.tooltip:
Getting Ready for Tier 2, MV
Prequest requests:
Welcome to Tier 1, LV

data.name: Glue1
data.data:
To make Good Circuit Boards, you need either glue or refined glue.

You can obtain refined glue either by centrifuging sticky resin or distilling glue. Note that it is GT glue, not Tinkers' Construct glue.

Alternatively, you can extract glue from slime trees that you can obtain from slime islands in the sky.
data.title: §5§lGlue
data.tooltip:
Glue1
Prequest requests:
Molten Redstone?
Round and Round and Round...

data.name: Good Circuits
data.data:
Good circuits are an improvement on basic circuits. They're an MV-tier circuit, which is a component of all MV gregtech machines.

To open MV, you still need to make an EBF and do the Aluminium quest if you haven't already, since §oeverything§r needs aluminium.

This quest also opens the Project Red quests - one of the early automation options.
data.title: §5§lGood Circuits

data.name: Gotta Catch 'em All
data.data:
Sure, you can use wheat/potatoes/carrots to make animals follow you back to your base, but that can be tedious. A golden lasso is a proper solution for animal transportation.

You can use it for §oany§r passive mob, like for getting villagers back to base, or a horse across a river.
data.title: §5§lGotta Catch 'em All

data.name: GT MV Tank...Already?
data.data: These store 128,000L. The dark steel plates and LV pump make it a little annoying to make, since it needs an EBF.
data.title: §5§lGT MV Tank...Already?
data.tooltip:
GT MV Tank...Already?
Prequest requests:
GT Tanks, the LV Version
EBF-Time

data.name: GT Tanks, the LV Version
data.data: The next version of GT tanks stores 64,000L in a tank. It actually requires a pump this time, so it's a little expensive. Consider staying with your ULV ones if you only need basic I/O.
data.title: §5§lGT Tanks, the LV Version
data.tooltip:
GT Tanks, the LV Version
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Handle Resources Like a Bo$$ #1
data.data:
A feat of human engineering at your disposal!

This machine allows you to filter by machine recipe type and allows you to effortlessly set up automations. To use it simply put a machine of any type into the GUI to create a filter, e.g. a Macerator will allow the machine to only accept items that can be macerated. The same machine can be used to create an inverse filter (a button in the GUI) that will allow you to exclude all items that can be processed by that machine.
data.title: §5§6§l§5§lHandle Resources Like a Bo$$ #1
data.tooltip:
Handle Resources Like a Bo$$ #1
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #4

data.name: Handle Resources Like a Bo$$ #2
data.data:
A feat of human engineering at your disposal!

This machine allows you to filter 9 items, and will only output set batches. This allows you to automate processes such as electrolyzing that require different amounts of inputs that may clog the system otherwise.

[note]This will be particularly useful in MV once you unlock more electrolysis recipes![/note]
data.title: §5§6§l§5§lHandle Resources Like a Bo$$ #2
data.tooltip:
Handle Resources Like a Bo$$ #2
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #4

data.name: Handle Tiny Piles Like a K1ng
data.data:
Don't you hate having to manually compress all those tiny piles? Well, let me show you how to automate that. A combination of type filter, chest buffer (or super buffer in HV) and packager frees you from that annoying task. The chest buffer can hold up to 9 stacks of tiny piles and the super buffer can hold 256 stacks of tiny dusts, which is more than enough. You can set its mode with a screwdriver on the output side. Set it to 9 to export 9 tiny piles at a time and let the packager compress these into regular dusts.

Super buffers can be lag sources, so be careful to keep them as empty as possible. If you're using a multiblock packager, be sure to change the buffer from Stocking mode to Transfer Size mode.
data.title: §5§6§l§5§lHandle Tiny Piles Like a K1ng
data.tooltip:
Handle Tiny Piles Like a K1ng
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #4

data.name: Heavy Fuel1
data.data:
By adding Hydrogen to sulfuric Heavy Fuel in a Chemical Reactor you can produce Heavy Fuel, with a burn value of 360,000 EU per cell! Aside from this, it's also required for Diesel, in MV, which is a better fuel, and it can also be distilled into three very useful fluids: Benzene, Toluene and Phenol.

If you want to use Heavy Fuel as a power source, you will need Semi-Fluid generators, unlike Light Fuel and Diesel which use Combustion generators.

It's honestly not especially efficient to make Heavy Fuel out of regular Oil. You should try to get Heavy Oil to make it, like from Oilsands Ore in MV once you can. Then use it to make Diesel.
data.title: §5§lHeavy Fuel
data.tooltip:
Heavy Fuel1
Prequest requests:
H for Hydrogen... the Rest of the Alphabet is Too Complicated...
Heavy Sulfuric Fuel
C9H8O4...NaCl...H2O...

data.name: Heavy Sulfuric Fuel
data.data: You can distill your oil into heavy sulfuric fuel, that has a burn value of 80,000 EU.
data.title: §5§lHeavy Sulfuric Fuel
data.tooltip:
Heavy Sulfuric Fuel
Prequest requests:
Your Oil is Too Crude? Refine it!

data.name: Hello Baron, How's Your Black Gold Today?
data.data:
During your travels you may have seen some huge oil spouts. Now's the time to make a pump and go collect this black gold into tanks. Oil can be burned directly in a combustion generator (onsite to power the pump, perhaps?) or be refined for better fuels and crafting materials.

Bring a generator or battery buffer (with full batteries obviously) with you to power the pump. Thanks to the advancement of technology the pump can auto output on top. Stacking multiple pumps makes them work faster. In that case, oil has to be removed from the bottom of the stack using a pump cover or other means like a conduit.

Taller spouts have more oil. But for the LV pump, it's better to use the short spouts if possible since it doesn't have enough range to fully collect the larger ones in the horizontal range. Save the taller spouts for MV or HV pumps.

Mining pipes are needed for pumping the oil, same as the auto miner. When it hits the bottom (or something in the way), if there's no fluid left to collect, it will start retracting the pipes. Same thing if you disable it with a soft mallet. You can also change the range with a screwdriver if there's a reason to do that, like collecting lava in a limited area faster.

These are GT machines, so remember to protect them (and their power sources!) from rain on all sides. And set a waypoint with JourneyMaps so you don't forget where you placed it!

[note]Once you run out of surface oil, you'll want to turn to:
1) Oilsands ore, though this is better suited for making heavy oil
2) Making oil from logs in a pyrolyze oven
4) Bacterial Vat (EV+)
5) Crops
6) Bees
7) Underground (UG) oil. Dimensions generally have a couple fluids that can be accessed with a multiblock version of the pump, available in MV+[/note]

[note]Heavy oil cannot be used until MV for anything except lubricant and burning in semifluid generator since it requires MV distillery.[/note]
data.title: §5§lHello Baron, How's Your Black Gold Today?
data.tooltip:
Hello Baron, How's Your Black Gold Today?
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This #2

data.name: Here's Some Oil
data.data:
[note]Here the oil questlines diverge into two tabs - part about getting every possible output is in the LV tab, part about the usefulness of oil is in the Working with Oil tab, this quest is part of the latter.[/note]

Welcome! This is the questline that shows the path through oil processing towards all the useful items and fluids that can be obtained from it. Working with this black liquid involves a lot of steps that range from LV (Low Voltage), all the way to IV (Insane Voltage), and outputs that are useful at those tiers and beyond.

Oil is useful both for generating power, and to automate a lot of chemicals that are important for progression. As you progress, you will be able to get more of it, and get it faster, as well as process it in new ways that improve on the setup that you were using before. It is not a required path for progression in the pack, but it is a very useful one, should you choose to follow it.

The best way to start working with oil is to extract it from the surface. Oil spouts are visible without having to dig down, and they can be interacted with by using a Pump placed above them, alongside a generator that feeds it some power. You can use some of the Oil to generate this power for now.
