data.name: Acetic Acid
data.data: Acetic acid can be made out of Oxygen and Ethylene. Alternatively, it can be made out of Biomass, Wood Vinegar or Vinegar. It is an important part of making Ethenone on your way to Cetane-Boosted Diesel.
data.title: §6§lAcetic Acid

data.name: Advanced Centrifuge
data.data: The MV centrifuge is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power.
data.title: §6§lAdvanced Centrifuge

data.name: Advanced Circuits
data.data:
Finally, the HV circuit! To make it, you need good integrated circuits, RAM, an integrated logic circuit, and transistors.

By the way, circuits get cheaper to make as you go along, but not till HV.
data.title: §6§lAdvanced Circuits

data.name: Advanced Compressor
data.data: The MV compressor is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power.
data.title: §6§lAdvanced Compressor

data.name: Advanced Fluid Extractor
data.data:
The MV fluid extractor is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power.

To make bio diesel you need seed oil or fish oil. Seeds give seed oil and fish produce fish oil when placed in a fluid extractor.
data.title: §6§lAdvanced Fluid Extractor

data.name: Advanced Macerator
data.data: The MV macerator is twice as fast as the LV one but uses 4x the power.
data.title: §6§lAdvanced Macerator

data.name: All the Crops You Could Want
data.data:
Tired of applying bone meal or fertilizer by hand? A sprinkler can take water and boost your crop growth rate. Bone meal or fertilizer will make it work even faster.

[note]Note that the sprinkler does not work with IC2 crops.[/note]
data.title: §6§lAll the Crops You Could Want
data.tooltip:
All the Crops You Could Want
Prequest requests:
Come to the Dark Side...

data.name: All Those Chunks, All in a Row
data.data:
Sometimes you don't want a 3x3 area chunkloaded, but a long straight line instead. This can be handy for rail lines or power lines going across long distances. An anchor sentinel can perform this function. Right-click on a chunk loader with a crowbar, and it will activate. Go in any straight line from the chunkloader and place the anchor and hit it with the crowbar. Those chunks, up to 25x1, will now remain loaded.

This will draw an amount of chunkloader time relative to the 9 chunk area normally loaded. If for some reason you wanted only a 1 chunk area loaded, this will extend the time. Stock up on those pearls or server coins!
data.title: §6§lAll Those Chunks, All in a Row
data.tooltip:
All Those Chunks, All in a Row
Prequest requests:
Passive Chunkloading

data.name: All We Are is Dust in the Wind
data.data: Looking for an alternative to flowing water for your mobfarm? Use a fan to blow mobs or items where you want. Apply a redstone signal to activate.
data.title: §6§lAll We Are is Dust in the Wind
data.tooltip:
All We Are is Dust in the Wind
Prequest requests:
MV Motor

data.name: A New Alloy, Soularium
data.data: There are some... "Darker" uses for machines. Stuff that might be considered "magic". Anyway, for that you need a new alloy: Soularium.
data.title: §6§lA New Alloy, Soularium

data.name: Are You Prepared For HV?
data.data:
Stainless steel will be the tier material for HV. Use an MV mixer to produce the dust.

Manganese can be acquired as ore byproducts from spessartine, pyrolusite and tantalite ore. You can also pull them apart to get even more. Alternatively you can take apart Red Garnet dusts. If you get desperate, you can buy some ore from the Coins tab.

Chrome can be electrolyzed out of ruby dust. You can get ruby dust from redstone if the ruby in redstone veins isn't enough.
data.title: §6§lAre You Prepared For HV?
data.tooltip:
Are You Prepared For HV?
Prequest requests:
Mixing at MV level

data.name: A Soul Vessel
data.data:
The Soul Vial is used later in HV Ender IO machines. For now though you may find it convenient to deal with....troublesome mobs. The Soul Vial is reusable. Just right-click any living entity to steal its soul. Right-click again to release it in the environment.

The possibilities swirl in your head...
data.title: §6§lA Soul Vessel
data.tooltip:
A Soul Vessel
Prequest requests:
A New Alloy, Soularium

data.name: Auto Mining MV
data.data: The MV miner will find ores for you faster than the LV miner, and in a larger range. It also has a larger fortune bonus, great for gathering small ores in the Nether. Plus it's faster, but I'm sure you figured that.
data.title: §6§lAuto Mining MV
data.tooltip:
Auto Mining MV
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #6

data.name: Avengers, Assemble! 2
data.data: Time to make the MV version of the assembler.
data.title: §6§lAvengers, Assemble! 2
data.tooltip:
Avengers, Assemble! 2
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #4
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #1

data.name: BEEEP BEEEP BEEEP
data.data:
Knowing that your cleanroom needs maintenance is pretty important. Instead of just turning on a light, why not use a howler alarm? It'll notify you up to 128 blocks away.

[warn]Warning: May cause uncontrollable urine leakage when activated.[/warn]
data.title: §6§lBEEEP BEEEP BEEEP
data.tooltip:
BEEEP BEEEP BEEEP
Prequest requests:
Where's That Handyman When You Need Him?

data.name: Better Tools
data.data: Now that you have an MV extruder you can make the next level of Tinker Tools - Vanadiumsteel head parts with Damascus Steel rods.
data.title: §6§lBetter Tools

data.name: Bio Chaff
data.data: Plant mass needs to be centrifuged into bio chaff, the base material to make biomass.
data.title: §6§lBio Chaff

data.name: Bio Diesel Fuel
data.data: With ethanol or methanol and seed oil or fish oil you can make bio diesel. Its burn value is 320,000 EU per cell, less than regular diesel, but more renewable. Diesel or bio diesel are needed for cetane-boosted diesel.
data.title: §6§lBio Diesel Fuel
data.tooltip:
Bio Diesel Fuel
Prequest requests:
Seed Oil
Sodium Hydroxide1
Fish Oil
Methanol
Ethanol1

data.name: Bio Fuels
data.data:
You've been using steam, creosote, and possibly oil plus their byproducts to generate power. It's time to start making bio diesel. The first step is to make plant balls out of organic materials. You can use wheat, sugarcane, apples, saplings or, well, practically anything. Indigo blossoms are 4:1 and unlike the rest of the IC2 crops with the same ratio, not really useful for anything else. Realistically, you'll probably just use saplings though, since you'll want/need a tree farm anyway.

Be sure you have a Forestry multifarm, Steve's Carts Farm, IC2 Crop Sticks with a harvester, or whatever, because you need plenty of bio materials for constant bio diesel production.
data.title: §6§lBio Fuels

data.name: Biomass
data.data:
Chose the IC2 or the gregtech way to make biomass. Water and Bio Chaff is needed.

You can also use the pyrolyze oven to make biomass in a more efficient way if you make it.

Note that forestry has its own biomass as well. It can also be made into fermented biomass like this kind. Choose which kind you want to make later on yourself.
data.title: §5§6§lBiomass
data.tooltip:
Biomass
Prequest requests:
Way One: IC2 Fluid Canner
Way Three: Pyrolyse Oven
Way Two: Brewery

data.name: Bio Organic Mesh
data.data:
If you want to save the environment you can autoclave 16 plantballs to get raw bio fiber with the following liquids:

Biomass 33% chance
Methanol 50% chance
Fuel 90% chance
Nitro-diesel 100% chance

§rHowever, making carbon plates this way will require an electric blast furnace.
data.title: §6§lBio Organic Mesh

data.name: Borax Electrolyzing
data.data: Now that you have an MV Electrolyzer, you can extract Boron from Borax. This element is used later on for Borosilicate Glass and fiber, but for now you can use it to make some volumetric flasks to hold precise amounts. This is handy for recipes that may only need a tiny amount of a substance, like 1L.
data.title: §6§lBorax Electrolyzing

data.name: Brewing Liquids
data.data:
This machine is not only capable of brewing more powerful burnable liquids, it can also be used to brew nutrient distillation, which might have further usage soon™.

Note that you get different ratios depending on what item you use for recipes that allow alternates. Use what you like.
data.title: §6§lBrewing Liquids

data.name: Caging a Demon - Wither Killing Chamber
data.data:
Ever wanted to trap a wither but the only option was non movable bedrock? Now that you've made dark steel you can get reinforced obsidian which is wither-proof. Useful for manual killing and even automation once you get a powered spawner supplying you with wither skeleton skulls.

[note]Hint: Unlike vanilla obsidian, reinforced obsidian CAN be moved by pistons which might come in handy.[/note]
data.title: §6§lCaging a Demon - Wither Killing Chamber
data.tooltip:
Caging a Demon - Wither Killing Chamber
Prequest requests:
Come to the Dark Side...

data.name: Carbon Plates
data.data: Carbon plates are used for a bunch of stuff, including eventually the nanosuit. Go check out the armor chapter.
data.title: §7§6§lCarbon Plates

data.name: Chemical Dehydrator
data.data:
Dehydrate your grapes to raisins. Or make some Styrene, Benzene or Ethylene at MV. Either way, this device is a nice to have.

It also does the Drying Rack recipes as well.
data.title: §6§lChemical Dehydrator
data.tooltip:
Chemical Dehydrator
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #4

data.name: Chemical Lesson, Part Two
data.data: More advanced recipes need an MV chemical reactor. It also speeds up your existing recipes.
data.title: §6§lChemical Lesson, Part Two

data.name: Clay Electrolyzing
data.data:
If you looked through NEI you may have found out that electrolyzing clay dust will give you Alumina, Silicon Dioxide, Sodium, and Lithium dust. And water, but you're probably just voiding that already, right? There are plenty of stained clay blocks found in canyon, mesa, lush desert biomes or several to a couple dozen on mountains that can be pulverized to clay dust.

There are more ways to get alumina now that you're in MV, enough that it's basically worthless by the time you get to EV.
data.title: §6§lClay Electrolyzing

data.name: Come to the Dark Side...
data.data: ...we have cookies.
data.title: §5§6§lCome to the Dark Side...
data.tooltip:
Come to the Dark Side...
Prequest requests:
IO, IO, It's Off to EnderIO We Go

data.name: Conduits
data.data:
Probably the most awesome way to transport just about anything in multiple different ways. Get some conduits of each type. Higher tiers of each (except item) exist.

[note]There's also ME conduits for when you can do that.[/note]
data.title: §6§lConduits
data.tooltip:
Conduits
Prequest requests:
IO, IO, It's Off to EnderIO We Go
Avengers, Assemble! 2

data.name: Coolant
data.data:
Make your first coolant out of water or distilled water and lapis dust in an MV mixer.

Using distilled water lets you save on lapis while also speeding up the process by a lot.

[note]If you don't use distilled water, you will need a lot more than 8 lapis dust.[/note]
data.title: §6§lCoolant

data.name: Cooling Kanthal
data.data: Hot Kanthal ingots can be cooled down in an MV Chemical Bath.
data.title: §6§lCooling Kanthal
data.tooltip:
Cooling Kanthal
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #2
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #1

data.name: Cough Cough - Something Needs to Be Done About the Smell
data.data:
Birds falling out of the sky, fish dead and floating belly up in the rivers, acid rain melting the ground...Time to start picking up the trash and cleaning up the air. Small black steel turbines should be fine for now. You'll need two amps of steady power to keep the scrubber working.

The detector's setting can be changed by clicking on the +/- texture with a screwdriver. Also, in general, better (and larger) turbines work better at cleaning up pollution. The code is too complex to fully explain here, but that's basically it. More EU turbine = more pollution cleaning turbine.

[warn]This quest covers one method of combating pollution - there are others, including not making as much to begin with.[/warn]
data.title: §6§lCough Cough - Something Needs to Be Done About the Smell
data.tooltip:
Cough Cough - Something Needs to Be Done About the Smell
Prequest requests:
Stainless Taking Too Long?

data.name: Creative Flight With MagLev
data.data:
Getting annoyed trying to reach pipes and conduits around your base? Look no further than the §5§lMagLev Harness§r!

With the MagLev, you can have creative flight whenever you are within range of a MagLev Pylon and have the Harness equip.

This will work even when unpowered, however the range of the Pylon gets doubled when it's given §21A§r of it's corresponding tier of power. The MagLev will only draw power while you are in-range, not passively. A Harness can only be tethered to one Pylon at a time, but a Pylon can attach to any number of Harnesses. Will only consume 1A §nregardless§r of how many Harnesses are tethered to the Pylon§r.

[note]Check the tooltip to see the range of your chosen Pylon, the MV one has a maximum range of 16 (33 x 33 x 33) when powered![/note]
data.title: §6§lCreative Flight With MagLev

data.name: Dark Steel Chest
data.data:
After embracing the dark side you get access to the new even bigger dark steel chest... perhaps another upgrade will be available in the future?

[note]Just as with the previous chests you can also upgrade with a fitting upgrade item.[/note]
data.title: §5§6§lDark Steel Chest
data.tooltip:
Dark Steel Chest
Prequest requests:
Diamond Chests... Ooo, Shiny
Come to the Dark Side...

data.name: Dark Steel Pipes
data.data:
Dark steel pipes are much better than the bronze, steel, or potin pipes you might have been using. Make sure your wrench can handle mining level 3 or you can't deconstruct them.

[note]If you don't need these, just recycle them to get the materials back. Not everything needs ginormous pipes or high heat tolerance.[/note]
data.title: §5§6§lDark Steel Pipes
data.tooltip:
Dark Steel Pipes
Prequest requests:
Come to the Dark Side...

data.name: Dark Steel Tools
data.data:
There are also tools made of dark steel. Each of them can receive upgrades. Hold shift to get the tooltip which will explain what you need in order to upgrade them.

These tools can also be enchanted like vanilla tools.

The Ender will increase wither skull and ender pearl drops. It can be upgraded to teleport the player.

Dark shears can be empowered, and then will shear a large area, including leaves. Handy for clearing away that giant redwood! Maybe you will find other uses for it.

The axe, once empowered, can be recharged wirelessly while in farming station.

The pick? Well, it can mine cobalt I guess if you haven't gotten a tool capable of that yet. You could keep it around to use for base decorations if your normal pick is too fast, I suppose.
data.title: §6§lDark Steel Tools
data.tooltip:
Dark Steel Tools
Prequest requests:
Come to the Dark Side...

data.name: Did You Run Low On Gold or Redstone?
data.data:
Did you run low on redstone and/or gold? It's no problem with a glowstone flower farm. You can centrifuge glowstone dust to redstone and gold dust. Redstone is also a good source of chrome. You'll need tons of gold for HV, so it's a good idea to set this up before then.

[note]There are actually a couple plants that produce glowstone, pick the one you like![/note]
data.title: §6§lDid You Run Low On Gold or Redstone?
data.tooltip:
Did You Run Low On Gold or Redstone?
Prequest requests:
Advanced Centrifuge

data.name: Diesel Fuel
data.data: If you get an MV mixer, you can mix your light and heavy fuel together to give diesel. At 480,000 per cell, this turns 1,885,000 EU into 2,880,000, not accounting for how much you spent to get it, so it's definitely worth it.
data.title: §6§lDiesel Fuel
data.tooltip:
Diesel Fuel
Prequest requests:
Light Fuel1
Heavy Fuel1
Mixing at MV level

data.name: Do You Feel Unlucky?
data.data:
Well not anymore! With some emeralds and a blank book, I'll give you a Fortune I book you can use in your printing press. Once you've duplicated it, you can combine the 2 Fortune I books in an anvil to get a Fortune II. Duplicate the Fortune II books to get a Fortune III!

With a Fortune III book and a tier-specific item you can remove the trash item rewards from your loot bags. More good stuff!

Soulbound is another good enchantment, it will keep an enchanted item in your inventory in case of death.
data.title: §6§lDo You Feel Unlucky?
data.tooltip:
Do You Feel Unlucky?
Prequest requests:
Gut-Enough For You? Bet You Thought Newspapers Were Dead!

data.name: Electrolyzing All the Things
data.data:
Collected a lot of dusts you can't do anything with since you started with macerating, washing and centrifuging ores? It's finally time to get all the useful materials out of them.

This machine is §overy §o§rimportant for your MV progression. If you find a biome with tons of Stained or Hardened Clay, you can process it here, plus some other machines, into Sodium, Lithium, Silicon, Aluminium and Oxygen!
data.title: §6§lElectrolyzing All the Things

data.name: Empty Plastic Board
data.data:
Plastic circuit boards require a plastic plate with Sulfuric Acid to make an Empty Board. By adding copper foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft a plastic circuit board. Later on you can make them more efficiently.

[note]PCBs are used in the circuits in HV tier.[/note]
data.title: §6§lEmpty Plastic Board

data.name: Ethanol1
data.data: Ethanol has a burn value of 192,000 EU per cell can be used to make bio diesel and other fluids.
data.title: §6§lEthanol

data.name: Ethenone
data.data:
Hopefully you saved some sulfuric acid. If not, make some more. Together with acetic acid you can make ethenone.

Save the ethenone for HV, you'll need it to make tetranitromethane for cetane boosted diesel.
data.title: §6§lEthenone

data.name: Ethylene
data.data:
You can make ethylene several different ways

- Ethanol and sulfuric acid in a Chemical Reactor
- Ethanol in a Chemical Dehydrator
- Distilling various gases (i.e. wood gas) in a Distillery
- Obtain it from Oil in the Working with Oil tab

[note]You will need much more than 4 cells later on so keep that in mind.[/note]
data.title: §6§lEthylene

data.name: Even Rarer Earths
data.data:
Rare Earth processing may have been ignored, but you believe your new Dehydrator can finally make it worthwhile. First, you need to use some Sulfuric Acid to melt off any impurities in a Chemical Bath, leaving you with Crushed Rare Earth (I). After that you need to process it like a normal ore until you get Rare Earth (I) Dust.

After running the Dust through your Dehydrator, you get a number of strange materials, only some of which you recognize. But if you run these materials through an Electrolyzer or through the Dehydrator again, you may get some use out of them. Some of them may take quite a few to do so, but you §o§o§r§h§ohave§r been stockpiling, right? You'll need 204 Rare Earth.

You believe if you had more powerful acids and machines, you could extract even more valuable materials out of the Rare Earth.
data.title: §6§lEven Rarer Earths

data.name: Extrude All the Things
data.data:
Now that you've hit MV tier, it's time to get a better ratio when making rods, pipes, wires, plates and many more parts. Most extruder recipes use more than 32 EU/t so you need an MV extruder. After crafting the machine you need extruder shapes for the different types of parts you will want to make.

There are a few more shapes than the ones listed here. Make sure to have a look.

[note]Most of the Tinkers Gregworks tool parts are made in the extruder. They also have long extrusion times to balance out their usefulness.[/note]
data.title: §6§lExtrude All the Things
data.tooltip:
Extrude All the Things
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3

data.name: Fermented Biomass1
data.data: Fermenting your biomass allows you to get more products out of it like methanol, ethanol, ammonia, etc.
data.title: §6§lFermented Biomass

data.name: Firestone Ore/Dust
data.data:
Firestone ore is used to make some BC machines like the filler, and some other stuff. Unfortunately, it's in the nether...at the bottom of the lava ocean!

Here are some tips for finding it:

-Firestone only spawns in deep lava, at least 6 deep. It will only replace netherrack, so a fjord filled with soulsand won't have any. Can you think of ways to check the lava depth, and what's down there?
-Alternatively, if you keep your head at just the correct height above the lava and at the correct angle, you'll be able to see underneath it - surely there must be a hovering jetpack?
-...or just look for the biome when your cursor is over the JM map. Hell is the default one that has netherrack.

Firestone can be mined with the GT miners, if you place it within horizontal range. Firestone ore and products will cause random fires to start nearby, so get it into a backpack quickly!
data.title: §6§lFirestone Ore/Dust

data.name: Fire Water
data.data: Too bad, you can't drink it. When used in the Combustion Generator, it will produce 80 RF/t.
data.title: §6§lFire Water

data.name: First Kanthal
data.data: You made your first Kanthal ingots. It's time to make some more to upgrade your Electric Blast Furnace.
data.title: §6§lFirst Kanthal

data.name: Fish Oil
data.data:
Got Fish?

[note]There are rumors of a weird crop in the shape of a fish...

Otherwise look under Fishing Farming Cooking tab for fish catching options.[/note]
data.title: §6§lFish Oil

data.name: Fluid Solidifier
data.data:
Use molds to make plates, sticks, bolts and many more item parts in the fluid solidifier.

Molds are != to Extruder shapes. You're gonna need 2 sets. If they're too expensive, just make the most important ones for now.
data.title: §6§lFluid Solidifier
data.tooltip:
Fluid Solidifier
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #2

data.name: Glycerol
data.data:
Glycerol is a byproduct of making bio diesel, but it's really useful too. It's used to make epoxid in EV, and for making dynamite, I guess. Both TNT and iTNT are better though.

[note]PS: You don't actually need dynamite, and epoxid can be made another way, if you don't want to make bio diesel forever/at all.[/note]
data.title: §6§lGlycerol

data.name: Good Integrated Circuits
data.data: By the way, did you ever try looking at the oredict for circuits? You can tell what tier they are from that. They go: Primitive (ULV), Basic (LV), Good (MV), Advanced (HV), etc. Now make your Good Integrated Circuits.
data.title: §6§lGood Integrated Circuits

data.name: Grinding Heads Are Better Than None
data.data: While the SAG mill will work with no grinding heads, flint heads only save a little power. If you want to exploit the true capability of the SAG mill, you want to use Diamond or Tungsten grinding heads. Craft me a Diamond head and I'll give you a Tungsten one as a reward.
data.title: §6§lGrinding Heads Are Better Than None
data.tooltip:
Grinding Heads Are Better Than None
Prequest requests:
Ore Processing, Kind Of...

data.name: GT Tanks, HV Tank
data.data: This one stores 256,000L. The ULV circuits make it annoying to craft, so make them only if you need them. This is the last of the Voltage Tier ones, after this is the Super Tanks, which you can actually make right now.
data.title: §6§lGT Tanks, HV Tank
data.tooltip:
GT Tanks, HV Tank
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #2

data.name: Gut-Enough For You? Bet You Thought Newspapers Were Dead!
data.data:
When used together, the Typesetting Table and Printing Press allow you to duplicate enchanted books. You'll need a lot of XP, so either build a mob grinder or get farming. A Fortune III book, for example, requires 40 levels to convert into an enchanted plate.

To use the §lTypesetting Table§r, place a print press chase in the top slot and an enchanted book in the bottom left slot. Sneak right-click the enchanted book to convert it into an enchanted plate if you have enough XP.

To use the §lPrinting Press§r, place an enchanted plate in the center of the machine, ink sacs on the top metal plate, and books on the bottom left side of the counter. It immediately starts processing without any power or redstone signal.

Wearing Reading Glasses, Tinted Glasses, or a Monocle will display more information about these blocks when looking at them.

Each enchanted plate can make three enchanted books before breaking, but the trick is to make two books and then repair it in a Thaumic Restorer for unlimited uses.

[note]You'll need some Thaumium ingots. You can get into Thaumcraft, find some in a chest, or try breeding the Magic Metal Berry IC2 crop.[/note]
data.title: §6§lGut-Enough For You? Bet You Thought Newspapers Were Dead!
data.tooltip:
Gut-Enough For You? Bet You Thought Newspapers Were Dead!
Prequest requests:
MV Motor

data.name: Hangover From All That Glue?
data.data: Surface-mount devices are more advanced circuits parts. They're needed for the EV tier+ circuit line and are cheaper to craft than the basic versions, if you have the right materials. You need an MV Assembler and some molten polyethylene. For now, resistors are probably the only ones you can make with any ease.
data.title: §6§lHangover From All That Glue?
data.tooltip:
Hangover From All That Glue?
Prequest requests:
Molten Polyethylene
Avengers, Assemble! 2

data.name: HCL
data.data:
More than just a byproduct of your Sodium Persulfate production. HCl becomes important for Epoxid in HV/EV tier. You can also use it to process bee combs.

You can also make it directly from Hydrogen and Chlorine.
data.title: §6§lHCL

data.name: Hootch
data.data: The lowest tier of renewable, burnable fluid. Generates 60 RF/t, but can be automated for "green" infinite power.
data.title: §6§lHootch

data.name: ILC and RAM
data.data:
Advanced circuits need integrated logic circuits and random access memory chips.
You can get those by cutting the ILC and RAM wafers.
data.title: §6§lILC and RAM
data.tooltip:
ILC and RAM
Prequest requests:
MV Precision Laser Engraver

data.name: Improving Conduits
data.data:
Conduits on their own are pretty awesome, but you can do better. By using filters and speed upgrades, you gain even more control over what they do and how fast they work.

[note]PS: You can't make all of these right now.[/note]
data.title: §6§lImproving Conduits

data.name: I need a drink. And more Chrome.
data.data:
The most efficient way to process Ruby Ore. Better than electrolysis.

[note]Check out NEI for similar processes based on Sapphire and Green Sapphire.[/note]
data.title: §6§lI need a drink. And more Chrome.
data.tooltip:
I need a drink. And more Chrome.
Prequest requests:
Sodium Hydroxide1
Advanced Centrifuge
Mixing at MV level

data.name: Integrated Circuit
data.data: In order to make HV machines, you need HV circuits. The first one you can make is the Advanced Circuit from IC2. You'll need to make LV circuits to make MV circuits to make the HV circuits. Yay for recursive crafting! Start with the LV Integrated Logic Circuit. And no, you can't use the IC2 Electronic Circuits.
data.title: §6§lIntegrated Circuit
data.tooltip:
Integrated Circuit
Prequest requests:
ILC and RAM
Basic Circuit Assembler

data.name: IO, IO, It's Off to EnderIO We Go
data.data: You've probably used EnderIO before. It's quite useful for a lot of things. But the recipes are different and it's not as useful for some things like ore processing. Let's go through what it has to offer. Note that the other half is in HV.
data.title: §6§lIO, IO, It's Off to EnderIO We Go
data.tooltip:
IO, IO, It's Off to EnderIO We Go
Prequest requests:
MV Motor

data.name: Iron (III) Chloride1
data.data:
Iron (III) Chloride can be made by first making hydrochloric acid out of hydrogen and chlorine. Then combine this with some iron dust to make Iron(III) Chloride.
You can etch your board with it.
data.title: §6§lIron (III) Chloride

data.name: Large Aluminium Fluid Cells
data.data: 512 buckets in a stack not cutting it? Aluminium cells can hold 32 buckets per cell, and stack to 64. 2,048 buckets in a single stack? That's half a supertank!
data.title: §6§lLarge Aluminium Fluid Cells

data.name: Machine Chassis
data.data: All EnderIO machines still require the basic chassis, and it's almost the same recipe as before; Except that you need plates instead of ingots. But that shouldn't be a problem at all...
data.title: §6§lMachine Chassis

data.name: Make a better Distillery
data.data: To produce methanol and ethanol much faster, craft a mv distillery.
data.title: §6§lMake a better Distillery

data.name: Making Things Pretty
data.data:
While conduits on their own are already awesome, you can also hide them if you want. There are 2 types of facades, basic and hardened. While basic ones are simple and easy, the reinforced ones are able to withstand explosions and mining with tools. You have to use your Yeta Wrench to remove it.

You'll have to paint your facades in the Painting Machine first - place the block you want them to look like where the paintbrush is, and the facade on the left. Of course, the Painting Machine needs to be powered.
data.title: §6§lMaking Things Pretty

data.name: Methane Gas
data.data: Methane gas has a burn value of 104,000 EU per cell and can be burned in the gas turbine.
data.title: §6§lMethane Gas

data.name: Methanol
data.data: Methanol has a burn value of 84,000 EU per cell and can be used to make bio diesel and other fluids. It's also used to make certain rocket fuels.
data.title: §6§lMethanol

data.name: Mixing at MV level
data.data: MV Mixer is needed to progress toward HV. It also unlocks Diesel, more efficient fuel.
data.title: §6§lMixing at MV level

data.name: Molten Plastic
data.data: Molten polyethylene can be made in a chemical reactor using ethylene, compressed air cells or oxygen - using oxygen gives a 50% boost. Use a mold for making plates in a fluid solidifier to make plastic sheets.
data.title: §6§lMolten Plastic

data.name: Molten Polyethylene
data.data:
Polyethylene is made out of ethylene and oxygen in a chemical reactor. Molten Polyethylene cells hold 144L, perfect for 1 ingot or plate.
If you want precise amounts, you can use a Volumetric Flask once you electrolyze some Boron from Borax.

You §omay§r have started getting damaged from holding the cells. If you have, put your glove baubles back on. All Molten cells cause damage and store 144L. Mostly, Molten cells come from metal-type materials, or stuff that was melted. Excuse me, §oFluid Extracted§r, whatever that's supposed to mean.

Notice some leftovers? Try using the plunger, or if you have the materials, you can use 12 ethylene cells and 84 oxygen cells to make exactly 125 cells of polyethylene.
data.title: §6§lMolten Polyethylene

data.name: Monocrystalline Silicon Boules
data.data: To make wafers, you need to make monocrystalline silicon boules first. The process takes 450 seconds and requires solar grade silicon dust and a small gallium arsenide crystal in the electric blast furnace. You can make 16 wafers out of every boule.
data.title: §6§lMonocrystalline Silicon Boules
data.tooltip:
Monocrystalline Silicon Boules
Prequest requests:
Gallium Arsenide Crystal
Silicon Solar Grade

data.name: MV Advanced Steam Boiler
data.data: The MV GT++ Steam Boiler is the next machine you can make to produce steam efficiently. It regulates its fuel more efficiently if it ends up being full.
data.title: §5§l§6§lMV Advanced Steam Boiler
data.tooltip:
MV Advanced Steam Boiler
Prequest requests:
Stainless Steel EBF processing

data.name: MV Bending
data.data:
This Plate Bending Machine allows you to directly make double, triple or more compressed plates, which might be useful for your first rocket in HV Tier.

It also allows you to make dense plates at all.
data.title: §6§lMV Bending
data.tooltip:
MV Bending
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3

data.name: MV Energy Hatch
data.data:
Some materials like stainless steel require 480 EU/t. Your LV hatches are not good enough. Craft a minimum of two MV hatches to upgrade your electric blast furnace to HV.

[note]BTW, if a Multiblock's recipe is 1EU over 1A for that tier, you must use a second energy hatch for it to use 2A or more.[/note]
data.title: §6§lMV Energy Hatch
data.tooltip:
MV Energy Hatch
Prequest requests:
Lubricant2
Ultra Low Power IC
EBF-Time

data.name: MV Motor
data.data: Most machines in MV need a motor as well. If you haven't built a polarizer already, go craft one. MV motors need magnetic steel rods and aluminium rods, 2x cupronickel wires and copper cables.
data.title: §6§lMV Motor

data.name: MV Precision Laser Engraver
data.data: Advanced circuits need an MV precision laser engraver. Let's craft one.
data.title: §6§lMV Precision Laser Engraver
data.tooltip:
MV Precision Laser Engraver
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #5
Silicon Wafer

data.name: MV Superconductors (128 EU/t)
data.data:
How about lossless 128 EU Wires? Pentacadmiummagnesiumhexaoxide is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss. Every Voltage going forward has a superconductor wire with zero loss.

Mix Cadmium, Magnesium and Oxygen in an MV mixer. Next, the base dust needs an EBF with Kanthal Coils to be smelted. A vacuum freezer is also required to cool it down. Make some MV Superconductor Base Wires and use an Assembler to combine these wires with Helium, Stainless Steel pipes and MV pumps to get your 128 EU/t superconductor wires.

[note]Whether these are worth it to save a little power or not is up to you of course. Also note that although they're wires, you aren't hurt by coming into contact with them.[/note]
data.title: §6§lMV Superconductors (128 EU/t)
data.tooltip:
MV Superconductors (128 EU/t)
Prequest requests:
Stainless Steel EBF processing
More Heat - Kanthal Coil Upgrade

data.name: O like Oxygen
data.data:
Oxygen can be made in lots of different ways. Most commonly you'll either electrolyze it out of cassiterite sand, sugar from sugar canes or sugar beets, water, or various other oxygen-rich dusts, or centrifuge it from brown or yellow limonite dust.

Later on, water electrolyzing or air centrifuging is probably going to be your main source.
data.title: §6§lO like Oxygen
data.tooltip:
O like Oxygen
Prequest requests:
Electrolyzing All the Things

data.name: One in a Million
data.data: Or 4? Need to store ludicrous amounts of cobble? Stone dust? Saplings? Super chests are the thing to use. A Super Chest I can store 4 million items, worry free. You will need to take items out manually 64 at a time, or use conveyors etc. to extract them.
data.title: §6§lOne in a Million

data.name: Ore Processing, Kind Of...
data.data:
The endless war between macerators and SAG mills rages on eternally, so why does it matter which one you choose?

HV Macerators are still required for the final byproducts on many ore chains, but a SAG mill still shines through with upgraded grinding heads! SAG mills are perfect machine for getting the most from your ores without using bees and crops. You can get bonus outputs with tungsten grinding heads, but that doesn't mean you can dupe materials (like ingots) with it. Plus for many of them you'll get the final output directly without any need for further processing. Handy for processing Redstone to get Chrome!

It's great for lead, copper, tin, silver, nickel, redstone, ruby, lapis, certus quartz, and malachite ores. Other ores will give you better outputs as well if you use a good enough head.

Even coal, charcoal, bones, wheat, ender pearls, and charcoal non-ores will give bonus outputs.

That said, the GT ones are still way faster later on.
data.title: §6§lOre Processing, Kind Of...

data.name: Organic Way
data.data: Bio carbon plates are made out of raw carbon mesh. Put it in the electric blast furnace to make carbon plates.
data.title: §6§lOrganic Way

data.name: Passive Chunkloading
data.data:
Using the MV bender you can finally press dense plates. So let's craft a passive chunkloader. It will also load a 3x3 chunk area. You need ender pearls or coins to power the chunkloader.

Passive anchors will run for 1 hour off of an ender pearl, and a varying amount depending on the coin used.

§aPersonal Anchors§r are loaded once the owner visits, and stay loaded while the player is logged in.

§9Passive Anchors§r are loaded once the owner visits, and stay loaded until the server resets.

[warn]World Anchors[/warn] are always loaded, even after a server reset.
data.title: §6§lPassive Chunkloading

data.name: Pipes, Pipes Everywhere
data.data:
Now that you're in MV, you'll want to start automating processes. Polyethylene, Oxygen, Nitrogen, Hydrogen, Rubber, Charcoal, etc. Faster item pipes will help with transporting items quicker around your base. For now, use your spiffy new extruder to craft some brass item pipes.

The reward - restrictive item pipes - allow you to prioritize destinations. Locations on the other side of a restrictive pipe are treated as much further away than locations on the same side of a pipe. Very handy when you want overflow (or non-matching) items to go somewhere else!

For higher tiers, look up "item pipe" in NEI, or just look at the spreadsheet.
data.title: §6§lPipes, Pipes Everywhere
data.tooltip:
Pipes, Pipes Everywhere
Prequest requests:
Extrude All the Things

data.name: Plantballs
data.data:
Next you should compress plantballs out of your wheat.

The MV compressor is twice as fast as the LV. You might think this means using it is a good idea. Well, it depends. Remember it also uses 4x the power. This means you spend 2x the EU in total to get the same amount of EU out. If you overclock too much in your fuel production setup, you end up with an EU deficit! Overclocking once is usually well worth it though.

Eventually you want to use multiblocks for better speeds and efficiency!
data.title: §6§lPlantballs

data.name: Plant Mass
data.data: Macerate the plantballs down to plant mass for better processing. The HV macerator has an extra slot so you can get more, but it's not worth it power-wise, same for EV and IV.
data.title: §6§lPlant Mass

data.name: Polyvinyl Chloride
data.data:
Polyvinyl Chloride is PVC which can be used for the PVC Pipes. You need Vinyl Chloride and Oxygen to make it. You'll also want it for SMD capacitors later.

Do the recipe twice if you want to clean out your reactor, or three times if used the eight second recipe.
data.title: §6§lPolyvinyl Chloride

data.name: Portable Prospecting Tool
data.data:
Now that you have some tech, you've discovered a way to prospect for ores.

Unfortunately, the tech to make it repairable or rechargeable doesn't work, so you'll have to make a new one each time it breaks. It does work better at higher tiers and lasts longer with better materials.

It doesn't make a convenient book like the Seismic Prospector, but you can look at the results of scanning on the map, thanks to Visual Prospecting.

It can be hard to choose a good material for the Basic Prospector. Here are some good choices for you in their respective tiers, the size searched, and the average amount of veins they can scan:

LV Vanadiumsteel 3x3 - 50
MV Vanadiumsteel 3x3 - 213
HV Vibrant Alloy 5x5 - 299
EV Shadow Metal 7x7 - 1080
IV Oriharukon 7x7 - 2649

As you can see, the prospectors become better and better with each tier, but it might also be worth looking around for better materials.

Good luck.
data.title: §5§6§lPortable Prospecting Tool
data.tooltip:
Portable Prospecting Tool
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #6

data.name: Portable Tanks
data.data:
Until now, you had to use buildcraft tanks with dollies to carry liquids around. Which can be a pain with all that slowness. These portable tanks from EnderIO are able to push and pull liquids by themselves, as they have a built-in pump which is powered by some magic energy source. How convenient.

The pressurized versions are twice as large.

[note]Just be careful, because it will eat water cells instead of returning them.[/note]
data.title: §6§lPortable Tanks

data.name: Power of the Sun
data.data:
Now it's time to invest in some renewable energy. Let's start with solar panels. The basic one only gives 1 EU/t. Most GT machines can use them as covers, and receive power, but only so long as it can see the sun (the top). Be sure to put a glass layer above them in case it rains while you swap panels. You'll still want to keep rain off the sides of the machine hull too.

[note]The Aluminium Iron plate needs an MV Forming Press.[/note]
data.title: §6§lPower of the Sun

data.name: Power of the Sun 1x1
data.data: Put those single EU panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with a ULV hull.
data.title: §6§lPower of the Sun 1x1
data.tooltip:
Power of the Sun 1x1
Prequest requests:
Power of the Sun

data.name: Power of the Sun ULV
data.data: The next solar panel you can make is the ULV one. It generates 8 EU/t.
data.title: §6§lPower of the Sun ULV
data.tooltip:
Power of the Sun ULV
Prequest requests:
Power of the Sun

data.name: Press All the Things in MV
data.data: With the MV forming press you can make aluminum iron plates for solar panels, turbine blades for turbines and some items for Logistics Pipes.
data.title: §6§lPress All the Things in MV
data.tooltip:
Press All the Things in MV
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3

data.name: PVC Sheets
data.data: PVC Sheets make SMDs (make foils), plastic circuit boards, and really good item pipes.
data.title: §6§lPVC Sheets

data.name: Raw Carbon Mesh
data.data: This way of making carbon plates requires autoclaving carbon dust. There are 4 different fluids you can use, check NEI to see which gives how much.
data.title: §6§lRaw Carbon Mesh

data.name: Raw Silicon Dust
data.data:
Silicon is needed in all boule (and thus wafers, chips, and circuits) creation. Silicon is therefore an §oincredibly important material§r.

With your new Electrolyzer you can obtain Raw Silicon Dust from many different sources. Alternatively, you can also centrifuge Redstone. You can also get it from Silicon Dioxide, by adding Magnesium Dust to it in a Chemical Reactor and then recycling it in an Electrolyzer, which also gives you a lot of bonus Oxygen.
data.title: §6§lRaw Silicon Dust
data.tooltip:
Raw Silicon Dust
Prequest requests:
Silicon Dioxide
Electrolyzing All the Things

data.name: RF Batteries
data.data:
Basic Capacitor Banks are RF batteries which can store the RF power you generate. You can put many blocks together to enlarge your total battery capacity - they will merge into one battery.

You can also change the mode of each face using your wire cutters or yeta wrench instead of the GUI. One option is a nice display of input and output RF, but it has to be taller than it is wide.

These are great for interfacing with RF machines. GT wires will convert to RF, but they send a full amp packet no matter what. EnderIO machines properly accept it, but others like Genetics do not and waste most of the packet, so consider using them with any RF machine if it looks like you need it.
data.title: §6§lRF Batteries

data.name: Ruby Electrolyzing
data.data:
Ruby is a good source for chrome and a little alumina. Once you get low on Ruby, you can centrifuge Redstone to get more.

Another good source of alumina and oxygen is red granite dusts. You can get those from red stonelillies. Check out the Fishing Farming Cooking tab for more details about IC2 crops.
data.title: §6§f§6§lRuby Electrolyzing

data.name: Salty from all the silicon?
data.data:
If you are salty about the ingredients needed to purify silicon, I got good news for you! You can recover all of the chlorine and sodium you used by electrolyzing the salt you got!

[note]You can also use zinc instead of sodium, the first reaction is longer but the recycling is much cheaper.[/note]
data.title: §6§lSalty from all the silicon?
data.tooltip:
Salty from all the silicon?
Prequest requests:
Silicon Tetrachloride - continued

data.name: Seed Oil
data.data: Pam's peanuts are a good seed oil source, and can be sped up with sprinklers. Or you can use IC2 crops to get Rapeseed. Another option is Forestry tree nuts such as Hazelnuts, Butternuts, or the King of nuts, coconuts. Or you can be lame and get them from regular seeds like wheat seeds.
data.title: §6§lSeed Oil

data.name: Silicon Dioxide
data.data:
Get yourself some Silicon Dioxide! Smelting it in your EBF with some carbon is the best way to obtain raw silicon ingots. It is used it a few places but most importantly you can macerate it back down to raw silicon dust. You can also turn the silicon dioxide into raw silicon dust via chemical processes using aluminium or magnesium.

You can get silicon dioxide easily by centrifuging glass dust or electrolyzing sand.

If you have raw silicon dust but want silicon dioxide for some reason, you can use an arc furnace or an autoclave.
data.title: §6§lSilicon Dioxide

data.name: Silicon Plate
data.data: Advanced circuits require transistors, which are made out of high grade silicon plates, fine tin wire and molten polyethylene.
data.title: §6§lSilicon Plate

data.name: Silicon Solar Grade
data.data: Whichever path you followed, you now have the Solar Grade Silicon Dust. You want to smelt it into ingots to make plates for Transistors, but you will also need some to make Silicon Boules.
data.title: §6§lSilicon Solar Grade
data.tooltip:
Silicon Solar Grade
Prequest requests:
Trichlorosilane - continued
Silicon Tetrachloride - continued

data.name: Silicon Tetrachloride
data.data: However, the raw silicon dust you obtained is not pure enough! We will need to work on that. There are two reasonable options to do so. Let us look at the first one here. Don't worry, this is just a simple two step process. First let us start by reacting it with some chlorine in a chemical reactor.
data.title: §6§lSilicon Tetrachloride

data.name: Silicon Tetrachloride - continued
data.data:
As a second step, we combine the Tetrachloride with Sodium Dust. There we go! The Silicon Dust is now purified to solar grade!

The Chlorine and Sodium are §onot§r lost during this process. To recover them, just electrolyze the Salt you get at the end and send it back to the Chemical Reactors, for a complete loop that turns Raw Silicon into Solar Grade Silicon.
data.title: §6§lSilicon Tetrachloride - continued

data.name: Silicon Wafer
data.data:
To create some silicon wafers, put the monocrystalline silicon boule in a cutting machine. It would be best to make the MV version because you'll need it soon for ILCs, RAM, and other chips.

You can also use wafers to make diodes more efficiently if you have polyethylene as well.
data.title: §6§lSilicon Wafer

data.name: Simple Fluid Transfer
data.data: Just like the item translocators, the fluid ones transfer... fluids. Same restrictions apply, 1 block distance. These can also be upgraded.
data.title: §6§lSimple Fluid Transfer

data.name: Simple Item Transfer
data.data: Translocators can only transfer items over a distance of 1 block. But they're quite cheap, and a good solution to building compact machine setups. They include a free simple item filter which can be enabled on the input or output side. And they support multiple inputs and outputs! Glowstone will make it transfer faster - try investigating other upgrades.
data.title: §6§lSimple Item Transfer

data.name: Simple RF Power: Liquids
data.data:
This generator requires both water as coolant, and a burnable liquid as fuel. The amount of power it produces depends on the type of liquid used.

Fuel Burn Time (ticks/mb) Power Output (RF/tick) Power Output (RF/mb)
Oil 5 30 150
Hootch 6 60 360
Ethanol 15 40 600
Fire Water 15 80 1200
Diesel/Fuel 25 60 1500

[note]Rocket Fuel is disabled.[/note]
data.title: §6§lSimple RF Power: Liquids

data.name: Simple RF power: Solid
data.data:
By simply burning coal as fuel, this machine produces RF power. Enough for a basic machine setup. This machine will also accept compressed and multiple-compressed blocks. Want to burn something for 250+ days? Also, with double or octadic capacitors the output will increase and efficiency will improve.

GT wiring can convert EU to RF, but not the other way around. Note that with the eNet changes a GT wire network will need at least one GT energy consumer - a machine hull of the matching voltage will work.

Ender IO machines and GT cables and Wires can be left safely out in the rain.

It might be useful for Genetics machines since they consume excessive power when attached to GT wiring - Forestry and EnderIO machines work fine (except for the Thermionic Fabricator). Or use a Capacitor Bank.
data.title: §6§lSimple RF power: Solid

data.name: Smelting All-Joy
data.data:
This combination smelter allows you to produce fused quartz and quite clear glass of all variants.

It does §onot§r alloy you to make the EIO alloys though, you'll need a mixer and (probably) EBF for that.
data.title: §6§lSmelting All-Joy

data.name: Sodium Hydroxide1
data.data:
Sodium hydroxide is needed for bio diesel. You can make it out of sodium and water, or out of salt water.

Sodium hydroxide is also used in advanced aluminium production.
data.title: §6§f§6§lSodium Hydroxide

data.name: Sodium Persulfate1
data.data: Sodium Persulfate can be made in the electrolyzer out of sodium bisulfate dust. Sodium bisulfate is made out of sulfuric acid and salt in the chemical reactor. You can etch your board with it.
data.title: §6§r§6§k§r§6§lSodium Persulfate

data.name: Solar Grade Ingots
data.data: To turn your solar grade dust into solar grade ingots you need to use an EBF with kanthal coils and then cool the resulting hot ingots in a chemical bath.
data.title: §6§lSolar Grade Ingots
data.tooltip:
Solar Grade Ingots
Prequest requests:
First Kanthal
Coolant
Silicon Solar Grade
EBF-Time

data.name: Speeding Up Slow Machines
data.data:
Many mods don't have methods of speeding up their slow machines. For this, you'll need a GregTech World Accelerator. It guzzles amps though, so your power infrastructure better be ready for it. The tooltip will list the performance boost provided. For block-based acceleration, the WA will do an area around it. For TileEntities like most machines, it will only accelerate the blocks directly touching the WA, and will need to be reconfigured with a screwdriver. This uses twice the power though.

[warn]This does not work with GregTech machines![/warn] For those, build more or higher tier ones.

If you want, you can change the level of acceleration by using a wrench on it. It will go back to the minimum, then increase one tier from there for every usage. It will use that tier's amount of power (and acceleration), increasing as per GT standard of 2x speed (acceleration) and 4x EU per tier.
data.title: §6§lSpeeding Up Slow Machines
data.tooltip:
Speeding Up Slow Machines
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #4

data.name: Stainless Steel EBF processing
data.data:
Stainless Steel ingots are made in the Electric Blast Furnace at a temperature of 1700K.

It takes 85 seconds at 480 EU/t or 60 seconds at 480 EU/t by adding Oxygen gas. Always add a gas if you can, you're saving tons of power by doing so, and you're gonna need a TON of SS. The Cracker, Large Steam Turbine, and Distillery Tower all need huge amounts of SS. A single DT uses several stacks, and you're gonna want more than just one.
data.title: §6§lStainless Steel EBF processing
data.tooltip:
Stainless Steel EBF processing
Prequest requests:
MV Energy Hatch
Are You Prepared For HV?

data.name: Stainless Taking Too Long?
data.data:
Time for a second EBF!

You can make ingots faster in 3 ways - better coils, higher tier energy hatches, or adding more furnaces. It's probably time to add a second EBF to your base.

Multiblock machines can share casings, mufflers, and input/output hatches/buses, but not maintenance hatches (you can share the auto ones though). You can share energy hatches, but only if you can supply enough power to all machines it's a part of.

Remember, pollution will be very high with two EBFs active at once! Watch out for high pollution effects. Use the best mufflers available and don't place the EBFs in the same chunk as farmland or other high pollution machines like Pyrolyse Ovens and Large Boilers. Maybe it is time to do something more active?

You can use whatever coils you have lying around, but you certainly want to start searching for Mica if you haven't found any yet.
data.title: §6§f§6§lStainless Taking Too Long?
data.tooltip:
Stainless Taking Too Long?
Prequest requests:
Stainless Steel EBF processing

data.name: Super Tank I
data.data:
This tank works the same as the smaller GT tanks, but holds way more. Specifically, 4,000,000L. Only make this for things you need tons of, LV circuits are expensive after all.

Now you can store the same amount of fluids a steel 5x5 Railcraft tank contains in a single block.

[note]A lot of nice functionality has been added to Super and Quantum tanks. You can now pick them up with a wrench without voiding the fluids! Super tanks (but not Quantum) will give you heavy debuffs though, so better prepare some milk.

If you actually want to void the fluids you can crouch while using the wrench.

They now also have optional automatic fluid output, fluid locking, overflow void mode, or full void mode. And all that with a nice and simple GUI. Quite the IMPACTful change I would say.[/note]
data.title: §6§lSuper Tank I
data.tooltip:
Super Tank I
Prequest requests:
Molten Polyethylene
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #2

data.name: Tantalum Ore
data.data:
Tantalum is used in the GT (optional) and Ender IO Capacitors, and is also a source for niobium. You can find Tantalite at Y 20-30 on the Overworld and at Y 20-30 in the Nether.

§4Keep in mind you need an HV + Kanthal EBF and an MV Chemical Bath to get Tantalum Ingots.
data.title: §6§lTantalum Ore
data.tooltip:
Tantalum Ore
Prequest requests:
IO, IO, It's Off to EnderIO We Go

data.name: Tasty...
data.data: Yeah, that is... Well... You are sure it will have a usage for something... some day... eventually... maybe...
data.title: §6§lTasty...

data.name: There Can Be Only One...
data.data:
...so make them lose their heads.

Make yourself a Cleaver with your tool forge and collect some wither skeleton skulls.

[warn]If you have problems finding wither skeletons, once you get to HV you can put a powered skeleton spawner in the Nether.[/warn]
data.title: §6§lThere Can Be Only One...
data.tooltip:
There Can Be Only One...
Prequest requests:
Caging a Demon - Wither Killing Chamber

data.name: Tier 2 (MV)
data.data:
The MV Machine Hull needs aluminium. You're also gonna need aluminium for every MV machine part, so keep that EBF truckin'.

Here are some tips on where to start:
- MV Electrolyzer makes getting aluminium easier.
- MV Extruder makes parts cheaper.
- MV Miner saves your time.

Have you read the quest Safety First for details about mixing tiers?
Sending MV to an LV machine causes it to explode.
Sending MV voltage over LV cables causes them to melt, which causes fire that will likely cause the machines to blow up.
Additionally, recipes done in a tier higher than the original one (not ULV, ULV counts as LV) are overclocked (OC'd). The OC'd recipes use 4x power but complete 2x faster.
data.title: §6§lTier 2 (MV)
data.tooltip:
Tier 2 (MV)
Prequest requests:
Avengers, Assemble!
Getting Ready for Tier 2, MV
EBF-Time
Good Circuits
C9H8O4...NaCl...H2O...

data.name: Too Many Items? Unpossible!
data.data: Too many items getting you down? Just slap this badboy on a drawer, and any items you put in over the maximum will be automatically voided for you! More useful in combination with a Drawer Controller admittedly.
data.title: §6§lToo Many Items? Unpossible!

data.name: Too Much Mercury?
data.data: After a couple of hours...days...weeks...of processing redstone for chrome you'll have a massive stockpile of Mercury and not know what to do with it. You can store it all in supertanks, but really, how much hypochlorous acid does one need? Instead you can build an Acid Generator and at least get a little power out of it.
data.title: §6§lToo Much Mercury?
data.tooltip:
Too Much Mercury?
Prequest requests:
Did You Run Low On Gold or Redstone?

data.name: Transistor
data.data:
For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To make advanced circuits, you need transistors.

[note]If you already made SMD Transistors you can hold 16 of them to skip this quest![/note]
data.title: §6§lTransistor

data.name: Trichlorosilane
data.data: The second route is probably even better! With just 2 singleblock chemical reactors you can make Silicon Solar Grade. In the first step, make some Trichlorosilane.
data.title: §6§lTrichlorosilane

data.name: Trichlorosilane - continued
data.data:
Keep the hydrogen and continue in a second chemical reactor to obtain the purified Solar Grade Silicon. You get all the Hydrochloric Acid back!

Maybe you can automate this process?
data.title: §6§lTrichlorosilane - continued

data.name: Ultra Low Power IC
data.data: MV Energy hatches need ultra low power ICs. Go and craft some.
data.title: §6§lUltra Low Power IC

data.name: Venting the Heat
data.data:
A low tech method to cool down the hot coolant is to use vent covers. Just place the cover on any GregTech block which can contain IC2 coolant and place water in front. The easiest might be just a tank or pipe. This will help until you have access to a Large Heat Exchanger or a Vacuum Freezer.

An advanced or overclocked reactor vent is much faster than a basic heat vent and can work without a water block in front of it, albeit slower. Unfortunately, you can't make those yet, but you can keep that in mind for later.
data.title: §6§lVenting the Heat

data.name: Vinyl Chloride
data.data: Vinyl Chloride is the base product for making PVC for advanced pipes. These Pipes are needed in LuV machines or the Hermetic Casing IIs for Super Tank IIs.
data.title: §6§lVinyl Chloride

data.name: Way One: IC2 Fluid Canner
data.data:
The first way you get biomass out of bio chaff is to use the IC2 Fluid Canner. One bucket of water and one bio chaff gives one bucket of biomass.

[warn]This option is not really recommended. You should focus on GT machines, not IC2. It also has some buggy interaction with normal cells, you might need to use universal cells.[/warn]
data.title: §6§lWay One: IC2 Fluid Canner
data.tooltip:
Way One: IC2 Fluid Canner
Prequest requests:
Bio Chaff

data.name: Way Three: Pyrolyse Oven
data.data:
By using the Pyrolyse Oven, you are able to reap the rewards of coil speed increases.

You can also side-step the need for a Fermenter. Check out NEI to see which way suits you best. The GT++ Industrial Coke Oven will allow you to do this as well.

(You only have to submit one of these)
data.title: §6§lWay Three: Pyrolyse Oven

data.name: Way Two: Brewery
data.data: If you are lucky and find some brewing stands or have started using Thaumcraft to make one, you can craft a brewery. You get 1000mb of biomass out of 1000mb water and 1 bio chaff. Use Distilled water to get a better ratio and a much faster recipe.
data.title: §6§lWay Two: Brewery

data.name: Welcome to the Church of Benzene
data.data:
If you made it to MV using steam, you're probably wondering how to survive going further. One option is to switch to Light Fuel, discussed in LV. Another option is to use Benzene. Benzene is made from Wood Tar. There are a couple of pathways for that. Both start with logs from trees.

One path is to use Coke Ovens or Advanced Coke Ovens to make Charcoal, and fluid-extract Wood Tar from it. Then distill the Wood Tar to make Benzene. This method produces less pollution, but will also provide less Benzene.

The second path is to use the Pyrolyze Oven multiblock and Nitrogen gas to extract Wood Tar and Charcoal. Fluid-extract the Charcoal for additional Wood Tar. Then proceed as above. This method will create pollution from the Pyrolyze Oven, but will provide more Benzene per log.

Excess wood tar can also be turned into Toluene, a key ingredient for explosives that you'll need later on to make rockets.

If you use the Charcoal Byproducts recipe, you can get a plethora of useful byproducts as well, but you'll need 4 DTs.

[note]Later on you will get an even better option in the form the Industrial Coke Oven.[/note]
data.title: §6§lWelcome to the Church of Benzene
data.tooltip:
Welcome to the Church of Benzene
Prequest requests:
Tier 2 (MV)

data.name: Where's That Handyman When You Need Him?
data.data:
A Needs Maintenance cover will send out a redstone signal when the controller it's attached to requires maintenance. This is handy for the cleanroom you'll need to build in HV, since maintenance issues reduces cleanliness level and will cause voided materials.

For the cleanroom you can place this on the top or bottom. For other machines you might want to place it on the side so you can have access to the front face. In that case, you can use a soldering iron and fine solder to have it emit a strong redstone signal that will penetrate through a block next to the cover.
data.title: §6§lWhere's That Handyman When You Need Him?
data.tooltip:
Where's That Handyman When You Need Him?
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #5

data.name: Yet Another Wrench
data.data: The Yeta Wrench is more than just a regular wrench. While holding it, you are able to switch between conduit types, eventually allowing you to remove one specific conduit type from a bundle of many. Ctrl-Mousewheel will switch modes, also shift-left-click allows you to open the configuration interface even if you don't have access to that side of the conduit.
data.title: §6§lYet Another Wrench

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #2
data.data: The second item you'll need a lot of in MV tier. When you want to get fluid out of tanks you'll want one, though you don't necessarily need an MV one.
data.title: §6§lYou're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #2
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #2
Prequest requests:
MV Motor

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #1
data.data: The first item you'll need a lot of in MV too. If you want to pull items out of chests or barrels you'll need one. Way faster than the LV one, so it's actually useful.
data.title: §6§lYou're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #1
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #1
Prequest requests:
MV Motor

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3
data.data: An electric piston for your MV machines. The third item you're going to craft a lot of in the future.
data.title: §6§lYou're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3
Prequest requests:
MV Motor

data.data: The fourth item you'll need a lot of in MV, which is still a pain to craft.
data.title: §6§lYou're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #4
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #4
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #3

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #5
data.data: The fifth item you'll need a lot of. For the microwave, the scanner, the precision laser engraver, etc.
data.title: §6§lYou're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #5
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #5
Prequest requests:
MV Motor

data.data: The sixth item you'll need a lot of. For the scanner and the seismic prospector.

You're Gonna Hate This in MV Too #6

data.data: With your workstation circuits you can craft an HV circuit assembler. This is needed for IV circuits.

[note]Shortly after this, all circuit recipes will need a cleanroom, so get started on it![/note]

data.name: Amplifying Your UUM Production
data.data: To get UU-Amplifier out of your scrap you need an Amplifabricator. Both types of scrap are equivalent.
data.title: §a§9§lAmplifying Your UUM Production
data.tooltip:
Amplifying Your UUM Production

Recycle for the Environment

data.name: And It Will Never Break
data.data: By using an etheric sword, your killer joe will run...forever. Proper enchantments are a requirement for it to be efficient, but that shouldn't be a problem.
data.title: §9§lAnd It Will Never Break
data.tooltip:
And It Will Never Break
Prequest requests:
Automated Mob Farming
Division Sigil

data.name: Automated Crafting1
data.data:
You know, yet another automated crafting solution...

The left grid sets the recipe. The center box on the left will show the output. The right item grid is where you place resources. The output products will show up on the right center box.
data.title: §9§lAutomated Crafting

data.name: Automated Mob Farming
data.data:
Of course... zombies love that... disgusting liquid (nutrient distillation). While using a small amount per hit, he will attack everything that is within his range with a weapon you give him. That also includes players, so be careful. Rumors are there might be a weapon that will never break when used in this "machine"...

[note]BTW you need to be at > 75% to run it.[/note]
data.title: §9§lAutomated Mob Farming

data.name: Auto Mining HV
data.data: The HV miner is faster, has longer range, and has more fortune than the previous two. If you want a better one, look in the multiblock tab. It's recommend to take one with you to the Moon to gather meteoric iron.
data.title: §9§lAuto Mining HV
data.tooltip:
Auto Mining HV

You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Avengers, Assemble! 3
data.data: You know what this does. :D
data.title: §9§lAvengers, Assemble! 3
data.tooltip:
Avengers, Assemble! 3
