You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Bauxite Slag
data.data:
Now the slurry can be separated in a chemical process. Besides the Alumina which we get directly, the most important part is the Bauxite Slag which we will process further. You can also centrifuge the Sluice Juice for some extra byproducts.

If you don't have Aluminum Hydroxide yet, look around a bit in NEI. You can get it from Sodium Aluminate or from either Ruby, Sapphire, or Green Sapphire Slurry.
data.title: §9§lBauxite Slag

data.name: Better Magnetic Rods
data.data: You don't need them this tier, but for EV motors, you're going to need Magnetic Neodymium Rods, so make sure to make this before you start EV.
data.title: §9§lBetter Magnetic Rods

data.name: Bigger, Better, Chargier?
data.data: The Vibrant Capacitor Bank is the largest non-creative RF Battery from EIO. It can store 25 million RF in a single block.
data.title: §9§lBigger, Better, Chargier?

data.name: Bio Lab
data.data:
The Bio Lab is a multi-use bioengineering station. You can create bacterial cultures for use in the Bacterial Vat with it, as well as make DNA Samples and Data Orbs, and Plasmids to duplicate cultures and create new ones.

The Bacterial Vat can be found in the multiblock Goals tab. You can use it right now if you have any industrial brewing needs or wait until later when you need to get into bioengineering.

[note]If you are only doing this later you might as well make a higher tier Bio Lab. You only need one of them to complete the quest.[/note]
data.title: §9§lBio Lab

data.name: Central Processing Unit
data.data: Integrated Processors need central processing units. You can get these by cutting a central processing unit wafer.
data.title: §9§lCentral Processing Unit

data.name: Cheaper Simple Circuit
data.data: The NAND chip is an industrial replacement for the vacuum tubes that is much cheaper. You can't use it to make circuits though, only to make other things as a ULV circuit. Make sure to check out all the possible recipes!
data.title: §8§9§lCheaper Simple Circuit
data.tooltip:
Cheaper Simple Circuit
Prequest requests:
Simple SoC - System on a Chip

data.name: Chloroform
data.data:
The next step is to mix methane and chlorine to make chloroform. Make sure you have your circuit set correctly.

Now is probably a good time to look at stockpiling chlorine. Look for salt ores, or lapis veins. You can also make salt water with ghast tears. Better get started with IC2 crops, you'll need a lot of chlorine later!

[note]Lucky for you though, in this line we can recover all of our Chlorine.[/note]
data.title: §9§lChloroform

data.name: Chunkloading
data.data:
With your HV assembler you can craft a world anchor. So let's make one. It will again load a 3x3 chunk area.

You need coins to power the world anchor, it will run a varying amount depending on the coin used.

§aPersonal Anchors§r are loaded once the owner visits, and stay loaded while the player is logged in.

§9Passive Anchors§r are loaded once the owner visits, and stay loaded until the server resets.

[warn]World Anchors[/warn] are always loaded, even after a server reset.

[note]Check with server operators in case world anchors are disabled. On the official servers, world anchors are currently disabled to keep TPS high.[/note]
data.title: §9§lChunkloading

data.name: Controlling Your Drawers
data.data:
Now that you have MV Circuits and Stainless Steel, you can make the incredibly handy Drawer Controller. This block will make any drawers it connects to in a 4-block radius (including the y-axis) and 50 blocks at maximum as part of a multiblock that allows storage (and retrieval with the right setup) to any of the blocks that make it up. This will allow you to dump the contents of your mining trip into a storage system much easier. Just hold right-click on the Controller front for a second or two, and any items that match what's already in the multiblock will be deposited, while your tools and such won't. Just make sure to place your Controller last so it registers all the drawers.

You can feed into the Controller (and thus the rest of the drawers) with any kind of piping or hopper equivalent. If using it as part of a Multifarm or Mob Farm, make sure to set the contents of the drawers, and lock them with a key so that it properly stores everything in an organized manner. If the drawers' contents aren't set, it will start filling starting from the ones closest. If you wish to have more than one drawer full of an item, put a void upgrade on the drawer further from the Controller, and it will fill the first one, then the second.

If you want to go around corners, use the Trim Drawers to extend the multiblock. If you want to have a second point to dump items into, use the Controller Slave (one per multiblock, automation only). Note that you can use a key on the Controller to affect all drawers at once.

Once you have an ME Network, place a storage bus on the Controller, and the entire inventory will be accessible from the network, with both storage and retrieval. Just remember to set the priority higher than your ME Drives. If you haven't locked them yet expect all your drawers to fill with random items from your ME Network.

[warn]Using the drawer controller with large amounts of I/O will tank TPS! If you're on a server, do not use drawer cubes, or expect the possibility of it being deleted or you getting banned.

Additionally, expect all non-backpack interactions to be DISABLED on the official servers. Congratulations, Drawer Cubists, you ruined it for everyone.[/warn]
data.title: §9§lControlling Your Drawers

data.name: Dark Steel Tool and Weapon Basic Upgrades
data.data: In order to upgrade a Dark Steel weapon or tool, you need a vibrant crystal, 10 XP levels, and your trusty anvil.
data.title: §9§lDark Steel Tool and Weapon Basic Upgrades
data.tooltip:
Dark Steel Tool and Weapon Basic Upgrades
Prequest requests:
Vibrant Crystals

data.name: Dark Steel Tool and Weapon Advanced Upgrades
data.data: Your weapons and tools can be upgraded even more by adding capacitors and various other items.
data.title: §9§lDark Steel Tool and Weapon Advanced Upgrades
data.tooltip:
Dark Steel Tool and Weapon Advanced Upgrades
Prequest requests:
Dark Steel Tool and Weapon Basic Upgrades

data.name: Data Sticks
data.data: Data sticks are very important for seismic prospecting and for the assembly line in the LuV age. Go and craft a few data sticks.
data.title: §9§lData Sticks
data.tooltip:
Data Sticks
Prequest requests:
NOR and NAND Chips
Central Processing Unit

data.name: Dimensional Goal: Moon
data.data:
HV is about getting to the moon so you can get Titanium, used to make EV and AE2 machines. It's a long and involved task though, so head on over to the Space Race tab for more info.

[note]You need IV circuits and the HV assembler to start the tab though.[/note]

§6If you're doing the no-rocket run, hold a stack of Titanium Ingots to proceed. Same thing for Tungstensteel when you get to EV.
data.title: §9§lDimensional Goal: Moon
data.tooltip:
Dimensional Goal: Moon
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Dimethyldichlorosilane
data.data: For the next step you need Chloromethane and Silicon Dust. This gets you Dimethyldichlorosilane.
data.title: §9§lDimethyldichlorosilane

data.name: Distillation
data.data: For the next steps you need a few fluids/gases like Benzene, Ethylene and Butadiene. Run your distillation tower a few cycles to get them.
data.title: §9§lDistillation

data.name: Ender Eyes2
data.data: Ender eyes are available at HV in the chemical reactor. Combine some ender pearls with blaze powder.
data.title: §9§lEnder Eyes
data.tooltip:
Ender Eyes2
Prequest requests:
Performing Chemical Experiments at HV Level

data.name: Energetic Alloy1
data.data:
Energetic alloy is a new alloy from EnderIO made out of gold, conductive iron and black steel dust. Double-layer capacitors need it, as does the HV energy hatch.

[note]The direct mixer recipe has 7 ingredients, so you need an EV mixer or a multiblock to use it. You have to use the other one for now.[/note]
data.title: §9§lEnergetic Alloy
data.tooltip:
Energetic Alloy1
Prequest requests:
Tier 3 (HV)
More Heat - Kanthal Coil Upgrade

data.name: Even LARGER Tanks
data.data: 4000 buckets not enough storage? Stockpiling diesel for a lifetime? Try a Super Tank 2.
data.title: §9§lEven LARGER Tanks

data.name: Experience Storage
data.data: Dying is painful, isn't it? As almost all of your precious experience is lost. But fear not, there's a solution! By using an experience obelisk, you're now able to store all your collected experience in a safe location. Other than the other way of doing it that you could already do.
data.title: §9§lExperience Storage

data.name: Farming a Little Easier
data.data:
Tired of the Multifarm's requirements? The EnderIO Farming Station is here to ease your suffering. It only requires EU and tools and can be easily upgraded with capacitors. Most standard crops and trees work with it, but unfortunately, IC2 crops do not.

[note]If you want to use it for farming crops from Pam's HarvestCraft, you'll need to provide the crop itself, not the seed, for it to work properly.[/note]
data.title: §9§lFarming a Little Easier
data.tooltip:
Farming a Little Easier
Prequest requests:
Torture Device
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Find Bastnasite, Monazite and Neodymium
data.data: EV motors need Neodymium. Rare Earth is an §oOK§r source, but on the Moon you can find a vein with pure Neodymium ore. Bastnasite is a great source of fluorine. And Monazite can be taken apart for more Rare Earth.
data.title: §9§lFind Bastnasite, Monazite and Neodymium
data.tooltip:
Find Bastnasite, Monazite and Neodymium
Prequest requests:
Dimensional Goal: Moon

data.name: Find Bauxite
data.data:
The Bauxite vein contains two ores that get you Titanium, Bauxite and Ilmenite. Bauxite also contains Aluminium, as does (obviously) the Aluminium ore. You want tons of Titanium, so collect a bunch.

When you're mining you'll surely pick up some Meteoric Iron from small ores, enough to make your rocket. But if it's not enough, or you want more, you can also mine the meteors that fall out of the sky.
data.title: §9§lFind Bauxite

data.name: Find Ilmenite
data.data: You actually get more Ilmenite from the Bauxite Vein. But maybe you are here for the Chromite?
data.title: §9§lFind Ilmenite

data.name: Fluid Heater
data.data:
You will need a Fluid Heater for some chemical processes, for the best fries, but also right now to make liquid sodium for NaK coolant. To proceed you will need either an MV or an HV Fluid Heater. Make one of them.

The HV one can be used later to better process bauxite after you have been to the moon.

[note]If you used sodium sulfate to create liquid sodium instead, you can hold 2 60k NaK coolant cells in your hand to skip over this quest.[/note]
data.title: §9§lFluid Heater
data.tooltip:
Fluid Heater
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Forget Something?
data.data: Need some Electrotine for your Workstations? Go back to the Nether and find a Saltpeter vein at Y 5-45. You can also centrifuge it for Electrum and Redstone if you have too much.
data.title: §9§lForget Something?

data.name: Gallium and more
data.data: Centrifuge the Bauxite Slag to get the remaining desired products.
data.title: §9§lGallium and more

data.name: Getting the most out of your Bauxite.
data.data:
If processed correctly you can get a lot more Gallium out of your Bauxite compared to just using the Thermal Centrifuge. You will also get large amounts of Rutile and Alumina.

First, make some Bauxite Slurry.
data.title: §9§lGetting the most out of your Bauxite.
data.tooltip:
Getting the most out of your Bauxite.
Prequest requests:
Find Bauxite

data.name: Getting Your First Platinum
data.data:
Efficient Platinum processing is quite complicated. But for now, we can just smelt it directly into nuggets. This might not be the most efficient route to take, but it is enough for what we want to do next.

At this tier, your best source of Platinum is Nickel ores from the Twilight Forest, or maybe Endstone Dust if you've managed to survive the End already.
data.title: §9§lGetting Your First Platinum
data.tooltip:
Getting Your First Platinum
Prequest requests:
Tier 3 (HV)
More Heat - Kanthal Coil Upgrade

data.name: Hidden Drawers
data.data: You might notice once you get a wall of drawers that looking that direction gives you a little lag. If the lag gets bad enough, you can craft this key to stop putting the item on the front. Use it on the drawer controller to affect all of them.
data.title: §9§lHidden Drawers

data.name: Hot Slurry
data.data: Then heat up the slurry you made with a Fluid Heater.
data.title: §9§lHot Slurry
data.tooltip:
Hot Slurry
Prequest requests:
Getting the most out of your Bauxite.
Fluid Heater

data.name: How Much is Too Much Cobblestone?
data.data: A super chest III is just ridiculous. Who would possibly need to store 16 million items? You, that's who.
data.title: §9§lHow Much is Too Much Cobblestone?
data.tooltip:
How Much is Too Much Cobblestone?
Prequest requests:
LV Field Generator

data.name: How Much is Too Much Fluid?
data.data: There's no limit to how much fluid you might want to store. Make yourself some super tank III's for all your bulk storage needs.
data.title: §9§lHow Much is Too Much Fluid?
data.tooltip:
How Much is Too Much Fluid?
Prequest requests:
LV Field Generator

data.name: HV Advanced Steam Boiler
data.data: The HV GT++ Steam Boiler is the next machine you can make to produce steam efficiently. It regulates its fuel more efficiently if it ends up being full.
data.title: §5§l§6§l§9§lHV Advanced Steam Boiler

data.name: HV Bender
data.data:
An HV Bender is 4x faster than your LV Bender, but it also opens up an important recipe - Tin Cans!

With this bender you can turn Tin Casings into Tin Cans. Using the Tin Cans with food in a Canner will make Canned Food. This can stack up to 64, and will fully restore your shanks - no need to rotate food types anymore! You will eat as much as you need with one click. One drawback is you will no longer get the Well Fed buff with its slight health regen bonus, nor will you gain more hearts from eating new food. Also, these cans don't fit in the lunch bag or lunch box so you don't need those anymore.
data.title: §9§lHV Bender
data.tooltip:
HV Bender
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: HV Cutting Machine
data.data:
NOR, NAND and other high tier chips require an HV cutting machine.

[note]You'll soon find that everything you cut needs a cleanroom, so make sure you start on that.[/note]
data.title: §9§lHV Cutting Machine
data.tooltip:
HV Cutting Machine
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: HV Energy Hatch
data.data: The HV energy hatch is crucial to a faster EBF that can do higher tier recipes. You will probably want to make at least two.
data.title: §9§e§9§lHV Energy Hatch
data.tooltip:
HV Energy Hatch
Prequest requests:
Avengers, Assemble! 3
Keeping your energy hatch from overheating

data.name: HV Extruder
data.data: The HV Extruder is needed to extrude tough metals like Tungstensteel and HSS.
data.title: §9§lHV Extruder
data.tooltip:
HV Extruder
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: HV Superconductors (512 EU/t)
data.data:
How about lossless 512 EU Wires? Titaniumonabariumdecacoppereikosaoxide is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss.

You'll need Nichrome Coils and an HV Assembler.

[note]Whether these are worth it to save a little power or not is up to you of course.[/note]
data.title: §9§lHV Superconductors (512 EU/t)
data.tooltip:
HV Superconductors (512 EU/t)
Prequest requests:
Titanium, Finally
Nichrome Coil Upgrade

data.name: Integrated Processor
data.data:
This is the start of the first 4-circuit circuit line. This one doesn't really have a consistent naming scheme unlike the later ones, but it still works the same way, aside from the fact that you get your first EV §oand§r IV circuits from it, all the rest only have 1 new tier of circuit. Because of this you'll need to make 2 new CAs to finish it.

The first one is the Integrated Processor, the final type of MV circuits. You also don't need to craft any other circuits to make it, so it's the cheapest. This repeats each circuit tier.

[note]This and all circuits past it need a cleanroom.[/note]
data.title: §9§lIntegrated Processor
data.tooltip:
Integrated Processor
Prequest requests:
Empty Plastic Board
Central Processing Unit

data.name: I See Everything
data.data:
The inventory panel is an alternative to a PR or LP storage system. Just like PR, you have to connect every chest/barrel with an item conduit.

In addition to that, you also have to install a "Remote Awareness" upgrade into every conduit side you want the panel to see, and provide the panel with Nutrient Distillation which you make in The Vat.

Well, they're all obsolete once you get AE2 though.
data.title: §9§lI See Everything

data.name: Keeping your energy hatch from overheating
data.data: You have two options here. Either you followed the NaK quests or you made a vacuum freezer to cool helium.
data.title: §9§lKeeping your energy hatch from overheating
data.tooltip:
Keeping your energy hatch from overheating
Prequest requests:
At the End of...
NaK

data.name: Kinetic Power HV
data.data:
The Kinetic Generator will transform mechanical energy into electricity. The EU output depends on the KU input. It is most commonly used together with a Kinetic Wind Generator or Kinetic Water Generator. The Kinetic Steam Generator only has one tier, so you should probably use a Steam Turbine instead.

When placing a kinetic generator, any time, the "input" side is the side facing you. So you will place the kinetic generator, then the wind/water/steam gen, and then place a rotor inside. Power can be drawn from any side of the kinetic generator, up to the rated amount per side.

WARNING: Breaking a kinetic generator improperly will not return the generator. Use a GT wrench, and right-click it. It should drop immediately. Try again if it just changed directions.
data.title: §9§lKinetic Power HV

data.name: Kinetic Water Power HV
data.data:
The Kinetic Water Generator allows Kinetic Units to be produced via the movement of water in river and ocean biomes. As with the Kinetic Wind Generator, it requires either Gearbox Rotor. Search NEI for appropriate options.

If the Kinetic Water Generator's Rotor isn't entirely submerged in water, it will alert you there is "no room for the rotor". If the Kinetic Water Generator isn't placed in a river, ocean or deep ocean biome, it will alert you it "must be placed in a river or ocean biome". Check the Game Mechanics spreadsheet on Discord for a list of biomes and their tags.

While inconvenient, the Water Generator runs more consistently.

[warn]You can use Witchery (for example) to convert biomes.[/warn]
data.title: §9§lKinetic Water Power HV
data.tooltip:
Kinetic Water Power HV
Prequest requests:
Kinetic Power HV

data.name: Kinetic Wind Power HV
data.data:
The Kinetic Wind Generator generates energy from wind power which varies randomly, although certain factors can change this.

Unlike the Windmill, the Kinetic Wind Generator will require maintenance in the form of Rotors. These are needed to run the Kinetic Wind Generator.
Once a Rotor is placed inside the GUI, the block is given sufficient space, and the current wind level is adequate for the current rotor, the Kinetic Wind Generator will begin to generate Kinetic Energy.

This can be converted into EU by using a Kinetic Generator attached to the correct face (the black circle).

About Wind
First off, the wind strength of a particular area is affected by 3 factors: Height, Weather, and Chance. The higher up in the world you are, the higher the wind level. Below y64, there is never enough wind to be used, and KWG's will not function at all. Weather will also give boosts; Rainy weather will give a 20% boost to normal wind levels, and stormy weather will give a 50% boost. The final factor of chance makes the wind strength vary randomly, however there is a limited range of variation.

The easiest way to check the current wind level in an area is by using a Windmeter. Wind is strongest at around Y160, towards the build limit of Y255 there is very little wind, hence no point attempting to run Windmills that high. While inconvenient, the Wind Generator can run anywhere.
data.title: §9§lKinetic Wind Power HV
data.tooltip:
Kinetic Wind Power HV
Prequest requests:
Kinetic Power HV

data.name: LV Field Generator
data.data: Field Generators are powerful devices. They're generally used in super tanks, super chests, in UU-Matter production and use, or in teleporters. Also, anything someone wanted to make harder to make.
data.title: §9§lLV Field Generator
data.tooltip:
LV Field Generator
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: LV Microprocessor
data.data:
The Microprocessor is the highest tier version of the LV circuit, getting you 2 per recipe.

In addition to what's listed, you'll need 2 Resistors, Transistors, and Capacitors, SMD or non-SMD.

This advanced circuit type needs a cleanroom.
data.title: §9§lLV Microprocessor
data.tooltip:
LV Microprocessor
Prequest requests:
Advanced Circuit Assembler
Empty Plastic Board
Cleanroom

data.name: Magnetic Personality
data.data: If you haven't received one in a lootbag already, you can craft a nice magnet with a vibrant crystal. It doesn't work great on servers if you're moving around too fast, but it makes harvesting crops a lot easier.
data.title: §9§lMagnetic Personality

data.name: Mainframes, Your First IV Circuit
data.data: Mainframes are the first IV Circuits you can make. It's used for a few EV machines, and basically all IV machines and components.
data.title: §9§lMainframes, Your First IV Circuit
data.tooltip:
Mainframes, Your First IV Circuit
Prequest requests:
Advanced Circuit Assembler II

data.name: Mixing at HV Level
data.data: Mixing better alloys needs a better Mixer.
data.title: §9§lMixing at HV Level

data.name: NaK
data.data: Let's make some NaK coolant!
data.title: §9§lNaK

data.name: Need a Place For All Those Ores?
data.data: ...at last, the final chest, it will keep its inventory even after breaking! Item transportation will become much simpler with this!
data.title: §9§lNeed a Place For All Those Ores?
data.tooltip:
Need a Place For All Those Ores?
Prequest requests:
Auto Mining HV
Obsidian Chest
Dark Steel Chest

data.name: Nitric Acid
data.data: Nitric acid can be made out of water, oxygen and nitrogen dioxide.
data.title: §9§lNitric Acid

data.name: Nitric Oxide
data.data: To make nitric oxide you need to combine oxygen and ammonia in a chemical reactor.
data.title: §9§lNitric Oxide

data.name: NITRO! (Cetane-Boosted Diesel)
data.data:
1,000,000 EU per cell, way more dense than before. Yes, yes, this is very good! Make some cetane-boosted diesel fuel and power your Combustion Engine with it.

[note]BTW HOG is a different path, so you'll need to completely redo your setup if you want that in EV.[/note]
data.title: §9§lNITRO! (Cetane-Boosted Diesel)

data.name: Nitrogen Dioxide
data.data: To make nitrogen dioxide you need to combine oxygen gas and nitric oxide in a chemical reactor.
data.title: §9§lNitrogen Dioxide

data.name: NOR and NAND Chips
data.data: NAND is used for data sticks, data orbs, and UV circuits. NOR chips are needed for data orbs and LuV circuits. You can get these by cutting NAND and NOR wafers. Just worry about the data sticks for now.
data.title: §9§lNOR and NAND Chips
data.tooltip:
NOR and NAND Chips
Prequest requests:
Precision is Required
HV Cutting Machine
Phosphorus Doped Wafer
Cleanroom

data.name: Performing Chemical Experiments at HV Level
data.data: High tier chemical recipes like ammonia need an HV chemical reactor.
data.title: §9§lPerforming Chemical Experiments at HV Level
data.tooltip:
Performing Chemical Experiments at HV Level
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Petri Dishes, Not for Eating
data.data:
You'll need petri dishes to hold the cultures. You can make them out of borosilicate, styrene, or PTFE.

The petri dishes must then be sterilized to allow cultures to grow on them. You can use ethanol, methanol, ammonia, or chlorine to sterilize them.
data.title: §9§lPetri Dishes, Not for Eating
data.tooltip:
Petri Dishes, Not for Eating
Prequest requests:
Bio Lab

data.name: Phosphorus Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
data.data:
To make more advanced wafers, you need to make phosphorus doped monocrystalline silicon first. The process takes a while, so make sure you have stable power.

You can also get more wafers, and thus more chips out of higher tier boules. You still need to make the lower tier ones sometimes though.
data.title: §9§lPhosphorus Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
data.tooltip:
Phosphorus Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
Prequest requests:
Tier 3 (HV)
Silicon Solar Grade
More Heat - Kanthal Coil Upgrade

data.name: Phosphorus Doped Wafer
data.data: To create some phosphorus doped silicon wafers, cut them in a cutting machine. An HV version of the cutting machine is needed for future wafers and chips.
data.title: §9§lPhosphorus Doped Wafer
data.tooltip:
Phosphorus Doped Wafer
Prequest requests:
Phosphorus Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
Cleanroom

data.name: Playing With Dust
data.data: This machine will help you turn dust into crystals which you will need for high tier recipes.
data.title: §9§lPlaying With Dust
data.tooltip:
Playing With Dust
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Polydimethylsiloxane Dust
data.data: Put Dimethyldichlorosilane and Water into the chemical reactor to get Polydimethylsiloxane.
data.title: §9§lPolydimethylsiloxane Dust

data.name: Polystyrene
data.data:
To make Polystyrene use the chemical reactor to combine oxygen and styrene.

[note]There's only one type of machine that uses it, so don't bother making more until you need it.[/note]
data.title: §9§lPolystyrene

data.name: Polytetrafluoroethylene
data.data:
Molten plastics smell great, don't they? Mix your Hydrofluoric Acid and Chloroform to make Tetrafluoroethylene. React the TFE with oxygen to make molten PTFE.

[note]To get the 125 sheets without any leftovers or anything missing, follow the amounts of the optional quest and use the recipe that uses 1000L of Tetrafluoroethylene and 7000L of Oxygen. [/note]
data.title: §9§lPolytetrafluoroethylene

data.name: Precision is Required
data.data:
You'll use this a lot to make high tier circuits, and for other recipes.

[note]You'll soon find that everything you use the PLE on needs a cleanroom, so make sure you start on that.[/note]
data.title: §9§lPrecision is Required
data.tooltip:
Precision is Required
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in HV

data.name: Processor Assembly
data.data: This is the second step to making EV and IV circuits.
data.title: §9§lProcessor Assembly

data.name: Prototype Matter Manipulator
data.data:
The §4§lMatter Manipulator§r is an extremely powerful tool that you can use during your entire playthrough. It is essentially a survival version of world-edit that is custom made for the GTNH player's convenience.

The §3§lPrototype Matter Manipulator§r is expectedly the least powerful, most rudimentary version. You can only use the §5§lGeometry Mode§r to create and manipulate shapes for use in building. You will §nnot§r be able to remove blocks until you install an upgrade unlocked in §2§lEV§r.

For the most accurate and detailed information visit: [url]https://github.com/RecursivePineapple/MatterManipulator/blob/master/README.md[/url]

[note]The best way to learn about it is to use it! Experiment with the UI and become familiar with how it works.[/note]

[warn]Checkout the Building Better Bases tab for the complete Manipulator questline.[/warn]
data.title: §9§lPrototype Matter Manipulator
data.tooltip:
Prototype Matter Manipulator
Prequest requests:
Tier 3 (HV)
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in HV
LV Field Generator

data.name: Raw Styrene-Butadiene Rubber
data.data: The second last step is Raw Styrene-Butadiene Rubber. Mix Butadiene, Styrene and Oxygen to make the dust.
data.title: §9§lRaw Styrene-Butadiene Rubber

data.name: Recycle for the Environment
data.data:
If you have too much wood, saplings, netherrack or other garbage, you can recycle it and get scrap [note](this does not have a 100% chance)[/note]. Scrap can be used to make UU-Amplifier to make UU-Matter in 1/4 the time, saving you a significant amount of energy.

Certain items such as cobblestone, stone, and tiny/small dusts are too easy to make and don't give any scrap. But otherwise any items can be recycled to get scrap.
data.title: §9§lRecycle for the Environment
data.tooltip:
Recycle for the Environment
Prequest requests:
Workstations, Your First EV Circuit

data.name: RF Solar Panel
data.data: It's possible to power RF machines with a solar panel. It outputs 10 RF/t. Perfect for low use RF machines.
data.title: §9§lRF Solar Panel
data.tooltip:
RF Solar Panel
Prequest requests:
Power of the Sun
Vibrant Alloy1

data.name: RF Solar Panel Tier 2
data.data: The upgraded RF solar panel is much better. It outputs 40 RF/t.
data.title: §9§lRF Solar Panel Tier 2
data.tooltip:
RF Solar Panel Tier 2
Prequest requests:
RF Solar Panel

data.name: Rock Cutter LV
data.data: The Rock Cutter is an unbreakable and Silk-touched Mining Device. It will enable you to mine blocks without damaging them, like glass or stone, while it is charged. Uh, Woo?
data.title: §9§lRock Cutter LV

data.name: Rotor
data.data:
The Kinetic Wind and Water Generators need Gearbox Rotors to function. They can be added and removed with standard automation. Higher tier rotors will last longer. In addition, the iridium ones don't break. The IC2 ones might bug out for durability loss though. Energetic is probably the best for now, since it can give out a full amp, and more is wasted.

[note]You only need to make one rotor to complete this quest.[/note]
data.title: §c§9§lRotor
data.tooltip:
Rotor
Prequest requests:
Kinetic Wind Power HV
Kinetic Water Power HV

data.name: Rutile
data.data:
You've gotten some Rutile as a byproduct by now, right? Or EBF'd some Ilmenite?

Rutile, Chlorine and Carbon makes Titaniumtetrachloride, and some CO. You can recycle this for Carbon if you want to. Best use a Large Chemical Reactor in that case to get the full recipe.

Combining TiCl4 with Magnesium in an HV EBF will give you a Hot Titanium ingot, and Magnesiumchloride. You can recycle this as well to get all the Magnesium and Chlorine back using some Sodium.
data.title: §9§lRutile

data.name: Sending the Power Back
data.data:
Kinetic generator compatibility has been improved so that you no longer need transformers, you can connect directly with a cable. But why not use your transformer to send the power back to base more efficiently, it's a loss of about 57/512EU per A just going from 160 straight down to 63 without it. If you transform up (after going through 1 block of cable to transform it to GT power), you only lose about 57/2048EU per A, much better.

[warn]IC2 machines don't care about rain, but remember to cover your transformer.[/warn]
data.title: §9§lSending the Power Back

data.name: Separating Gems From the Dust
data.data: The sifter runs sooo slow, you should make an HV sifter to get gems faster.
data.title: §9§lSeparating Gems From the Dust
data.tooltip:
Separating Gems From the Dust
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Separating Molecules
data.data:
Many centrifuging recipes are slow. You better upgrade your machines.

There are many interesting things you can centrifuge outside your normal ore processing or Methane production. Glowstone, Redstone, Soul Sand, Lava, Ashes, Planet Dusts, Compressed Air, etc. Make sure to look around a bit.
data.title: §9§lSeparating Molecules

data.name: Shake That Booty...
data.data:
...out of the purified ores. Anyways, a Large Sifter will increase your sifting speed significantly. What will you do with all these gems??

[note]You need one more casing if you don't want to use 2 energy hatches.[/note]
data.title: §9§lShake That Booty...
data.tooltip:
Shake That Booty...
Prequest requests:
Separating Gems From the Dust
High Voltage Multiblocks

data.name: Silicone Rubber
data.data:
Want to make the synthetic rubber Silicone? As the first step you need Chloromethane.

You can use 2 Chlorine and 1 Methane per Chloromethane in your chemical reactor. Alternatively you can use Methanol and Hydrochloric Acid.

There are different ways to do it and this quest is only an example of how you can make it.

§6Already automated Silicone Rubber? Hold 128 sheets to skip this questline.
data.title: §9§lSilicone Rubber
data.tooltip:
Silicone Rubber
Prequest requests:
Performing Chemical Experiments at HV Level

data.name: Silicone Rubber Sheet
data.data: Lastly we add a bit of sulfur to the polydimethylsiloxane dust and get molten silicone rubber.
data.title: §9§lSilicone Rubber Sheet

data.name: Simple SoC - System on a Chip
data.data: SoCs (Systems on a Chip) are used to simplify circuit crafting. In this case, you can use Simple SoCs to make ULV circuits more easily.
data.title: §9§lSimple SoC - System on a Chip
data.tooltip:
Simple SoC - System on a Chip
Prequest requests:
Advanced Circuit Assembler

data.name: Small Coil
data.data:
The Processor Assembly circuit needs some small coils. You can make these a couple different ways.

[note]If you're an overachiever and created SMD Inductors already you may hold 24 in your hand to skip this quest.[/note]
data.title: §9§lSmall Coil

data.name: SMD Circuit Components
data.data:
Surface-mount devices are more advanced circuit parts. They're needed for circuits starting next tier and are cheaper to craft than basic capacitors, transistors, diodes and resistors. Once you get a reliable polyethylene setup, you can save a lot of resources by using SMD components.

Be sure to check how much gallium you have available. It might not be worth it to use SMD diodes and transistors until you have a steady supply with an HV macerator or bees. Also look into IC2 crops to 4x your zinc, sphalerite, and bauxite.
data.title: §9§lSMD Circuit Components
data.tooltip:
SMD Circuit Components
Prequest requests:
Getting Your First Platinum
Avengers, Assemble! 2

data.name: SMD Inductors
data.data: Now that you have Neodymium you can make the last of the SMDs, the SMD inductor. It can replace Small Coils in your circuit crafting.
data.title: §9§lSMD Inductors
data.tooltip:
SMD Inductors
Prequest requests:
Find Bastnasite, Monazite and Neodymium

data.name: Some Rare High Tier Metals
data.data:
Platinum, Palladium, Iridium and Osmium can be extracted with a chemical reaction from Chalcopyrite and Pentlandite using sulfuric acid. You don't have the technology to process them properly right now but later on you need large amounts of them.

Note that this is not the proper method to get rare metals. This means none of them are pure, and cannot be utilized without the platline method, aside from EBF-ing platinum. Proper Platinum processing is EV, but you'll have to wait until IV to use the rest. Collecting a lot of it now (especially using this method) might not be a great idea depending on how long that will be.

[note]A Chemical Bath also extracts Platinum from Nickel Ore if you use Mercury. Time to head back to the Twilight Forest![/note]
data.title: §9§lSome Rare High Tier Metals
data.tooltip:
Some Rare High Tier Metals
Prequest requests:
Nitric Acid
Ammonia

data.name: Soul Eater
data.data: Wouldn't it be great to actually make use of the intelligence or abilities a certain creature has? For example: enderman teleportation or brain capacity of a zombie for simple logic? (He doesn't use it anyway...) With this machine, you're able to bind a captured soul to an item, which can then be used in machines to improve their functionality, or create them to begin with.
data.title: §9§lSoul Eater

data.name: Specific Enchantments
data.data: Enchanting books is, just as it is for items, random. And that's annoying if you need a specific enchantment on your tool or armor. Now there's a way to actually select enchantments. For a price, obviously.
data.title: §9§lSpecific Enchantments

data.name: Styrene
data.data:
Putting Benzene and Ethylene in the Chemical Reactor gives you Styrene.

[note]And also hydrogen, just pack that away with the rest.[/note]
data.title: §9§lStyrene

data.name: Styrene-Butadiene Rubber Sheet
data.data: Add sulfur to the raw dust to get molten styrene-butadiene rubber, then solidify it to get sheets.
data.title: §9§lStyrene-Butadiene Rubber Sheet

data.name: Synthetic Rubber
data.data:
Want to make the synthetic rubber styrene-butadiene?

I'll show you a way you can get it. You'll need an Oil Cracker and a Distillation Tower. There are different ways to do it and this quest is only an example of how you can make it.

The first step is to crack your Naphtha with steam.

§6Already automated Styrene-Butadiene rubber or Polystyrene? Hold 128 sheets of each to skip their respective questline.
data.title: §9§lSynthetic Rubber
data.tooltip:
Synthetic Rubber
Prequest requests:
Performing Chemical Experiments at HV Level

data.name: Teflon Don
data.data:
To make PTFE, aka Teflon, you only need a few steps.

The first one is hydrofluoric acid. If you haven't reached the moon yet, the best sources for fluorine might be cryolite. Other options are treating Sand or Sandstone in a Chemical Plant for some Fluorite Ore, and centrifuging stone dust or black granite dust for biotite. You can also get small amounts from Lepidolite in salt veins and Mica. Mix it with some hydrogen to get hydrofluoric acid.

If you have reached the moon, you can also process Bastnasite ore.

§6Already automated PTFE? Hold 128 sheets to skip this questline.
data.title: §9§lTeflon Don
data.tooltip:
Teflon Don
Prequest requests:
Performing Chemical Experiments at HV Level

data.name: Tesla Would be Proud
data.data: Tired of sticking your EnderIO items in the capacitor bank to charge it? Time to make a wireless charger.
data.title: §9§lTesla Would be Proud
data.tooltip:
Tesla Would be Proud
Prequest requests:
A New Alloy, Soularium
Vibrant Alloy1

data.name: Tetranitromethane
data.data: Bio diesel and diesel can be boosted using tetranitromethane. Ethenone and nitric acid are required to make tetranitromethane in a chemical reactor.
data.title: §9§lTetranitromethane

data.name: The Creation of Life
data.data:
By utilizing large amounts of energy, you're able to reactivate those broken spawners you may have found in the past. If you haven't, you should get one of them now.

If the broken spawner isn't of the type of mob you want to spawn, you'll need to do some extra work. Capture one in a soul vial, then use that and the broken spawner in the soul binder to change the type. This takes forever, and also levels.

Combine a BS with your Powered Spawner in an anvil to set the type for it to spawn. Then you just gotta power it up!

If you set it to capture mode, you can make souls of a specific mob without any danger.

[note]Please try to use as few as possible on servers, mobs are laggy. Use crops if possible.[/note]
data.title: §9§lThe Creation of Life
data.tooltip:
The Creation of Life
Prequest requests:
Soul Eater
Vibrant Crystals

data.name: Tier 3 (HV)
data.data: Your first hull, as usual...
data.title: §9§lTier 3 (HV)
data.tooltip:
Tier 3 (HV)
Prequest requests:
Stainless Steel EBF processing
Advanced Circuits
Molten Plastic

data.name: Titanium, Finally
data.data: You just need to cool down those ingots in your Vacuum Freezer and you'll get your first Titanium.
data.title: §9§lTitanium, Finally

data.name: Torture Device
data.data: When the subjects don't want to cooperate.
data.title: §9§lTorture Device

data.name: Universal Macerator
data.data: One of the most important machines in HV is the Universal Macerator. It has an additional output slot to get more materials when macerating ores. You want this, really, really, badly. If you get it, you can say goodbye to your Gallium worries!
data.title: §9§lUniversal Macerator
data.tooltip:
Universal Macerator
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Upgraded RF Batteries
data.data:
Capacitor Banks are upgraded RF batteries which can store the RF power you generate.

BTW, you can also use capacitors to upgrade your EnderIO machines. They'll use more power, but also work faster.
data.title: §9§lUpgraded RF Batteries

data.name: UUMatter
data.data:
Now you can actually make the UUM with a Mass Fabricator. Well, technically you could make it without UUA, but that's way more expensive. To make sure it only runs with UUA, put a programmed circuit (any value) in the machine's slot. UUMatter can be used for some very specific things, such as replicating §osome§r materials (check NEI, mostly/all periodic table), used with crops to create an ore, some specific high-level recipes need it, and...you can also sit in it to get regen.

The energy usage and overclocking of the Mass Fabricator is different from the usual GT way. To have fixed EU to UUM ratios for all tiers, the machine does perfect 2/2 overclocks. It also starts with a very high amperage in LV. The following chart should make it more clear:

Tier Amps EU/t Time
LV 8A 256 160
MV 4A 512 80
HV 2A 1024 40
EV 1A 2048 20
IV 0.5A 4096 10
etc.

Put in power (and hopefully UUA), and out comes UUM.

For now, just stockpile the UU matter. You need data orbs to use the replicator, and that's explained next tier.

[note]You only need to complete one of the tasks.[/note]
data.title: §9§lUUMatter

data.name: Vibrant Alloy1
data.data: Vibrant alloy is a high tier EnderIO alloy made out of ender eye, energetic alloy and chrome dust.
data.title: §a§9§lVibrant Alloy
data.tooltip:
Vibrant Alloy1
Prequest requests:
At the End of...
Energetic Alloy1
Nichrome Coil Upgrade

data.name: Vibrant Crystals
data.data: Vibrant capacitor banks need this magical crystal. Armor and tools can be upgraded with it too.
data.title: §9§lVibrant Crystals

data.name: Wind Meter
data.data: The Windmeter measures wind strength. It shows you on which height you can place your Wind Generator.
data.title: §9§lWind Meter

data.name: Workstations, Your First EV Circuit
data.data:
Your first EV circuit is the Workstation.

You can make Blue Alloy with Silver and Electrotine in an Alloy Smelter. If you don't have Electrotine, you can make it from Redstone and Electrum in a Mixer. Have fun!

Also note that using the fluid solidifier is way faster than the extruder for Blue Alloy.
data.title: §9§lWorkstations, Your First EV Circuit
data.tooltip:
Workstations, Your First EV Circuit
Prequest requests:
Processor Assembly

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in HV
data.data: Some machines need emitters and sensors, like the analyzer or the circuit assembler.
data.title: §9§lYou're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in HV
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in HV
Prequest requests:
Ender Eyes2
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV
data.data: Pumps, pistons, conveyor modules and robot arms are the most needed machine parts in HV. Go and craft one of each.
data.title: §9§lYou're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV
Prequest requests:
Tier 3 (HV)
