links.target: You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in HV
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in HV

data.name: Advanced Glue
data.data: Combine that with Acetone or Methyl Acetate to obtain Advanced Glue.
data.title: §a§k§r§a§lAdvanced Glue

data.name: Advanced Ilmenite Processing
data.data: Get the most out of your Ilmenite by putting the crushed ore into an EV Chemical Bath with Sulfuric Acid. The acid can even be fully recycled.
data.title: §a§f§a§lAdvanced Ilmenite Processing

data.name: Advanced Mob Protection
data.data:
Like the chandelier, the magnum torch prevents monsters from spawning. However, its range is quite big, so a single one might be enough for your entire base. The range is 64 blocks horizontally in each direction, and 32 up and down.

[warn]Don't forget, monsters can still follow you home![/warn]
data.title: §a§lAdvanced Mob Protection

data.name: Appropriate Power
data.data:
Whether you used magic, steam, oil or biogas for power until now, you will run into problems as you advance to higher tiers. So you'll need to upgrade your power grid, at least for your EBF(s). So let's start with something more powerful: A nuclear reactor!

If you want to know how they work, refer to The Internet or the Reactor Planner at [url]https://github.com/MauveCloud/Ic2ExpReactorPlanner/releases[/url]

Note: The EU multiplier is set to 10x in this pack. That means your nuclear reactor is 10 times more efficient. Make sure to set the planner to GTNH mode under advanced. Also, the base numbers (before 10xing) can be seen on the hover text for all the components.

If you just want to use them, go to [url]https://wiki.gtnewhorizons.com/wiki/Nuclear_Reactors[/url] for reactor designs. The Thorium 1920 EU one is probably best for now.
data.title: §a§lAppropriate Power

data.name: Back to Step 1
data.data:
The Refined Platinum Salt can be heated to evaporate the last remaining impurities. Now you are left with PMP again, which you can use back in the first step again.

[note]Add an output hatch to the bottom layer of your EBF to capture the Chlorine for reuse.[/note]
data.title: §a§lBack to Step 1
data.tooltip:
Back to Step 1
Prequest requests:
Platinum Salt Recycling
Platinum Processing, Step 1

data.name: Basic Nuclear Fuel: Thorium
data.data:
The weakest of all fuel rods, but very easy to produce, very easy to keep cool and runs twice as long as uranium. It even returns 1/3 of the thorium back later. A perfect "fission and forget" power source.

[warn]Note: After they're used up you can recycle them to get Lutetium which is used for making americium in the fusion reactor. Americium is needed for top tier materials later, so start stockpiling now. Plus, you get power![/warn]
data.title: §a§lBasic Nuclear Fuel: Thorium

data.name: Bigger Drums
data.data:
Now that you have drums, you want them larger? Already??

Well, in that case, you better start collecting or making cobblestone, by the tens of thousands. And making explosives too.

Compress the cobblestone in an assembler first with circuit 1, then run them through the Implosion Compressor until you get Quadruple Compressed Cobblestone. Do that four times, and then another pass through the assembler with a diamond block, and there you have it - one bedrockium ingot.

Now do that 5 more times, and you can make yourself a bedrockium drum.

64k buckets of portable fluid. Perfect for your new Ore drill!

[note]There's also a Bedrockium ore much later on if you're lazy. By then you probably won't want the drums though.[/note]
data.title: §a§lBigger Drums
data.tooltip:
Bigger Drums
Prequest requests:
Want to Join a Band?

data.name: Bisphenol A
data.data: The next step towards Epoxid is to get Bisphenol A. You will need to combine Phenol, Acetone and HCl in a chemical reactor.
data.title: §a§lBisphenol A

data.name: Blue Steel
data.data: Sunnarium batteries are made out of blue steel: a mixture of steel, black steel, brass and rose gold.
data.title: §a§lBlue Steel

data.name: Create New Materials Out of Pure Energy
data.data:
Using the scanner, you can scan certain items (check the replicator's NEI recipes) to store the information of the item to a data orb so you can make copies of them with the replicator. This process uses a varying amount of UUM and time, depending on the item. Scanning also takes forever.

Some items you might want to replicate include:
Indium
Platline metals like Iridium and Osmium
Neon, Krypton, Xenon from liquid air distilling
Oganesson

For some things (Oganesson), this might be considered the only reasonable way of getting a decent amount.
data.title: §a§lCreate New Materials Out of Pure Energy
data.tooltip:
Create New Materials Out of Pure Energy
Prequest requests:
MV Field Generator

data.name: Critical Materials
data.data:
For more tungsten and tungstensteel, you'll want scheelite and tungstate. But the most important is desh, found only as small ore elsewhere, and used for the next rocket. Check Y 5-40.

[note]Since there's a good chance you have the MBM by now, you can do the crushed ore task instead of the ore one. This holds for other, similar quests.[/note]
data.title: §a§lCritical Materials

data.name: Cutting Up Stuff at EV
data.data: Now that you've reached EV you're going to need a more advanced cutting machine. Better get one built.
data.title: §9§a§lCutting Up Stuff at EV

data.name: Data Orbs
data.data: Data Orbs are high tier data sticks to replicate materials or used as data storages.
data.title: §a§lData Orbs

data.name: Dealing with Radiation
data.data:
Nuclear materials cause two types of radiation effects. One is a large number of standard debuffs. These can be removed the normal ways, with milk or terra wart or other methods that imitate them.

The other effect is a special Radiation unique debuff. This gets applied the longer you hold onto the radioactive item. Severely radioactive items can apply minutes of this deadly debuff. Regeneration might delay the inevitable death, but most regeneration sources aren't fast enough or long enough to keep you alive. You can try using an Amulet of Remedium to get rid of the effects. You should have one from your Moon trip, if not you'll have to dive into Thaumcraft to make one.
data.title: §a§lDealing with Radiation
data.tooltip:
Dealing with Radiation
Prequest requests:
HEV Mark III Protective System

data.name: Dichlorobenzene
data.data:
To make higher tier cables, you'll have to use Polyphenylene Sulfide to coat them. Let's start with Dichlorobenzene.

§6Already automated Polyphenylene Sulfide? Hold 128 sheets to skip this questline.
data.title: §a§lDichlorobenzene

data.name: Dimensional goal: Deimos
data.data: You can actually get the ores you want from the other two, but visit if you like?
data.title: §a§lDimensional goal: Deimos

data.name: Dimensional Goal: Mars
data.data: Mars has a few new ores you need to find like tungsten, uranium and desh. You can centrifuge uranium-238 for U-235 and plutonium-239, which can also be centrifuged to get Pu-241 if you happen to need it.
data.title: §a§lDimensional Goal: Mars

data.name: Dimensional Goal: Phobos
data.data:
Phobos has new ores, go get them!

[note]Honestly, aside from the dungeon, Phobos has all the ores you need.[/note]
data.title: §a§k§l§r§a§lDimensional Goal: Phobos

data.name: Double the Fun
data.data:
Need even more power? Why not combine rods? Produces more power (NOT double, it varies per rod type) and more heat (again NOT double) but only uses up one slot. You need more complex designs to handle them, but you were ready for that, right?

So how about doubling your doubling to double your double (4x)? Quad rods put out even more power and heat, expect all the other rods to work similarly (for the most part).
data.title: §a§lDouble the Fun
data.tooltip:
Double the Fun
Prequest requests:
Basic Nuclear Fuel: Thorium

data.name: Draconium Egg
data.data: The next step is to add draconium and ender goo to the ender egg to get a draconium egg.
data.title: §a§lDraconium Egg

data.name: Dragon Egg Omlet
data.data: The last step to create a dragon egg is to add enderium using a dragon heart as a catalyst. It's not used up.
data.title: §a§lDragon Egg Omlet

data.name: Egg Mutation
data.data: After you've gotten some mutagen try soaking your Big Egg in it along with some U-238.
data.title: §a§lEgg Mutation
data.tooltip:
Egg Mutation
Prequest requests:
One Dragon Egg is Not Enough Mr Bond

data.name: Empty Epoxid Board
data.data:
Epoxid circuit boards require an epoxid plate, gold foil and sulfuric acid to make an empty board. By adding electrum foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft an Advanced Circuit Board.

[note]If you used IC2 Scrap Boxes to obtain the empty boards instead of using epoxy, hold 64 Advanced Circuit Boards in your hand to unlock this quest.[/note]
data.title: §a§lEmpty Epoxid Board

data.name: Empty Fiber Reinforced Glass Board
data.data:
Fiber Reinforced circuit boards require fiber-reinforced epoxid resin sheets, aluminium foil, and sulfuric acid to make an empty board. By adding energetic alloy foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft a More Advanced Circuit Board.

[note]With these new boards you can make Lapotronic Energy Orbs. You could use them to upgrade your LSC. The boards are also used in IV for the next circuit line.[/note]
data.title: §a§lEmpty Fiber Reinforced Glass Board
data.tooltip:
Empty Fiber Reinforced Glass Board
Prequest requests:
Fiber Reinforced Epoxid Sheet

data.name: Ender Egg
data.data: Next, we need to start infusing it with the essence of The End. Start with endium dust and molten ender to get an ender egg.
data.title: §a§lEnder Egg

data.name: Epichlorohydrin
data.data: Epichlorohydrin is another product needed in your epoxid production. By now you should be experienced enough to figure out which path is best for your setup using NEI.
data.title: §a§lEpichlorohydrin

data.name: Epoxid
data.data:
Epoxid is needed for Advanced Circuits boards. You need Sodium Hydroxide, Epichlorohydrin and Bisphenol A to make it.

You can also use the molten form for some other things you might want to check out.

[note]Using a Large Chemical Reactor? You might be able to skip some steps, look around NEI to find out more.[/note]
data.title: §a§lEpoxid

data.name: EV Assembler
data.data: An EV assembler is required to make lapotron crystals, coils, and other stuff.
data.title: §a§lEV Assembler
data.tooltip:
EV Assembler
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in EV

data.name: EV Chemical Bath
data.data: An HV chemical bath or better is needed for the quantum eye. If you make an EV one you can also process Ilmenite better.
data.title: §a§f§a§lEV Chemical Bath

data.name: EV Chemical Reactor
data.data:
An EV chemical reactor is required to get some indium or make your radon production much faster. If you already made a large chemical reactor use that instead.

[note]Complete either task.[/note]
data.title: §b§a§lEV Chemical Reactor

data.name: EV Circuit Assembler
data.data: An EV circuit assembler requires IV Circuits to craft. With this assembler you can make higher tier circuits.
data.title: §b§a§lEV Circuit Assembler
data.tooltip:
EV Circuit Assembler
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in EV

data.name: EV Field Generators
data.data:
With Field Generators you can make your first Quantum Chests or Quantum Tanks. But the first two should be for your T2 rocket.

[note]Note that the Assembler recipe is more resource efficient.[/note]
data.title: §a§lEV Field Generators

data.name: EV Laser Engraver
data.data: An EV precision laser is required to make quantum crystals.
data.title: §a§k§r§a§lEV Laser Engraver
data.tooltip:
EV Laser Engraver
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in EV

data.name: EV Superconductors (2048 EU/t)
data.data:
How about lossless 2048 EU Wires? Uraniumtriplatinide is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss.

You'll need TPV Coils.

[note]Whether these are worth it to save a little power or not is up to you of course.[/note]
data.title: §a§lEV Superconductors (2048 EU/t)
data.tooltip:
EV Superconductors (2048 EU/t)
Prequest requests:
Pure Uranium Ores
Reactor Fuels
Tungstensteel

data.name: EXTREME MIXING
data.data:
Well, maybe it's not as extreme as the quest name suggests, but it gets the job done.

You'll need one anyway so why not make one now and save some time on the mixing?
data.title: §a§lEXTREME MIXING

data.name: Fiber Reinforced Epoxid Sheet
data.data: Fiber Reinforced Epoxid Sheets are needed for More Advanced Circuit Boards. Mix glass fiber or carbon fiber with epoxid to get your sheets.
data.title: §a§lFiber Reinforced Epoxid Sheet
data.tooltip:
Fiber Reinforced Epoxid Sheet
Prequest requests:
Glass Fiber
Raw Carbon Fiber

data.name: Four fluids in the one Hatch!
data.data:
Now that you're in EV tier you now have access to the Quadruple input hatches. These hatches can hold four different fluids in the one hatch which saves valuable spots in your multiblocks.

Perfect to be placed in your EBFs.
data.title: §a§lFour fluids in the one Hatch!
data.tooltip:
Four fluids in the one Hatch!
Prequest requests:
Tier 4 (EV)

data.name: Glass Fiber
data.data:
Glass Fiber is used in Fiber Reinforced Boards for circuits. [note]For next tier. Go left for this tier's circuits.[/note]

Borax can be extracted out of Salt ores. Electrolyze it to get Boron and mix it with Glass dust to get Borosilicate Glass Dust.

The ingots can be turned into glass fiber in the wiremill or extruder.

You can also use borosilicate to make higher tier glass for higher tier SB recipes, or for the blocks for the multis that need it.
data.title: §a§lGlass Fiber

data.name: Graphene
data.data: Graphene is a material that is just one atom layer thick. It has very favorable electric properties. To create though you will have to make some Graphene you can use a powerful adhesive to pull a single layer of material away from Graphite.
data.title: §a§k§r§a§lGraphene

data.name: HEV Mark III Protective System
data.data:
Some items will give you a Radiation debuff without protection. How long it lasts depends on the item. Some items will give you an enormous or unlimited time debuff timer, which effectively kills you because there's no way to get rid of it.

Other items will give you a general sickness with many debuffs, but not Radiation. That can be removed the normal ways, Milk, Terrawart, Aqua bees, etc.

If you wear a Hazmat suit (and rubber boots!) you are not affected by radioactive effects at all. Same for some other armors that list hazmat protection.
data.title: §a§lHEV Mark III Protective System
data.tooltip:
HEV Mark III Protective System
Prequest requests:
Appropriate Power

data.name: Higher Tier Cables
data.data:
Now you can use Polyphenylene Sulfide Foils and Silicone or Styrene-Butadiene Rubber to coat higher tier cables.
You'll need both Tungsten and Platinum in IV-tier.
data.title: §a§lHigher Tier Cables

data.name: HSS-G
data.data:
After you craft an IV assembler, upgrade your Electric Blast Furnace with new Coils out of HSS-G Ingots. This ingot becomes even more very important in LuV tier. But right now both of these are still far away. Just make a bit that you need for the next rocket.

To find a Molybdenum Vein, you probably want to make a high quality Prospector's Scanner with a good range.
data.title: §a§lHSS-G
data.tooltip:
HSS-G
Prequest requests:
TPV Coil Upgrade
Just Enough Tungstensteel For Your Rocket

data.name: Hypochlorous Acid
data.data: You'll need this for epichlorohydrin.
data.title: §a§lHypochlorous Acid

data.name: Increasing the Capacity
data.data: To unleash the full potential of your reactor, you have to attach six reactor chambers to it.
data.title: §a§lIncreasing the Capacity

data.name: Indium2
data.data:
At EV you're able to make Indium. Indium cannot be found in Ore form [note](except in super small amounts on Ross)[/note].

First you need to make Indium concentrate out of purified galena and sphalerite ore, then mix in some aluminium to get Indium. Indium is used in large amounts later on, automate this ASAP.

You also get lead, zinc, silver, sulfur, and water back from the lead-zinc solution. So it's not like you don't get the materials from the ores at all, just less of them.
data.title: §a§lIndium

data.name: Just Enough Tungstensteel For Your Rocket
data.data:
OK, now you can:

1) Turn the Tungsten Trioxide into Hot Tungsten Ingots in the EBF with some Carbon
2) Keep going for TS

We want TS, so put some Hydrogen along with the Tungsten Trioxide in your EBF to get rid of the Oxygen.

Combine your pure Tungsten with Steel in a mixer to get Tungstensteel. Then EBF and then freeze it to get the Tungstensteel ingot.

Some of Tungstensteel Dust you don't need to smelt as you will want to use it for HSS-G!

[note]Note that Tungsten Trioxide to Tungsten Ingot has reduced smelt time. This does not apply to the pure version. You're gonna need a bunch of it in IV as well as the TS, so keep this in mind.[/note]
data.title: §a§lJust Enough Tungstensteel For Your Rocket
data.tooltip:
Just Enough Tungstensteel For Your Rocket
Prequest requests:
TPV Coil Upgrade
Tungstate Processing - Step 2

data.name: Lapotron Dust
data.data: Lapotron crystals require you to mix your energium dust with some lapis dust. You should check out the Storing and Transforming EU tab for the lapotron crystal and the Lapotronic Supercapacitor Multiblock.
data.title: §a§lLapotron Dust

data.name: Monitoring Your Reactor
data.data:
It's important to monitor your reactor (Or just fancy to have a big screen somewhere...). So now that you've gained knowledge about the available fuel rods, you can start to build yourself a power plant. Here is something to help you out.

Use the sensor kit on the block you want to monitor, then put the sensor card in the display panel. Next select which lines of information you want to display.
data.title: §a§lMonitoring Your Reactor

data.name: More Power Needed, Sir!
data.data: EBF and LCR recipes are going to need even more power. You'll need to craft EV energy hatches to supply them and keep them running.
data.title: §b§a§lMore Power Needed, Sir!
data.tooltip:
More Power Needed, Sir!
Prequest requests:
Cutting Up Stuff at EV
Just Enough Tungstensteel For Your Rocket

data.name: Move the Heat
data.data:
Heat exchangers are a passive way to pull heat from the reactor or adjacent components and spread it out across a wider area. Their performance is measured in heat units per tick (Hu/t), and there are a few different types that all work slightly differently. [note]Moving heat around is not enough on its own. Heat vents or coolant cells are required to actually dissipate it.[/note]

Heat Exchanger: Pulls 4 Hu/t from the reactor and 12 Hu/t from adjacent components.

Advanced Heat Exchanger: Pulls 8 Hu/t from the reactor and 24 Hu/t from adjacent components.

Reactor Heat Exchanger: Pulls 72 Hu/t from the reactor.

Component Heat Exchanger: Pulls 36 Hu/t from adjacent components.
data.title: §a§lMove the Heat

data.name: MV Field Generator
data.data: Field Generators are powerful but expensive devices.
data.title: §a§lMV Field Generator

data.name: Nano Assembly
data.data: The Nano Assembly is an EV circuit.
data.title: §a§lNano Assembly

data.name: NanoCPU Wafer and Chip
data.data: The NanoCPU Wafer is made out of a CPU Wafer with raw carbon fiber and molten glowstone in an EV chemical reactor. Cut it for nano CPU chips.
data.title: §a§lNanoCPU Wafer and Chip
data.tooltip:
NanoCPU Wafer and Chip
Prequest requests:
Empty Epoxid Board
Central Processing Unit

data.name: Nano Mainframe
data.data:
The Nano Mainframe is the first LuV Circuit, and the end of this circuit line produced in EV. To craft the Tier 2 Rocket and reach Mars, Phobos and Deimos, you need to reach this circuit and make 8 of it.

After that, you will be able to progress into IV much more easily, but you will need two more circuits to make the IV Circuit Assembling Machine.
data.title: §a§lNano Mainframe

data.name: Nano Processor
data.data: This is the Nano Processor circuit line. Similar to the previous circuit line, these are four circuits. The §onano§r circuits go all the way to the LuV-tier Nano Mainframe.
data.title: §a§lNano Processor
data.tooltip:
Nano Processor
Prequest requests:
NanoCPU Wafer and Chip
EV Circuit Assembler

data.name: Nano Supercomputer
data.data: The Nano Supercomputer is an IV circuit.
data.title: §a§lNano Supercomputer

data.name: No Boom Tomorrow
data.data:
With a nuke, you can cause some real catastrophic damage to your base. You can either place it 20 chunks away, or surround it with blast proof materials.

Fused Quartz is no good now, forget about it OK? Instead, use the GTNH approved Plated Reinforced Stone series! Or one of the other options I guess, like Warded Glass. You may need multiple layers depending on your reactor, try it out in creative. Remember you must close in the corners - blasts can slip through the cracks. To get power out, do right angle turns on the wires as blasts go in a straight line.

[note]There are 6 of them, use NEI.[/note]

[note]Okay, okay, you don't have to forget Fused Quartz, I'll give you some. Maybe you can stop rain with it.[/note]
data.title: §a§lNo Boom Tomorrow

data.name: One Dragon Egg is Not Enough Mr Bond
data.data:
Dragon eggs are very rare and only drop after a dragon's death. How about I show you a way to recreate this powerful item out of a monster spawn egg?

Let's start with step one. Using a mob spawn egg (any work, you can purchase one from the CCC tab if you do not have one), growth medium, and bacteria to create a bigger egg. This process needs one hour.
data.title: §a§lOne Dragon Egg is Not Enough Mr Bond
data.tooltip:
One Dragon Egg is Not Enough Mr Bond
Prequest requests:
Ender Eyes2
Dimensional Goal: Mars
Cleanroom

data.name: Other Ores
data.data: You can find several other ores on these planets (some of which actually don't have a use, honestly), but the most useful right now are probably the ones on the right. There's also Draconium, Jade, Mirabilite, Tanzanite, Vinteum, and Vyroxes.
data.title: §a§lOther Ores
data.tooltip:
Other Ores
Prequest requests:
Dimensional Goal: Phobos
Dimensional goal: Deimos

data.name: Phenol1
data.data:
The next circuit line requires Epoxid. To start, let's get some Phenol.

The easiest way is to get phenol out of heavy fuel. There are other ways, like getting it out of wood tar from a pyrolyse oven, isopropylbenzene and oxygen, or chlorobenzene and water.

§6Already automated Epoxid? Hold 128 sheets to skip this questline.
data.title: §a§lPhenol

data.name: Platinum Processing, Step 4
data.data: Platinum Chloride? You promised Pure Platinum Metal at a much higher efficiency than just smelting it! No worries, just react the Platinum Chloride with Calcium and you're done. The calcium and chlorine can be recycled as well!
data.title: §a§lPlatinum Processing, Step 4

data.name: Platinum Processing, Step 3
data.data:
Hooray! All my Platinum Metal is now a fluid.... Time to add the second chemical to recrystallize the dust.

You do different things with each of the results:

Reprecipitated Platinum: Go to step 4, the last step.
Platinum Salt: Go to the recycling step.
Palladium Enriched Ammonia: Keep it like the Platinum Residue until IV. Or process it now if you like, but you don't §oneed§r it until later.
Others: Can be reused.
data.title: §a§lPlatinum Processing, Step 3
data.tooltip:
Platinum Processing, Step 3
Prequest requests:
Platinum Processing, Step 2b
Platinum Processing, Step 2a

data.name: Platinum Processing, Step 2b
data.data: Now, start with dissolving all the PMP into the Aqua Regia. You will also gain some Platinum Residue Dust. This highly concentrated dust contains a lot of even Rarer Metals, like Rhodium, Ruthenium, Osmium, and Iridium. You will need this at IV and higher, so stockpile it!
data.title: §a§lPlatinum Processing, Step 2b

data.name: Platinum Processing, Step 1
data.data:
Aqua Regia, the water of the Kings, is a chemical that will dissolve Platinum. The perfect solvent for Platinum processing. Get a few Cells of it.

§6Don't wanna do all these cell quests because you already automated it? Hold a stack of any platline dust to skip to the end of that chain.
data.title: §a§lPlatinum Processing, Step 1

data.name: Platinum Processing, Step 2a
data.data: Ammonium Chloride is used to precipitate the dissolved Platinum into a purer form, you'll need some of this.
data.title: §a§lPlatinum Processing, Step 2a

data.name: Platinum Salt Recycling
data.data:
What, recycling? That's lame. I just wanna void this stuff! - is what you might think right now, but be aware that Platinum Salt still holds a high concentration of Platinum. We can recycle it to get even more Platinum out of it!

You need to sift it to get Refined Platinum Salt. You only have a 95% chance to get a dust.
data.title: §a§lPlatinum Salt Recycling

data.name: Playing With Dust in EV
data.data: The EV Autoclave is needed to process tungsten and other high tier materials.
data.title: §a§9§a§9§l§9§a§lPlaying With Dust in EV
data.tooltip:
Playing With Dust in EV
Prequest requests:
Pulverize the Planet

data.name: Polyphenylene Sulfide
data.data: Combine Dichlorobenzene with Sodium Sulfide and Oxygen to get Polyphenylene Sulfide.
data.title: §a§lPolyphenylene Sulfide

data.name: Polyvinyl Acetate
data.data: You know how polymerization works by now. Use Air or Oxygen and optionally Titaniumtetrachloride to obtain Polyvinyl Acetate.
data.title: §a§k§r§a§lPolyvinyl Acetate

data.name: Portable Hole? How About Portable Chunk!
data.data: With further research, I've discovered a key made of spectral iron can open a portal into a pocket dimension. It's only one chunk wide, but perfect for storing stuff I might need while exploring faraway planets, or as a quiet refuge after a difficult battle. Using it as a teleportation hub might also be an idea...
data.title: §a§lPortable Hole? How About Portable Chunk!
data.tooltip:
Portable Hole? How About Portable Chunk!
Prequest requests:
Dimensional Goal: Mars

data.name: Power of the Sun from Nuclear
data.data:
Your good old singleblock Molecular Transformer is gone. So how to obtain Sunnarium? Well there are a couple of ways, but at EV you'll need to radiate Glowstone and convert to Sunnarium.

The Glowstone rod will slowly charge up if you put it next to any fuel rod in your IC2 reactor. The exact charging speed is (number of rods adjacent) * (floor(hull temperature/3000) + 1) per second. A dual rod will count as 2 rods and quad fuel rod will count as 4 rods for this purpose. The Glowstone rod will neither emit heat, nor cause other component to emit more heat. You can treat this rod as a reactor plating in the IC2 Reactor Planner.

As you can see, the speed is directly proportional to hull temperature and rods adjacent. At the very extreme you can fully charge up a Glowstone rod in less than half a minute and output one Sunnarium every 10 second (on average, since cells aren't charged at same speed due to different position), but that require very considerable resource to set up. It also involves a vacuum freezer to cooldown the coolant cells and running the reactor at 66000+ hull temperature. Balance your need and your resource situation wisely. In any case, if you just wish to charge it up FAST then here is a possible string for the IC2 Reactor Planner:

erp=bpO50cpsdtJElVqn4hObFJc0tiOE0JpEHYpqTxJHvyezjSKRjUuwgouXzNOlU4a3hFBRygM=

Replace Containment Reactor Plating with actual Glowstone rods and you should be good to go. You can also use fewer reactor chambers by using less plating. Enjoy!
data.title: §a§lPower of the Sun from Nuclear
data.tooltip:
Power of the Sun from Nuclear
Prequest requests:
Appropriate Power

data.name: Pulverize the Planet
data.data:
Literally. You can grind the rock of most planets, to get a chance for...stuff. It depends on the planet. Does consume quite a bit of power, but can really help you out.

For Tungstate, you can centrifuge previously macerated moon dust, macerate end stone with an HV+ macerator and then centrifuge it, or centrifuge endergoo (found all over the end, does not give back buckets).

If you want to make your rocket, you need to get at least a little before you can get to a planet with the ore. However, keep in mind that you'll need an EBF with TPV Coils to smelt Tungstensteel Dust into the ingot!

[note]Do one of the tasks.[/note]
data.title: §a§lPulverize the Planet

data.name: Pure Uranium Ores
data.data: If you want pure uranium ores for your nuke, you'll need to visit Deimos or Phobos to fetch them. They're at Y 20-30.
data.title: §a§lPure Uranium Ores
data.tooltip:
Pure Uranium Ores
Prequest requests:
Dimensional Goal: Phobos
Dimensional goal: Deimos

data.name: Quantum Eye
data.data: Quantum eyes are required in EV emitters and sensors. Just infuse your ender eye with radon to get one.
data.title: §a§lQuantum Eye

data.name: Quit Exhaling Dusts
data.data:
The QED is used to make only a few things, so I'll just list them here:

Magnum Torch: Prevent mob spawns.
Ender Quarry, and the Ender-Markers that go with it: Quarry up the landscape, so you can get planet blocks, dirt, etc., unlike miners.
Ender-Thermic Pump: For nether lava pumping with less lag.
Transfer Node Energy/Hyper-Energy: Transfers RF, so. useless.
data.title: §a§lQuit Exhaling Dusts

data.name: Radon Decay
data.data:
Radon is needed for EV Emitters and Sensors.

You can get Radium-226 from sifting Thorium, Pitchblende, Uraninite, or Uranium 238. It needs 4500 seconds, or 75 mins, to decay, and it will debuff you until it decays unless you have complete hazmat protection. It's a good idea to make a Lead-Lined Box and let the Radium decay there, instead.

Thorium can be obtained from the Nether, whereas the other 3 ores are locked after the Tier 2 Rocket. However, Thorium gives a much smaller chance of getting Radium, so you'll need a good amount of it to continue.

After it decays, you can electrolyze Radon out of it and progress into the next circuit line. However, you will not be able to do the Radon loop here, that can only be done with Plutonium 239.

[note]You only need to do one task.[/note]
data.title: §a§lRadon Decay

data.name: Radon Loop
data.data:
Radon is needed for EV emitters and sensors.

If you can get some Plutonium 239 and Uranium 238, you can use the LCR recipe and just keep cycling the Plutonium around to get more.
data.title: §a§lRadon Loop

data.name: Raw Carbon Fiber
data.data:
Alternatively, you can use Raw Carbon Fiber for your Reinforced Circuit Boards.

[note]You can use Epoxid to get a better yield on it![/note]
data.title: §a§lRaw Carbon Fiber

data.name: Reactor Fuels
data.data: For impure radioactive ores for your nuclear reactor, you can look for pitchblende and uraninite. You can find them on Mars and Phobos at Y 30-60.
data.title: §a§lReactor Fuels
data.tooltip:
Reactor Fuels
Prequest requests:
Dimensional Goal: Mars
Dimensional Goal: Phobos

data.name: Sodium Sulfide
data.data: Combine Sodium and Sulfur to get Sodium Sulfide.
data.title: §a§lSodium Sulfide

data.name: Supersized Buses
data.data:
Input and output buses not holding enough for you?

Upgrade your buses to the Super bus and enjoy increased slots.

[note]To get Molten Silicon Carbide without an ABS, you can make Silicon Carbide Dust in a Mixer, then smelt it and fluid extract.[/note]
data.title: §b§lSupersized Buses

data.name: The Redstone Sniffer
data.data:
Ever wonder where your redstone transmitters are? Or wish they were labeled? Maybe your teammate placed one down, didn't tell you, and now you're stuck wondering what private frequency they placed?

Now, you have a way to do all of that.

Introducing the §6Redstone Sniffer§r!

For §cregular wireless redstone§f§r, the sniffer will list all currently used frequencies, tell you whether that frequency is private, and gives you an option to label it.

For §cadvanced wireless covers§f§r, the sniffer will additionally tell you where that cover is currently located, including in other dimensions, and offers you the option to also highlight or teleport to it.
data.title: The Redstone Sniffer
data.tooltip:
The Redstone Sniffer
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in EV

data.name: Tier 4 (EV)
data.data:
The main goal here is to get a tier 2 rocket, and reach Mars. You also might want to rethink your power setup, as more and more machines will be upgraded. This quest set will teach you about a couple of options you have regarding power production.

Multiblock goals includes quests for the large gas turbine, large combustion engine, and multiblock ore drill.
data.title: §a§lTier 4 (EV)
data.tooltip:
Tier 4 (EV)
Prequest requests:
Workstations, Your First EV Circuit
Titanium, Finally

data.name: Tungstate Processing - Step 2
data.data: Next up is Tungsten Trioxide. Note that you got back all of the Calcium Chloride. If you process Scheelite ore at all, you'll want to set up an electrolyzer.
data.title: §a§lTungstate Processing - Step 2

data.name: Tungstate Processing - Step 1
data.data:
First, let's turn our Tungstate into Scheelite. When you can get Scheelite ore, you can just skip this step.

Note that if you're processing Huebnerite or Ferberite from ross128b or 128ba, the first step is slightly different.
data.title: §a§lTungstate Processing - Step 1
data.tooltip:
Tungstate Processing - Step 1
Prequest requests:
Playing With Dust in EV

data.name: Tungstensteel
data.data: Tungstensteel is needed in all machines for the next tier. Can you get enough to advance?
data.title: §a§lTungstensteel

data.name: Unfortunately, There's No Depleted Uranium Bullets
data.data: After your rods have finished their cycle they turn into depleted rods. You can then thermal centrifuge them to get some materials back. Depending on the rod, you can get different stuff, see NEI or the wiki for details.
data.title: §a§lUnfortunately, There's No Depleted Uranium Bullets
data.tooltip:
Unfortunately, There's No Depleted Uranium Bullets
Prequest requests:
Double the Fun

data.name: Venting Heat
data.data:
Heat vents are a passive way to remove heat from your reactor. Their performance is measured in heat units per tick (Hu/t), and there are a few different types that all work slightly differently.

These heat vents simply cool themselves after absorbing heat from adjacent fuel rods and heat exchangers:

Heat Vent: Cools itself by 6 Hu/t

Advanced Heat Vent: Cools itself by 12 Hu/t

These heat vents absorb heat and cool themselves much like the ones above, but they also pull heat directly from the reactor core to themselves:

Reactor Heat Vent: Cools itself by 5 Hu/t and the reactor by 5 Hu/t

Overclocked Heat Vent: Cools itself by 20 Hu/t and the reactor by 36 Hu/t[note]Since it pulls more heat from the reactor than it dissipates, these are prone to melting if their heat is not balanced by a heat exchanger[/note]

The Component Heat Vent works differently to the other vents. Rather than absorbing heat and cooling itself or the reactor, it simply cools adjacent components (but not fuel rods) by 4 Hu/t
data.title: §a§lVenting Heat

data.name: Vinyl Acetate
data.data:
Graphene is required for IV motors. This organic compound is just a stepping stone.

§6Already automated Graphene? Hold 128 dust to complete this questline.
data.title: §a§k§r§a§lVinyl Acetate

data.name: Want to Join a Band?
data.data:
Or at least play with drums? If you have extra Meteoric Iron after building your rocket and making your thermal padding, turn it into Meteoric Steel and use it to make some drums. These drums can hold 256 buckets even after breaking.

And did you know you can use them as cells? Try loading or unloading a supertank!
data.title: §a§lWant to Join a Band?

data.name: Water, Fast
data.data:
The Remote IO Water Reservoir works like the Everfull Urn in that you can pull water out as fast as you need. Additionally, you can pull water from any side of the block.

You can further upgrade it into a reservoir hatch, which can be used as an input hatch directly. Producing massive amounts of distilled water with a DT has never been easier!

§3Maybe those massive amounts of water could be condensed into something useful...
data.title: §a§lWater, Fast
data.tooltip:
Water, Fast
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in EV

data.name: What's in the Box?
data.data:
Tired of waiting around for hours with radium in your inventory, waiting for it to decay? With a lead-lined box you can safely leave your radium in it and it'll decay while you do real work.

[note]You may not be able to shift-click items in and out, but pipes still work. You can not use a WA.[/note]
data.title: §a§lWhat's in the Box?

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in EV
data.data: Some machines need emitters and sensors, like the analyzer or the circuit assembler.
data.title: §a§lYou're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in EV
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in EV
Prequest requests:
Quantum Eye

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in EV
data.data: Pumps, pistons, conveyor modules and robot arms are the most needed machine parts in EV. Go and craft one of each.
data.title: §a§f§a§lYou're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in EV
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in EV
Prequest requests:
