You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in EV

data.name: 2-Nitrochlorobenzene
data.data: Next step is to mix the nitration mixture with your chlorobenzene in the HV chemical reactor to get 2-nitrochlorobenzene.
data.title: §b§l2-Nitrochlorobenzene

data.name: 3,3 Diaminobenzidine
data.data: Mixing 3,3 Dichlorobenzidine with Ammonia and Zinc in an IV Chemical Reactor gives you 3,3 Diaminobenzidine.
data.title: §b§l3,3 Diaminobenzidine

data.name: 3,3 Dichlorobenzidine
data.data: Mixing 2-nitrochlorobenzene with copper dust gives you 3,3 Dichlorobenzidine in an EV Chemical Reactor.
data.title: §c§b§l3,3 Dichlorobenzidine

data.name: A Little Bit of Sifting
data.data: Now you can sift some of the radioactive impurities out.
data.title: §b§lA Little Bit of Sifting
data.tooltip:
A Little Bit of Sifting
Prequest requests:
Now for Nitration

data.name: Almost Done With Rhodium
data.data: Place your solution in your Chemical Reactor to heat it while it spins. That way you get a dust out of your Solution, 100% lump free!
data.title: §b§lAlmost Done With Rhodium
data.tooltip:
Almost Done With Rhodium
Prequest requests:
Re-Solving the Purity Issue

data.name: Another Acid to Worry About!
data.data:
Formic Acid, also known as methanoic acid, is an organic acid. We'll need it for the final Palladium step, so don't be shy, make tons of it! The Sodium Sulfate can be recycled.

Make Sodium Formate, then the Formic Acid.
data.title: §b§lAnother Acid to Worry About!
data.tooltip:
Another Acid to Worry About!
Prequest requests:
Salty Metals Are the Worst!

data.name: Another One Bites the Salt
data.data: Hey, why're you looking at me that way? You ain't finished yet. Get more Chlorine and Salt, to process your Rhodium.
data.title: §b§lAnother One Bites the Salt
data.tooltip:
Another One Bites the Salt
Prequest requests:
But... This is Expensive!

data.name: Argon
data.data:
To process some of the new ingots you will find, you need argon. Your first source will come from air, in small amounts. Unlike centrifuging Compressed Air Cells, you'll need to turn the Air into Liquid Air first in a Vacuum Freezer so you can centrifuge it more efficiently.

You can also make the Air Intake Hatch - it's much better than spamming compressors!

Don't bother with the DT recipe unless you need the other fluids from it, it's not nearly as good as centrifuging. You also need the Liquid Air Fluid Hatch (only works with Liquid Air!) and Giant Output Hatch when you want to do that.
data.title: §c§b§lArgon

data.name: A Sift, a Sift! My Kingdom for a Sift!
data.data: Now to filter the leached concentrate in order to get the cerium out.
data.title: §b§lA Sift, a Sift! My Kingdom for a Sift!
data.tooltip:
A Sift, a Sift! My Kingdom for a Sift!
Prequest requests:
Leach The Concentrate

data.name: A Small Reward: The Infinite Spray Can
data.data:
Congratulations! You have completed the Platinum Line. Not many players have the perseverance to accomplish this task. A small reward is in order!

The [note]Infinite Spray Can[/note] never runs out of paint, and contains all sixteen colors (as well as solvent!) Of course, line mode and Ring of Loki support are included. There are also many convenience features. Middle-click to open a color choice GUI. Middle-click a painted block to copy its color to the spray can. Left-click to cycle the active color (sneak to go backwards.) Sneak-middle-click to lock the can; while locked, you can't accidentally change the color. Sneak-middle-click to unlock.

Naturally, you'll have to craft the infinite spray can yourself. It's a Dire Crafting recipe, so hopefully you have a dire crafting table. It requires a lot of platinum line materials, of course. And, apparently, a rainbow cactus, so a small detour into magic will be necessary. And a bunch of random-looking AE2 parts. And an IV world accelerator. And... a fence?

Is this really a reward?
data.title: §b§lA Small Reward: The Infinite Spray Can
data.tooltip:
A Small Reward: The Infinite Spray Can
Prequest requests:
Iridium2
Palladium

data.name: ASoC - Advanced System on a Chip
data.data:
ASoCs. Advanced system on a chip, will be used for a new multiblock, the Precise Assembler.

And just like SoCs, ASoCs will be used to make cheaper HV and EV circuits.

However you'll need to wait until ZPM to make the cheaper EV circuits.
data.title: §b§lASoC - Advanced System on a Chip
data.tooltip:
ASoC - Advanced System on a Chip
Prequest requests:
Naquadah Doped Wafer
EV Laser Engraver

data.name: But... This is Expensive!
data.data:
Gathering Zinc might not have been a pleasant task in the past, but here, it's just used as a catalyst, so you will regain all of it.

When you electrolyze the Zinc Sulfate, you get a Sulfur and 4000L Oxygen back too.
data.title: §a§b§lBut... This is Expensive!
data.tooltip:
But... This is Expensive!
Prequest requests:
Fluid From Sulfur Gas

data.name: Callisto Trip
data.data:
Callisto Ice is a material you need for Tier 4 Rockets. Look for it at Y 40-60. You can also find platinum series and radioactive ores here.

[note]You can also find Mytryl and Ledox here as small ores.[/note]
data.title: §b§lCallisto Trip
data.tooltip:
Callisto Trip
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs

data.name: Ceres Trip
data.data:
You can find the same ores as Callisto minus callisto ice here, but the real goal is the dungeon and the small ores: Naquadah and Quantium.

Naquadah is used for efficient Silicon Wafer, as well as highly advanced components you'll need tons of at ZPM.

Quantium is used for T5 Rocket and item pipe that has the best throughput in GT.

[note]Make sure to bring your MBM to maximize ore yield.[/note]
data.title: §b§lCeres Trip
data.tooltip:
Ceres Trip
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs

data.name: Cheaper LV Circuits
data.data:
With the EV circuit assembler and SoCs you can now make microprocessors for a reduced price.

Remember that these can't be made into MV circuits.
data.title: §b§lCheaper LV Circuits
data.tooltip:
Cheaper LV Circuits
Prequest requests:
SoC - System on a Chip
EV Laser Engraver

data.name: Cheaper MV Circuits
data.data: With the IV circuit assembler and SoCs you can now make integrated processors for a reduced price.
data.title: §b§lCheaper MV Circuits
data.tooltip:
Cheaper MV Circuits
Prequest requests:
IV Circuit Assembler
SoC - System on a Chip
EV Laser Engraver

data.name: Chemically Bathing!
data.data: Yep, this really is an all-rounder line. Again you'll need some ammonium nitrate. Just another reminder for those who are yet to make a dedicated nitric acid setup :P
data.title: §b§lChemically Bathing!
data.tooltip:
Chemically Bathing!
Prequest requests:
A Little Bit of Sifting

data.name: Chemical Reactions at IV level
data.data:
High tier chemical recipes need a high tier IV chemical reactor.

Alternatively you can use your Large Chemical Reactor with two EV or one IV energy hatches.

[note]...Which you can make after you finish the platline. Have fun![/note]

§6If you missed it or forgot, hold a stack of the platline dust to skip the quests in between.

You can also skip PBI, but you need to hold 256.
data.title: §b§lChemical Reactions at IV level

data.name: Chromium Trioxide
data.data: Chromium Trioxide is made out of chrome and oxygen in two steps. First you make Chromium Dioxide and then Chromium Trioxide.
data.title: §b§lChromium Trioxide
data.tooltip:
Chromium Trioxide
Prequest requests:
Chemical Reactions at IV level

data.name: Class, Concentrate!
data.data: Your Acidic Osmium solution is way too weak to precipitate out Osmium. Go and distill it in a DT to get a more concentrated variant of it.
data.title: §b§lClass, Concentrate!

data.name: Compounding With Oxalic Acid
data.data: Combining your cerium chloride with oxalic acid yields you cerium oxalate. This can then be heated (in your EBF(s), of course) to get §oanother §rcerium oxide.
data.title: §b§lCompounding With Oxalic Acid

data.name: Concentrated Samarium
data.data:
Precipitate samarium ions with oxalic acid. Samarium oxalate is then washed with hydrochloric acid; you get Impure Samarium Chloride as a result. This Samarium chloride dust is the base material for the extraction of samarium.

To actually get Samarium Dust out of this, there are two methods, one is for IV, the other a bit later in LuV.
data.title: §b§lConcentrated Samarium

data.name: Cool it Back Down
data.data: You just need to run your Ruthenium Tetroxide through a fluid solidifier in this step to, well, solidify it.
data.title: §b§lCool it Back Down
data.tooltip:
Cool it Back Down
Prequest requests:
Why, Bart, Why?

data.name: Dilution, Yet Again
data.data:
Those sulfates aren't going to dilute themselves!

You get more fluid per piece of monazite, what's not to like?
data.title: §b§lDilution, Yet Again
data.tooltip:
Dilution, Yet Again
Prequest requests:
Sifting the Goodness Out

data.name: Dimethylbenzene
data.data: Dimethylbenzene can be distilled from Wood Tar or using Benzene and Methane gas in a Chemical Reactor.
data.title: §b§lDimethylbenzene

data.name: Diphenyl Isophtalate
data.data: Mix Sulfuric Acid, Phthalic acid and Phenol to get Diphenyl Isophtalate. An IV Chemical Reactor is needed.
data.title: §b§lDiphenyl Isophtalate

data.name: Dissolve Ir
data.data: Adding Hydrochloric Acid to Iridium Dioxide yields Acidic Iridium Solution.
data.title: §b§lDissolve Ir
data.tooltip:
Dissolve Ir
Prequest requests:
Removing Sludge From the Iridium

data.name: Dry It Real Good
data.data:
Your concentrate is far too damp! You'll need to dry it off in the EBF.

Thankfully the recipe is far from difficult.
data.title: §b§lDry It Real Good
data.tooltip:
Dry It Real Good
Prequest requests:
To Sift, or Not to Sift?

data.name: EBF Time2
data.data: For the next step in the process, just EBF your solution with some magnesium.
data.title: §b§lEBF Time

data.name: EuO
data.data:
Monazite europium?

Unfortunately you won't be able to process it until you actually have some actual europium, so just hold onto this for now.
data.title: §b§lEuO

data.name: Europa Trip
data.data:
Ledox is a material you need for Tier 4 Rockets which can be found on Europa. Look for it at Y 55-65. You can also find Chrome, Molybdenum, Manganese, Tungstate and Rubracium, among others.

[note]You can also get Ledox from small ores on Callisto.[/note]
data.title: §b§b§lEuropa Trip
data.tooltip:
Europa Trip
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs

data.name: Even Betterer Magnetic Rods
data.data: Like before, you're going to need better rods for your motors next tier. Build this to make your Magnetic Samarium Rods.
data.title: §b§lEven Betterer Magnetic Rods

data.name: Even More Chlorine Needed
data.data: By combining your Acidic Iridium Solution with Ammonia Chloride you'll get some Iridium Chloride, which is rather easy to process into Iridium. You're almost done.
data.title: §b§lEven More Chlorine Needed

data.name: Finally, Actual Hafnium
data.data:
Now that wasn't so hard, was it?

Hafnium is used as a component in making the Sparge tower which is useful if you ventured into the Liquid Fluorine Thorium Fluid Nuclear reactor.

You also get half of your Iodine back with this. Also, keep the runoff. It might become useful later, especially if stuff's suggested §owink wink nudge nudge§r
data.title: §b§lFinally, Actual Hafnium
data.tooltip:
Finally, Actual Hafnium
Prequest requests:
We Ain't Running a Farm!

data.name: Finally, Samarium!
data.data:
(And Gadolinium)

Easy, right? Not to worry, there's always the bastnasite line to stay your hunger for complex lines!

Samarium can be used to fuel your ever growing Magnetic Samarium Rods needs from LuV up to UHV while Gadolinium is used in the far lategame in the making of powerful Compact Fusion reactors.
data.title: §b§lFinally, Samarium!

data.name: Final Separation - Iridium & Osmium
data.data: You will need heat and Hydrochloric Acid to separate Iridium and Osmium from the Rarest Metal Residue, but we're getting to the end.
data.title: §b§lFinal Separation - Iridium & Osmium
data.tooltip:
Final Separation - Iridium & Osmium
Prequest requests:
Second Separation - Ruthenium

data.name: First Separation - Rhodium
data.data:
The Platinum Group processing line (AKA Platline) is a multi-step complicated process. Because of its complexity, and how much you need, you should have a processing line running all the time. You should be able to comprehend it better after doing these quests. Or maybe you set it up already, and you're siphoning off some of the results? Either way.

As a first step in getting Rhodium, Ruthenium, Iridium, and Osmium, we will split apart the Rhodium from the other metals in an EBF with the Potassium Disulfate you made previously.

The amounts for this step are pretty annoying, blame Bart for that.

[warn]Your output hatch needs to be at the bottom to collect the Rhodium Sulfate.[/warn]
data.title: §b§lFirst Separation - Rhodium
data.tooltip:
First Separation - Rhodium
Prequest requests:
Platinum Group Processing - All the Other Metals

data.name: Fluid From Sulfur Gas
data.data:
Combine the Rhodium Sulfate you got with Water, and you'll get Rhodium Sulfate Solution, as well as some more Leech Residue, and Molten Potassium.

You get just over 13 ingots' worth of Potassium back, you'll want to use the fluid solidifier and then macerate it to use it again.
data.title: §b§lFluid From Sulfur Gas
data.tooltip:
Fluid From Sulfur Gas
Prequest requests:
First Separation - Rhodium

data.name: Freezing Nitrates
data.data:
Yep, you're seeing right: A line with a vacuum freezer!

To separate some of the more... tricky elements, extreme cold is needed.
data.title: §b§lFreezing Nitrates
data.tooltip:
Freezing Nitrates
Prequest requests:
A Sift, a Sift! My Kingdom for a Sift!

data.name: Getting Samarium in IV
data.data:
Mix Samarium chloride dust with Salt. Electrolyze the result and the Samarium dust will be separated out.

Sodium and chlorine can also be fully recovered.

You also get some additional residue. It does not have any uses currently but might be useful in the future.
data.title: §b§lGetting Samarium in IV

data.name: Getting Samarium in LuV
data.data:
Once you get ZPM tier power (2 LuV energy hatches), this method is much better.

Melt the Samarium Chloride and reduce it with Lanthanum in a Distillation Tower. Then recover Lanthanum Chloride by electrolysis.
data.title: §b§lGetting Samarium in LuV
data.tooltip:
Getting Samarium in LuV
Prequest requests:
Concentrated Samarium
LuV Energy Hatch

data.name: Glowing Matter
data.data:
Another way to get Sunnarium! Just throw stacks of Glowing Coral and a tiny bit of UU-Matter in an autoclave and hope for the best.

You can either use an IC2 crop farm, or have any type of Glowstone farm and combine it with a GT++ Algae Farm.

A farm for Glowing Coral or Glowstone should also help you mass produce other resources like Gold, Redstone, Mercury, etc.

[note]You may want to check out the Industrial Autoclave for speeding things up, but you will need to be in LuV to build one.[/note]
data.title: §b§lGlowing Matter

data.name: Hafnium Line
data.data:
There is a key difference with hafnium here, however. Follow this mini line to hear more.

First off you'll need to react your hafnia with some hydrochloric acid.

And, like with zirconium, you'll need the solution rather than the dust.
data.title: §b§lHafnium Line

data.name: Heat it Up!
data.data: You can make Hot Tetroxide Solution in the fluid heater so get on with it!
data.title: §b§lHeat it Up!

data.name: HSS-S
data.data: Now that you have HSS-G, it's time to make HSS-S. This new alloy is an important part of a lot of LuV recipes.
data.title: §b§lHSS-S

data.name: Intradimensional Input buses
data.data:
This Special bus is rather pricey however it will allow all items that are in the bus to be accessible in all other linked buses in the same dimension.

This would allow multiple machines to work from the same input of items.

While holding a data stick the configuration settings can be copied with a left-click and pasted with a right-click on the bus.
data.title: §b§lIntradimensional Input buses
data.tooltip:
Intradimensional Input buses
Prequest requests:
Polybenzimidazole, Finally!
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in IV

data.name: Io Trip
data.data:
Any ore veins not on Mercury are on this planet for this tier. The pyrolusite vein can have niobium extracted from it, and samarium can be acquired from mytryl and rubracium. Infused gold is also found here.

[note]Like Venus, you can collect firestone from small ore here.[/note]
data.title: §b§lIo Trip
data.tooltip:
Io Trip
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Tier 4 DIMs

data.name: Iridium2
data.data:
Add Calcium to Iridium Chloride to finally get pure Iridium.

You can run the Metallic Sludge through a centrifuge to get nickel and copper, while the Calcium Chloride needs to be solidified in a fluid solidifier before it can be electrolyzed for calcium and chlorine.

BTW, this step is only EV, the only part that is, so you could do it earlier if you really wanted to.
data.title: §b§lIridium

data.name: IV Assembler
data.data: An IV assembler is required to make new coils, or enriched Sunnarium for HV Solar Panels.
data.title: §b§lIV Assembler
data.tooltip:
IV Assembler
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in IV

data.name: IV Circuit Assembler
data.data: The IV circuit assembler will let you make easier MV circuits, as well as single step EV circuits.
data.title: §b§lIV Circuit Assembler
data.tooltip:
IV Circuit Assembler
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in IV

data.name: IV Energy Hatch
data.data:
You'll need this to increase the power to your multis and progress.

You need some Vanadium-Gallium to make HPIC Wafers for it, and an IV Cutting Machine if you haven't made the multi.

[note]I hope you had fun with the platline, lol.[/note]
data.title: §b§lIV Energy Hatch
data.tooltip:
IV Energy Hatch
Prequest requests:
IV Superconductors (8192 EU/t)
Iridium2
IV Assembler

data.name: IV Mixer
data.data:
An IV mixer is required for example to mix HSS-S dust or to make IV superconductors.

You can also check out the Mass Processing tab and make a multiblock mixer out of this one.
data.title: §b§lIV Mixer

data.name: IV Superconductors (8192 EU/t)
data.data:
How about lossless 8192 EU Wires? Vanadiumtriindinide is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss.

From now on, SCs are not optional, you need to make them to craft stuff.
data.title: §b§lIV Superconductors (8192 EU/t)

data.name: Keep Soldering On!
data.data: You have been using a very basic soldering alloy for a while now. Time for an upgrade! You will need it in your Assembly Line.
data.title: §b§lKeep Soldering On!

data.name: Leach The Concentrate
data.data: Here you have two options: Either you can mix some water with your nitrated mixture for relatively low yield, or you can mix it with the cerium-containing mixture you get from ores for double the amount.
data.title: §b§lLeach The Concentrate

data.name: Mallard Rust Smelly
data.data:
Or is it Alloy Blast Smelter? Well, that makes more sense. This multiblock creates the higher tier alloys needed for more advanced multiblocks and your soldering needs. It directly smelts ingredients into liquids. You can even melt down metals like Tungsten faster too! Until you get better coils for your EBF at least.

[note]Most of the multiblocks you can now make are optional, but quite powerful upgrades to your current singleblock setups. Not only do they provide more speed, they also have a bit of advanced functionality: you can also electrolyze materials without using cells or use a single multiblock for many different extruder shapes. They also act as cleanrooms where needed.[/note]
data.title: §b§lMallard Rust Smelly

data.name: Matter Manipulator MKI
data.data:
The MKI is where you really start unlocking the potential of the Matter Manipulator. This new one has a §264 Block§r range and a §264 Block/Second§r speed limit.

Unlike it's prototype predecessor, this now has §53 new modes§r made available to you:

§l- Geometry§r: Places standard blocks in a selected and configurable shape.

§l- Cable§r: Allows you to place AE and GT cables & pipes in lines (and connecting them automatically).

§l- Exchange§r: Allows you to swap large swaths of blocks like the TC Equal Trade Focus.

Additionally, it can now connect to your §5AE network§r for automatically transferring items and liquids. You can link the tool in your security terminal and use it while within wireless range.

When something is placed into the world, the tool will §3pull§r from inventories in this order:
1 - ME system
2 - Player's inventory
3 - Uplink§r

When something is removed from the world, the tool will §3push§r into inventories in this order:
1 - ME system
2 - Uplink
3 - Player's inventory
4 - The Ground (Items Only)

[note]This also comes stock with the ability to remove blocks, so there is no need for another excavation upgrade.[/note]
data.title: §b§lMatter Manipulator MKI
data.tooltip:
Matter Manipulator MKI
Prequest requests:
Tier 5 (IV)
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in IV

data.name: Mercury Trip
data.data: The only interesting ore on this planet is the deep iron from small ores. Grab a ton of it so you can get trinium out of it.
data.title: §b§lMercury Trip
data.tooltip:
Mercury Trip
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Tier 4 DIMs

data.name: Monazite
data.data:
Welcome to lanthanide processing!
It'll be a fun journey, whether you like it or not :P

First off get some monazite. This is only to get you started,
as you're going to need a §oton§o§o§r to truly reap the rewards
of this line.

You'll then need to combine it with nitric acid in the Digester multiblock,
to get its mud form.
Yes, this is a §overy§r nitric acid hungry process!

[note]To skip all of the Monazite quests hold a stack of each of these in your hand:

- Zirconium Dust / Ingot
- Hafnia Ingot
- Cerium Dust / Ingot
- Samarium Dust / Ingot[/note]
data.title: §b§lMonazite

data.name: More Samarium!
data.data:
If you have a stable Samarium resource acquisition, refining Samarium Ore should be the best way to get Samarium.

As the first step, dissolve some Samarium Ore Concentrate Dust or Crushed Samarium Ore (you probably don't have access to this option yet) in Nitric Acid in a Digester to get Muddy Samarium Rare Earth Solution. Thorium and Phosphate are retained in the form of a solid slag powder.

Then transfer the muddy solution to a Dissolution Tank and continue to soak it in nitric acid. The undissolved powder is then meticulously filtered out, yielding some Cerium.

Then dilute the result with water to adjust the pH.
data.title: §b§lMore Samarium!

data.name: Naquadah Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
data.data: To make more advanced wafers, you need to make Naquadah Doped Monocrystalline Silicon first. The process takes 750 seconds and requires Silicon Solar Grade blocks, a Naquadah Ingot, and a Gallium Arsenide Crystal in the Electric Blast Furnace. You can make 64 wafers out of every boule.
data.title: §b§lNaquadah Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
data.tooltip:
Naquadah Doped Monocrystalline Silicon
Prequest requests:
Your First Naquadah Ingot

data.name: Naquadah Doped Wafer
data.data: To create some naquadah doped silicon wafers, place the monocrystalline naquadah doped silicon boule in a cutting machine. An HV cutting machine is needed for future advanced wafers and chips.
data.title: §b§lNaquadah Doped Wafer
data.tooltip:
Naquadah Doped Wafer
Prequest requests:
Naquadah Doped Monocrystalline Silicon

data.name: Niobium-Titanium
data.data: Niobium-Titanium becomes more important in LuV Tier. It needs an EV Mixer to mix and an Electric Blast Furnace with TPV heating coils.
data.title: §b§lNiobium-Titanium

data.name: Nitration Mixture
data.data: We also need nitration mixture. We can do it out of nitric acid and sulfuric acid.
data.title: §b§lNitration Mixture

data.name: Nitration Time... Again
data.data: You'll need to add even more nitric acid to be able to deal with the dust further.
data.title: §b§lNitration Time... Again
data.tooltip:
Nitration Time... Again
Prequest requests:
Dry It Real Good

data.name: Not Quite Ferromagnetic...
data.data:
...But it's enough to separate with the magnetic separator.

Now you can get both Europium III Oxide and some of the rarer rare earths.
data.title: §b§lNot Quite Ferromagnetic...

data.name: Now for Nitration
data.data:
For the next step you'll need ammonium nitrate (again with the nitric acid!) and your diluted monazite sulfate.
You'll need to do this in an LCR.

The resulting fluid simply vanishes into the void. Best not to worry about it.
data.title: §b§lNow for Nitration

data.name: On Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs
data.data: There's some good stuff in the asteroids, so you should stop by. Especially for the naquadah.
data.title: §b§lOn Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs
data.tooltip:
On Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs
Prequest requests:
Tier 5 (IV)

data.name: On Your Way to Tier 4 DIMs
data.data: Tier 4 Planets are Jupiter's Moon Io where you will find the next dungeon, Venus (needs a SpaceSuit) and Mercury.
data.title: §b§lOn Your Way to Tier 4 DIMs
data.tooltip:
On Your Way to Tier 4 DIMs
Prequest requests:
Assembly Line
Callisto Trip

data.name: Osmiridium
data.data: Osmiridium is a quite expensive alloy. You'll need it to make Pure Tears to get rid of your Warp if you've been doing Thaumcraft. It's also used in the ZPM emitter and sensor.
data.title: §b§lOsmiridium

data.name: Osmium2
data.data: Since you have concentrated your solution, it's now time to gather the solid Osmium from it. Go ahead and mix it with Hydrochloric Acid.
data.title: §b§lOsmium

data.name: Oxalic Acid
data.data:
Oxalic Acid is really only useful for cerium processing. Go ahead and make a bit.

There are a couple options for this so just look through NEI and pick whichever is most suitable for you.
data.title: §b§lOxalic Acid

data.name: Palladium
data.data: Lastly, add Formic Acid to Reprecipitated Palladium to get pure Palladium, along with other stuff you can reuse.
data.title: §b§lPalladium
data.tooltip:
Palladium
Prequest requests:
Another Acid to Worry About!
Repreci... what?

data.name: Palladium Processing
data.data:
Palladium is a rather useful Platinum Group Metal, necessary to make all machines in LuV.

This questline will help you figure out how to process it properly.

First, process some of your Palladium Enriched Ammonia to Palladium Salt Dust.
data.title: §b§lPalladium Processing
data.tooltip:
Palladium Processing
Prequest requests:
Chemical Reactions at IV level

data.name: Phenol2
data.data: You can get Phenol in different ways, but if you don't have any, you can make some using chlorobenzene and some water.
data.title: §b§lPhenol

data.name: Phthalic Acid
data.data: To get Phthalic Acid you need mix Dimethylbenzene, Potassium Dichromate and Oxygen in an EV Chemical Reactor.
data.title: §b§lPhthalic Acid

data.name: Platinum Group Processing - All the Other Metals
data.data:
If you've been processing Platinum, you should have a lot of Platinum Residue Dust lying around.

Now you can finally process it and gain all the rest of the delicious rare metals from it. But to do so, we'll need some to make Potassium Disulfate, and then fluid extract it to get the molten version beforehand.
data.title: §b§lPlatinum Group Processing - All the Other Metals
data.tooltip:
Platinum Group Processing - All the Other Metals
Prequest requests:
Chemical Reactions at IV level

data.name: Polybenzimidazole
data.data:
Polybenzimidazole or PBI is a synthetic fiber needed in ZPM Hulls and in high tier solar panels, and can also be used to make some other items more efficiently. It has many steps to produce it. Let's start with chlorobenzene, but keep in mind you'll need to complete the other non-platline IV-tier chemical quests too.

§6Already automated PBI? Hold 256 sheets to skip this questline.
data.title: §b§lPolybenzimidazole

data.name: Polybenzimidazole, Finally!
data.data: 3,3 Diaminobenzidine and Diphenyl Isophtalate will finally give you molten Polybenzimidazole. Use a plate mold to get plates.
data.title: §b§lPolybenzimidazole, Finally!

data.name: Potassium Dichromate
data.data: Potassium Dichromate is made out of Potassium Nitrate and Chromium Trioxide in an HV Chemical Reactor.
data.title: §b§lPotassium Dichromate

data.name: Potassium Nitrate
data.data:
Potassium Nitrate is made from Potassium and Nitric Acid.
If you have some saltpeter you can use that instead.


Potassium nitrate can only be crafted while saltpeter has many different sources.
Pick the one you prefer, only one is needed to complete the quest.
data.title: §b§lPotassium Nitrate
data.tooltip:
Potassium Nitrate
Prequest requests:
Chemical Reactions at IV level

data.name: QBit Wafer and Chip
data.data: The Qbit Wafer is made out of a Nano CPU Wafer and either Quantum Eyes and Gallium Arsenide, or IGP and Radon. Cut it for Qbit processor chips.
data.title: §b§lQBit Wafer and Chip
data.tooltip:
QBit Wafer and Chip
Prequest requests:
NanoCPU Wafer and Chip
IV Circuit Assembler

data.name: Quantum Assembly
data.data: Quantum Assembly is an IV Circuit.
data.title: §b§lQuantum Assembly

data.name: Quantum Mainframe
data.data: The Quantum Mainframe is the first ZPM circuit you can make.
data.title: §b§lQuantum Mainframe

data.name: Quantum Star
data.data: Both the IV emitter and sensor need a Quantum Star to craft them. Hope you automated Radon production.
data.title: §b§lQuantum Star
data.tooltip:
Quantum Star
Prequest requests:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in IV

data.name: Quantum Supercomputer
data.data: The Quantum Supercomputer is an LuV Circuit.
data.title: §b§lQuantum Supercomputer

data.name: Removing Sludge From the Iridium
data.data: Separating Iridium from the Sludge is quite easy. Just heat it in the Blast Furnace and you're done with this step. The Sludge can be centrifuged into Gold and SiO2.
data.title: §b§lRemoving Sludge From the Iridium
data.tooltip:
Removing Sludge From the Iridium
Prequest requests:
Final Separation - Iridium & Osmium

data.name: Repreci... what?
data.data:
Reprecipitated! It means you have separated a solid from a solution/suspension, then dissolved it again, and then separated it again.

Combine the original Palladium Enriched Ammonia with Palladium Metallic Powder. This will get you Palladium Salt again, but also Reprecipitated Palladium.

From now on you should skip the first step, it's not necessary anymore as this gives the same thing, but more. You do need to find a way to combine the dusts automatically though.

When/if you run out of Palladium Enriched Ammonia, you can make more by adding Ammonia to Palladium Metallic Powder.
data.title: §b§lRepreci... what?
data.tooltip:
Repreci... what?
Prequest requests:
Salty Metals Are the Worst!

data.name: Re-Solving the Purity Issue
data.data: Hmm, the sifting did well, you lost a lot of impurities, but also, new ones from the sifting grates are there... Time to filter them out with water.
data.title: §b§lRe-Solving the Purity Issue
data.tooltip:
Re-Solving the Purity Issue
Prequest requests:
Sift it Goooood

data.name: Rhodium
data.data: This is the last step for Rhodium. You also get some Chlorine and Ammonia back.
data.title: §b§lRhodium

data.name: Rhodium-Plated Palladium
data.data:
Rhodium Plated Palladium is the LuV Tier Hull Material. Now that you know how to make it, you should automate it and make a bunch, you're gonna need it.

Why is it called plated if it's clearly an alloy you ask? I don't know either!
data.title: §b§lRhodium-Plated Palladium

data.name: Ross128b Trip
data.data: Ross128b is a lovely and habitable planet, that does not contain any hostile lifeforms. It offers a several new ore veins and, rumors say, there are ruins of ancient civilizations that left quite a few machines there. You can find this planet to the galactic south.
data.title: §b§lRoss128b Trip
data.tooltip:
Ross128b Trip
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Asteroids and Other Rocket Tier 3 DIMs

data.name: Ruri... Ruridididi?
data.data:
Combining Ruthenium with Iridium yields a very special metal, that is needed for LuV components.

You're gonna need a bunch of it.
data.title: §b§lRuri... Ruridididi?

data.name: Ruthenium
data.data: The final step to get Ruthenium is to react it with Hydrochloric Acid and you're done. You also get some Chlorine and Water.
data.title: §b§lRuthenium

data.name: Salt Can't be Stored in Water?
data.data: Dissolve the Rhodium Salt in Water in a mixer to get Rhodium Salt Solution.
data.title: §b§lSalt Can't be Stored in Water?
data.tooltip:
Salt Can't be Stored in Water?
Prequest requests:
Another One Bites the Salt

data.name: Salty Metals Are the Worst!
data.data: Now that you have Palladium Salt, you need to sift it to get Palladium Metallic Powder. You only have a 95% chance to get a dust.
data.title: §b§lSalty Metals Are the Worst!
data.tooltip:
Salty Metals Are the Worst!
Prequest requests:
Palladium Processing

data.name: Samarium, The Other Way
data.data: Only thing left to do is to centrifuge your concentrated dust to get samarium. You get a little thorianite too so, win.
data.title: §b§lSamarium, The Other Way
data.tooltip:
Samarium, The Other Way
Prequest requests:
The Other Way

data.name: Saturation Needed
data.data:
You're nearly done!

Now you need to mix with acetone.
data.title: §b§lSaturation Needed

data.name: Second Separation - Ruthenium
data.data:
For the next step in the process, we will split up the Ruthenium from the Leach Residue. Remember that you can get it from both Platinum Residue and a little bit more from making Rhodium Sulfate Solution.

You'll need Saltpeter and Saltwater for this. You can pump saltwater or make it, and mine saltpeter or make it too. Given how much KNO3 you need, you should probably automate making it.

For the steam, you can just void it.
data.title: §b§lSecond Separation - Ruthenium

data.name: Separate Those Last Specks
data.data: Now to centrifuge what remains. You get a little chloromethane back too, so what's not to like?
data.title: §b§lSeparate Those Last Specks

data.name: Sifting the Goodness Out
data.data:
Yes, you're seeing right. A fluid sifting recipe! A lot of the materials here won't be good sources in any way, but they're literally better than nothing.

Monazite Sulfate isn't an actual compound btw, just a term for a collection of rare earth sulfates and other things.

I'll only ask for the primary output as who wants to worry about chances?
data.title: §b§lSifting the Goodness Out

data.name: Sift it Goooood
data.data: Sift Rhodium Nitrate to get Rhodium Filter Cake. You only have a 95% chance to get a dust.
data.title: §b§lSift it Goooood

data.name: Single Step EV Circuits
data.data: Quantum Processors are your first chance to make EV circuits in a single craft.
data.title: §b§lSingle Step EV Circuits
data.tooltip:
Single Step EV Circuits
Prequest requests:
Empty Fiber Reinforced Glass Board
QBit Wafer and Chip

data.name: SoC - System on a Chip
data.data: To make cheaper LV and MV circuits you need SoCs. System on a chip.
data.title: §b§lSoC - System on a Chip
data.tooltip:
SoC - System on a Chip
Prequest requests:
Naquadah Doped Wafer
EV Laser Engraver

data.name: Sodium Nitrate
data.data: You need Sodium Nitrate to process your Rhodium further.
data.title: §b§lSodium Nitrate
data.tooltip:
Sodium Nitrate
Prequest requests:
Salt Can't be Stored in Water?

data.name: The Other Part
data.data:
Getting tired of all the names yet? Hope so.

Now to chlorinate and heat, in order to separate the whole dust further.
data.title: §b§lThe Other Part

data.name: The Other Way
data.data:
When you inevitably get Samarium Ore, you'll end up getting a ton of this dust. There are a couple of options here: One includes the monazite line and has a higher yield, the other is simpler but has a poorer yield.
We'll look at the latter here.

Eventually you'll probably want to switch entirely to the monazite option, but for now, supplementing it with this can be a good idea.
data.title: §b§lThe Other Way
data.tooltip:
The Other Way
Prequest requests:
Chemical Reactions at IV level

data.name: There's My Salt!
data.data: Combine Rhodium Salt Solution with Sodium Nitrate to get Rhodium Nitrate.
data.title: §b§lThere's My Salt!
data.tooltip:
There's My Salt!
Prequest requests:
Sodium Nitrate
Salt Can't be Stored in Water?

data.name: The sane option
data.data:
So you choose the sane two step processing option?

Great choice.

To get started you will need to create a Titanium tier Chemical Plant with §nat least HV tier machine casings.§r It can be HV tier casings as two HV tier energy hatches will overclock the multiblock to EV.

Once completed, place in your Borax Dust. Then in the second step feed in your Thorium Dust with some Distilled Water.

Then you have your Thorium 232 Dust, nice and easy.
data.title: §b§lThe sane option

data.name: The Start of Cerium
data.data:
This line will guide you through obtaining elemental cerium.

First, react your cerium dioxide with ammonium chloride for some cerium chloride.
data.title: §b§lThe Start of Cerium
data.tooltip:
The Start of Cerium
Prequest requests:
A Sift, a Sift! My Kingdom for a Sift!

data.name: This Is Probably Not Worth It
data.data:
You can EBF that thorium-phosphate dust to continue that chain but the yield isn't too great in the end...

Still, if you have the resources, why not?
data.title: §b§lThis Is Probably Not Worth It
data.tooltip:
This Is Probably Not Worth It
Prequest requests:
A Little Bit of Sifting

data.name: Thorium 232?
data.data:
So you were looking at Thorium 232 and wondering how to make it?

You could centrifuge it at a horrible chance rate with a long recipe but there are better ways of obtaining it.

The better ways are processing chains that can be made in three different paths with the third path being unlocked at a further stage after obtaining Fusion with the Neutron Activator.

The first path requires the chemical plant multiblock that you might not be familiar with but will become required to create rocket fuel for any tier three or higher rocket. This path is the fastest with only two steps to obtain the Thorium 232, but requires borax which can only be obtained (for now) through mining salt veins as a byproduct or through bees (probably the better option if you already have some).

The second path is a six step processing chain that requires Chemical Reactors, a Centrifuge, and an EBF. Even though it is longer it offers much better conversion ratio (75% instead of 25% in chemical plant), instead of borax it requires nitric acid (4000L per dust if you account for recycling) and 100L of fluorine per dust.

Either way I would recommend using AE2FC as it allows on demand fluid crafting which will assist in both processing chains.
data.title: §b§lThorium 232?

data.name: Thorium and Phosphate
data.data: Now you can thermal centrifuge the dust to get both thorium and phosphate out. Told you the yields weren't great...
data.title: §b§lThorium and Phosphate
data.tooltip:
Thorium and Phosphate
Prequest requests:
This Is Probably Not Worth It

data.name: Tier 5 (IV)
data.data:
IV-Level. You will need Tungstensteel for machines. Suggested planets and moons to visit: Mars, Phobos, Deimos.

Make sure to get a set of TPV coils for your EBF.

You should've learned "how to GregTech" by now. If not, go clean up the machine craters in your base...

Many GT++ multiblock machines unlock at this tier. Make sure you have an Alloy Blast Smelter ready to go and check the GT++ tab.
data.title: §b§lTier 5 (IV)

data.name: To Sift, or Not to Sift?
data.data:
The real question is, who came up with all these sifting recipes?

You can get some Uranium out of this so it's not all bad.
data.title: §b§lTo Sift, or Not to Sift?
data.tooltip:
To Sift, or Not to Sift?
Prequest requests:
Chemically Bathing!

data.name: Universal pickaxe, Vajra
data.data:
This tool can mine blocks instantly, including GregTech blocks or cables.

Using left-click will mine blocks as usual, right-clicking will harvest blocks 1 by 1. Enabling silk touch will work for both.

[note]To enable silk touch mode Shift+Right Click air while holding the Vajra.[/note]

[warn]If you already have a Vajra built before GTNH version 2.8, you can put it in the crafting grid to swap it to the new version[/warn]
data.title: §b§lUniversal pickaxe, Vajra

data.name: Uranium?
data.data: §o§r...And sift it to get the uranium. You §odo§o§r get some 235 out of it so time not entirely wasted, hopefully?
data.title: §b§lUranium?

data.name: Uranium Filtrate
data.data: You can process this further with some hydrofluoric acid.
data.title: §b§lUranium Filtrate
data.tooltip:
Uranium Filtrate
Prequest requests:
To Sift, or Not to Sift?

data.name: Venus Trip
data.data:
Venus has 3 different veins, with quantium and titanium the most important to grab. And Naquadah if you still don't have enough.

[note]You can also get firestone from small ore if you still need it.[/note]

§5Warning! Venus requires a full set of armor with the Spacesuit capability in it or it will kill the player on entering it!!

Check the space race chapter for more information.
data.title: §b§lVenus Trip
data.tooltip:
Venus Trip
Prequest requests:
On Your Way to Tier 4 DIMs

data.name: Wait are you sure?
data.data:
So for some reason you have decided to pick the EBF option.

Well get ready for a processing line.

First you need to react Thorium Dust with Hydrofluoric Acid and eight buckets of Nitric Acid. I hope you have a Nitric Acid setup.

Then react the Thorium Nitrate with Sodium Hydroxide to produce Thorium Hydroxide. Then react with even more Hydrofluoric Acid to get Thorium Tetrafluoride.

Then pump it into a Centrifuge to separate the normal Thorium away from the Thorium 232. Sadly it is still in a liquid form so you will need to blast it with Zinc Chloride and Calcium.

Then finally use your Blast Furnace again for the Zn-Th alloy ingot to separate the Zinc from the Thorium 232 to obtain the Thorium 232 Dust and even get your Zinc back in fluid form.

Well I hope you enjoyed the processing line for Thorium 232 EBF edition.
data.title: §b§lWait are you sure?

data.name: Watery Mud
data.data:
That mud on its own is far too concentrated, so you'll need to dilute it with water in the Dissolution Tank.

Fun fact, the saltpeter in the recipe was only added due to a problem with recipe search!

You also get some Zirconium and Hafnium from this. You'll probably need both later on, so definitely don't void any.
data.title: §b§lWatery Mud

data.name: We Ain't Running a Farm!
data.data:
...What's this low-purity hafnium stuff?

Well, because you of course want your hafnium to be of the highest quality, you're going to have to do a little more than just EBF it with a little magnesium.

Go ahead and react it with some Iodine. If you're not too sure where to get Iodine, have a look at Seaweed Ash. (hint: you'll need to look at small piles)

Note that both the liquid and dust forms of iodine are optional, so you can complete the quest with one. Or none!
data.title: §b§lWe Ain't Running a Farm!
data.tooltip:
We Ain't Running a Farm!
Prequest requests:
EBF Time2

data.name: Where's the Salt?
data.data: Add Chlorine to Sodium Ruthenate to get Ruthenium Tetroxide Solution.
data.title: §b§lWhere's the Salt?

data.name: Why, Bart, Why?
data.data:
Take your Hot Ruthenium Tetroxide Solution and distill it in a DT to get Ruthenium Tetroxide. Also, Salt and Water.

The amounts in this step are quite annoying unfortunately. You need to run it 5 times to get whole cell amounts.
data.title: §b§lWhy, Bart, Why?

data.name: You Can't Be Cerious!
data.data:
Punny, right?

You now can electrolyze the cerium oxide to get pure elemental cerium dust.

Oh, and oxygen, but who cares about that anymore?

This handy material is useful in many different multiblock machines that will be unlocked in later tiers such as the Precise Assembler, the Elemental Duplicator and better casings to the Chemical Plant for a new tier of rocket fuel.
data.title: §b§lYou Can't Be Cerious!
data.tooltip:
You Can't Be Cerious!
Prequest requests:
Compounding With Oxalic Acid

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in IV
data.data: Some machines need emitters and sensors, like the analyzer or the circuit assembler.
data.title: §b§lYou're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in IV
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in IV
Prequest requests:
Quantum Star

data.name: You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in IV
data.data: Pumps, pistons, conveyor modules and robot arms are the most needed machine parts in IV. Go and craft one of each.
data.title: §b§lYou're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in IV
data.tooltip:
You're Gonna Hate This 1-4 in IV
Prequest requests:
Tier 5 (IV)

data.name: Your First Naquadah Ingot
data.data:
You may have noticed that you can't get naquadah dust from the naquadah ore, it will only give you the Naquadah Oxide Mixture (NOM) dust, annoying.

The full naquadah processing line is too complex and does not fit in IV. I believe you won't want to set up another line after finishing Platinum, PBI and Lanthanide lines.

Lucky, you can directly smelt the NOM dust into naquadah nuggets in EBF, but it is inefficient and you will lose the byproducts in it.

[note]PS: The Naquadah Oxide Mixture was once called "Naquadah Metal Oxide Mixture" and someone called it Nq-MOM for short.[/note]
data.title: §b§lYour First Naquadah Ingot

data.name: Yttrium Barium Cuprate
data.data: Yttrium Barium Cuprate becomes more important in LuV Tier. It needs an EV Mixer to mix and an Electric Blast Furnace with TPV heating coils.
data.title: §b§lYttrium Barium Cuprate

data.name: Zirconia-Hafnia Blend
data.data:
This process is a little involved so I'll guide you through it. First, centrifuge the dust you got from the dissolution tank.

Because Hafnium and Zirconium are refractory metals, like Titanium and Zirconium,
they have very similar process to it and each other.
data.title: §b§lZirconia-Hafnia Blend

data.name: Zirconium Ingots
data.data:
Just EBF your zirconium tetrachloride with some magnesium and you're done!

Zirconium is used in many different multiblock machines such as the Industrial mixer and the Alloy blast smelter that you might have already built. It's also used in the creation of High Density rods for an extra boost to your nuclear reactors.
data.title: §b§lZirconium Ingots

data.name: Zirconium Line
data.data:
To get started, react your zirconia with some hydrochloric acid.

The dust on its own is kinda useless, though... Make it into a solution instead.
data.title: §b§lZirconium Line

data.name: Accelerating Things
data.data: If an ender quarry won't satisfy your needs for MOOORE. A speed upgrade is required.
data.title: §c§lAccelerating Things

data.name: Accelerating Things III
data.data: If Speed upgrade II is too slow craft a speed upgrade III.
data.title: §c§lAccelerating Things III

data.name: Accelerating Things II
data.data: While the ender quarry on its own with speed upgrade is good, why not speed it up a little bit more?
data.title: §c§lAccelerating Things II

data.name: Advanced SMDs
data.data:
To craft circuits from the crystal processor series and beyond, you'll need these.

If you use these to make a circuit tier lower than Crystal, it'll use 1/4 the amount compared to normal SMDs, and half the required time.
data.title: §c§lAdvanced SMDs

data.name: Almost Success
data.data: Now you only have to subside the naquadah from the solution. Hooray!
data.title: §c§lAlmost Success

data.name: Another Solvent
data.data: Why does it need seed oil?
data.title: §c§lAnother Solvent

data.name: Antimony and Chlorine
data.data: Now put the antimony, chlorine and ether in an LCR to get antimony trichloride solution.
data.title: §c§lAntimony and Chlorine

data.name: Assline Quest Updates
data.data: When the pack updates and changes an assembly line recipe, your old data sticks also need to change their recipe. In old versions, you needed to update the sticks by scanning new items, but now they will update automatically if placed in the assembly line, so you don't need to change things manually. If there is some kind of bug with data stick recipes after updating, do let the developers know, either on the Discord server or on GitHub.
data.title: §c§lAssline Quest Updates

data.name: Automated Mining
data.data:
The QED enables you to assemble the most convenient device for mining: The ender quarry.

As 0lafe says, "This small black box is life-changing" and "Sympathy for the amount of dense obsidian plates you need."

Guess you better get compressing!

[warn]NOTE: It's best to place your quarry and markers on ore vein boundaries. This way you start getting ores right away, especially from planets.[/warn]
data.title: §c§lAutomated Mining

data.name: Behold: The Netherite Line
data.data:
You didn't seriously think you only needed to do the Naquadah line in LuV did you? Well if so; better brace yourself for the Netherite line!

Don't panic, it's a relatively straight-forward line so long as you can wrap your head around minor processing loops and percent based output. Fortunately you have a quest book to guide you through your initial setup.

Be warned- you will need at least §2§lGrade 1 Purified Water§r and§5§l Naquadah Coils§r to make it through this entire line.

§3This questline will start you off with the three primary things you must prepare in order to begin:

§l- Milled Netherrack
- Nether Air
- Ancient Debris Collection§r

§3For at least one and likely two of those you will need to journey into the nether, so make sure you're prepared equipment wise!§r

[warn]If you already created the line and do not wish to complete the individual quests, hold one of these three item sets in your hand after completing this quest: [/warn]

§4§l- 1 Dense Netherite Plate
- 64 Intensely Bonded Netherite Nanoparticles
- 16 Netherite Ingots
data.title: §c§lBehold: The Netherite Line
data.tooltip:
Behold: The Netherite Line
Prequest requests:
LuV Energy Hatch

data.name: Brittle Netherite Scrap
data.data:
You're so close... just a few more steps.

Now that you've attained the Netherite Scrap Seeds, you can combine them with Poor Nether Waste in a §5§lChemical Bath§r for a §2§l50%§r chance to get 3 §4Brittle Netherite Scraps§r. As a bonus, there's even a §2§l50%§r chance that you get your Netherite Scrap Seed back to run the recipe over again.

[note]Don't worry, this is the last Netherite recipe based on chance.[/note]
data.title: §c§lBrittle Netherite Scrap
data.tooltip:
Brittle Netherite Scrap
Prequest requests:
Poor Nether Waste
Netherite Scrap Seed

data.name: Cheaper HV circuits
data.data: You can make Nano Processors cheaper than before. You'll need to make an imprint first though.
data.title: §c§lCheaper HV circuits
data.tooltip:
Cheaper HV circuits
Prequest requests:
ASoC - Advanced System on a Chip
Imprints, They're Important

data.name: Clarifier
data.data: The first step in the water purification process is the clarifier. Operating this machine is a simple task, you will just need to maintain a steady supply of Activated Carbon for the filters. Using this machine, you will be able to make Grade 1 Purified Water, which can speed up processing of Naquadah-Doped Boules and Wafers by 25%.
data.title: §c§lClarifier

data.name: Crystal Assembly
data.data: The Crystal Assembly is a LuV Circuit.
data.title: §c§lCrystal Assembly

data.name: Crystal Chips
data.data:
To make these chips you need Europium, as well as an HV Autoclave in the Asteroids dimension (or on your space station) to achieve "low gravity".

[note]Alternatively you can use an Industrial Autoclave.[/note]
data.title: §c§lCrystal Chips
data.tooltip:
Crystal Chips
Prequest requests:
LuV Circuit Assembler
LuV Laser Engraver
Getting Europium

data.name: Crystal Mainframe
data.data: The Crystal Mainframe is the first UV circuit you can make.
data.title: §c§lCrystal Mainframe

data.name: Crystal Processors
data.data:
Now that you're this far into LuV, you can make easier IV circuits, as well as your first UV circuit.

After crafting each circuit, make an imprint of it to reduce the cost of following ones.
data.title: §c§lCrystal Processors
data.tooltip:
Crystal Processors
Prequest requests:
Advanced SMDs
NanoCPU Wafer and Chip
Niobium-Titanium
Elite Circuit Board
Imprints, They're Important

data.name: Crystal Supercomputer
data.data: The Crystal Supercomputer is a ZPM circuit.
data.title: §c§lCrystal Supercomputer

data.name: Dense Netherite Plate
data.data:
Once you've managed to aquire 36 of these Intensely Bonded Netherite Nanoparticles you can finally create your very first Netherite material: The §4§lDense Netherite Plate§r.

You will need one of these for the §3§lMk1 Fusion Reactor§r, which is required to create the rest of the Netherite materials.
data.title: §c§lDense Netherite Plate
data.tooltip:
Dense Netherite Plate
Prequest requests:
Intensely Bonded Netherite Nanoparticles

data.name: EBF Time1
data.data: Heat the NOM dust with fluoroantimonic acid and it will dissolve the Nq, Ga, Ad, and the titanium will become precipitate.
data.title: §c§lEBF Time

data.name: Elite Circuit Board
data.data: A new circuit line, a new board. Also required for the Hi-Computation Station MK-I.
data.title: §c§lElite Circuit Board
data.tooltip:
Elite Circuit Board
Prequest requests:
Tier 6 (LuV)
Empty Fiber Reinforced Glass Board

data.name: Ether Strike!
data.data:
The naquadah is so inert that most acids won't react with it, so you need a more powerful kind of acid to dissolve it.

Let's prepare some necessary organic solvent to make the acid.

[warn]If you have already created the Naquadah line, hold 64 Naquadah Ingot / Dust to skip these quests.[/warn]
data.title: §c§lEther Strike!

data.name: Extraction
data.data: Now, the metal elements have been concentrated in solution.
data.title: §c§lExtraction

data.name: Fetching Cubic Zirconia
data.data:
For Cubic Zirconia, you'll need to combine Zirconium and Yttrium Oxide in the EBF as well. Fortunately you only need the dusts.

You can get Zirconium from:
1) The Red Zircon ore on Ross128b <- Do this one
2) Sifting Cassiterite, Tin, or Ilmenite <- Do this one if you hate Ross

Oxygen isn't hard to get, but the Yttrium more than makes up for it. You have a couple options:
1) Make Rare Earth (I) out of Rare Earth (see the MV quest) and get it out of Xenotime
2) Make Rare Earth (II) out of Rare Earth using a stronger acid and get it from Yttriaite
3) When you have a T6 rocket, you can pick some Yttrium ore up from Triton, making you cry at how much easier it is
4) In ZPM you can try going to the Toxic Everglades to grab weird GT++ ores, some of which have Yttrium in them (Yay RNG ore worldgen!)

To get Rare Earth you §ocan§r use Redstone or Skystone, but you can also get it out of Monazite directly or some other ores as a byproduct. Hopefully you saved it up?
data.title: §c§lFetching Cubic Zirconia

data.name: Fetching Prasiolite
data.data:
For Prasiolite you'll want to put Quartzite and Amethyst in an EBF to get Flawed Prasiolite. You'll need to either use the Implosion Compressor or Precision Laser Engraver to up the quality to Exquisite. You'll also need the dust version as well, so don't convert them all.

For the amount of Amethyst you'll need, you'll want to make a stop on Venus.

If you have a T5 rocket, you can get the ore from Ross128ba directly and run it through the sifter.
data.title: §c§lFetching Prasiolite

data.name: Fetching Tellurium
data.data:
For Tellurium, you can do it these ways:

1) EBF Crushed Lead Ore for 2 Tellurium Nuggets
2) If you have old worldgen, you can get it from Temagamite practically anywhere (it was broken so it currently doesn't generate), or Mercury if it has been fixed
3) Make Rare Earth (III) out of Rare Earth using the strongest of acids and get it from Alburnite
4) Toxic Everglades again
5) Once you have a Void Miner, you can place it in the Overworld to obtain Tellurium.
data.title: §c§lFetching Tellurium

data.name: Fetch Quests
data.data:
To make the Circuit Assembly Line imprints you'll need a bunch of new materials.

To start, let's get some raw materials, Prasiolite, Cubic Zirconia, and Tellurium.

You also need some other materials, but I don't need to explain those, do I?

[note]If the materials are too much of a pain, you can replicate some of them once you have one of it.[/note]
data.title: §c§lFetch Quests

data.name: Fluid TP for Magic-Haters
data.data:
Hate magic (and fluid P2P), but still want to TP fluids? TT has your back with the Ender Fluid Link Cover!

Place one on a tank and open the GUI.
Channel: Covers with the same text will connect.

Public: Links to any of the same color not set to private. Use an internet program to find out what the numbers mean, and get colors you like.
Private: Does not link to public version of that color. Meaningless in SP.

Import: Exports from attached tank.
Export: Send to attached tank.

You can use multiple as inputs and/or outputs. It runs at 8000L/t.

You can send §ofrom§r an output hatch or §oto§r an input hatch for multis. Probably won't work well for anything with multiple I/O, like a singleblock Chemical Reactor.
data.title: §c§lFluid TP for Magic-Haters
data.tooltip:
Fluid TP for Magic-Haters
Prequest requests:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in LuV

data.name: Fracture Chlorine
data.data: The fluorine atom has higher electronegativity, so it will replace the chlorine atom around the antimony.
data.title: §c§lFracture Chlorine

data.name: Fusion Rocketry
data.data:
So you completed your Fusion Reactor and made your rocket, great! Now time to get some new ore! (like that isn't getting old) You don't need your hand held anymore, so I'll just list what's new.

Enceladus, Miranda, Oberon, Ross128ba and Titan are the new planets. Miranda is the 1st moon of Uranus, while Oberon is the last. Enceladus is the 2nd moon of Saturn, while Titan is the second last. Ross128ba is Ross128b's moon in the Ross128 System to the South.

The new veins are Nickel, Tungsten, and Vanadium. The ores are: Chrome, Deep Iron, Iridium, Gold, Magnetite, Nickel, Osmium, Silicon, Shadow Iron, Tungsten, and Vanadium.

You can get Neutronium from small ores on Enceladus, Oberon, and Titan.

And grab some planet blocks while you're at it too.

You can get the schematic for T6 on Enceladus.

[note]I'm sure you can tell by now, but it's not like every planet is required, so go to the ones you want to, and skip the ones you don't want to go to. Use NEI to figure out where you NEED to go.[/note]
data.title: §c§lFusion Rocketry

data.name: Getting Europium
data.data: To make a mk2 reactor, ender quarry, T5 rocket, unlock ZPM, or other things, you will need europium. Once you make a t5 rocket you will be able to find this as part of a very rare ore. Until then you need to produce it in the reactor. But it's probably not worth it to look for the ore anyway.
data.title: §b§9§d§l§b§c§lGetting Europium

data.name: Hellish Metal
data.data:
Regular Netherite Nanoparticles alone don't have enough density to compress into Netherite... they require a strong and somewhat magical binding agent.

§4Hellish Metal§r should be the perfect candidate, you can either fabricate it in the §5§lElectrolyzer§r or §5§lInfuse§r it.

[note]The Infusion recipe is much cheaper, but can only be used by those who have been proactive in their magic infrastructure.[/note]
data.title: §c§lHellish Metal

data.name: Hot Netherite Scrap
data.data:
Heating up the Netherite Scrap is a rather quick and cheap process; simply throwing it in the §5§lChemical Bath§r with a little lava ought to do the trick!

Bear in mind though, you will be re-heating this scrap many times over so it's definitely recommended to have a substantial supply of lava to be able to pull from.
data.title: §c§lHot Netherite Scrap

data.name: Imprints, They're Important
data.data:
Now that you've finally gotten all the materials to make your imprints, you can make them as you get your new circuits. You'll need to slice the circuits for the imprint in either a tier-appropriate slicing machine, or the Cutting Factory in slicing mode.

To use the imprints, place them in the CAL controller's item slot. The CAL will be imprinted once you turn it on. You can see what it's imprinted with by using a portable scanner on the controller. You can also swap out controllers if you're too lazy to make more CALs.

[note]If you already have an imprint for an earlier version of a recipe, you don't need to make another, it works with both recipes.[/note]
data.title: §c§lImprints, They're Important
data.tooltip:
Imprints, They're Important
Prequest requests:
RNG is Definitely Good Game Design

data.name: Industrial Water Purification
data.data:
For a while now, you have been able to get away with cutting and engraving your silicon circuit wafers with nothing but the bare metal of your machines. However, this can cause significant imperfections in the final wafer, so now that you are producing even more advanced circuitry such imperfections are no longer tolerable.

With the ability to make LuV components, you can now make the Water Purification Plant. This multiblock allows you to make purified water, which will be helpful in making wafers of increasing purity and perfection. For your current Naquadah-Doped Wafers, this is not yet necessary, but using purified water may significantly speed up the process, so it's definitely worth checking out.

The Water Purification Plant does not run recipes itself. Instead, it provides the core logistics for your water purification line to work. Around it you can build water purification units that link to the Water Purification Plant. The plant then provides power and maintenance to the different units, and synchronizes their recipe cycles.
data.title: §c§lIndustrial Water Purification

data.name: Intensely Bonded Netherite Nanoparticles
data.data:
At long last... the final ingredient needed before making Netherite materials.

Through the combination of the Netherite Nanoparticles and Hellish Metal in the §5§lEBF§r, you can create §4Intensely Bonded Netherite Nanoparticles.§r As an added bonus for those who have invested in bees, using the combs from a Netherite Queen, will reward you with §2§l2x§r the product.

These are not only the primary pre-requisite ingredients for the Dense Netherite Plate that you need for the §3§lFusion Reactor§r, but also the pre-requisite material for making the rest of the Netherite parts after you have created one; so be sure to stockpile and manufacture as many of these nanoparticles as you can.

[note]Keep in mind this recipe does require Naquadah coils![/note]
data.title: §c§lIntensely Bonded Netherite Nanoparticles
data.tooltip:
Intensely Bonded Netherite Nanoparticles
Prequest requests:
Hellish Metal
Netherite Nanoparticles
Naquadah Alloy

data.name: King of Acid
data.data:
This is the fluoroantimonic acid, the strongest acid in the world currently. It can dissolve almost everything on earth, so it is the best choice to dissolve our NOM dust.

Of course there are some things the fluoroantimonic acid can't deal with, like the "Empty Cell". x)
data.title: §c§lKing of Acid

data.name: LuV Assembler
data.data: The LuV assembler is needed for IV Solar Panels and other high tier stuff. Let's build one.
data.title: §c§lLuV Assembler
data.tooltip:
LuV Assembler
Prequest requests:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 1-4 in LuV

data.name: LuV Circuit Assembler
data.data:
You may have noticed that the circuits you're thinking of crafting cost way more, 6x more. This is intended for circuits needing LuV+ voltage. You now need to craft your circuits in the Circuit Assembly Line or CAL if you don't want to pay out the ears in materials. You'll still need to craft your first ones using the normal Circuit Assembler though.

Once you've done that, you can make an imprint for use in the CAL to set it to make that (and only that) type of circuit.
data.title: §c§lLuV Circuit Assembler
data.tooltip:
LuV Circuit Assembler
Prequest requests:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in LuV

data.name: LuV Energy Hatch
data.data:
If you want to upgrade your multis (and make the Fusion Reactor) you'll need to make these. You'll need a ton of wafers for Fusion, so step up your Indium game if you haven't already.

You need an LuV Cutting Machine, or an OC'd multi.
data.title: §c§lLuV Energy Hatch
data.tooltip:
LuV Energy Hatch
Prequest requests:
LuV Assembler
LuV Superconductors (32,768 EU/t)

data.name: LuV Laser Engraver
data.data:
The LuV laser engraver is an important part of lategame circuit production. You need to make crystal CPU's for both the crystal processor series of circuits, and later on for the wetware series.

[note]If you've made the Hyper-Intensity Laser Engraver, you can just upgrade that instead.[/note]
data.title: §9§a§c§lLuV Laser Engraver
data.tooltip:
LuV Laser Engraver
Prequest requests:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in LuV

data.name: LuV Superconductors (32,768 EU/t)
data.data: How about lossless 32768 EU Wires? Tetraindiumditindibariumtitaniumheptacoppertetrakaidekaoxide is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss.
data.title: §c§lLuV Superconductors (32,768 EU/t)

data.name: Making Power With Your Plasma
data.data:
Now that you have a reactor, it's time to utilize it to create power.

The simplest plasma you can make for power is Helium plasma, but it also provides a lot of power. Deuterium is renewable from water, and you can get Helium-3 from Endstone.

However, you will need a way to convert the plasma into EU. To do this you will need a large plasma turbine. This will also need a dynamo hatch that can handle the power you're outputting. For Helium plasma, you will want a LuV Buffered Dynamo or above.
data.title: §d§l§f§c§lMaking Power With Your Plasma
data.tooltip:
Making Power With Your Plasma
Prequest requests:
Starting Fusion

data.name: Matter Manipulator MKII
data.data:
The MKII is the penultimate upgrade in the Matter Manipulator line. This one being much more powerful, storing §210x§o§r the power, with a range of §2128 Blocks§r, and the ability to place §2256 Blocks/Second§r.

In addition to all of the MKI features you now unlock §5two powerful new modes§r:

§l- Copy / Paste§r: Copy a selection of blocks and paste it as many times as you'd like. Works best with GT & AE2.

§l- Move§r: Similar to Copy / Paste, but will physically relocate something already built.

Here is a short list of things that are copied / moved with the MM, the more complete list is on the Readme, but this should give you a general idea of how versatile it is.
§3
§lGregTech:§r

- Pipe/Cable connections
- Machine color
- Machine front & output directions
- Basic machine settings (auto outputs, etc)
- Hatch settings (sorting, stack limiting, etc)
- Multi machine settings (void protection, batch mode, etc)
- Multi rotation
- Covers
- Strong redstone output
- Custom names
- Ghost circuits
- Bus/hatch item/fluid lock
- Modes (for machines that use the new mode system)
- Data stick data
- TecTech machine input parameters
- ME output bus/hatch capacity
§3
§lAE2:§r

- Any coloring
- The orientation
- The configuration
- The upgrades
- Custom names
- Any stored cells (will also automatically configure cells & install their upgrades)
- Any patterns (will encode but not decode patterns)
- Priority Settings
- P2P Settings
- OreDict / Regular Filter
data.title: §c§lMatter Manipulator MKII
data.tooltip:
Matter Manipulator MKII
Prequest requests:
Thought Emitters Were Bad Enough?
Tier 6 (LuV)

data.name: Molecular Transformer, finally!
data.data:
If you're reading this before LuV and want to know how to make Sunnarium, check out EV or IV quests.

[note]Yes, this multi is somewhat buggy.[/note]
data.title: §c§lMolecular Transformer, finally!

data.name: More Chlorine
data.data: Oh god, why can't I get it in one step.
data.title: §c§lMore Chlorine

data.name: Mutating Things is Cool
data.data:
When making Raw Crystal Chips, you have two other options if using Europium constantly is too expensive for you: Bacterial Sludge, and Mutagen.

Mutagen is obviously better than the sludge, but how do you get it? I'll teach you how.

First, get the Bacterial Sludge you got from Mars, and run it through a Brewery along with some U-238 to get Enriched Bacterial Sludge. Then Ferment it to get Fermented Bacterial Sludge. And finally you Distill it to get Mutagen.

But is a single bucket enough for you? Hardly! But now that we have some, we can make more with the vat. Use the Mutagen you got along with some of that Mysterious Crystal Dust to make a culture. Unfortunately the chances are pretty low, so you'll almost certainly have to do it several times.

Once you have your culture you can use it in the vat along with some of the dust again to make more. You'll need LuV-tier glass, and Plutonium rods.

If you want to get more Bacterial Sludge more easily, you can use the vat to make that too! The culture is much easier to make.

[note]Mutagen is also used for Gendustry, so if you want to do that, make a bunch.[/note]
data.title: §c§lMutating Things is Cool
data.tooltip:
Mutating Things is Cool
Prequest requests:
Bacterial Vat
Mysterious...
Bio Lab
Crystal Chips
Bacterial Sludge

data.name: Mysterious...
data.data: If you want some of this highly mysterious material, you'll need to go to Enceladus and collect some of those crystals lying around everywhere and macerate them. Or grab some Ice with a shovel and get the Dust out of it. You can also turn the dust back into Unknown Crystal Shards with an Autoclave if you need those.
data.title: §c§lMysterious...

data.name: Naquadah Alloy
data.data:
In order to make a Fusion Reactor you're going to need some Naquadah Alloy.

First, pop on by Mercury and collect some Deep Iron from small ores if you haven't already, and get Trinium out of it.

You'll also need Naquadah coils, and LuV Energy Hatches.
data.title: §c§lNaquadah Alloy
data.tooltip:
Naquadah Alloy
Prequest requests:
LuV Energy Hatch
Naquadah Coil Upgrade
Almost Success

data.name: Naquadah Dust
data.data: You can directly get naquadah dust in a chemical reactor.
data.title: §c§lNaquadah Dust

data.name: Naquadah Ingot
data.data: If you want ingots, you can smelt it in EBF with carbon.
data.title: §c§lNaquadah Ingot

data.name: Nefarious Oil
data.data:
Using purified water, you can use an §5§lOil Cracker§r to convert the Nefarious Gas from the previous step into §4Nefarious Oil§r.

[note]If you are proactive and setup grade 2 water production, you unlock a recipe that produces much more oil, with much less water, in much less time. §[[/note]
data.title: §c§lNefarious Oil

data.name: Nefarious Production
data.data:
Now that you're producing Nether Semifluid§r, you can run it through a §5§lDistillation Tower§r to start extracting the nefarious products. You will need the §4Heavy Hellish Mud§r later in the line, and you'll need the §4Nefarious Gas§r for the next step.

[note]Don't neglect the byproducts! There are a lot of useful bonus resources to be collected.[/note]
data.title: §c§lNefarious Production

data.name: Nether Air & Semifluid
data.data:
Ever take a deep breath while roaming the nether and start to feel lightheaded or dizzy? Turns out that's from the highly toxic air. There may be no saving our lungs, but at least we can take advantage of this dense air for our own material gain!

If you haven't already been taking advantage of the Nether Air for it's sulfurous properties, (talking to you, Nitrobenzene lovers) you'll need to take advantage of it now for making §4Nether Semifluid§r.

Setup a §5§lVacuum Freezer§r in the nether and attach an§2§l Air Intake Hatch§r to start collecting the Nether Air. You can move onto the next step once you've started Semifluid production.
data.title: §c§lNether Air & Semifluid
data.tooltip:
Nether Air & Semifluid
Prequest requests:
Behold: The Netherite Line

data.name: Netherite Materials
data.data:
Now that you've completed the Netherite line and successfully set up your Mk1 Fusion Reactor, you finally have access to the ingredients necessary for creating all of the different §4Netherite materials§r.

These will be important for the rest of the game and are used often in a variety of items and materials, so it's important to make upgrades to your line both in terms of power and recipe usage as you continue to progress through the tiers.

[note]UHV power and the QFT are the biggest milestones in terms of recipe upgrades for the line.[/note]
data.title: §c§lNetherite Materials

data.name: Netherite Nanoparticles
data.data:
§4Netherite Nanoparticles§r can be made from §5§lMacerating§r your newly attained Brittle Netherite Scraps.

[note]Almost seems too easy doesn't it?[/note]
data.title: §c§lNetherite Nanoparticles

data.name: Netherite Scrap
data.data:
Netherite Scrap is an integral part of the Netherite refinement process and fortunately you don't need very much of it. Technically you §nonly need two§r§r pieces of scrap, as they will constantly cycle from hot to cool while never actually being used up in the process §(§(§3(though, having more scrap handy could improve your setup efficiency).

§rYou can obtain Netherite Scrap by either §5smelting§r Ancient Debris or using a §5§lForge Hammer§r on it. Though considering the forge hammer offers a §2§l25%§r chance at gaining an additional scrap, you would be a little crazy to choose the former.

If you're wondering where you can find Ancient Debris, try scouring the Nether. It's more likely to spawn lower near the lava, and is found sporadically like small ores are rather than being in large veins like usual GT ores. §3Miners can also collect it!

§r[warn]If you don't feel like leaving home, or are lacking blocks within your nether dimension, there is also a §lmeteor§r that can alleviate your Ancient Debris woes.[/warn]
data.title: §c§lNetherite Scrap

data.name: Netherite Scrap Seed
data.data:
Finally, we can start putting some of that Netherite Scrap to use!

Combine the Hot Neterite Scrap and some Rich Nether Waste in an §5§lAutoclave§r for a §2§l10%§r chance at getting a §4Netherite Scrap Seed§r.

Notably, as mentioned before, the Netherite Scrap gets recycled during this recipe so it only really costs Rich Nether Waste to create. Given the low probability, you want the recipe to be running as often as possible.
data.title: §c§lNetherite Scrap Seed
data.tooltip:
Netherite Scrap Seed
Prequest requests:
Hot Netherite Scrap
Rich Nether Waste

data.name: Netherrack Froth
data.data:
To get §4Netherrack Froth§r, you can combine your milling products with your Nefarious Oil in a §5§lFlotation Cell§r.

[note]It would be wise to make a robust setup for this.[/note]
data.title: §c§lNetherrack Froth

data.name: Netherrack Milling
data.data:
With the Netherite line comes the first mandatory usage of the §5§lIsamill Grinding Machine§r, which you will need to create§4 Milled Netherrack§r. You will require a lot of this so be prudent in keeping up with your netherrack and milling ball production.

For netherrack, the best methods of production are through the rock breaker using glowstone dust, or through compressing netherrack dust that you may have obtained a stash of through mining.

For the milling balls, you have two options:

§2§l- Soapstone ->§r§2 Cheaper, 50% as effective as Alumina
§3§l- Alumina ->§r§3 More Expensive, 2x as effective as Soapstone
data.title: §c§lNetherrack Milling
data.tooltip:
Netherrack Milling
Prequest requests:
Too much Indium?
Behold: The Netherite Line

data.name: Neutralization
data.data: The solution is acidic now. Gallium will be separated when 8 < pH < 10.
data.title: §c§lNeutralization

data.name: No, It Won't Repair Your Car
data.data: The Auto Maintenance Hatch will correct maintenance problems immediately at the cost of some materials. Invaluable if you want to make sure your cleanroom machines won't void stuff. Or you could just use a howler and do it yourself I guess.
data.title: §c§lNo, It Won't Repair Your Car
data.tooltip:
No, It Won't Repair Your Car

Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 1-4 in LuV
