data.data: Some machines need emitters and sensors, like the analyzer or the circuit assembler.
data.title: §c§lNow You're Really Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in LuV
data.tooltip:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in LuV
Prequest requests:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 1-4 in LuV

data.name: Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 1-4 in LuV
data.data: Pumps, pistons, conveyor modules and robot arms are the most needed machine parts in LuV. Go and craft one of each with your new Assembly Line.
data.title: §c§lNow You're Really Gonna Hate This 1-4 in LuV
data.tooltip:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 1-4 in LuV
Prequest requests:
HSS-S
Tier 6 (LuV)
Ruri... Ruridididi?

data.name: Ozonation
data.data:
Want even more speed on your wafer processing? Using Grade 2 Purified Water, made by ozonation, you can now reduce processing time by 50%. To run this machine, you will need to make large amounts of Ozone Gas by bombarding air with a strong laser. If you haven't already, you should definitely make the Hyper-Intensity Laser Engraver multiblock to speed up this process.

[note]This multiblock is very picky about where the ozone input hatch goes. If you can't figure out why it's not forming, chances are you forgot to place this hatch in the correct location. Use the hologram projector to see where it goes.[/note]
data.title: §c§lOzonation

data.name: P-507
data.data: This solvent can be 100% recycled in the naquadah process line, so don't make a line for it.
data.title: §c§lP-507

data.name: Panning For Gold is For Chumps
data.data:
Now that you've reached LuV you can make the god-tier prospector - The Electric Prospector. This handheld machine can provide detailed information on ores in the area, and return maps of how much UG fluid and what type is in each chunk.

Note that the range is determined by the tier and material (the durability seems to not matter). You can select an ore from the list to show only that ore, or double-click to switch dark/light mode.
data.title: §c§lPanning For Gold is For Chumps
data.tooltip:
Panning For Gold is For Chumps
Prequest requests:
Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in LuV

data.name: Poor Nether Waste
data.data: Once you've gathered enough froth, it can run through a §5§lVacuum Furnace§r to get a number of useful resources. Most importantly though, this is where we extract §4Poor Nether Waste§r; a quite valuable fluid to the Netherite line.
data.title: §c§lPoor Nether Waste

data.name: Recycle Fluorine
data.data: Fluorine is one of the most important resources. You can recycle most fluorine from it.
data.title: §c§lRecycle Fluorine

data.name: Recycle Gallium
data.data:
You have two options to deal with it.

1) React with Sodium Dust in a chemical reactor.

2) Mix it with Indium Phosphate Dust in a mixer.
data.title: §c§lRecycle Gallium

data.name: Recycle Titanium
data.data: As to titanium trifluoride, you can recycle titanium and some hydrofluoric acid in EBF.
data.title: §c§lRecycle Titanium

data.name: Recycle Waste Water
data.data: The 'Waste Water' is still very useful to some extent and you can get something interesting from it.
data.title: §c§lRecycle Waste Water

data.name: Relentless Glue
data.data:
Ethyl Cyanoacrylate, commonly known as Super Glue is the best glue there is. But with great power comes... great complexity. It's not needed now and probably for the next few tiers, but it will make your recipes more efficient and will be necessary in the lategame.

[note]Technically this line is available in IV, but only optional. Show your true skills by searching the recipes in NEI yourself![/note]
data.title: §c§lRelentless Glue

data.name: Rich Nether Waste
data.data:
§nOne§r of the ways you will be using the Poor Nether Waste is to combine it with the Hellish Mud you obtained earlier in the §5§lMixer§r to create §4Rich Nether Waste§r.

We will be using the Rich Nether Waste for the next step, and it will continue to be valuable for a while, though it does eventually become unecessary to the line when you reach §4§lUHV.
data.title: §c§lRich Nether Waste
data.tooltip:
Rich Nether Waste
Prequest requests:
Nefarious Production
Poor Nether Waste

data.name: RNG is Definitely Good Game Design
data.data:
Once you've collected all the materials, you'll need to make Magneto Resonatic Dust and Circuit Compound Mk3 in a Mixer.

Combine these in the Forming Press to make Raw Imprint Supporting Boards.

You then craft those into Imprint Supporting Boards in an Autoclave in a Cleanroom with Soldering Alloy. Unfortunately, there's only a 75% chance of succeeding, so I had you collect extra materials. You can use the leftovers for your next imprint.
data.title: §c§lRNG is Definitely Good Game Design
data.tooltip:
RNG is Definitely Good Game Design
Prequest requests:
Fetching Tellurium
Fetching Cubic Zirconia
Fetching Prasiolite

data.name: Separate Solvent
data.data: Distill the antimony pentachloride solution to get the pure antimony pentachloride liquid. You can recycle §c§6ALL§r of the ether.
data.title: §c§lSeparate Solvent

data.name: Separation
data.data:
IT COMES BACK AGAINNNNN? ! ! !

[note]You can find out more about the Neutron Activator and the Precise Assembler in the Multiblock tab.[/note]
data.title: §c§lSeparation

data.name: Silicon Boule
data.data: You can also use naquadahine dust directly to make a Silicon Boule in the EBF. It takes less time than with naquadah ingots.
data.title: §c§lSilicon Boule

data.name: Starting Fusion
data.data:
Fusion is a valuable tool you will be using for the rest of the game. It's used to create unique materials & plasmas. It can also be used as a very powerful power source when combined with plasma turbines.

For your first reactor, you will need a controller, 2-16 fluid input hatches, 1-16 fluid output hatches, and 16 energy hatches. All hatches have to be LuV tier or better. Each hatch provides 2048 EU/t for the recipe, and has a storage capacity of 10M EU.

This means you can do any fusion recipe that takes 32768 EU/t or less, and has a startup cost of 160M EU or less. Using more fluid hatches means you need less fusion casings. While this doesn't matter as much for the mk1 reactor, this principle helps tremendously with the higher reactor tiers.
data.title: §l§c§lStarting Fusion
data.tooltip:
Starting Fusion
Prequest requests:
Thought Emitters Were Bad Enough?
Dense Netherite Plate
Naquadah Alloy
Clarifier

data.name: Sun Fusion
data.data: Alternative way to mass produce Sunnarium.
data.title: §l§c§lSun Fusion

data.name: Thought Emitters Were Bad Enough?
data.data: Field generators are a big part of lategame crafts. And yes, they always suck to make.
data.title: §c§lThought Emitters Were Bad Enough?
data.tooltip:
Thought Emitters Were Bad Enough?

Now You're Really Gonna Hate This 5 and 6 in LuV

data.name: Tier 6 (LuV)
data.data: LuV-Level. You will need Rhodium-Plated Palladium for machines. Suggested planets and moons to visit: Jupiter's Moon Io, Venus and Mercury. Machine parts will now require an Assembly Line - Check Multiblock Goals for details.
data.title: §c§lTier 6 (LuV)
data.tooltip:
Tier 6 (LuV)

Assembly Line
Tier 5 (IV)

Keep Soldering On!
Nano Mainframe

data.name: Turbine Time
data.data:
Your fancy new Large Plasma Turbine will need a rotor to go inside of it.

You can make it out of any GT material, but the best right now is NORMAL Draconium. [warn]Always test in Creative first![/warn]

When using turbines, be careful of flow rates. To find the optimal flow rate, you divide the optimal energy flow rate listed on the turbine, by the energy value for the plasma. You can also use the Large Turbine Calculator (there's a link on the main spreadsheet, which is linked to in discord), or scan the multiblock's controller while feeding it a minimal amount of plasma to see what the optimal flow is. Make sure to use a Fluid Regulator set to this flow rate for highest fuel efficiency, or go beyond it to get more EU/t at a cost to efficiency, with Plasma Turbines being the best at retaining efficiency beyond the optimal flow.

If you go beyond the optimal flow, you will get a higher EU/t value, but less fuel efficiency, and the maximum EU/t value depends on the turbine type and its Overflow Efficiency tier. For this type of turbine, tier 1 reaches the max at 250% of optimal flow to produce 158% of the EU/t, tier 2 reaches the max at 400% of optimal flow to produce 214% of the EU/t and tier 3 reaches the max at 550% of optimal flow to produce 301% of the EU/t. The closer you get to this maximum, the more fuel efficiency you're throwing away.

The choice is yours!

[note]For a lot of extra information on fusion, check out the new quest line called Powerful Nuclear Physics.[/note]
data.title: §a§b§c§d§e§f§d§l§l§c§lTurbine Time
data.tooltip:
Turbine Time

Making Power With Your Plasma

data.name: A Casing
data.data: I need something for the outer shell. Again, a crystal-based material would be best, because I like it shiny. I tested all crystals I know of and none of them met the requirements. I heard you have access to outer space? Can you try to find a suitable material while you're out there?
data.title: A Casing

data.name: A Few More Things...
data.data:
Ok, I think I have everything I need to assemble the device. Can you assist me with some additional materials? I need to update some of my machines, as these exotic components you got me damaged some of them already. Don't worry, I have a list here.

Some of my circuits burned to a crisp while I was trying to measure the conductivity of these soul and life shards. I need better ones.

Good lord, these mysterious crystals have eaten away my diamond grinding head! How could that happen? Can you get me a better one?

Do you see that pile of Rhodium and Palladium over there? No? Neither do I. Because the machine was VAPORIZED! Good that you gave me 2 singularities, the first one... Well... Just get me a better casing, would you?

It seems, that the stabilizers need... stabilizing... But I'm out of field generators. Can you help me with this?
data.title: A Few More Things...
data.tooltip:
A Few More Things...
Prequest requests:
Now that Matters!
I'm Hungry
Fancy!
Red and Blue
Shiny!

data.name: A Problem that Matters
data.data: I need to open a wormhole. But for that, I need an immense gravitational field. One like those created upon the death of a massive star, a black hole. But I can't really "kill" a sun for this. I need to compress matter somehow... But... How? I think I may need a specialized machine for this, one that does not use explosions, as that won't get dense enough.
data.title: A Problem that Matters
data.tooltip:
A Problem that Matters
Prequest requests:
Power, So Much Power!

data.name: A Vision of the Future (FPS Drop Not Included)
data.data:
To get to the Toxic Everglades, you'll need 10 Containment Frames and an Alkalus Disk (Activated). You use them like when making a nether portal. The disk can also be used to set special fires. It doesn't spread across the ground that well, but it'll take out a tree real fast. If you want to get rid of a giant tree, this is your tool.

The dim itself is filled with GT++ ores.
data.title: A Vision of the Future (FPS Drop Not Included)
data.tooltip:
A Vision of the Future (FPS Drop Not Included)

ZPM Energy Hatch

data.name: Cheaper EV Circuits
data.data: With a higher voltage, you can use your ASoCs to make cheaper Quantum Processors.

Cheaper EV Circuits

ASoC - Advanced System on a Chip

data.name: Concentration
data.data: Now, let's neutralize the solution.
data.title: Concentration

data.name: Configuring TecTech Multiblocks
data.data:
Many TecTech multis can be customized by adjusting certain internal numbers called parameters. You can directly adjust them in the GUI.

If there are lit up sections in the parameters part of the multi interface (see the TecTech Multiblocks quest), you can configure the multi, otherwise there is nothing to do.

We'll be using the Quantum Computer as our example, since that is what you probably want it for.

First we need to understand the parameter naming, like ID:0:1:I. The first number represents the parameter block. For the QC only block 0 is used. Each such block can have up to 4 used parameters, 2 inputs and 2 outputs. The letter at the end specifies if a parameter is an input or output with I or O and the number in the middle distinguishes the 2 parameters of this kind in the block. It is either 0 or 1.

Inputs are something that is either set or is a default. Outputs give information that the machine sends to you, that indicates things. (like heat or Computation)

And lastly, the Parametrizer Memory Card lets you copy settings from one machine to another easily.
data.title: Configuring TecTech Multiblocks
data.tooltip:
Configuring TecTech Multiblocks
Prequest requests:
Learning Curve? Where We're Going There Are No Curves

data.name: Data Bank
data.data:
By now you probably feel overwhelmed with the number of data sticks needed for your Assembly Line. TecTech has a solution for you: The Data Bank. It allows you to store more than just 16 data sticks and can be connected to multiple Assembly Lines at the same time.

Place the controller one block above the ground and use the Multiblock Structure Hologram Projector to see how it is built. You will need a Maintenance Hatch and at least an EV Energy Hatch, though the power requirements can be much higher if you use many Data Access Hatches and Data Bank Master Connectors, for now you should start with an LuV energy hatch. Trying to run the Data Bank and then scanning the controller will tell you how much EU/t is needed.

You will need more blocks than what is asked for in this quest, as the number of Data Access Hatches and Connectors is up to you. You can have a maximum of 15 combined.

The Assembly Line Reception Connector replaces your old Data Access Hatch on the Assembly Line. Connect it to a Master Connector on the Data Bank with Optical Fiber Cable and make sure to color the hatches and the cable.

[note]If you can't figure out what blocks to place, pay attention to the tooltip in the bottom-left when using the Multiblock Structure Hologram Projector. In this case the filler blocks are Computer Casing.[/note]
data.title: Data Bank
data.tooltip:
Data Bank
Prequest requests:
The Beginning of the End Game

data.name: Disproportionation
data.data:
The chemical properties of naquadria are a bit weird.

There's nothing known that can precipitate it. The only way to get naquadria from the solution is to use high energy particle to bombard it.

However, only a part of the output naquadria can be used for further processing and you have to re-purify the rest.
data.title: Disproportionation

data.name: Energy Infuser
data.data:
The Energy Infuser is the tech answer to the Thaumic Restorer for repairing items and also acts a charger.

When fed with energy it is able to charge any item that is fed into its Input Bus. Fully charged items will be placed in the Output Bus. The items will be fed with the amount of energy provided by the used Energy Hatch.

Apart from its charging capabilities the Energy Infuser can repair items when provided with UU-Matter and energy. However, GregTech tools can not be repaired. When repairing the machine consumes 1L UU-Matter and 1000 EU per repaired durability point.
data.title: Energy Infuser
data.tooltip:
Energy Infuser
Prequest requests:
The Beginning of the End Game

data.name: Enriched Naquadah Time
data.data:
The Enriched Naquadah line is much shorter than the Naquadah line, and easier. It's used for fuel or Neuro Processing Units which are UV content, and it's also used in the Prismarine line to make Prismatic Naquadah; something you will need for Trinium Coils.

[warn]Hold 16 enriched Naquadah Ingot / Dust to skip this questline.[/warn]
data.title: Enriched Naquadah Time

data.name: Enriched Naquadah Ingot
data.data:
Ah, you made it.

You can choose to smelt it with zinc in an EBF or electrolyze it. Either is fine but you can fully recycle the zinc, so the EBF recipe is better if you want the ingot.
data.title: Enriched Naquadah Ingot

data.name: Europium Doped Wafers
data.data: These boules are more efficient when making wafers out of them than Naquadah.
data.title: Europium Doped Wafers

data.name: Fancy!
data.data: Yes. Yes! That's it! Bring me more of this stuff! I probably need a lot of it...
data.title: Fancy!

data.name: Flocculation
data.data: You want to start using your new Europium to make even better wafers, but it turns out that your old methods of creating purified water are no longer enough. You will need to use the Flocculation Purification Unit to make even better purified water first. To run this machine, you will need large amounts of Polyaluminium Chloride, but luckily you can get all your Chlorine back if you properly recycle the waste liquid.
data.title: Flocculation
data.tooltip:
Flocculation
Prequest requests:
You Can't Get Enough of This Pt 1 in ZPM
Ozonation

data.name: Fusion Reactor MKII - Bigger, Better, Fusor
data.data:
Now that you have some Europium, put it to use by making a MK II reactor.

This one will require the same block placement, but replaces LuV casings with fusion machine casings, superconducting coil blocks with fusion coil blocks, and uses ZPM tier hatches.

Each of the up to 16 ZPM Energy Hatches adds 8192 EU/t power input and 20 MEU starting capacity. Therefore this reactor can handle recipes up to 320M EU at startup. In addition, if you perform a MK I recipe on a MK II, you will overclock it. Fusion overclocking is different from normal GT. It will take 2x the power and the recipe will go 2x faster.
data.title: Fusion Reactor MKII - Bigger, Better, Fusor
data.tooltip:
Fusion Reactor MKII - Bigger, Better, Fusor

ZPM Energy Hatch
Superdense

Getting Europium

data.data: What... I work a lot! So get me some food please.
data.title: I'm Hungry

data.name: I need a stabilizer
data.data: Opening the wormhole is one thing, but I need to stabilize it, so it doesn't harm anything. I guess I need something made of crystal. Why? Because I like it fancy. Find me a crystal-based, transparent material with immense power, would you?
data.title: I need a stabilizer
data.tooltip:
I need a stabilizer
Prequest requests:
Power, So Much Power!

data.name: It Needs a Power Plug...
data.data: Given the fact that I will be able to craft this device, it needs some kind of "plug" to get the power out. I need something to conduct immense amounts of power. I thought about superconductors, but they don't fit with the crystal casing material I have in mind. I need 2 different crystals, one for positive and one for negative charge.
data.title: It Needs a Power Plug...
data.tooltip:
It Needs a Power Plug...
Prequest requests:
Power, So Much Power!

data.name: Lasers Solve Everything
data.data:
Laser hatches are a high-end way of sending lots of amps of power, so much in fact, that it starts at 256A. This goes 1024/4096/16384+ and continues from there. They're also so powerful that only a few machines support them outside of the ever §owonderful§r TecTech: LSC, MBF, MVF, and PSS. Remember to paint the Laser Vacuum Pipes, the Source Hatch, and the Target Hatch. Also, Source = Output, Target = Input. Laser Vacuum Pipes do not split or bend, to turn your laser use [note]Active Transformer[/note]. Later on you can use Laser Vacuum Mirror to bend your Laser Vacuum Pipes, this will however not allow splitting.

[note]Laser hatches can have their operational amperage adjusted in their GUI.[/note]

[warn]Be careful with using very high amp hatches as every Laser Hatch has 1EU/s * max amps passive power loss. For example, a 256A Laser Source Hatch and 256A Laser Target Hatch will both lose 256 EU/s regardless of the amount of power flowing through.[/warn]
data.title: Lasers Solve Everything
data.tooltip:
Lasers Solve Everything
Prequest requests:
The Beginning of the End Game

data.name: Learning Curve? Where We're Going There Are No Curves
data.data:
Only dangerous cliffs to fly off. TecTech can be the source of adventures, scary and satisfying.

Thanks to Piky/Scripted for giving you some guardrails to stay on the road. Scripted/Piky shed blood over these quests for you. Now it's your turn!

For additional details on TecTech, check out the wiki at [url]https://github.com/Technus/TecTech/wiki[/url]

You'll probably receive better help in Discord, though.
data.title: Learning Curve? Where We're Going There Are No Curves
data.tooltip:
Learning Curve? Where We're Going There Are No Curves
Prequest requests:
Tier 7 (ZPM)

data.name: Linear Accelerator
data.data:
I think you should have known how to process it.

Suitable for 9+ to use.
data.title: Linear Accelerator

data.name: Making Americium
data.data:
To upgrade your reactor further and to make UV motors, you will need to get some americium. The recipe is pretty expensive, but once you made the next tier of reactor, you will unlock a simpler and cheaper one. However, to get there you will need a lot of americium already, so better make sure you are producing enough lutetium.

Let's start with just 48 ingots. Enough for a single UV motor.
data.title: Making Americium
data.tooltip:
Making Americium
Prequest requests:
Fusion Reactor MKII - Bigger, Better, Fusor

data.name: Making Tritanium
data.data:
In order to make Tritanium, first you need to make Duranium.

Tritanium is used for the T6 rocket, Gravisuit, the T4 mining multi, and UHV circuits.
data.title: Making Tritanium
data.tooltip:
Making Tritanium
Prequest requests:
Fusion Reactor MKII - Bigger, Better, Fusor

data.name: Matter Manipulator MKIII
data.data:
The MKIII is the final upgrade in the Matter Manipulator series, and grants you access to it's most heightened capabilities. With §210x§r the EU storage as the MKII, it also boasts an §5§lUnlimited§r block range and can handle placing §21024 Blocks / Second§r.

Feature wise, the MKIII comes with all of the same abilities as the MKII, except now with the ability to use the §3§lQuantum Uplink§r, though you won't be able to build that multiblock until §4§lUV§r.
data.title: Matter Manipulator MKIII

data.name: Nano Power ICs
data.data:
You need these for Solars, UV -> UHV transformers, and ZPM Hatches and Dynamos.

[note]You'll need a ZPM Cutting Machine, or an OC'd multi.[/note]
data.title: Nano Power ICs

data.name: Naquadria Ingot
data.data: Smelt it with magnesium dust in an EBF.
data.title: Naquadria Ingot

data.name: Naquarite Universal Insulator Foil
data.data: Finally, you can combine the §2Radiation-Proof Composite Sheet§r with §2Netherite Foil§r and §2Manyullyn§r in the §5§lForming Press§r to create §3Naquarite Universal Insulator Foil§r. This incredibly strong foil can be used to bind ingredients to all of your future coils due to it's unrivaled radiation and heat resistance.
data.title: Naquarite Universal Insulator Foil
data.tooltip:
Naquarite Universal Insulator Foil
Prequest requests:
Prismatic Naquadah Composite Sheet

data.name: N.N.Q.Q.N.Q.Q
data.data:
Do you want some naquadria?

Unfortunately, the naquadria dust has become repulsive naquadria oxide mixture dust because of a NERF. You have to build a line for it, like the naquadah.

[warn]Hold 16 Naquadria Ingots / Dust to skip this questline.[/warn]
data.title: N.N.Q.Q.N.Q.Q

data.name: Now that Matters!
data.data: Of course! The matter condenser! How come I didn't think of that?
data.title: Now that Matters!

data.name: Once again
data.data: The miscibility of P-507 and naquadria is still very perfect like naquadah. Most naquadria can be concentrated again.
data.title: Once again

data.name: Paint-by-Numbers
data.data:
If you want to color all those fancy cables and such, you'll want to use the humble Paintbrush. To uncolor them, use a bucket of water.

Alternatively, you can also use the IC2 Painter, GT Spray Can, or the AE2 Color Applicator.

[note]The buildcraft paintbrush and GT spray cans can now color many cables or pipes in a row with just a single click![/note]
data.title: Paint-by-Numbers
data.tooltip:
Paint-by-Numbers
Prequest requests:
Learning Curve? Where We're Going There Are No Curves

data.name: pH Neutralization
data.data:
If you want to process your Europium-Doped Wafers with a significant speed boost, this machine is for you. Using the pH neutral water you get from this machine, you can process wafers twice as fast.

This is the first real complex automation challenge in the waterline, it's up to you to figure out how you want to deal with the pH neutralization process. Have fun!

[note]This multiblock is very picky about where its hatches for acids and bases go. If you can't figure out why it's not forming, chances are you forgot to place these hatches in the correct location. Use the hologram projector to see where they go.[/note]
data.title: pH Neutralization

data.name: Power, So Much Power!
data.data:
If only I could harness it... Well, hello there my friend. I need your help with a project of mine. I want to create an immense power source, but I have a few problems that I need to solve first. Will you help me? You'll be well rewarded.

[note]The quests to get items will trigger the next part once you hold the item in question.[/note]
data.title: Power, So Much Power!

data.name: PPIC Wafers
data.data:
You'll need Piko Power ICs to make Solars, UHV -> UEV transformers, and UV Hatches and Dynamos.

[note]You'll need a UV Cutting Machine, or an OC'd multi to cut the wafers.[/note]
data.title: PPIC Wafers

data.name: Prismarine Precipitate
data.data:
After creating the §2Prismarine-Rich Nitrobenzene Solution§r, you'll need to process it using a §5§lChemical Plant§r with §2Strontium Hydroxide§r. Once processed, you can successfully obtain your first §3Prismarine Precipitate§r.

[warn]The Strontium is completely recyclable within the line, so no need to worry about it's continuous injection.[/warn]
data.title: Prismarine Precipitate

data.name: Prismarine Recycling Pt. 2
data.data:
You'll notice after processing your first Prismarine Precipitates you are left with a second §2Contaminated Prismarine Solution§r. You can also recycle this for added §3Prismarine Solution§o§r and §3Prismarine-Rich Nitrobenzene Solution§r. Again, technically optional, but highly recommended.

[warn]If you didn't setup the recycling for the Contaminated Hydrogen Peroxide then you'll want to now since this recycling actively produces it.[/warn]
data.title: Prismarine Recycling Pt. 2

data.name: Prismarine Recycling
data.data: §2Prismarine-Contaminated Hydrogen Peroxide§r is a byproduct of a couple different recipes in this line, it's best to recycle it for the bonus §3Prismarine Solution§r. Of course, you don't have to, but it would be ill-advised to avoid it.
data.title: Prismarine Recycling

data.name: Prismarine-Rich Nitrobenzene Solution
data.data:
After you've gotten ahold of some §2Prismarine Solution§r, combine it with §2Nitrobenzene§r in a §5§lChemical Bath§r in order to create a §3rich solution mixture§r.

Additionally, you will start to receive some §3Prismarine-Contaminated Hydrogen Peroxide§r byproduct.
data.title: Prismarine-Rich Nitrobenzene Solution

data.name: Prismarine Solution
data.data:
After you've managed to grab some §2Prismarine§r, you must process it with §2Industrial Strength Hydrofluoric Acid§r and §2Hydrogen Peroxide§r in the §5§lDissolution Tank§r. Using these ingredients you can make your very first batch of §3Prismarine Solution§r.

[warn]After you've created your first batch of Industrial Strength HF, it's highly recommended to check the Chemical Plant recipes for further creation of it![/warn]
data.title: Prismarine Solution
data.tooltip:
Prismarine Solution
Prequest requests:
Prismarine!? What Do I Need That For?

data.name: Prismarine!? What Do I Need That For?
data.data:
§5§lPrismarine§r is an ancient material long rumored to have originated from structures found deep within the ocean. Learning how to create this is extremely important, and may lead to advancements in technology with further exploration into the substrate.

You can get Prismarine in a few different ways as shown resource-wise by the optional tasks:

§31. Through Botania by transmutating §nNether Quartz§r§3 directly to §nPrismarine§r§3 via an §nAlchemical Catalyst or the Fountain of Alchemy§r
§r
§22. Using §nRed Algae Biomass§r§2 and §nCertus Quartz§r §2dust in an §nAutoclave
§r
§c3. Using §nRed Algae Biomass§r§c and §nPrismatic Combs§r §cin an §nAutoclave.
§r
Which method you choose is entirely up to you and dependent on what infrastructure you have setup thus-far. Either way you would be wise to make a robust setup as you will be needing a decent amount of Prismarine in the future.

[warn]Hold 16 Naquarite Insulator Foil to skip the Prismarine line Quests.[/warn]
data.title: Prismarine!? What Do I Need That For?
data.tooltip:
Prismarine!? What Do I Need That For?
Prequest requests:
Tier 7 (ZPM)

data.name: Prismatic Acid
data.data:
Almost there I promise!

Now that you have obtained the §2Prismatic Gas§o§r, you must cool it down in a §5§lVacuum Freezer§r with the assistance of §2Liquid Nitrogen§r. This will give you §3Prismatic Acid§r.

[warn]Aside from continuing down this line, you can also use Prismatic Acid in the processing of Gaia blocks later.[/warn]
data.title: Prismatic Acid

data.name: Prismatic Crystal
data.data: After finally getting the §2Prismarine Precipitate§r, the logical next step is to crystallize the Prismarine into a §3Prismatic Crystal§r. Using a §2Magneto-Resonance Lens§r we can do this in a §5§lLaser Engraver§r with the assistance of §2Molten Crystalline Alloy§r.
data.title: Prismatic Crystal

data.name: Prismatic Gas
data.data: The §2Prismatic Crystal§r will then be processed in a §5§lVacuum Furnace§r with §2Boron Plasma§r in order to successfully convert it to the highly sought after §3Prismatic Gas§r.
data.title: Prismatic Gas

data.name: Prismatic Naquadah Composite Slurry
data.data:
Why stop at §2Prismatic Naquadah§r? Given it's malleable nature you suspect that it may be advantageous to use it's unique strength to form new, much more durable, foil types.

Combing the §2Prismatic Naquadah§r with your choice of §2binding powder§r in a §5§lMixer§r and you'll create exactly the type of substance you were looking for; A §3Prismatic Naquadah Composite Slurry§r to mold into foil.
data.title: Prismatic Naquadah Composite Slurry

data.name: Prismatic Naquadah Composite Sheet
data.data: §5§lDehydrating§r this §2Prismatic Naquqdah Composite Slurry§r over the top of §2Tungsten Carbide§r & §2Lead foil§r creates a completely §3Radiation-Proof Composite Sheet§r. This will prove to be very useful in protecting your environment from radiation emitting structures.
data.title: Prismatic Naquadah Composite Sheet
data.tooltip:
Prismatic Naquadah Composite Sheet
Prequest requests:
Prismatic Naquadah Composite Slurry

data.name: Prismatic Naquadah
data.data:
Woah, a new metal?

By combining the forces of your newly created §2Enriched Naquqdah§r and §2Prismatic Acid§r in the §5§lAlloy Blast Smelter§r, you find that a new metal forms; §3Prismatic Naquadah§r.

[warn]This extremely strong, yet shockingly pliant material will be used in quite a few different structures and materials going forth.[/warn]
data.title: Prismatic Naquadah

data.name: Purification
data.data: The barium will react with sulfuric acid and become insoluble dust so we can remove it.
data.title: Purification

data.name: Recycle Indium
data.data:
Free indium!

You have two options to deal with it.

1) React with Calcium Dust in a chemical reactor.

2) Mix it with Gallium Hydroxide Dust in a mixer.
data.title: Recycle Indium

data.name: Recycle Trinium
data.data: You can get the Trinium dust by reacting it with Hydrogen in an LCR.
data.title: Recycle Trinium

data.name: Red and Blue
data.data: Really? A red and blue crystal? How awesome is that! I think I will need 8 of each color, just to be sure.
data.title: Red and Blue
data.tooltip:
Red and Blue
Prequest requests:
Trigger: Life and Soul Shard

data.name: Refining
data.data: So it is a circle?
data.title: Refining

data.name: Shiny!
data.data: What in the world is this? This is amazing! I need more of these! They will be an amazing containment material for the wormhole!
data.title: Shiny!

data.name: Superdense
data.data:
The advanced machines you are now creating require more advanced materials, as well as more advanced ways to process them. In ZPM, you can construct the Hot Isostatic Pressurization Unit, an upgrade to the Large Electric Compressor. This multiblock heats material to extreme temperatures under extreme pressure, allowing it to create superdense plates with minimal imperfections.

The HIP Unit heats up while it is running, and must be given some time to cool off. If it reaches its maximum heat threshold, it will significantly slow your recipes or even void the inputs. Use better coils to increase how long it will take to overheat, and use Heat Sensor Hatches to automate it properly.

[note]Can perform compression recipes which say "Requires HIP Unit" in NEI.[/note]
data.title: Superdense
data.tooltip:
Superdense
Prequest requests:
You Can't Get Enough of This Pt 1 in ZPM

data.name: TecTech Multiblocks
data.data:
TecTech Multiblock Common Functionality

Multiple Ampere and Laser Hatches Compatibility - to ease power distribution.

Power Pass - Allows connected dynamo hatches to take power from the controller and output it, just like the active transformer does (and that is why the controller always need it in its recipe if that function is enabled...). [warn]Be sure to turn off Power Pass if you want to edit your machine and don't want it to explode![/warn]

Constructable Interface - Allows visualizing the structure with blueprints (there is an API to implement that for any block, but almost nothing does).

From left to right is 1, then clockwise for the rest in TT multi interfaces.

1) Parameters - They are the way of the controller to communicate with player and parameter hatches. Lights indicate status but more detailed information can be seen when moused over. The tooltip contains ID in form of HatchID:ParameterNumber:Direction, Current Status, Current Value, and Short Description.

2) Uncertainty status - These 9 blocks indicate uncertainty status of the machine. If the lights are on, this machine requires an uncertainty resolver. Red = Bad, Green = Good. You need to do the absurd puzzle before using the machine.

Control buttons - Buttons might change their behavior and appearance depending on machine but usually they work like this, starting from top:

3) Power Pass - Toggles Power Pass.

4) Safe Void - Currently unused.

5) Power Switch - Soft Mallet with your finger...

6) Input slot - Standard functionality.
data.title: TecTech Multiblocks
data.tooltip:
TecTech Multiblocks
Prequest requests:
Learning Curve? Where We're Going There Are No Curves

data.name: The Beginning of the End Game
data.data:
Welcome to TecTech! The pinnacle of absolute high-tier machinery for all your end-tier needs. However, learning TecTech is incredibly confusing, so listen very carefully.

First, you'll need to gather various casings for your machines that you'll need. We've provided some examples of the blocks you'll need, but you should expect to have to craft more. Lots more.

You use the optical cables to connect machines together. Just make sure that they're painted, as well as what you want to connect them to.
data.title: The Beginning of the End Game
data.tooltip:
The Beginning of the End Game
Prequest requests:
Learning Curve? Where We're Going There Are No Curves

data.name: The Final Goal
data.data: Thanks to your help I have managed to create the ultimate energy source: An encased wormhole that drains energy from a synthesized pocket universe, to the point when it reaches heat death. I have no use for it, so you may have it. Thank you for making my dream come true!
data.title: The Final Goal
data.tooltip:
The Final Goal
Prequest requests:
A Few More Things...

data.name: Tier 7 (ZPM)
data.data: The ZPM tier. Speaking of ZPM, did you know the name is based on the Zero Point Module from the show Stargate SG-1, which continues the story of the movie? It's a great show, go watch it! Maybe you have already found a depleted ZPM in the world generation. If you find some help, maybe you can even create a completely new one.
data.title: Tier 7 (ZPM)

data.name: Transform and...Stay Put Actually
data.data:
Active Transformers will transform power up or down at only a 0.004% power loss, making using several in a row obsolete, if you can afford it. Unfortunately, it's kinda expensive. On the other hand, you can use it to turn your lasers from your laser hatches, which is probably a better use.

It doesn't need a Maintenance Hatch, just the I/O Hatches.
data.title: Transform and...Stay Put Actually
data.tooltip:
Transform and...Stay Put Actually
Prequest requests:
The Beginning of the End Game

data.name: Wasn't This Only Found in the Center of Neutron Stars?
data.data:
You'll need Neutronium for UV and the T7 rocket, so let's make some.

To get Neutronium, go to one of the planets that has the small ores. Then mix it with Helium Plasma to make Raw Neutronium Dust. It can be smelted in a Blast Furnace at 9000K and 491,520 EU/t. This recipe takes a long time and a lot of power. Better make another EBF or Volcanus. Or a few. Or upgrade your Mega Blast Furnace.
data.title: Wasn't This Only Found in the Center of Neutron Stars?
data.tooltip:
Wasn't This Only Found in the Center of Neutron Stars?
Prequest requests:
ZPM Energy Hatch

data.name: Where No One Has Gone Before
data.data:
Another rocket, another set of planets. Get to work already, that's why you made it, right?

There's only two new planets this time, Proteus and Triton. They're both moons of Neptune.

The new veins are Neutronium, Niobium, and Thorium. The ores are: Adamantium, Gallium, Naquadah, Neutronium, Niobium, Plutonium-241, Titanium, Uranium 235, Uranium-238, and Yttrium.

You can get Black Plutonium from small ores on Triton.

You should pick up some planet blocks while you're visiting.

The schematic is on Proteus.
data.title: Where No One Has Gone Before
data.tooltip:
Where No One Has Gone Before
Prequest requests:
Rocket Tier 6
Tier 7 (ZPM)

data.name: You Can't Get Enough of This Pt 1 in ZPM
data.data: You know what to do.
data.title: You Can't Get Enough of This Pt 1 in ZPM
data.tooltip:
You Can't Get Enough of This Pt 1 in ZPM

Tier 7 (ZPM)

Just Make It ™.

[note]PS: You can make the ZPM CA now and start on the wetware line if you want, but the quests are in UV since you can't make the last circuit until then.[/note]

You Can't Get Enough of This Pt 2 in ZPM

ZPM Energy Hatch

data.name: Actually Copying Cultures
data.data:
To copy a culture, you'll need
1) A Sterilized Petri Dish
2) A Plasma Membrane (made from Stemcells, or gotten while making EnzymesSollution)
3) Stemcells
4) A Data Orb with the appropriate data on it
5) Liquid DNA
6) A UV Bio Lab
7) A Clonal Cellular Synthesis Module

You can change out the Data Orb for one with whatever culture you wish to copy. Keep in mind that it might be easier to make a second culture the normal way, and that there's generally an alternative recipe that uses the fluid it produces to make it with a higher chance.

PS: This recipe is the only one in NEI that uses this module, so you can find it if you look, but the number will change, so I can't specify which page.
data.title: Actually Copying Cultures
data.tooltip:
Actually Copying Cultures
Prequest requests:
Data Orbs for Copying Cultures

data.name: Admit it, You Love This Pt 1 in UV
data.data: Are you okay? Playing this much might not be healthy you know?
data.title: Admit it, You Love This Pt 1 in UV
data.tooltip:
Admit it, You Love This Pt 1 in UV

Tier 8 (UV)

data.name: Admit it, You Love This Pt 2 in UV
data.data: Try going outside once in a while, it's fun! Unless you have agoraphobia I guess.
data.title: Admit it, You Love This Pt 2 in UV
data.tooltip:
Admit it, You Love This Pt 2 in UV
Prequest requests:
Tier 8 (UV)

data.name: Advanced Crystal SoC Production
data.data:
We can process Crystal Processing Units in a Laser Engraver to get the Crystal SoC. But as our demand for circuits gradually increases, this method of production is becoming untenable. We need a more advanced way to mass produce Crystal SoCs!

For that we use a new material, Cerium-doped Lutetium Aluminium Garnet (Ce:LuAG). LuAG has better performance when making Crystal SoCs - in fact it is a laser crystal material.

First, mix Lutetium, Aluminium, Oxygen, and a little Cerium to get the material blend. Then put the blend with Molten Lutetium into an Autoclave to get a regular LuAG gem. If you have already got Oganesson you can also directly use that. As the second step, use the LuAG gem and more of the blend to produce Exquisite LuAG Gems.

After you get the first gem, you can also use your Autoclave to grow crystals. Using the Vacuum Furnace might be a better choice to produce Exquisite LuAG Gems.

Lutetium, Lutetium, it needs a lot of Lutetium. How will you get a lot of Lutetium? Check out the Powerful Nuclear Physics quest tab!
data.title: Advanced Crystal SoC Production
data.tooltip:
Advanced Crystal SoC Production
Prequest requests:
Cheaper IV Circuits

data.name: All Good Things...
data.data:
So you've built your T7 rocket. Great, there's only one more left. Until then, the new places you can visit are: Haumea, the Kuiper Belt, Makemake, and Pluto.

Pluto is just before the Kuiper Belt, and Haumea and Makemake are just after.

The new veins are Black Plutonium, Garnet, Red Garnet. The ores are: Black Plutonium, Borax, Chrysotile, Garnet Sand, Nether Star, Realgar, Red Garnet, and Yellow Garnet.

Don't forget the planet blocks!

The last schematic is on Pluto. This is also the last dungeon.
data.title: All Good Things...

data.name: Americium Doped Wafers
data.data: These boules are the last ones, and are the most efficient when making wafers out of them.
data.title: Americium Doped Wafers
data.tooltip:
Americium Doped Wafers
Prequest requests:
Purifying Water With Plasma

data.name: Bio Chamber
data.data:
As I got new technologies, I have seen the need to make a chamber where the circuit board can contain neurons for the wetware boards or the upcoming bioware boards.

The Bio Chamber is a simple upgrade, it doesn't require many resources. Don't know why I didn't make it earlier.

[note]It can use any glass.[/note]
data.title: Bio Chamber

data.name: Cheaper IV Circuits
data.data: The Crystal SoC will allow you to make Crystal Processors cheaper.
data.title: Cheaper IV Circuits

data.name: Circuits, Assemble!
data.data: To make Wetware Circuits (UHV-Tier Circuits), you need to make either a ZPM Circuit Assembling Machine, or a UV energy hatch for your Circuit Assembly Machine.
data.title: Circuits, Assemble!
data.tooltip:
Circuits, Assemble!
Prequest requests:
You Can't Get Enough of This Pt 2 in ZPM
Tier 8 (UV)

data.name: Data Orbs for Copying Cultures
data.data:
After getting your sample you need to encode the information to a Data Orb. Again, many times you'll have to do it repeatedly (the Data Orb is given back if it fails), but in this case it's 100%.

[note]Look at the uses of the eColi DNA Sample to see the recipe.[/note]
data.title: Data Orbs for Copying Cultures
data.tooltip:
Data Orbs for Copying Cultures
Prequest requests:
DNA Samples for Copying Cultures

data.name: DNA Samples for Copying Cultures
data.data: To copy cultures, you'll need to make a DNA sample first. Many of these have low chances, but this one's 100%. I'm sure you can figure it out yourself, but keep in mind that the Modules are not consumed, and that you may wish to use one of the IC2 Crops for the Detergent materials.
data.title: DNA Samples for Copying Cultures
data.tooltip:
DNA Samples for Copying Cultures
Prequest requests:
Fluids for Copying Cultures

data.name: Extract what you want
data.data:
Directly dissolve and chlorinate of lanthanide ores in Digester to get the concentrated solution of the corresponding ore. Then use the corresponding Extracting Nano Resin to extract the main material in the solution. The rest (Chlorinated Rare Earth Concentrate) is still rich in useful lanthanides.

You can use any type Extracting Nano Resin to extract the useful things in the rest. What Nano Resin you use, what lanthanide you'll get. Every bucket of Chlorinated Rare Earth Concentrate can do this extraction 3 times. First Concentrate to Enriched Solution, then Enriched Solution to Diluted Solution, then waste liquid.

After extracting, the Nano Resin will be "Filled". Put them "Filled" into Electrolyzer then nanites will transfer the "Particles" out from the resin under the influence of electric field. And you can get the Nano Resins and let them go into the next work round, again and again without breaks.

Yes, Rare Earth will not be Rare. Bless the Nano Tech.
data.title: Extract what you want
data.tooltip:
Extract what you want
Prequest requests:
Nano Resin - Particle Extractors

data.name: Fluids for Copying Cultures
data.data:
Ok, so let's say you've made some kind of culture, but you want more of it? You only need one per Vat, but they're consumed when making DNA Samples, so you should probably learn how.

To start off, you'll need to get an eColi Culture.

Use that to make the eColi Bacteria Fluid. [note](I know the name is completely different, deal with it)[/note]

Centrifuge that to make Liquid DNA.

And combine it with Radon in the Mixer to make FluorecentdDNA.

eColi Bacteria Fluid can also be Centrifuged for Plasma Membranes (10% chance) and EnzymesSollution, so do that as well.

And then Centrifuge the EnzymesSollution again for Polymerase.

You should expect to need a significant amount of eColi Bacteria Fluid if you plan on copying a lot of cultures, or making the hard to make ones.

[note]To search for items related to copying cultures, search for 'culture', 'dna sample', or 'plasmid'. You can't do this for the Data Orbs, you have to check the uses of DNA Samples.[/note]

§5A bunch of the fluids have incorrect spelling, don't blame me for it.
data.title: Fluids for Copying Cultures

data.name: General Purpose Fermenting Bacteria
data.data:
So if you looked in NEI and tried to figure out how to make this, you were probably confused by the fact that you use the fluid it produces to make it. This is where NEI is lying to you. Like the previous recipe, NEI doesn't show it correctly (they should be around the same page in NEI, they both also appear to produce Sterilized Petri Dishes, (even if that's not true) and both use unique Modules).

In order to make this, you'll need to make the Rotten Flesh Bacteria culture, get the DNA Sample, and then get the Data Orb. It changes its name to beta-Lactamase, that's normal.

Then, do the same thing for Common Yeast (get the right Yeast!).

Then you need to use the recipe to combine the information from the Data Orbs and get the Common Yeast Plasmid from that.

Lastly, use the Rotten Flesh Bacteria culture, the Common Yeast Plasmid, Penicillin (make it by centrifuging Common Yeast Fluid), and Distilled Water. You want the Transformation Module for this. It's a 100% chance.

You'll want to use the normal recipe to make more cultures, since it also becomes beta-Lactamase once you turn it into a DNA Sample.
data.title: General Purpose Fermenting Bacteria
data.tooltip:
General Purpose Fermenting Bacteria
Prequest requests:
Actually Copying Cultures

data.name: High Energy Laser Purification
data.data: For even more pure water, you will need to use strong lasers to precisely bombard the water and remove impurities. As usual with the waterline, this multiblock presents you with a complex automation puzzle to solve.
data.title: High Energy Laser Purification
data.tooltip:
High Energy Laser Purification
Prequest requests:
Purifying Water With Plasma

data.name: Intelligent Circuits
data.data: Another component for the Wetware Circuits is NeuroCPUs. To make it you need to use the Assembly Line.
data.title: Intelligent Circuits
data.tooltip:
Intelligent Circuits
Prequest requests:
The Board that Keeps Life

data.name: I Put Fusion in Your Fusion so you Can Fusion While You Fusion
data.data:
To make Oganesson, you'll need to make Californium. To make that, you'll need Beryllium and Plutonium 239, all in the Fusion Reactor. After the two fusion chains, you'll have the best noble gas in the pack, which is used in several places.

In this tier, you can send it to Void Miners, to increase their ore production speed, or EBFs, to make them run faster, although the EBF option is too weak right now (changes coming soon). Later on, Oganesson will be used in other places, like the optical circuit line, or to produce Metastable Oganesson, which is needed in much larger quantities later on.

Oganesson replication is on the way out, and the fusion recipe has improved a lot, so there is no longer an incentive to replicate and your Fusion Reactor should keep running for Og.
data.title: I Put Fusion in Your Fusion so you Can Fusion While You Fusion
data.tooltip:
I Put Fusion in Your Fusion so you Can Fusion While You Fusion
Prequest requests:
Upgrading the Reactor

data.name: Kevlar
data.data:
There is a new material that can be used for some high tier crafts. The production line is long and tedious but you should know how to use NEI by now, right?

[note]Hint: If you don't feel like automating a 52 step chemical line, you could also have a look at the Kevlar bee and the new QFT if you are sufficiently high tier.[/note]
data.title: Kevlar

data.name: Maintenance Free At Last!
data.data: You'll never §oever§r need to fix maintenance problems on any multi that has this, nor will it cost parts. Well, except to make it.
data.title: Maintenance Free At Last!

data.name: Nano Forge Tier 1
data.data:
There must be a way to make a nano scale robots to work in a machine. Carbon ones can be made in an assembly line, but very inefficiently. There must be a better way.

What about a Nano Forge, able to cut up blocks into nano-thin sheets and then creating the first nanite, which helps create thousands of them in mere seconds.

[note]The Nano Forge is a big multiblock requiring lots of power over the course of a couple minutes. It is able to use TT energy hatches (including lasers). The controller must have a carbon nanite inside to make tier 1 recipes.[/note]

[note]Despite what NEI might claim there are no minimum voltages for the Nano Forge recipes. If you want to do a recipe you just have to achieve the minimum EU/t required, no matter the voltage[/note].
data.title: Nano Forge Tier 1

data.name: Nano Resin - Particle Extractors
data.data:
Arrange Nanites in P-507 and label them with target particle information in the high-energy laser beam environment of a laser engraver. Then we get the Extracting Unit called "Nano Resin".

These Nanites automatically capture the target particles in solution and store them in the resin. It is worth noting that the actual production rate will be limited by the number of Nanites. So if you want to use this method to produce lanthanides in large quantities, you need to prepare more extra Nano Resin.

Here are all 15 types of Extracting Nano Resin.
data.title: Nano Resin - Particle Extractors
data.tooltip:
Nano Resin - Particle Extractors
Prequest requests:
Use Nano Tech to produce Lanthanides

data.name: Neutrons From Space
data.data:
Now let's make Cosmic Neutronium, a material that is used in a lot of late game stuff.
Centrifuge Black Plutonium to get a Pile of Neutrons. It can then be compressed to Cosmic Neutronium Nuggets in an Implosion Compressor.

Compress the nuggets again to make a Cosmic Neutronium Ingot.

[note]Avaritia's Neutronium and GT Cosmic Neutronium are oredicted together, it's not the same as normal GT Neutronium. It goes back to being called SpNt if you craft it into something, like a plate.[/note]
data.title: Neutrons From Space

data.name: Never Hungry Again
data.data:
Congratulations! You have gracefully served your penance; no longer shall you be bound by the woes of hunger.

With this new trinket (equipable in a baubles slot) you will automatically have your hunger and saturation replenished, so long as the nanobooster stays charged.

Additionally it will do it's best to keep you healed, though it cannot ward off death completely on its own.

[note]P.S. Upgrading your wireless charger might be a good idea![/note]
data.title: Never Hungry Again

data.name: PCB Factory
data.data:
All those boards made in a chemical reactor. It's time to stop that, there must be a more efficient way to make them. After a couple days of research I have found one, a factory designed to print out circuit boards.

The PCB Factory is able to use a wide range of plastics to create circuit boards ready to be used. The printing mechanism overheats when it tries to overclock currently, so I will have to find a way to make that work later. Boards with neurons on them will also take a bit before they can be made, but it won't be hard to achieve.

§2Trace size: the trace size represents the lines between components, which are needed to transmit the electrical signals on the circuit. One can make it smaller to slow down the machine, but use less resources, or make it bigger to make it faster, but use more resources.

§1Formulas:
- 10000/(TraceSize/100) Production
- RecipeDuration/TraceSize^2 Time

§2Using the GUI, the player can go to the configuration menu. There they can change the trace size or add new parts to the multiblock. One can also change where they are placed around the multiblock.§r

[note]Make sure to set the configuration you want before using the structure lib blueprint for autobuild.[/note]
data.title: PCB Factory
data.tooltip:
PCB Factory
Prequest requests:
The Board that Keeps Life

data.name: Purifying Water With Plasma
data.data:
As usual, before you can make use of your Americium to make better wafers, you will need better water. This time, we're going to use plasma to rapidly heat up the water and then cool it back down.

Some of the mechanics may seem similar to how you set up the pH neutralization process, maybe you can expand on what you learned there?

[note]This multiblock is very picky about where its plasma and coolant input hatches go. If you can't figure out why it's not forming, chances are you forgot to place these hatches in the correct location. Use the hologram projector to see where they go.[/note]
data.title: Purifying Water With Plasma
data.tooltip:
Purifying Water With Plasma
Prequest requests:
UV Energy Hatch
Netherite Materials
pH Neutralization

data.name: Quantum Computer
data.data:
The Quantum Computer (QC) is an incredibly complicated machine used to generate computation for the Research Station and a few other multiblocks. There are a few things you need to understand before using one.

§lCONSTRUCTION§r. Much like an assembly line, the QC is built as a series of slices. The first and last slice are the only valid locations for hatches. The slices in between are primarily for computer racks. The Multiblock Structure Hologram Projector shows the minimum length QC, but holding multiple in a single stack will show/build longer versions up to the maximum length of 16. There is also a mandatory air block in front of the computer heat vents.

§lOUTPUT§r. Computation is nothing more than an integer input for certain recipes--much like EU. There may exist a minimum throughput requirement, a threshold to reach, or both (NEI will tell you everything). Computation is generated every second by the QC, transmitted by an Optical Transmission Connector, received by an Optical Reception Connector, and "consumed" by the machine or process that needs it. There is no storing computation and there can only be ONE transmission or reception hatch connected to the same Optical Fiber Cables at a time. If absolutely necessary, the Network Switch with QoS can split/join connections but know that it takes both power and maintenance to run.

Additional QC can be chained together using another set of Optical Transmission and Optical Reception Connectors between machines, but they cannot wallshare the same Optical Transmission Connector.

§lUNCERTAINTY§r. The QC has a unique maintenance requirement that can only be corrected by balancing the Schrödinger Matrix inside an Uncertainty Resolver--an additional hatch that must go on either the first or last slice of the machine. Start with the basic Uncertainty Resolver, but know that there are two more tiers unlocked later on that lower the difficulty of the puzzle, or not?

The interface of the Uncertainty Resolver has the Schrödinger Matrix in the middle and two sets of 8 buttons on the left and right. Clicking on one button and then another will switch the states of the two corresponding cells in the matrix. This means switching their blinking speed (in the basic Uncertainty Resolver) or their shade/color (in the Uncertainty Resolver X). The goal of the puzzle is to balance the states of the matrix around the glowing LED lights, turning all of them green.

§lPARAMETERS§r. In the GUI of the controller, there are two configurable parameters, overclock and overvolt, that change how computation and heat are generated. Higher overclock values contribute the most to computation and higher overvolt values contribute the most to heat. Alone, this would encourage the player to make overclock as high as possible and overvolt as low as possible, but there is a penalty to computation for large differences between these two parameters. Furthermore, overvolt values <1 will cause the QC to randomly drop computation proportional to its distance from 1. It is highly encouraged to play around with these parameters, as all the best setups do.

See the adjacent quest for more information on computer racks and generating computation.
data.title: Quantum Computer
data.tooltip:
Quantum Computer
Prequest requests:
UV Energy Hatch
The Beginning of the End Game

data.name: Quantum Mechanics is Hot
data.data:
The QC has 2-24 computer racks depending on the length of the machine. Each rack has four total slots for either circuits (to generate heat and computation) or vents (to dissipate heat). Although conceptually similar to a nuclear reactor, the location of the components inside does not matter at all. Every rack is also completely independent from every other rack which means it is not possible to have one rack with all circuits and another with all vents.

The computation of a rack is the sum of all the components' individual computation. For example, two APU (Tier 3) and two Cooling Cores have 240 + 240 + 0 + 0 = 480 base computation per second. However, computation changes significantly depending on the values for overclock and overvolt:

[note]Computation = Base * (1+overclock^2) / (1+(overclock-overvolt)^2)[/note]

The heat of a rack is a value between 0 and 10,000 and is reported in the interface of the QC or by using a Portable Scanner on the rack. Every component has a certain heat limit which if exceeded will void that component. Breaking or wrenching a rack while it is hot (>2000) will similarly void the components inside. The QC will explode if the heat exceeds 10,000 but no component has a heat limit greater than that, so don't worry too much about ruining your base.

[note]Heat α HeatConstant * overclock * overvolt^2[/note]

The power consumption of a rack is 1A ZPM regardless of the components inside. This is in addition to the 1A ZPM of the QC itself. However, these EU/t values are directly proportional to overclock and overvolt which should increase as you unlock better circuits. Be sure to turn on the QC before the research station and only when you need it.

[note]EU/t = 131,072 * overclock * overvolt * (racks + 1)[/note]

To get you started, craft 4x APU (Tier 3) and 4x Cooling Cores. Place two of each component in the two racks and the QC will safely produce 1,920 computation/s for just 393,215 EU/t (0.75A UV) which is more than enough for researching the Wetware Mainframe. If you would like to further increase the computation/s at the cost of power, adjust the overclock and overvolt values to 1.44 and 1.03, respectively. This will generate 2,526 computation/s at a cost of 583,217 EU/t (1.11A UV).

If the APUs are too bothersome to craft, try Crystal Mainframes instead but you will need different overclock and overvolt values to get the most out of them. That goes for every unique combination of circuits and vents.
data.title: Quantum Mechanics is Hot

data.name: Quantum Power ICs
data.data:
You need Quantum Power ICs for UEV -> UIV and UIV -> UMV transformers, and UHV Hatches and Dynamos.

[note]You'll need a UHV Cutting Machine, or an OC'd multi to actually cut the wafers.[/note]
data.title: Quantum Power ICs

data.name: Quantum Uplink
data.data:
The §5§lQuantum Uplink§r is a multi made specifically for the Matter Manipulator that is unlocked with the aid of §4§lUV§r tech.

This allows the Matter Manipulator to connect to your ME system over an §2infinite range§r, and §3across dimensions§r. The tool can be linked by placing it into the controller while the uplink is active. The uplink will take a continous 1A of ZPM power to function.

Additionally, you can now use it to create fake ME patterns upon selecting an area. This will make it quick to order all of the parts needed for Copy & Pasting in an area.

[warn]The Uplink is powerful, but at a cost. Moving all items / fluids from the AE system will cost a small amount of plasma per transfer.

Specifically: 16k EU of plasma per item / per 1000L of fluid[/warn]
data.title: Quantum Uplink

data.name: Research Station
data.data:
Now that you've started building up your precious Quantum Computer, how about the Research Station? Once again, using the Multiblock Structure Hologram Projector will tell you how to build this Multiblock. There should be 3 empty blocks beneath it so you can see the whole blueprint. Once it is nearly assembled, place down an Energy Hatch, an Optical Reception Connector, and a Maintenance Hatch all on the back side.

Once fully assembled, you can begin operating recipes at any time, so long as the Quantum Computer is also active and connected. The Research Station requires you to put the item to research within the Object Holder, then a data stick in the Multiblock interface. Once the Computation is fully completed, the data stick that houses all the data of the completed item will be inside the Multiblock Interface.

Still confused? Good, that's the spirit of learning! Always make sure to test these things in creative single player if you wish to find exact measurements and such. Don't forget to ALWAYS COLOR THE OPTICAL HATCHES AND FIBERS!

[note]Note that some researches require a significant amount of power, so keep that in mind.[/note]
data.title: Research Station

data.name: Space Elevator
data.data:
The Space Elevator is a modular structure. It can be equipped with Space Elevator modules, which then can take on different tasks.

Initially, your Space Elevator has 6 module slots that can be used. You can later upgrade that to up to 12 with Mk-II and Mk-III motors. The motor tier also determines the module tier that you can use. The I/O is not shared between modules, each module only sees their own I/O slots. Energy is only provided to the central structure of the Space Elevator and then automatically distributed to all modules.

After a module has been inserted and supplied with the right I/O, it can be configured further using parameters.

You can see in NEI which fluids are pumpable with the Space Pumping Module. It consumes 1A UHV to work. The Gas Type and Planet Type are parameters.

NEI also has an overview of all the ores you can obtain with a Space Mining Module. It needs to be supplied with a drone, which will act as catalyst, a set of input items, computation and either Helium, Bismuth or Radon plasma. The plasma will boost both the recipe time and the amount of bonus stacks you get out of a recipe. With its parameters you can adjust parallels, overdrive, and distance. When multiple recipes have the same input and you have the distance set to a value that they share, the module will pick a random one, taking the recipes weights into consideration.

The space elevator also lets you travel to other planets, but it doesn't get you back though so better keep that in mind!

The mining module also got a cycle mode. In static mode it will hold its distance while in cycle mode it will change its distance after each recipe check (and you can configure the range and step size of that).

Here's a good spreadsheet to check material chances and other values, across motor tiers, for this multi: [url]https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xRApa3HnQiJDstr8I5csIi24Mx4mJNsalRJh8PVa52M/edit#gid=1497391303[/url].

[note]Teleportation can be accessed though the controller.[/note]
data.title: Space Elevator

data.name: STERILIZE!, STERILIZE!
data.data: Turn your Raw Growth Medium into Sterilized Growth Medium in an IV Fluid Heater, and then you can use it in the Wetware Lifesupport Circuit Boards or the Neuro Processing Unit. But you'll also need to use it to make stemcells, so let's do that first.

You'll need a TecTech Research Station and Quantum Computer to make the Wetware Mainframe circuit, so make those before continuing.

[note]If you can't see the quests, go back to ZPM and do the TT ones there you skipped.[/note]

data.data:
Fabricating Crystal SoCs with LuAG is so much faster than directly engraving crystal chips! They can also be used for Raw Advanced Crystal Chip.

Remember to keep some LuAG gems for growing more crystals.

data.name: The Board that Keeps Life
data.data:
To make Wetware Circuits, you'll need to make a Wetware Lifesupport Circuit Board. Making this board is quite a different process than making all the other Circuit Boards you've made, because making it actually requires materials!

To actually use it in circuits, you need to etch it. I guess by now, you know how to etch a circuit board, so I won't tell you and you have to use NEI :P

data.tooltip:
The Board that Keeps Life

data.name: This is Not How You Make Cheese
data.data:
In order to make Wetware circuits, you'll need Sterilized Growth Catalyst Medium and Stemcells.

To begin, you will first need Bacteria which you can get through the Bacterial Vat or the Brewing Machine. The vat recipe is more efficient, but you need a culture for it so you need to start with the brewing recipe. The Bacterial Vat needs at least Bismuth rods in the Radio Hatch for the proper Sievert and at least EV-tier glass to make Bacteria. There are also 3 different recipes, so you can use a higher tier one later if you like.

You'll also need Mince Meat and Agar. You'll want a stable supply of meat such as a fish farm, a standard animal farm, or IC2 Meatrose/Goldfish farm.

Agar has a more complicated processing chain, but it's nothing compared to Platinum. You'll need even more meat for it.

Use some of the Bacteria to create an Ova Evolutionis culture (15% chance), and then place that in the Bacterial Vat's controller. The Bacterial Vat also needs at least Uranium rods in the Radio Hatch for the proper Sievert and at least IV-tier glass to make Raw Growth Catalyst Medium. There are higher tier recipes for this as well.

[note]Cultures are NOT consumed in the Bacterial Vat.[/note]

This is Not How You Make Cheese

data.data:
While one reactor is nice and all, why not make another? This time you can use the MK3 americium recipe to make it easier.

Costing just 1 ingot of Plutonium, and 2 cells of hydrogen, this recipe is much easier and faster than the MK2 version. By making americium plasma, then putting it through a turbine, you will get americium in the liquid state. You will need at least 132 plates for the controller and the fusion machine casings.

Plus, free power!

data.name: Upgrading the Reactor
data.data:
A MK II is nice, but why not make a MK III? This time you will need UV or above hatches, as well as the Fusion Machine Casing MK II.

Each of the up to 16 UV Energy Hatches adds 32768 EU/t power input and 40 MEU starting capacity. Therefore this reactor can handle recipes up to 640M EU at startup.

When using it for lower tier recipes, the reactor will double the power needed per recipe, while cutting the processing time in half, both for each tier difference.

data.name: A Blast to the Past
data.data:
Now that you have the bioware mainframe, you have unlocked the first of the stargate trophies!
Yes, there's multiple of them, one for each major iteration of the stargate recipe.
These trophies are just that, trophies, and you can try to craft them if you want to compare the costs to today's stargate standards.
To complete these quests you have to submit two stargates' worth of materials.

§3Now, let me bestow upon you a short history lesson about this point in GT:NHs past.

The year is 2020. The bio mainframe was pretty much the end of GTNH progression at the time, not much above UHV existed or was craftable. This was also the point in the pack where you'd start scaling for stargate, as that too was tiered at UHV. Technically UEV parts were craftable, but their only uses were singleblocks for PAs (which only held up to 16 UEV machines) and the Deep Dark Portal. UEV-UMV energy hatches were craftable, but their recipes were simple hull + wire crafting table recipes
...and that was about it for UHV+ content.
With the recent addition of void miners, the previously thought to be impossible started to seem actually attainable, a set of stargates. Specifically, to §ocraft§3 a set of them, not just find them like others have before.

One group in particular, known as the §aGigaplex§3, gave it their all and actually managed to do it, to prove that crafting stargates is possible with enough determination.

Thus, on the §a16th of February, 2021§3, the first set of crafted stargates had been born.

P.S.: If you want to be as faithful to the challenge as possible, try completing this quest without using any of the modern functionality that didn't exist back then.
Here's a non-exhaustive list of major things that didn't exist (in no particular order):
-PCB Factory, Space Elevator, Component Assemblyline, AAL, PrAss, EEC, EIG, Compact Fusions, MCR, MABS
-Any bee related GT machines
-Any UEV or above multis
-XL Turbines, Naq fuel, LEG
-Sub 1-tick OC, Batch Mode, inbuilt Void Protection on multis
-Level Maintainer, AE Fluid Crafting, Stocking Buses/Hatches, Crafting Input Buses, ME Output Buses/Hatches, non-recursive AE component recipes
-Shift-clicking recipes into AE patterns (pain)
-Early-Midgame QoL such as ghost circuits, visual prospecting, reprogramming circuits with a screwdriver, seeing Assline recipes in NEI before having crafted them, and more

P.P.S: This quest is missing the chaotic capacitors on purpose, because the chaotic core recipe requires spacetime now, but the chaotic capacitor recipe did not change at all since then. All in all the cost for these banks was completely negligible back then and still is today, they only serve as a magic gate for SG.
data.title: A Blast to the Past
data.tooltip:
A Blast to the Past

data.name: Compressing the Core of a Star
data.data:
The next material is Infinity Catalyst. Infinity Catalyst needs to be compressed with insane amounts of force. The only machine capable of doing that is a Neutronium Compressor. Check out the Neutronium Compressor quest in Multiblock Goals.

To make the Catalyst, go to Vega B to get the dust. Then use the Neutronium Compressor to make Infinity Catalyst with 64 of the dust.

You can also do the insane Avaritia recipe to make the Infinity Catalyst, if you want a challenge :P

[note]The compressor can also be used to make singularities, culminating in the Eternal Singularity, used in the alternate recipe.[/note]

[note]If you want to automate singularity creation you can just click with the middle mouse button to modify the number of items in a pattern beyond the normal limits.[/note]

data.tooltip:
Compressing the Core of a Star

You have tinkered long and hard to try to combine magic and technology. It looks like you finally found a way! Combining your powers as a thaumaturge and blood mage with your UHV technology you think you have found a way to distill the power of a dragon into a small core. This machine can do it, you are sure. If only you know how precisely to assembler such a core.

[note]Use a hologram projector to see how it is built. You can also upgrade your draconic cores but for that you need the higher tier schematics and you need to upgrade the multiblock.[/note]

data.name: Industrial Scale Seaweed Production
data.data:
So you probably noticed that the amount of seaweed you'll need to make Bio circuits is kind of...intense. Collecting them yourself is a huge pain, and who wants to program robots? Plus servers. Fortunately, there's now a way to make seaweed.

The first thing you need is...Seaweed! Use that with Unknown Water you pumped from the same planet to make the culture. Expect this to take a while, as the chances are super low. You'll also need the max tier Bio Lab.

Once you have the culture you can make Seaweed Broth, by combining it with Unknown Nutrient Agar and some other stuff. This can then be made into seaweed.

data.name: It's Not Going Bad, I Swear!
data.data:
To make your next tier of circuits (Bio Circuits), you need to make Raw Bio Medium. There are three ways of making it.

The first one requires Stemcells, Unknown Crystal and T-Ceti Seaweed Extract at LuV voltage and 94 Sievert (Plutonium level) in a Bacterial Vat. It makes Raw Bio Medium at 4:1 ratio.

The second one is basically the first one, but it requires Infinity Catalyst instead of Tritanium at ZPM voltage and 140 Sievert (Enriched Naquadah level) in a Bacterial Vat. It makes Raw Bio Medium at 1:1 ratio.

The third one is the most efficient, but it requires Biocells (which you don't have yet), and 4 dust of Infinity Catalyst at UV voltage and 150 Sievert (Naquadria level) in a Bacterial Vat. It makes Raw Bio Medium at 1:2 ratio.

[note]The second and third ways use a different culture.[/note]
data.title: It's Not Going Bad, I Swear!
data.tooltip:
It's Not Going Bad, I Swear!

data.name: Liquid Cooling Tower
data.data:
I have started to hit the limit of the multiblock without overclocking it, so I decided to give it a liquid cooling tower. This will allow it to overclock like every other multi with 2x Speed and 4x EU/t.

I will need to provide some distilled water to its hatch to absorb any excess heat.

[note]The Liquid Cooling Tower allows the Multiblock to have 2/4 OC at the cost of 10L/s of distilled water when running. The input hatch is placed in the bottom center of the Liquid Cooling Tower.[/note]

data.name: Nano Forge Tier 2
data.data:
Carbon Nanites are good first workers, but they don't have much in the way of working with more complex systems as they have a very basic nanite network. So a new more advanced nanite will be needed to produce complex nanites.

The neutronium nanite is an in-between of the two tiers able to produce tier 2 nanites, which have other uses.

[note]When putting the neutronium nanite in the controller, you will need to wait for the structure check to happen again or break and replace the controller with a neutronium nanite inside. Allows the Nano Forge to make tier 2 nanites.[/note]

data.name: One Ingot, Infinite Power
data.data:
Here at Questbook, Inc. we are seriously worried about your health if you got here legitimately. Playing this much might be bad for you. You can always go outside, you know?

By the way, to make the ingot, it's just a simple Dire Crafting Table recipe. Remember that you were the one that chose to be here.

[note]A number of endgame recipes have now opened up. Check the Endgame Goals tab or NEI recipes for the Table to see what they are.[/note]

[note]Something else to note is that there's an automated DCT if you happen to need a lot of these (hint: you will).[/note]

You can now make optical SMDs! They are required for all circuits beyond UEV.

Some of the materials are made in the ABS. Maybe it's time to add a few.

[note]If you have not gotten any strontium yet, you can obtain it from strontium oxide based on Rare Earth 3, from spessartine froth or from a Deep Dark void miner.[/note]

data.name: PCB Factory Tier 2
data.data:
With the Nano Forge built, we can upgrade our production of circuit boards for free, but the nanites need a container to hold them. The current casings aren't enough, we need to find an alternative casing.

After some research, infinity as a frame and enriched holmium as the protection layer seems to work well. It can be allowed to let through nanites to go into the printer base so that extra material can be directly removed instead of trying to go slower.

[note]Allows the player to use the tier 2 recipes with the use of a silver nanite in the input bus. This also unlocks parallels of the PCB Factory with said formula: Log2(x) parallels, where x is the amount of nanites in the input bus.[/note]
